Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Saffy273
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 3 nights in April, with my teenage daughter. The staff at the hotel are wonderful, and gave great advice about the surrounding area and attractions. Nothing seemed to much for them. The room size was not a problem for the two of us, and the bathrooms were lovely and clean. The mini bar was very handy, along with space in the fridge for our own purchases. Breakfast was good - the coffee was great and there was enough variety for everyone. Location wise, I thought it was very good. It was probably a good 10-15 minute walk to some of the popular sites, close enough to stroll to, but far enough away to escape the crowds and tour groups. Plus there were plenty of smaller things to see just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and the Forum was just 5-10 minutes at the bottom of the road. There were plenty of places to eat around the hotel, and an Irish Bar at the back - for those who wanted a pint! The hotel had just completed the roof top bar, and we were given vouchers for a drink. They also serve an evening meal, which we would have tried if we had stayed there longer. We are already planning our next trip back, a 4 days/3 nights is not long enough! When we return, we will be staying at the Hotel Artemide again - just longer this time! Thanks to all the staff, especially our Maid, for a welcoming and stress-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: jmak4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artemide Hotel for three nights in March. The staff were friendly and helpful for a big city hotel. There were several amenities that were very nice and that would make me recommend this hotel to others. The most important of which, was that everything in your room mini bar was complimentary. The mini bar included juice, water (sparkling and still), a beer, and a variety of snacks. This was really helpful for our long days of sight seeing. We would take the bottles of water and snacks with us as we explored Rome and didn't need to stop and buy food and drink as often. Also, on check in at the hotel, you received a voucher for a free prosseco or espresso in the hotel bar. The bar tender let my husband use his voucher on a beer instead, because that was what he preferred. Also, one of the best things about this hotel was its location. It was very convenient to the Rome Termini train station (5 minute walk) and the ancient Roman ruins (about a 10 minute walk). We even walked from our hotel to Vatican City. That was about a 30 minute walk, so maybe too much for some people, but we found the walk easy and allowed you to explore more of Rome along the way. The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious by European standards. The two main negatives to this hotel were that the breakfast was only fair, but most importantly, the street noise in our room was very loud. You cannot sleep with the window open because you hear loud trucks and people outside all night. If you closed the window, it was much better, but then the room was a bit stuffy. I would definitely ask for a room on the back side of the hotel if I were to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, odd location”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: An "odd" location, not a bad location. Easy walking distance to the train station. The hotel seems situated in a kind of Bermuda Triangle. Equally far from the main attractions, which might be considered an advantage to some travelers. The always busy street on which the hotel is located has no real identity, nor does it have any charm. The street has the usual array of hawkers, beggars, cigarette and other refuse, and dog leavings. In general, Rome (and Italy) would be much nicer if some effort was made to address these annoyances. The hotel public spaces are quite beautiful. The breakfast is, without question, in the top five of all the hotels in which I've stayed worldwide. That said, it might be that in the evening the restaurant is run by management independent of the hotel. I went one night and ordered lamb. The waiter failed to ask me how I wanted it cooked, took it to the wrong table where it was inspected at length by the surprised diners there, taken back to the kitchen, and then brought out to me. Worst lamb I've ever had; a description liking it to leather would be generous. Because of my lengthy stay, I was "upgraded" to a room on the top floor. The room was nicely appointed, but quite dark. It faced the inner "courtyard," so it had no view, which contributed to the lack of light in the room. This may be an advantage; rooms facing the street are likely to be noisy. Except for Mario, who procured a Galleria Borghese reservation for me, entailing four telephone calls, the rest of the front desk service was indifferent. All in all, a good place to stay in Rome for the first-time traveler, such as I was. Would I stay there again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Top qualityhotel,fair price,great staff.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We never had been in Rome before. Researched thoroughly spotted this place. Great rewiews bu t Bourne out by great personal experience. Top hotel in every aspect rooms- breakfast-staff-welcome-service-value- quality- I have been around but this hotel caught our eye. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: chappers21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night last week. I booked the hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and whilst it was a very good hotel it some how didn't quite come up to all the fabulous reviews it has had particularly when you take into account the cost of the rooms. Yes the "free" minibar, toiletries and tea and coffee are a nice touch but surely nothing is free and it is reflected in the price of the room. The room was not a bad size for the 3 of us but it was very dark and to be honest a bit claustraphobic. It had only 1 window opening onto a small courtyard and you had to nearly hang out of the window to see any sky. We got the complimentary fruit bowl but not the 50% off the cost of a meal voucher that would probably have been more useful. We did hear several other residents referring to the fact they had this offer and other reviewers refer to it. We did get a voucher for a free glass of prosecco each in the newly opened roof top terrace bar but as we were the only people there it did lack a bit of atmosphere. I am sure it will be much better during warmer months. I sound a bit negative and don't mean to be. We did have a wonderful break it's just it wasn't quite as exceptional as I was expecting and I have stayed in equivalent hotels at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not as good as I was hoping for”
Reviews.Author: scottSD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the first few days of April. It was okay. The staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet was good. The rooftop restaurant and bar were under construction so I can't comment on that. The rooms were smallish and the beds were hardish. I expect that in Italy (especially in Rome), but for the price we paid for this place, I was expecting a little more. The location was marginal. Close to termini, close to the metro stop. Not that close to the main points of interest (trevi fountain, forum, piazza navona). They were technically all walking distance. But more like cab distance. Overall, it was just okay. Definitely not a bad hotel, but i don't feel like I get great value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: We had a last minute unplanned 24 hours in Rome. Fortunately we found the Artemide Hotel and were extremely pleased with its location, helpful staff and unexpected upgrade to a superior room. Additional amenities included an open mini-bar and coupons to enjoy beverages in the lobby. Don't miss the special elevator as it adds to the character of the hotel. 15 minute walk to either the Colosseum or Fontana Trevi right off the Via Nazionale. Staff was ready at all times to answer questions, make transportation arrangements and offer restaurant recommendations. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NixBed
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel March 2011 for a birthday gift. It was amazing. Walking distance (as long as you like a nice walk!) to everywhere! Staff very helpful & the rooms were clean & smart. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Break”
Reviews.Author: CarlE1978
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome and very happy we picked the Artemide to stay at for our 4 nights. Arrived late on the first night, but smooth check in and complimentary vouchers were a nice touch. Room was the economy room, small but enough for us as we would be out and abot for the majority of our stay and only used the room to sleep, shower and then out all day as there is so much to take in!! Nice gesture by the hotel also when we were woken up by building work going on at 8am on the top floor, and when we notified reception, they were totally apologetic and assured us the work would not start so early in future, which it didn't!! And the complimentary fruit bowl to apologise was a good touch!!! Great location, nice touch af complimentary mini bar that is refilled each day, and have already recommended the hotel to family!!! Certainly would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and considerate sum up my experience”
Reviews.Author: ArnabRoyChoudhury
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is set in a 19th-century building on the elegant and central Via Nazionale. I am returning today and thought I should write out my review as I found it through TripAdvisor and I owe it to them for making my trip to Italy such a pleasure and hassle free one. Central Location: It is very centrally located - just a short walk from the Repubblica Metro Station (line A), 2 stops from the Spanish Steps and more importantly, very close to the Basilica Papale di Santa Maria Maggiore or Papal Basilica of Saint Mary Major which is also the largest Roman Catholic Marian church in Rome, Italy. Saint Mary Major is one of the only four that today hold the title of major basilica. Central location also allows for free pick ups and drop off from all major tour operators. Service and Staff Uber Good - The rooms we stayed in, had free Wi-Fi, free minibar and newspaper. The staff from those at the reception to the porters are all uber friendly and helpful. In particular Sirajul was spectacularly helpful resourceful and helpful with his advice around the city. With my twin tykes and elder lady in tow, that is a very major benefit to have. They recently opened their roof top garden bar and restaurant which is quiet nice as well. Shuttle service to/from the Fiumicino and Ciampino airports, is available and subject to charges [we were charged Euro 70 for a six seater to Fiumicino]. On the downside for those staying there for a longer period [like us for a week] - the food options can get limited and are not the best. However, there are plenty of food options all around the hotel - with a McDonald and a Burger King nearby, should you need it but I would recommend the plethora of local choices in the cafes, and restaurants within walking distance. Overall, I have had a very pleasant stay for my family of five with a staff that made us feel at home everyday of our stay. Happy that I choose it and will definitely recommend it to my friends and family should they go to Rome. To sum up - it was the perfect confluence of central location, clean rooms and considerate staff that makes for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleased a second time.”
Reviews.Author: Jean R
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The service is still fabulous, and the location is very central. Very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Awesome”
Reviews.Author: vinjcir
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel originally here through TripAdvisor. It had good reviews so I stayed here for a week in Rome with my two sons. From the beginning the staff was friendly, cheerful and helpful. They made us feel at home for our entire stay. One of the staff outlined a self-guided walking tour on a map, beginning from the hotel. There are a lot of monuments and sights within walking distance of the hotel or else a short taxi ride away. Whenever we needed a taxi they called one for us and it always arrived within 5 minutes. The breakfast buffet is excellent and a few times they let us in early because we had to leave for an early tour. Another time they delivered a box breakfast early in the morning before we left. The room was modern, clean and spacious for the three of us. My sons are college age and we needed the room. There were absolutely no negatives. Everything was above superb for our entire trip. Thank you Hotel Artemide!!! We will certainly recommend you to family and friends whenever they go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Geneva022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artemides in Rome for 4 nights in April. We had a family room with a sofa bed for the children in a separate room (separated by a sliding door) and a good sized double bed for us. We were impressed with the size and cleanliness of the room. Breakfast buffet was included in the price as was the minbar, coffee, tea and biscuits in the room. Breakfast was excellent - great service and good quality food. The location of the hotel is perfect for visiting Ancient Rome as well as the shopping districts. The hotel took good note of our departure time and were kind enough to provide picnic bags for breakfast for our early departure time. Overall a very pleasant experience with friendly staff and no hidden extra charges. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, overheated rooms...”
Reviews.Author: quiltmaven
Reviews.Content: We love our hotel but can't get the staff to understand that the room is too damned hot! We have the thermostat turned down and the window open. Hopefully you'll have better luck. We love that the breakfast is included-ableit buffet style and that there is a rooftop restaurant. But we're suffocating in here. However, being on the via Nazionale is great and so is the price.

Reviews.Title: “This is long overdue”
Reviews.Author: xxxiiiixxx
Reviews.Content: My time at the Artimide was more than pleasant. The staff was attentive and polite. Took care of things that needed to be done without asking. Little things like putting a cover on a open wine bottle. Considering I am in the Hospitality industry and am not easily impressed, I must say, I was. Having stayed at the best and worst hotels. A complement from me is a rarity. When I do give it the earth shakes a little. The location was also the best as far as I can see. Breakfast was also perfect. However the Barman / Manager (rooftop) in the restaurant is what really made the place and Rome special to us. He is such a lovely man and his staff follows in his showing of friendliness and service. The interesting thing was he looked very much and had mannerisms similar to one of my biggest adversaries. I did not get this till I was leaving and my wife was also struck by this when I told her. So what does this mean? Now because of this man I even look at my adversary in a better light. It is amazing the power of proper service and a good attitude (Genuine) can do. It can actually impact other parts of your life. Make sure to visit him on your stay and tip him well. He is much more than a barman / Manager (rooftop bistro). He is a blessing to be around when you are in a new place. Bravo John G and JoAnn P.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondoncouple
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely central Rome hotel. Very good breakfast, very pleasant staff and fair size room for a city. We arrived two hours early expecting to drop off our bags, but within 5 mins we were in our room. The room/bathroom was also very clean. Complimentary mini-bar was a nice touch, its not full of stuff but really good to have. Only downsides - the restaurant is not great for dinner, no atmosphere and food only ok. We were at the front which was noisy when the windows were open, which we needed as it was warm. But these are really minor against the location which is within easy reach of everything (apart from the Vatican which is a bit further) and all the other pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny717
Reviews.Content: We recently (March 2012) stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. As others have mentioned, it is a great location, within walking distance to most things and very close to public transport. Rooms were nice - not huge but plenty of room and very quiet - we heard no outside noise at all. Complimentary mini-bar was appreciated and the breakfast enjoyable with a wide selection. Staff were very helpful and attentive at all times. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeranFamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights and were completely happy with the stay. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The location is great and not too far to walk to the train stations and there is a taxis stand right down the street. The free wet bar is a nice touch and provides some beer, soda, and water daily. The breakfast is light, but good and our girls loved the hot chocolate! The only draw back is the elevator is small and slow at times. We would stay here again if in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperK3_0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located. We stayed here in July 2011. We got off of the train with our luggage and it was about a half mile walk to the hotel. We arrived at noon and then decided to walk around and check out the city. We knew that the hotel was close to everything, but we didn't realize just how close. In 3.5 hours we saw half of what we wanted to see in Rome. The next two days were spent on some great tours. The hotel itself is very nice. The bathrooms are a bit small, but very nicely appointed. Breakfast and the service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I'm rarely moved to write reviews - i just read others to help me choose. That's how I came across the Artemide Hotel in Rome. The service was SO good I had to put pen to paper. While we encountered a couple of minor problems, what shone through brightly was the absolutely superb attention to customer care by the staff. Nothing was too much trouble any time, any day. You just don't get service like that anymore (so I thought). Our holiday was to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday. The trip alone was wonderful, but the hotel and its magnificent staff made the experience truly memorable. One small example: my wife bought some shoes in Rome and managed to leave them behind. One email was all it took to elicit a swift response and the promise to post to us in England at no cost - all part of the service. Truly amazing. We shall stay there again next time we're in Rome and certainly not just because it's central and ideally placed for all the must-see tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Fitpro1
Reviews.Content: Third time I have booked a hotel using Tripadvisor reviews & each time loved my choice. The Giraffe & Casablanca NYC, this time the wonderful Artemide Rome. Highlights: perfect location to walk to all major attractions, clean & beautiful hotel, staff super hospitable & friendly, complimentary mini bar a wonderful idea (refilled daily), the widest choices for breakfast worth spending leisure time over, sauna & gym in basement (pool opens next year), calm relaxing atmosphere in lobby and bar area. Restaurant food was out of this world a definite dining destination. Requested quiet & high up room & wonderfully enjoyed private outdoor seating area & felt a milliion miles from the hustle & bustle of the city. Notwithstanding the wonderful complimentary prosecco, 50% discount on restaurant food & chianti plus welcome prosecco for my husband & my own birthday celebrations. Would love to return simply to enjoy the delights of Artemide alone. Free wifi & room snacks. What is there not to like..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesushi76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Minibar, Wi-Fi, & buffet breakfast were all great perks that came with the room. The service received from the staff was exceptional. We could not have asked for a better hotel to start our whirlwind trip in Italy. The bed was a little on the firm side. The hotel is located on a busy street however, I requested a room in the back so that street noise would not be a problem. I highly recommend staying at this hotel when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: kmtYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Our third visit here, and just as good as before. Many of the same staff as in previous years, which is a good sign I think and they are all really friendly, helpful and efficient. Everything excellent, lookin forward to the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: Diana K
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Hotel Artemide in Rome. The room was a little smaller than I expected for two people, but the hotel was very nice. The location was great and within walking distance of everything you would want to see. The staff was absolutely FANTASTIC!!! Free mini bar was brilliant! I will book there again if ever back in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Felice E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay in Rome...a visit that was made all the more wonderful as a result of the Artemide Hotel! Upon our arrival, we were surprised to learn that our room had been upgraded to a larger space with a balcony facing out on the Via Nazionale. Everyone at the hotel, from the people at the front desk, to the staff in the dining room, to the porters were a delight, very friendly and helpful. The place is immaculate and its location makes it easy to get to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Standard room--great breakfast--super staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: Family of six--two rooms. Our rooms were standard hotel rooms, so not much to brag about there. However, the Artemide's staff was superb! Anything we asked, they answered! They were extremely helpful and gracious. The breakfast had a good variety and was presented well. That staff was also extremely efficient. The fruit tray in the room was a nice touch, as was the mini-bar. Nice enough, clean enough, and close enough. Enough said!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AllenSuh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights. Very good location with about 15 minutes from Termini. Mini bar was nice as it was stocked every night with two sodas, four water bottles, two juice, and two beers. Chocolates, cookies, and peanuts were very nice touch. We were also given 50% off dinner coupon at the hotel restaurant and two free drink coupons at the bar upon check-in. Staff greeted us each and every time and were very helpful/friendly. Free Wi-Fi at room was very nice. Never tried it but they also have sauna and fitness center. Breakfast had nice choices and variety selection of fresh juices. Also, staff gave us breakfast doggie bag on our check-out since our return flight was early in the morning and we would have to skip our breakfast. They also helped us book tours and directions. Nothing but compliments to the staff. For reasons that I did not give 5 star rating. For a four star, hotel room was a bit smaller than I expected as it had no couch (just a king size bed, desk, mini-freezer, and small tv). Also, hotel amenities (shampoo, bath soap, and rinse) could be better. Also, room lacked air circulation and felt stuffy. Lastly, room needs better sound proofing since we were able to hear our neighbor's TV sound throughout our sleep. Overall, very nice staff and good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore the wonder that is Rome”
Reviews.Author: plasticbag19
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but that is expected in Rome due to the attractions. its got what you need from visiting a historical city Good base, to see Sites of Rome. Breakfast was delicious, hotel gym was sufficient. I would definately come again to rome, but maybe not back to this hotel. No Gripes with it, but for the price we paid, id have expected a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Trollemor
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here with a two year old during a week in March 2012. We booked a superior room with a larger living space, a sofa and table, and a bigger bathroom with a tub. Very nice breakfast, beautiful hotel and a very hospitable staff. Next time in Rome, Hotel Artemide is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A true four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: It seems that hotels often over pitch their star rating. Artemide Hotel lived up to what it claimed in all areas - from the room and services to the delicious breakfast buffet. Finding the hotel is quite easy. It's located on Via Nazionale which is a main road leading away from the main Rome Train Station. From here it's only a brief walk to the Coliseum and all major sites in Rome. The vatican is a bit further away but a metro ride will get you there in good time. Check in was easy and the reception staff made us feel very welcome explaining exactly what the hotel offered and providing us with a free drink coupon for the bar. The room itself was quite small but adequate. The view from the window was, regrettably, the back of the building which left the room quite dark. Very nice bathroom with a large tub and excellent selection of amenities provided. A free minibar is also included which featured a couple of beers as well as soft drinks and water - a nice touch. Breakfast was great. Wonderful range of hot and cold options including Italian breads, cheeses, and pastries. Juices were available in more colours than I have ever seen! The service was attentive. Plates were cleared regularly and coffee/tea offered on entry. Compared to other similarly priced hotels in Rome I'd stay here again just for the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't respond to email”
Reviews.Author: Hobbitbean
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 6 months in advance & then lost the booking reference - so I emailed them to confirm I had a booking with them. They did not respond to me - so I assumed I must have not actually booked it. Unfortunately it turns out I had booked it, so as well as booking another hotel last minute I've been charged the first night's stay. Why could they have not just responded to my email in the first place to tell me I had a booking there?!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MAXINEOxford
Reviews.Content: Very central location within walking distance of all the sites. The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient and went out of their way to speak and smile. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and very well equipped. Bonus points for the free mini bar, chocolates, peanuts and bottle of complimentary wine. An excellent hospitality tray with a range of biscuits, good toiletries in the bathroom and a voucher for 2 free glasses of sparkling wine in the bar. Our room was next to the lift on the fourth floor but there was no noise at all. Getting to the hotel from the airport is easy with a direct train - the Leonardo Express which goes to Terminii station and then an easy 10 minute walk to the hotel. There are also buses. The hotel arranged a car at our request. The driver was there waiting for us and we had a very pleasant journey to the hotel (60 euros) but this is really not necessary and we got the train back. My only criticism would be the shower in the bathroom - water pressure erratic and temperature warm at best and cold one morning. Other than that - would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a Large Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bebop11
Reviews.Content: The location is a great. The staff is very hospitable. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman Experience”
Reviews.Author: RaT3
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at the Artemide Hotel for 6 nights in mid March. We found the hotel and the staff to be all that the TA recommendation had stated. Great location, professional and helpful staff and the no extra charge breakfast and mini bar were a wonderful bonus. Great value hotel in a central Roman location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: TanyaCoutts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location, excellent for all the sights, staff really nice, knowledgable, lovely room, greeted with a bottle of wine, nuts etc... free mini bar which is great after a day trekking round Rome. Breakfast plentiful - would definately recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. Oh yes also great for the train station - we were travelling onto Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great service,polite and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: crowdhater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and booked a classic twin room for 780 euro. We found this hotel to be in a good location for using transport and only 20 mins walk to the trevi fountain. Most of the time we took taxis as I have walking difficulties. A taxi to Villa Borgese or the trevi fountain cost approx 6 euro. Our room overlooked the busy main street which meant when we opened the windows it was extremely noisy. We were unable to use the air conditioning as to help the environment in Rome it cannot be turned on until April.However the reception staff kindly offered to put a fan in our room and this solved the problem. Our classic room was a little small and short of storage space(no drawers and not enough hangers)The bathroom however was good sized and very well stocked with toiletries replaced daily. Via Nationale is a main shopping street with Max Mara next door and many other high street shops. However there are very few restaurants on this street so if you come in from a rather tiring day you may find you need to go back to the trevi fountain area to find a better choice of eateries. We would have loved to try the hotel's roof top restaurant but unfortunately it is closed and in the process of refurbishment . The breakfast room is also being used as the restaurant for the time being. If one turns left out of the hotel and walks for around 4 minutes there is a small street on the left (about the 2nd turning) and at the end there is a chinese restaurant and a pizza place called Ricci est est est. We had pizzas , wine and coffee for 13 euro per person. (very reasonable) It does get very busy so you may need to book. To sum up we had a lovely holiday which was made extra special by very friendly,polite and helpful staff who could not do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to reccomendations”
Reviews.Author: Kendo
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 night stay at Arimede Hotel in Rome, 1st visit to Rome over for the 6N rugby. Booked hotel on strength of TA recommendations/ratings and we were not disappointed. Hotel is well located, max 10 mins walk from Termini and just a few minutes from Repubblica Metro stop at top of Via Nazionale. After long day with flight delays and lost baggage staff were very welconing and helpful. Double room was on small side, but tastefully decorated, spotless and very well maintained. Window looked onto internal yard therefore no view, however this was not a major problem for us. Breakfast was very good, plentiful, lots of choice and very fresh, breakfast staff like all others were very pleasant and attentive. Hotel location is good with shops, bars and restaurants just out the door, and well placed for metro to get round rest of city. As per other comments agree it is also walking distance to many of the main attractions. Rooftop bar/terrace closed for refurb when we were there which was a bit of a downer but guess they need to close it at some point and we just got unlucky. Overall other than smallish double room size (average for Rome?) we couldnt fault this hotel. Staff were great and went the extra mile in helping us trace down our delayed baggage by repeatedly phoning airline etc on our behalf to let us get out and about and enjoy our limited time there. We would definately reccomend this hotel and would be more than happy to stay here again in 2 years time when we return to Rome for 6N.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jaclynt
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not have been better for us! Walking distance from the train station, a metro station, and much of Rome in general! Our room was great--upon arrival my husband and I were greeted with a bottle of wine and bowl of nuts. The minibar is also free and stocked daily. The breakfast was amazing and included hot items like eggs and bacon. Did have a couple negatives that would make me take away half a star. Though the perks above make up for these issues! The water temperature in the shower was weird. The first morning it was nice and hot...except for when it shot out bursts of freezing cold every 30 seconds or so. The remaining mornings my water temperature was luke warm at best, while my husband said his was fine. The hair dryer had a similar situation--it would work for 20-30 seconds, then shut off, then after another 20 seconds it would come back on and repeat. It was so methodical with both this and the shower, it seemed like strange energy conservation measures. Then again, maybe it was just our room! Didn't want to bother with complaining though, so perhaps we could have gotten a different room had we been willing to mess with it. But for such a pricey hotel, I would hope for no issues like this at all. Never the less, we very much enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: mauiman8
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our one week stay in Rome at the Artemide Hotel. I found the Artemide Hotel through tripadvisor.com (gotta love this site). We wanted to stay in an authentic Italian hotel and that's exactly what this is. It is in a great location in Rome--walking distance to The Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, Victor Emmanulle, Spanish Step, etc. Everything is about a 20-30 minute walk but a nice walk. I was emailing back and forth with Alessandro at the hotel before we arrived and he took very good care of us throughout the vacation.. Others have mentioned how terrific he was here and they were correct. He was great and extremely helpful! I would highly recommend you ask for a room in the back of the hotel. There is no view at all, but it is a lot quieter. The lounge is wonderful and they had Budweiser so I was psyched! Emilio the bartender was fantastic and makes one helluva Mojito! He was a great guy! The maid service was excellent as well which I love while on vacation.I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pity about the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: Bgiff
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at the artemide hotel. I would have given it 5 out of 5 but we asked for a quiet room and were placed on the sixth floor just below the builders on the 7th!!! I did not ruin our stay just got us up a little earlier than expected. But the hotel is great, very clean and friendly. Great location too. Rome is spectacular - my only tip is bring your most comfortable shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DDel87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in February, walked from Termini station to the hotel in 5-6 mins! Arrived early and this was no problem as the room was ready. Room was spotless, comfortable and free mini bar restocked daily. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Breakfast was great, and plenty of everything. The location of the hotel is great for all of the tourist attractions, we walked everywhere except to the Vatican, and if you dont feel like walking, there is a Metro Station less than one minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is a little pricier than others but well worth it for the comfort, we will be staying here when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide couldn't have been any more helpful, a great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: edgooner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide lived up to it's billing on trip advisor. Within minutes of booking we'd had an email conversation about wheat free food for one of our party. While we were there Alexandro, Rosa and Mario all continued to deliver excellent service, advising on where to go and when, making arrangements and bookings for us. They couldn't have done more to help. The hotels other services were good too. The range of breakfast, the free mini bar, the welcome proseco were all nice and added to the sense of good value for money. The location is excellent too. The furthest attraction is the Vatican and that is only a 30 minute walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: LY1019
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our honeymoon (as well as our first trip overseas) in Rome on 29 Feb-5 Mar and picked this hotel based upon the many positive reviews it received. I can happily say that Hotel Artemide lived up to the hype and helped give us a wonderful time in Italy. From the moment we checked in when we were greeted by the gracious Valentina to the moment we checked out with the friendly Alessandro, we were treated with class and warmth. The hotel manager even sent us a bottle of merlot and mixed nuts as a honeymoon gift! The hotel itself is an older (like most facilities in Rome) but well maintained building and we did not experience any technical issues. Our suite #402 was splendid and had a balcony overlooking Via Nazionale and, although it overlooks a busy street, we did not experience any issues regarding noise because we are heavy sleepers and generally not bothered by noise (that's what living in a city does to you!). The room had many amenities including sweets, mini-fridge with complimentary water/beer/soda, and plenty of space. We also did not feel unsafe in the hotel nor surrounding areas. The neighborhood is very urban yet safe. There is also actually a McDonalds down the street for anyone who truly craves American food but there is also a mini-grocery store across the street as well. The nicest restaurant that is closest to the hotel is Doverali, which is also across the street next to the grocery store. The food there is good and the service is pleasant. However there are plenty of trattorias and less fancy ristorantes with good food nearby too. Via Nazionale is a major street so there are also shops and sights nearby as well as a major museum that had a Guggenheim exhibit while we were there. If you stay at Artemide, you are literally no more than a 15-20 min walk from many sights such as Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto, and the Colosseum so the location is good. The only thing that is somewhat far away was the Vatican, but you can take a taxi there for about 10 Euros if you don't feel like taking the 45 min walk. We did not use the Metrorail in Rome and hired a car to pick us up at the airport when we arrived to take us to the hotel (it was an excellent limo service with prices comparable to a taxi). When we were leaving to go home, we tried taking the Metrorail to Fiumicino Airport from Termini Station however we found it to be very confusing and not user-friendly so we just grabbed a taxi instead from Termini. If you do decide to use the Metrorail, the hotel is about 3-4 city blocks away, which isn't too bad but just be prepared to not get lost because it can be confusing if you are unfamiliar with the area. Also the only thing we feel we missed out on was the Terrace Restaurant/Bar on the roof of the hotel. I had read many great reviews of it but the hotel was currently refurbishing and remodeling it so it was closed unfortunately. Overall the Hotel Artemide is a jewel in Rome and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient and comfortable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sue222
Reviews.Content: We have just returned for a great stay in Rome.The Artemide is ideally situated for sightseeing of major sights and the metro is nearby for connections to other attractions!! Hotel Artemide was very good value for money. The staff are friendly and helpful. The excellent breakfast set us up for the day!! and a mini bar in the room.. restocked daily for no fee ...which is unusual for europe was a nice touch. The hotel room was very clean & comfortable. We ate in the Hotel Restaurant and found the food to be tasty, well cooked and good value for money.. the wine list is good and reasonable too!! We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: BbytthDr
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed here this past week for 3 nights. I booked a triple superior room, which was a good value. Although the room was tight with two twins and a sleeper sofa, the bathroom was nice and the window faced a courtyard, so it was quiet. There is very little closet/drawer space, so expect to live out of your suitcase. There is a tea setup in the closet, too, which was nice but occupied some of the precious storage room. The front desk staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was good and the service was prompt. I had arranged through the hotel for a car to pick us up at the airport, and the driver was there when we came out of customs--a big help if you're traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personal service”
Reviews.Author: walkingWakefieldUk
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor we chose this hotel. At first it seems quite a normal type of hotel, but they pay attention to the little things, which puts it above many hotels of a similar standard. It is very convenient, the 64 bus is an easy way to get around and it is worth buying a Rome transport ticket, we bought a 7 day one. By I assume looking at my passport they realised it was my birthday and the bottle of wine and nuts delivered to our room was really appreciated. I enjoyed the lobster in their restaurant and had it twice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abby b
Reviews.Content: Thank you T..A Travellers for all the advice about Rome, the Hop on Hop Off Buses are brilliant but if you stay in the centre like we did at the fabulous Artemide Hotel, you can walk everywhere within 15 minutes e.g. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Pantheon, etc., etc., we went to the Vatican, Sistine Chapel etc which seemed a long way and took a taxi (very cheap) but then walked back in about 30 minutes. ALL cobbled streets, so comfy shoes a must. The Artemide was in a perfect location, exceptionally clean, ALL the staff were very friendly and helpful, great reasonable food in the restaurant too, and it even had a free mini bar. Could not be faulted. can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: hyattsydney
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay was awesome! The front desk staff was welcoming and "Super" Mario was very helpful. The room was spotless, well appointed and very comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. The breakfast was plentiful. There was quite a selection of hot items, pastries, fruit, cereal, etc. The hotel is conveniently located too. Just a short walk to the Termini! We will definitely recommend Hotel Artemide and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raindeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the same exact days with the previous user from 10th to the 13th March 12. However things were great for us. Not perfect but this is a great hotel with a very convenient location. Easy access to the old town and not noisy and too much crowded. Definetly the area to stay in Rome. I don't understand most of the bad comments because they simply didn't happen to us but I get the front desk being cold part. They didn't try to make us feel all that welcome, they were just business. The bathroom and amenities were nice and spotlessly clean. There was lots of fruit waiting for us in our room on our first day. Also minibar being free was a nice touch. I know it is somehow included in the room price but it is still nice to have a bottle of water without having the feeling of getting ripped off. Breakfast was nice with a decent amount of choices and good quality. There were not any variations which could be boring for a longer term guest. Wifi was free of charge and we used it for 3 different devices. Overall this was a very good experience and I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “So over all we will not be advising anyone to stay here when in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: cllr
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 10th to the 13th March 12. Booked because of the trip advisor reviews, not a good idea as I think a number of these must be written by the hotel themselves! On arrival the front desk could not have been more off putting, not rude but the staff really not as some reviews state on this site, they were just cold. Then the porter took us to the wrong part of the hotel, had to phone the front desk as they had given us the wrong room in the wing known as B wing. We had to walk all the way back to reception into another lift up to another room. So far not a great start to any stay. When we did get to the room the porter when in the room could not open the bathroom door as the door handle/lock was broken and stayed that way all of our stay with no one making any attempt to fix it. Next the in room safe needed fixing as it had not been fixed before we arrived, more poor customer service. While in the room the staff even noticed the noise from the room next door, from our so-called sound proofed room. We had to call the front desk every day about the noise from other rooms! There is NO soundproofing at this hotel. You hear it all from the other room! Joy of joys, not. Breakfast area, one has to get up to find staff to order coffee, one staff member liked to do her makeup and eyes while looking in the mirror in the restaurant, very professional. The other staff all behind the auto door doing what ever they were doing. Cold meets ran out not replenished. There is NO air-conditioning in the bedrooms, hotel even said they could not turn the air-conditioning on due to Rome’s rules. Don’t need to use the sauna as the rooms are saunas in them self’s. Folks the mini bar in your rooms are not free they are just included in you room rate, think about it. We filled in a comment card on the 3rd day and had a reply back saying we should have told the hotel on the first day and when the other problems occurred. We had to tell the hotel manager that we HAD informed HIS hotel staff but they never dealt with these issues. With this the hotel manager took 150 euros off our room bill and he seemed very embarrassed about the shabbiness of the hotel staff. So over all we will not be advising anyone to stay here when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: pamraysondean
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay at the Artemide.It is well placed for all sites in Rome and walking sitance for the Termini station, yet was quiet and luxurious too. Many thanks, we would definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: BIBF
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at the Artemide from the 5th - 8th march. This is our third or fourth time staying at this hotel. we always stay here when we go to Rome now as we love it. The staff are very helpful, professional and friendly. We requested a specific room a few weeks before we arrived and were very pleased to get it, even more pleased with the complimentry bottle of wine we found when we got to the room. a very nice touch. The free mini bar is handy, standing on the balcony with a cold beer after a day sightseeing is fabulous. the breakfast is wonderful, you can have as much as you want and they do all sorts, cereals, fruit, cheese, bread, cooked breakfast and even cakes and doughnuts. wonderful! All the staff are amazing, really helpful and kind. we had a lovely few days in rome, the hotel is walking distance to everything, with the vatican being about the furthest, about a 40 minute walk, but on the way to the vatican, you pass the trevi fountain, the pantheon and can pop to piazza navona and see the wonderful fountain depicting the four rivers, it is really great. We love Rome and will keep coming back, and when we do we will always stay at the Artemide. Emma

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Gem”
Reviews.Author: GoVTHokieTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience in every way at the Artemide Hotel. The staff was always polite, courteous and helpful. Plus, their English was excellent. The large room (with a FREE minibar) was very clean with luxury towels, bathrobe and slippers, plus the mattresses were extremely comfortable - thank goodness since we were there for 10 days. The breakfast was delicious - it was NOT a continental breakfast, but a full buffet with everything from cereal, pastries, fresh fruit and yogurt, to eggs and bacon - a great way to start the day as a tourist. Oh, and don't miss the cappuccino! We found the location for the Artemide Hotel perfect for getting around Rome. It is within walking distance of the Termini train station, and since we took day trips to Florence and Naples, the ability to walk to the station was very convenient. Plus, you can catch a bus from Termini to all of the sites in Rome, and there is a subway station within easy walking distance of the Artemide Hotel too! We walked to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Colosseum and Forum. We felt completely safe both day and night.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sahsameer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife in February 2012 and booked a room without breakfast online. The staff were very welcoming and polite throughout the stay even suggesting restaurants and booking tables for us. We landed in Rome early and we were at the hotel by 11.30. Generally most hotels do not let you check in but we were made to wait only 10 minutes during which time, they gave us additional complimentary drinks vouchers so that we could enjoy a glass of Prosecco each. We were also given a complimentary breakfast voucher and would advice that that it is better to book a room with breakfast as the quality and variety is good. The room was small, but well arranged and neat and clean. The mini bar is free which is amazing considering that most hotels rip you off with the prices on the products in the mini bar. The bathroom had a bath/shower, WC and a bidet, was kept spanking clean and was well stocked with toiletries. The only downside that I can think off is the shower curtain in the bathroom that did not effectively prevent the water from spilling on to the floor. Unfortunately, we did not have time to try the sauna or gym but the location of the hotel is such that you can get good exercise walking to all the sights in Rome. In fact, we did not need to take the taxi even once during our whole stay and the hotel staff were very helpful with directions. Shopping on Via Nazionale where the hotel is located is decent, especially for ladies dresses and shoes. In general, around Rome, products are fashionable and good and prices are low compared to the poor quality high priced stuff you find on Oxford Street in London. All in all, if we go to Rome again, we will definitely stay at the same hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan J
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in Rome to do sightseeing this is a great hotel The minibar is free and restocked every day. The breakfast buffet is great as are the rooms. The hotel is located close to most of the sights that you will want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelman64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a short break to Rome and we stayed at the Artemide Hotel. We made the trip to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful. Special mention must go to Valentina on the front desk who helped with our arrangements before and during our trip. We received an upgrade on arrival and on our anniversary were given a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and strawberries! Our room was very clean and had plenty of space. The free minibar was a really nice touch, with water, coke, fanta and beer replaced every day, together with peanuts and crackers. We had the buffet breakfast every day which was lovely and offered so much choice and ate in the restaurant on two of the evenings. The service was welcoming and friendly and the food was fantastic (try the beef fillet, possibly the best I have had anywhere including the USA). The only slight disappointment was that the roof terrace was off limits due to some building work. It took us approx 15 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Colloseum and 15 mins in the opposite direction to the Trevi Fountain and 45 minutes to stroll across to the Vatican. The hotel is on Via Nazionale which is a bustling road with shops and restaurants. We genuinely couldnt have wished for a better place to stay and would definitely recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a short Rome break”
Reviews.Author: Goodbloke1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Artemide for four nights on short break to Rome. To be balanced, I'll get a couple of slight negatives out of the way first. The Hotel is not as grand as some photos's might suggest. It's a relatively modest 4* hotel in terms of the specification of it's reception, lounge & restaurant areas. Also our room was very small, just a bit of space to get around the bed. We booked a standard room so it's hard to see how the cheaper "economy" size rooms we saw available when we booked could be any smaller. I note others have referred to the standard rooms being a good size at this hotel, therefore sounds like we got a bad allocation & so moral of the story is to try and get reception to move you if you get put in a very small room, as clearly the standard rooms must vary allot. Also the roof terrace bar you may have seen advertised is closed at the moment for refurb just to be aware. In terms of location, the better shopping & restaurant area's can be distant from the main historical attractions dotted around the city and this kind of sits in the middle of it all. So whilst the area immediately around the hotel is fine but without any great selling point (apart from maybe proximity to the main station), it is however a very good location to leave most things (Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Forum, Pantheon etc) all within 15/20 mins walking distance. The big plus with this hotel is that they have so many nice touches you really feel like you are being looked after. Free mini bar, free wifi, movies in the room only 5 euros, complimentary drinks when you arrive, helpful staff - the general culture at the hotel is one of good value & service. The rooms were perfectly clean, the morning buffet decent, overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: structed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March and had a wonderful time. Hotel is located near the train station and on a major road with bus service to many of the sites. Staff was most helpful and courteous. Room was large, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Breakfast was a "10"; delicious, well presented, and nutritious; with wonderful waitstaff and maitre d. We would stay again without a doubt. I consider this to be a well run 4 star hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Diserved réputation”
Reviews.Author: hectace74
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from march 7th to march 10th. Excellent welcoming, smiling and caring staff. We had the chance to have an upgraded room, which was excellent: large, calm, cosy and very well equipped. SOme details make it an excellent room: free mini bar, clean bathroom with many little fancy items, good beds, etc... The location is perfect, and if you have a roma pass, it's very easy to get quickly to any point of interest in the city. EXCELLENT HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Italy in February of 2012, my wife and I had the privilege of staying at the Hotel Artemide in Rome. It was a wonderful experience right from the beginning. The amenities provided were of the finest available. The breakfast every morning was complete, supplying us with all of the delights an American style buffet could provide. The coffee was freshly brewed, hot and delicious, both Italian as well as, American style. The most outstanding treat of this fine hotel located in the heart of the city was its staff. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating and responsive to our every need, from providing helpful hints on dining to arranging for taxis and general information about the location of desired destinations. Our room was kept very clean along with fresh linens and bathroom supplies provided daily. All this with a gracious smile and warm greeting from everyone there. If you come to Rome, don't miss this opportunity to make your stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonja A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week for a very good discount price (-65 %). For the first time in Europe someone else carried by baggage up to the room! The room was pleasant and there was plenty of space. Everything in the minibar was free and they also gave vouchers at the reception with which one could have a free prosecco or discount from dinner from the hotel restaurant. The restaurant was situated on the top floor and it had a beautiful roof terrace with sofas and radiators so that even in December it was comfortable to sit out. The hotel breakfast was very nice, a lot of options for a tasty meal and also fresh vegetables, which most hotels lack of. The hotel was situated at a walking distance from the railway station and metro stations, so that all the sightseeing spots were easily accessible. It is also very close to the Fontana di Trevi. Alltogether I had a very pleasant stay in the hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Artimede in August 2011”
Reviews.Author: aloftjf
Reviews.Content: We were booked for one night coming off a cruise. Very conveniently located from the Termini. Our room was excellent with a sitting room included. Both bedroom and sitting room were small by North American standards, but very spacious by European standards. Desk Staff were exceptionally friendly, and all seemed to speak English (I am always amazed especially given the uni-lingual nature of most North Americans). We had a little problem with our bathtub, but maintenance was right on it and completed repairs expeditiously.. The "no charge" mini-bar was not like a main line hotel, but included wine, fruit, water, soft drinks. Very good. Don't expect great air conditioning in Europe, but this was acceptable.. We had to leave very early in the morning for the airport, and the staff delivered a brown bag breakfast shortly after a wake up call . All of this and a comparatively great price. Lots of shopping and restaurants. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loveyl Anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: scarmic3 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an ideal location for all the main attractions, the service was friendly and professional and I would recommend to my friends and family travelling to Rome Breakfast had a great choice and the staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “The Artemide Hotel has it all...location, service and beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Gailagor
Reviews.Content: While researching for our trip to Rome, I came upon a review for the Hotel Artemide. I had almost decided on another hotel before further research led me to believe this was the place for us! I like being right! The hotel is not only beautiful, the service is incredible! Location, location, location... This is IT! We were right in the center of Rome and walked everywhere... Quit researching and book your room.... My husband and I cannot be more pleased that WE did!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend in Rome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bren121
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Artemide hotel and it was Perfect. The location was amazing right beside the termini and the metro also. it is walking distance to a number of the best sights. the staff were second to none they really went out of there way to make our stay very special and extremely enjoyable. The staff and hotel provided some extra special treats over the two days that made our time even more special. The hotel is in the perfect spot for good food, friendly atmosphere and access to all the main sights. i would recommend it to anyone! we are a young couple who had a fantastic time but the hotel would cater to everyone's needs!!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as Trip Advisor suggests”
Reviews.Author: mf62
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, friendly, helpful staff. Spotless rooms. Room products constantly topped up (tea, coffee, milk, biscuits, soap, toilet paper, hankies, etc). Crisp new sheets very day. Quiet. Had dinner one night which was really good. Welcome drink. 50% off voucher for food for one dinner. Good free in room wi-fi (including streaming). Would stay again and would recommend. Thanks hotel artemide ;0)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel apart from the building work”
Reviews.Author: Steve C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location within a 15 min walk from the main tourist attractions. The room is quite a good size by Rome standards with a free minibar restocked daily. The staff were helpful with directions etc. The only problem with this hotel was that the 7th floor which is usually the bar & restaurant was closed for major refurbishment. This meant each morning between 8:30 - 9:00am we were woken thinking we had fallen asleep in the middle of a building site. This carried on until about 5:00pm each day. This work has been going on for a while so I thought the hotel might have told me this before I travelled, but they didnt. They didnt even tell me when I checked in, they left it to the porter to tell me when we were in the lift on the way to the room! I would recommend this hotel but make sure the building work has finished before you book.

Reviews.Title: “A model for all other hotels - 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: ct_roy_nyc
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in the Artemide Hotel in mid-Feb 2012 as a surprise weekend away for my girlfriend whom I proposed to while in Rome (she said yes!). I wanted to stay somewhere special for the weekend that was in it and could not have picked a better hotel! I have stayed in many nice hotels over the years and rank the level in service to be on a par if not better than in many so called 5 Star hotels. Everybody who works there really cares for their guests and we were made to feel very welcome. I had asked the hotel for some special arrangements and they could not have been more helpful. The free minibar was also a wonderful treat. We were in Rome the same weekend that the heavy snow fell but if anything that added to a unique weekend - it's not often one gets to see the Colosseum covered in snow! The hotel is within walking distance of all the hot spots in central rome and makes for a wonderful base to explore this wonderful city. I would also say that the breakfast is first class - much much better than what one might expect in similarly priced hotels elsewhere in Europe. Thank you to Hotel Artemide for a wonderful weekend - and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location with great breakfast to start your day”
Reviews.Author: sparkycurtis
Reviews.Content: In brief, this hotel is in a great location and provides you good walking distance to all of Romes main sites. We love to walk a City to get a better feel for a place and rarely get any form of transport when in a city centre. From the hotel the furthest distance to walk was Vatican City which took us approx 35 - 40 mins. The Colloseum took about 10 mins to get too, as did the walk to the Spanish Steps. The entire walks were pleasant and safe - no dodgy areas to walk through which is a major plus. The Hotel itself is smart and well kept. The rooms are a good enough size for a City centre hotel. Staff are helpfull and friendly. A major bonus the hotel offers is the free mini bar in your room. This was replenished daily and consisted of 1 x Coke, 1 x Fanta Orange, 2 x Astro Lager, 2 x Carton of Fruit Juice, 2 x Still Water, 2 x Lightly Sparkling Water. Some biscuits and nuts were also provided. Great touch. Breakfast was really good here with the staff at this time particularly friendly too. Great coffee made for you how you want, and plenty of good breakfast options for you to choose yourself - the cakes and pastries were a particular favourite of mine! The only downside we found of the hotel was the temperature of the hotel and rooms. Far too hot for us and we were unable to get the temperature down either. We had to leave the window open all afternoon and evening to get the temperature down below 20 degrees. I guess some people might prefer the heat more than we did. Other than the heating issue, this was a great hotel that we would recommend and even use again should we return to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelkidx2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for short break in November. Hotel was in a great location for seeing the sights. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable, not overly big with limited storage but it suited our requirements. We had requested a quiet room so the lack of a view as we were at the back of the hotel was not an issue. The mini bar which was replenished daily with water, soft drinks and snacks for free was a very nice touch. Breakfast was varied and plentiful (we particularly enjoyed the scrambled eggs). One slight criticism would be that the lighting in both the breakfast room and the dining room (which didn't seem to be used much) was a little bright for our taste - not quite romantic enough for our anniversary dinner. On the other hand we were very taken with the roof terrace which was a great place to relax after all the sightseeing and indulge in a limoncello. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful Staff. Yummy Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LLLafferty
Reviews.Content: Exhausted after traveling from Colorado to Rome, I was so thankful to the desk staff, who whisked our bags away and suggested breakfast. No of course we could not check in early, but their kind suggestions of having some nourishment and a some coffee bolstered us for hours. The rooms are small, but just perfect. SO many Roman hotels have tiny, noisy rooms. Artemide is pretty close to the Forum and Coliseum, but only twenty to thirty minute walk to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. (Have a good map.) Lime green terrycloth slippers and lots of brightly colored amenities. But the best part was a delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “so helpful with disability”
Reviews.Author: BSeickel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week....The staff was wonderful and the room for the disabled was perfect. The REFILLABLE mini bar was great...the american breakfast was great. Any issue we had, the staff assisted......I was very concerned since I needed to utilize wheelchair and or cane...Would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Italian independent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days. We did a reservation for a triple deluxe room and had a mini suite because of availability, room was realy nice. Staff was excellent and well prepared with information. Breakfast was great. One day we went from Rome to Pompei and arrived late so we went to the hotel's restaurant that was also great. When back to the airport, they offered me transfer to Fumiccino for 15Euro each and took it, as it was the same amount as the Da Vinci train. It is also in an excellent location, we went walking to every place, even Vaticano. When we arrived, we knew it was walking distance from Termini station, it was snowing really hard, those 6/7 blocks were hard for us with our large luggage. I would definetly recommend this hotel and I'm sure I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: NorthantsMark
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday. We stayed for 3 nights from the 19th Feb 2012. The hotel was fantastic and the staff cannot do enough to help you in anyway they can. We stayed in a standard room on the third floor, which although small was perfect for the two of us to use as a base as we had no intention of spending time in our room with such a beautiful city to explore. The hotels location could not have been better for all the most famous attractions….a 15 min stroll to the Trevi Fountain, 15 mins to the Spanish Steps, 10 mins to the Colosseum and only a 45 min amble to the Vatican. You really are in the centre of the city with easy access to everything you would want to see or do. As per previous reviews I was treated to a free bottle of bubbly on my birthday compliments of the hotel manager (something that they had arranged without either of us even mentioning my birthday). It was certainly these little touches that made our stay extra special. In addition to this they also provide a free mini-bar and free wi-fi, and we were given a complimentary drink at the bar, and although we hadn’t taken the B&B option we were invited for a complimentary breakfast during our stay also. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and could not find fault during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & really good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Debbiesharp
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in the hotel, booked a 3 night trip for my husbands 40th birthday. I emailed the hotel before our stay and asked them if I brought decorations and balloons would they decorate the room for me, they were only too happy to help, in fact they left a bottle of prosecco on I've for us on our return to the room, a really nice touch. Our room is very clean, the bed is very comfortable and the shower is great, you have a free mini bar and snacks topped up daily, we also had breakfast included, this is also excellent, great coffee and great selection, the staff in the restaurant at breakfast are great, very friendly and welcoming and they keep you topped up with coffee, even I said I didn't want a second cappuccino I would come back to the table to find a babycino, just in case!! Really do highly recommend this hotel, had everything you could ask for in a great location, nothing is too much trouble, what more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: Miss_emily88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my boyfriends 30th birthday. The hotel was offerering a buy 3 nights and get 50% off and after looking at the website I was so excited to get such a bargain for a gorgeous hotel in Rome. We were looked after so well and got a few treats along the way for my boyfriends birthday, the little touches made it so memorable. The food was lovely, we had dinner at the hotel on our first night and it was really good. Breakfast was always really good too. Staff very helpful and kind. The hotel couldn't be in a better location either, 10 min walk to the Collisium and a short taxi ride to Vatican city. Rome is one of the best cities we've ever experienced. The hotel I would recommend to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded Expectations - Could not ask for Better Service”
Reviews.Author: Pen E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my 60th birthday in Rome and had picked this hotel because of it's description, location and reviews. I cannot imagine how anyone could give this hotel a bad review. The room was extremely comfortable, well maintained and contained everything we needed. Anything used was replenished every day, including the mini bar - juices, water and a couple of Peronis too!!!!! The staff were very polite and helpful and seemed to really like doing their jobs. I am mildly agoraphobic and when the restaurant manager realised I had a problem with feeling trapped at certain tables, he made sure the staff were aware and every morning they found us a table where I felt comfortable. I also admired the extreme patience with which one of the reception staff treated a very nasty American lady who actually snapped her fingers at him, demanding that her room be ready in five minutes!!! I wanted to kick her, but he just continued to be polite and helpful. The food was delicious and at breakfast there was plenty of choice and lots of everything - cold meat and cheeses, fresh fruits, yoghurts, different types of bread, eggs, bacon, several types of juices, pastires, etc etc. The dinner menu was a little limited, but as they served the best lasagne I have ever tasted, this didn't bother me. On my birthday we were given wine and strawberries in our room - compliments of the management - a lovely surprise. Location was excellent, we didn't use public transport once, you could walk to everything you wanted to see easily. We even walked up to St Peter's Basilica and back. I can honestly say that I have only ever stayed in one other hotel as good as this one. Admittedly I have not stayed in a five star hotel ever, but who needs one when four star standard is this good? We will most certainly choose this hotel again when returning to Rome and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful reprieve in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JWRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: The Artemide hotel is a small but well appointed hotel in the heart of Rome. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms are immaculate, comfortable and reasonable in size. Best of all, they are completely silent. A breakfast buffet comes with the room, and it is good (although not exceptional), Hundreds of shops, Restaurants, and the city center are all in the surrounding vicinity, so this is an excellent base for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: PT1955
Reviews.Content: From the word go, the staff could not have been more helpful. Hotel is short walk from main train station and centrally located. Everyting is within walking distance. Local bars and restaurants very good. suggestions and directions given by reception first rate. The man in the bar for our nightcap was knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction. Will be my first choice when I next visit Rome

Reviews.Title: “An excellent four star hotel, well worth all credit”
Reviews.Author: JanochBarbro
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor and had high expectations. Of course it is not a five star or luxury hotel, it has four stars, but they are very well worth it!! Good location (some noise from the traffic, so if that bothers you, ask for a room facing the back), excellent service both at reception and in the bar as well as the breakfast room. For Italy, an excellent breakfast buffet and possibilities to get espresso or cappuccino, too along with fresh fruit, various types of bread and cakes, bacon, scrambled eggs, veggies, salads, water, juices, cereals, cheeses and cold cuts. Minus for the fitted carpet in the room, but at least it was clean and not especially worn. Room was big, on the fourth floor, with balcony towards the street. Sofa and good desk provided ample space for work. Big and well equipped bathroom. Coffee/teatray with biscuits provided. Welcome from management with a bottle of decent red wine with nice wine glasses. Observed that one of us was celebrating birthday, got a fruit platter and a card, appreciated the gesture. Fridge and safe, of course. A free water bottle daily. Lots of help from the reception. Used their car with driver to go to airport at only a few euros more than the fixed taxi fare, and much more convenient. Would absolutely not hesitate to go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice”
Reviews.Author: Darryl_roze
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on here I chose this hotel for a 2 night stay for my girlfriends birthday. The reviews on here were very good so my expectations were very high and I must say I was not dissapointed. The location was very close to the main station and very central to all the main attractions. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and were happy to chat to you to help out with anything. We even called down on the Sunday to ask if the local supermarket would be open still at 7pm, they even offered to send someone to get us something if we needed. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was top draw. The only fault was that our room faced a fire exit stairway, but that's the only negative. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value, and service”
Reviews.Author: charlestontarheel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Artemide. It is a well located hotel which had an excellent staff. We walked from the train station to the hotel which was very convenient. Our room was on the small size but was also the most reasonably priced hotel we had during our stay in Rome. The free minibar is also a very nice touch. Bathroom was large and newly redone. Breakfasts were wonderful with almost everything one could ask - they would even bring me my diet (light) coke in the mornings. The nicest part for us was that is was a block from the metro so we could hop on and off to see Rome. The only disappointment for us was the 7th floor dining room was being redone, so the breakfast was in rather plain rooms. Will look forward to the new rooftop bar and restaurant when it is completed. Highly recommend if you are looking for a very nice and convenient spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: IrishWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artemide in mid February. The hotel is located approx 20 minutes walk to the Colosseum/ Forums and 15 minutes from the Spanish Steps area. Even though, the walking times are not long to many of the main tourist sites , however if you are travelling with young children it may not suit you due to the extra foot time to get to them. If your interested in going to the Vatican you can avail of the underground (close by), taxi or bus. Walking is a good 45 minutes-hour (for adults). The area around the hotel is fine; it is on a street with small stores and a few bars. There is also a small supermarket and pharmacy across the street. Although, there is not a huge selection of restaurants in the area and require some hunting down. I booked this hotel based on the amount of positive reviews on Tripadvisor and I would have loved to give this hotel a 5 star review, however a few things let this hotel down and stop it from been the top class hotel it could be.
