So what are the positives? 1) Nice and well decorated hotel. 2) Extremely friendly and helpful floor staff (staff in the blue jackets) 3) Helpful check in staff. 4) Nice rooms, a bit small (for more than 2 people). {We had a triple room} 5) Excellent breakfast area and very helpful breakfast staff. 6) Free mini bar! 7) Welcome Fruit in room on arrival. 8) Welcome drinks. So why not 5 stars? We were travelling with 2 children, 1 is a toddler and therefore we had pre-ordered a cot. The cot was perfectly prepared on arrival. However, the following morning the baby blanket in the cot was replace with a towel!! Yes - A TOWEL! It was not a mistake as it was under the bed sheet! This was totally unacceptable! I did request another blanket and one was quickly sent up. However, for a hotel in this calibre, it is just inexcusable! I would not expect this in motorway hotel let alone a 4 star hotel! Few other small points, the toilet supplies (shampoo, bath foam etc) were not topped up each day, the bar staff could be a bit more polite and the room service menu is very limited. Rome can be expensive in relation to hotels (especially at the upper end), so is this hotel worth the cost? We got a 3 for 2 deal which was fantastic, however if I'd paid full price I would have been disappointed especially with the size of the room (for the cost) and the incident with the baby cot. Others have said that the rooms are spacious, possibly for a couple, but the triple room did not appear to be much larger. I assume suits are larger and therefore maybe more suited if you’re staying with children. Would I stay here again? As a couple yes, especially if the main tourist sites are not the main focus of your trip. With children - No, due to the distance to the main tourist sites/parks etc and the room size.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location - well deserving of its rating”
Reviews.Author: Leah D
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 4 night stay at Hotel Artemide in early February. We were upgraded to a superior twin room, which was very spacious, spotlessly clean and was very quiet (apart from a bit of noise from the nearby lift). The free mini bar was a great touch - bottled water and snacks were perfect when we got back after a full day of sightseeing. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The snow in Rome while we were there meant that the Colosseum (for which we had pre-booked tickets) was closed for a few days. We therefore had to change our tickets and the hotel reception were more than happy to help by printing out the new tickets emailed to us by the ticket agency. Staff at breakfast were very helpful and attentive. Breakfast itself was fantastic - lots of choice, with all tastes catered for. The hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing, with the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum and Pantheon within 15 minutes walk. Even the Vatican was only a pleasant 45 minute walk away. The hotel is on a main road, but we heard no noise from this and it is a great location, with lots of places to eat within 5-10 minutes walk. We have already recommended the Hotel Artemide to friends and family as it offers everything you could want for a city break in Rome: great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Roman hospitality at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Eoghain J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two friends have just returned from Rome and felt the necessity to congratulate the Hotel Artemide on what was an excellent stay. The hotel is located within easy access of the Spanish Steps etc, has good facilities, is very clean and has some of the most helpful and friendly staff I have encountered. Nothing seemed too much to ask and was provided in unnaffected way. Well done Hotel Artemide! This is our second stay and we look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel, 5 stars service”
Reviews.Author: kerope28
Reviews.Content: For some reasons, it seems that service personnel in Italy aren't very friendly towards Asians. Upon reaching Rome, we were intially very disappointed by the attitude of the custom staff and thought that we will be receiving similar attitude throughout. But the warm and friendly hotel porter and reception staff made us felt otherwise and also felt at home.We booked for 5 nights and was upgraded to the Superior Room. Although the same breakfast was served throughout the 5 days, it was fantastic with a good range of cold and hot meat, cereals, salads, preserved fruits, pastries, etc. I actually enjoyed the breakfast the most. The hotel is just about 10 minutes walk to the Termini, but the cold weather made it torturing to walk.(we were there during the unexpected snow period). Had the weather been better, you could really walk and didn't even realise that you have reached a major attraction, as you will be so distracted by the beauty of the city around you!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live upto it's ratings”
Reviews.Author: Nam S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide Hotel for 1 night in Dec and this was THE most disappointing hotel during our entire stay in Italy. The room was extremely small and cramped with a bathroom to match. I have never felt more claustophobic in a hotel room. The location wasn't bad considering that we had to get to the airport pretty early in the morning. I wouldn't recommend this location if you are planning on sightseeing. The only reason I have given an average ranking is because of the service. The staff was extremely courteous and even packed us a light breakfast at 4 am when we checked out. Still for the price we paid, I don't think it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location. Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: NoeDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, all main attractions are within walking distance. We booked a superior room, it was quite big, very clean and we had free minibar & wifi. Breakfast was quite good. What we really loved is the staff, they were all very helpful and friendly. I'd definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in snowy Rome centre.”
Reviews.Author: JosephineBloggs
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel at reasonable prices. Yes, the room are smallish and could have done with a chest of drawers, but most people will visit Rome with carry-on only, so it really isn't an issue. The extras for the room were excellent though, Tea (various types) and coffee, with snacks and a mini bar with water, beer, soft drinks and juices which were replenished each day. The lovely robes and slippers with the fully stocked bathroom were a nice touch. We also had a nice bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived. We also had no issues with noise at all in this hotel and could not here the main road at all (Via Nazionale). Tip of the day: If you are getting a superior room, ask for a room away from the lift and with a walk-on terrace. I asked for this and we got our own private terrace with table and chairs (approx 5m square), but there is only one in the hotel (I think!). Last thing to mention is the excellent service from all of the staff, who were lovely from start to finish, always helpful and friendly. All in all, a brilliant place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: quite_particular
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel in terms of quality and value! The staff could not have been more helpful, polite, friendly or efficient - an absolute joy. We booked a superior room and received an upgrade to a junior suite without even asking which was much appreciated. To give you an idea of how refreshing this hotel is we ended up in a room which was a great size, had loads of space, loads of storage, big clean bathroom, huge bed, great shower pressure, free minibar, complimentary bottle of wine, 2 complimentary drinks in the rooftop bar, and all for a great price (booked a flight & hotel option with Expedia). Even the range of toiletries in the bathroom was well thought out and well presented! The location was great - minutes from Repubblica metro station, though we rarely used this as we found it no trouble at all to walk from here to and from all the major sights in Rome. Admittedly we do like to walk to explore a city anyway but this certainly felt central enough for this to be no problem at all. Breakfast was plentiful at all times, no running out of anything, so no need to worry that you are going to be left with a dry roll and a random yoghurt if (like us) you like to slope up 15 minutes before they stop serving! There was a varied range of choices and they were all of good quality. Service was prompt and of course friendly, even to the point where one of the waiters would remember my coffee order from the day before and come to offer a second round during the meal, whilst also humouring and encouraging my learner Italian :) We are a couple but the room we stayed in could have been used by a family as the sofa in the seating area was a double sofa bed, and there would have been a decent amount of room given that this is a central location in Rome. I have already recommended it to friends of mine with a child, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again the next time I go to Rome. Tip: on arrival at Fiumcino we were a bit hesitant to book the Leonardo Express train to Termini given how much of a walk the guide book said it was at the other end from the arrival platform to getting to the front of the station. The guy at the ticket booth said the same thing so we took a shuttle bus in which dropped us at the side of the station. On the way back we took the train and the platforms it departed from were right at the front of the station so I think there may have been a platform alteration at some point recently / a bit of disingeniousness from the ticket booth people. My advice would be don't worry about this and feel confident taking the train if that's what you want to do!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Leedsdave
Reviews.Content: We agree with the tone of all the other reports. This is a good 4 star hotel with smallish rooms, with limited storage space. Like many other city hotels. However where it excels is with the extras and service. As mentioned many time the service by ALL the staff is exceptional. They go out of their way to help with anything. We were in Rome during the snow, when no-one knew what was happening, but the staff did their best to find out and help. Food was good, breakfast especially. Free bar and wi-fi also helps. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: leaseah
Reviews.Content: loved the location of the hotel close to all the main attractions (within walking distance) and the free minibar and free wifi was an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfort, and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Nappy524
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location. Huge bed. Free unlimited mini-bar. Excellent customer service. Decent breakfast. Very clean. Though room may be smaller in comparison to other 4-Stars, plenty of room around the bed to manouver while spouse is at the desk. Great hotel. Will stay here every time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Je_C2011_12
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for a short trip to Rome - central location, clean and welcoming facilities. The hotel staff could not be more friendly or obliging. We truly enjoyed our stay and look forward to visiting again soon. As we were on a budget we chose the small double room - no breakfast. It suited us perfectly as the weekend for us was about getting out as much as possible to see all the sights. It was great value for money, very comfortable and we would highly recommend Artemide to all our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ana1210
Reviews.Content: We stay in one of the most expensive hotels in Rome and this one. Honestly I like this one better. The only downfall was the bed. It is not comfortable. They put two twins together to make a King with no padding. Other than that it was a great place to stay. Everyone was helpful and friendly. We had a room with a street view. It can be a bit noisy but not to bad. They had the worst snow in 26 years while we were there, but the walk to the Colosseum is only 10 min, the Spanish Steps are about 20 min walk and the Trevi Fountain is about a 15 min walk so we were able to still see it all. The only places we had to take a cab to was the Vatican, but that is not too bad. The drinks and snacks were nice also. The food at the reasturant is average there is a place one street down called Berzitello. The staff told us about it and it was very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Bella!”
Reviews.Author: Ange921
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked through the front doors to the time we left 4 days later, Artemide was a wonderful hotel experience - one of our best ever. The staff were all so attentive and genuinely helpful, including ordering taxis upon request and coming outside to wait with me until they arrived. The foyer is beautiful and our room was gorgeous - bathroom,separate lounge area and bedroom. The view wasn't great as it was towards the back of the hotel, but the lovely room and peace and quiet certainly made up for it. And the free mini bar was just another bonus (beer, water, juice, and snacks - restocked daily). The location is great - walking distance to the train station, and in the heart of the city. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in the snow”
Reviews.Author: terence c
Reviews.Content: A very good four star hotel, Well maintained, good service and close to all tourist sights. We loved Rome even thought we had to accept wet feet due to the unusual snow fall. Getting back to the UK was another matter. The service by Terevision bus to Ciampino airport was very poorly arranged and should be avoided what ever the weather. Ryanair cancelled our flight due to the snow we were sent text telling us to re book by computer not really possible at the airport. so had to return to Rome find hotel for the night. Four star but very poor compared to Artemide. There was a lack of Ryanair staff at the airport and the customer service was closed on a Saturday, bearing in mind that this airport must have half its flights run by Ryanair this reflects the lack of service generally expected when using this low cost airline. Re booked flight for following day on the hotel computer, no charge by Ryanair. Next day we again had to tolerate the poor bus service to the airport, the booking service for this bus is crazy and shows very poor management. The flight was delayed for 5hours now due to weather in Stansted. Ryanair did finally offer food and drink but very little chance of getting it as the queues were far to long due to the number of planes delayed Still have enjoyed Rome,would go again and use the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Clare R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for a 25th Wedding anniversary trip to Rome and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great position for all the sites, but remember the comfortable shoes! The room was well equipped and tastefully decorated, the view was rubbish though :-) but then we didn't spend much time in the room: too busy seeing the sites! We upgraded from the basic double when we booked so we could get breakfast included. To be honest, the room was quite small. With hindsight we should have mentioned it was our anniversary! We would go there again, would definitely upgrade , to larger room though, or even suite. Breakfast was great: good selection and good quality. The free mini bar in the room had a limited selection but was a very welcome addition. The selection of complimentary toiletries were a lovely touch and the tea/coffee facilites were great. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay....”
Reviews.Author: BernardShakey2905
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with our stay at the Artemide. Everything about it was just right for us for a weekend in Rome. The location depends on what you are looking for, but a few minutes from Repubblica Metro was good for us -- we found that a lot of the main sights were within walking distance, even in the snow and slush ! As mentioned by a lot of people here, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is common in most major cities, and when you are there to see the attractions of the city, how big do you need?.The rooms all have free wi-fi, flat-screen Tv and that most rare of all things in a hotel, a free mini-bar -- no wines or spirits, but water, Coke, juices and beers. The breakfast was very good as well -- not that different from what is on offer in many decent hotels, but the range on offer was wide, and nothing ever ran out. I mailed them in advance to request one double and one twin for our rooms and let them know we were in Rome for my daughters 18th birthday, and when we got to her room there was a birthday card and a huge plate of fresh fruit. Rome was hit by their first major snowfall in 30 years whilst we were there, but nothing was too much trouble for the staff at the hotel, including free umbrella's for all guests who ventured out whilst the snow was falling. The little touch's are the things that usually make the difference and that sum's up the Artemide. We didn't see as much as we would have liked because of the snow, and we will definitely go back. When we do the Artemide will be the first hotel that I look to book.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to help with any requests that we had. The breakfast was excellent with a great selection of fresh hot and cold food. The room was comfortable and well-maintained. The lobby areas were a little dated and uninspiring however the friendliness of the staff made this seem less important. For example, the hotel management kindly brought us a bottle of prosecco and strawberries to celebrate my mother's birthday. Overall I would recommend this hotel for its location, the staff, the breakfast and the well stocked and complimentary mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Special great experience”
Reviews.Author: Arniewinters
Reviews.Content: In perfect location.roof top patio bar a joy. Wifi throughout. Great mix of old and new. Buffet breakfast couldn't be beaten. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “The little things that count.... location depends on preference”
Reviews.Author: D K
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide delivered a wonderful hotel experience. I had a regular double room (not economy)... a bit on the small side, but that is pretty standard for european hotels. Bed is foam mattress that is pretty comfortable. The sheets are nice and soft. There is not alot of storage space (drawers, closet), so if you are staying in Rome long, you might need to live from your suitcase a few days. Bathroom is large... very roomy which was a pleasant surpise. Everything is upgraded and the bathroom amenities were nice. Location: About a 10-12 minute walk from Roma Termini. Taxi should cost 10-15 euros unless they give you a tour of the city. Be very careful with Roma Taxis. I try to avoid them as much as possible as they know every trick in the book to take money from you. I had a taxi charge me 5 euros extra for baggage. Have exact change. Gave 20 euros for a 10 euro ride, taxi driver said I gave him 5 euros. Eventually he said "oh you wanted change, I don't have change." If you like to take public transportation, metro republicca is only a few blocks away.. 5 min walk. If you like to be around Piazza Novana/Pantheon area and don't want to use the bus, then I wouldn't recommend Hotels up near Roma Termini, unless you like to walk 15-20 minutes one way. Rome is also not flat. Roma Termini and Via Veneto areas are sort of at the top while Coloseum/Forum, Pantheon, Piazza Novana are at the bottom. The Little Things: Service was great, everyone was helpful. Wifi is decent. Free mini bar is awesome! If you can get this hotel around $130-$160, then that's a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: c0c02009
Reviews.Content: We came upon Hotel Artemide after much research. We requested a family room as there were 4 of us and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at our room. It was very spacious and inviting. There were basically 2 rooms in the family room; one with the king bed and the other with the sofa bed. The room had a complimentary mini bar with soft drinks and water in it. We also had a fruit platter on arrival and a tea/coffee facility stocked with instant coffee, tea and snacks. We were also given vouchers to get either a free coffee or aperitif in the lounge upstairs. The staff were also very helpful and attentive. The hotel is very centrally located. We walked to the many of the tourist attractions (Trevi Fountain was about a 10 minute walk away). The buffet breakfast was also great, supplying lots of fresh fruit, fresh bread, cakes, cold meats and hot food like bacon and eggs. There were different varieties of juices and coffee, tea and also hot chocolate. Overall, we were very happy to have stayed at this hotel and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AMN-K
Reviews.Content: A relatively small hotel close to the Roma Termini station, Hotel Artemides fulfilled our expectations for accommodations in Rome. We wanted a clean, comfortable, affordable hotel with style but little pretension. Our room was on the third floor and while the view was not amazing (it overlooked a back street and the buildings beyond), it afforded us very quiet nights. The bathrooms were big and well-appointed with both European (bidet) and American (shower) fixtures. From housekeeping to the front desk, and from the bellhops to the restaurant waiters and waitresses, the staff was courteous, friendly and efficient. Every morning, the free breakfast buffet, with its wonderful selection of breads, hot foods, fruit/veggies, drinks, and pastries, was just right for starting our long days of sight-seeing. It was wonderful not to have to think about where to procure this meal each day. We appreciated the welcome bottle of chianti in our room on the first night as well as the free mini-bar items (re-stocked every day). [Taking a bottle of water from our mini-fridge came in handy during our hours-long exploration of the city.] We also appreciated the location, close to the metro and bus lines, and walkable to many major tourist sites. After staying in three different hotels during our trip, we also appreciated the free internet access in our room; it was fairly fast and helped us as we planned our next day's itinerary and kept in touch with people from home. Overall, from the amenities to the accommodations, we were well and truly satisfied with our stay at Hotel Artemides.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience,but not this year...”
Reviews.Author: LaCostaflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide last October for four nights. The complimentary mini-bar, prosecco on the terrace, etc. have already been mentioned by many. The room and bathroom were fine, the people at the front desk were nice and helpful. The breakfast was probably the best of the buffet breakfasts we've encountered, served in a very pretty dining area. In fact, all the public rooms are very attractive and cheerful. A variety of newspapers is offered in the public rooms. If the hotel were in the Pantheon or Navona square areas, my favorite places to stay in Rome, it would have been perfect. The problem is that the hotel has received so much publicity that, this year, the prices have risen dramatically. In fact, I believe that the hotel, in spite of the prices, is sold out for the period we shall be in Rome next October. Our request for a room went unanswered. I suppose it's inevitable that a lot of publicity and praise will cause higher rates and a sold-out high season! Therefore, we have made reservations elsewhere, in my favorite part of Rome. Incidentally, and this might be a coincidence, I had an allergy attack while staying at the Artemide. At first, I thought I had caught a bad cold, but, then I realized that it was an allergic reaction that I have gotten in one or two other old European hotels. It rather spoiled my stay in Rome a bit. Next time, I'll bring Claritin!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Rod A
Reviews.Content: This was our (my wife and I) first visit to Rome and we put quite a bit of time and effort into selecting the hotel. We could not have made a better choice than Hotel Artemide! We found the staff (all of the staff - front desk, bell men, bartenders at the rooftop bar, etc) to be helpful, accommodating and genuinely appreciative that we were staying with them - they take pride in being of service to their guests. Our room (101) was large, clean, comfortable and relaxing (bathroom was excellent as well). It was located at the front of the hotel (along Via Nazionale) and we had no issues with noise. The hotel is in a great location to walk to several sites and to take the Metro (only a 5 minute walk) to get to anywhere you want to go in Rome. The free Wi-Fi and complimentary minibar (we also received a bottle of wine as a welcoming gift which was most appreciated) are very nice touches that serve to truly set this hotel apart from others. We would stay here again without question - we made the absolute right choice for our hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Clarioner1966
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome for me and my son aged 16. It was our cultural trip and we stayed 3 nights at Artemide after doing a lot of research into hotels, location and attractions. This is a great hotel!... it is on Via Nazionale which is like Oxford Street/Knightsbridge in London, a lot of shops, fashion and restaurants on side streets. It's also 5-10 minutes’ walk from the main train station with a direct line to Fiumicino airport and where all the buses and coaches come in too from both of Rome’s airports. I recommend you take the coach from the airport not Rome... A company called Terravision charge €4 each way, it is the cheapest way (train is about €14 each and takes 30 minutes, taxi €40) and takes 45 minutes. They leave every 30 minutes. You can buy a return ticket for €8 there, or you pay €6 if you wait to buy it at the Rome end coming back. We flew with Alitalia from Heathrow and it was good flight times and all-round good flight, they serve drinks and biscuit snacks, but don’t expect a hot meal. They have their own coaches that come back from Rome, which we used... that was €7 and it was less crowded than the Terravision one. (Their coach service is not well advertised) You can get around Rome on foot, bus or taxi. We mostly walked and you can walk within 20-25 minutes from here to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, and Trajan's market. Also 25-30 minutes or two tube-stops to the Coliseum, Palatine and Roman Forum (which are all in the same area). The No. 64 bus gets you to the Pantheon - which is a must-see in a very picturesque old square. You CAN walk to the Vatican City but it would be 30-40 minutes, or you can take the tube and get pretty close. Beware the queues for St Peters Square are MASSIVE... buy your tickets online FIRST. The last Sunday in the Month is FREE entry so it gets very busy with locals. Unlike Paris and London getting around Rome is cheap... they are not out to rip you off... an All-day anywhere tube ticket is €4 per day... a ticket that lasts 75 minutes is just €1 to anywhere in the city. Buses operate similar all-day tickets which you buy from Kiosks or Newsagents, you CAN’T pay on the bus... we didn’t know this so we got a free ride un-wittingly, they don’t really check it’s too crowded. Watch your pockets on buses and tubes as when you are sandwiched in you are vulnerable to pick-pockets. Attractions are also quite cheap to get into - average €8 per adult. Children are usually half-price OR FREE up to aged 18 if you are an EU citizen (take proof e.g. passport with you at all times). The Coliseum ticket is FREE for up to 18 and also gets you into the Palatine and Roman Forums and can be used over a 2 days period. We paid for the guided tour at €5 and it is well worth it!... don’t get scammed outside there are street sellers as you wait to go in selling “ticket tours” – they are NOT cheaper, and DON’T allow children in FREE either... buy your tickets INSIDE! Restaurants are mainly small side-street very quaint (some quite basic in decor but with very good food) - prices can be high though, allow €30-€40 Euros per head, and ask at the hotel because some of the restaurants in the busy tourist areas are not great. This hotel is very clean and well maintained and the staff are great. The rooms can be a little on the small side but are well equipped.. this is not un-typical though for an inner city hotel in a historic building. Rooms have free Wi-fi, tea/coffee, air-con, TV (only English channels are Sky News, BBC World and CNN but we weren't there to watch TV). The Minibar is FREE and restocked every day... you will find water, 2 cans of beer, and fruit just cartons in there. Our room also had free dressing gowns, and slippers. Beds are firm (very firm) - you either like that or you don't. Breakfast is buffet and pretty comprehensive, juices, fruits, yoghurts, pastries, boiled eggs, toast, even sausage and scrambled egg. The Hotel has a roof terrace bar/restaurant which is lovely, and you get a voucher when you check-in for a free drink of Prosecco or Coffee. There are parasols and patio heaters up there and luxury wicker furniture. Wear comfortable shoes... you will be doing a LOT of walking! Overall a great place to stay for a cultural or shopping city break. Highly recommended. Btw: We booked through Hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda P
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really nice and the buffet breakfast was good. However, the service was pretty average. For example I called down for dry cleaning, they told me to put it in the bag in the cupboard with the completed form to be picked up the next day, I did this, but they didn't ever come and pick up my dry cleaning so I had to find a dry cleaner myself which was time consuming and expensive. In addition to this, the staff weren't particularly friendly or helpful when we were trying to find things to do and places to eat or go.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Leondelon
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Rome, two nights in Artemide hotel. We had a spacious room, with comfortable bathroom. The breakfast was very good. And the location! It is close to ancient Rome, just a few metres from metro station if you want to visit Vatican City. It is very easy to walk to most of interesting places.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and value.”
Reviews.Author: roseberryrose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a number of nights in January and found the experience to be a very positive one. The staff was more than helpful and even went to the trouble of leaving Champaign and fruit in our room to mark my wife's birthday. This gesture was most appreciated; initially I considered taking the credit for arranging this but in fairness I must acknowledge the attention to detail by the hotels management for this initiative. I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel as ideal location for exploring Rome. Breakfast was first class and really set one for for the day. The hotel is ideally situated being only 5 mins walk from the Rome Termini which provides an efficient train transfer from the airport. From the hotel the ancient part of Rome can be reached on foot in 15 mins while the metro and bus service is available for those who decide against walking. The Vatican can also be reached using either the metro or bus from just up the road. We booked the vatican tour online and were simply amazed by the knowledge and enery of the guide, great value. The Roma card was also good value as it enabled us to avoid the long lines around the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leitrim59
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from Rome where my wife and I stayed for 3 nights in Artemide Hotel. Located 5 minutes walk from Termini station which is the drop off point for trains and buses from the airport. Check in at hotel was quick and friendly and we were pleasantly surprised when on arrival in our room , there was a welcome note and a lovely bottle of Chanti. The room was not overly big , but this is normal with European cities , and the double bed was King size and very comfortable. The mini bar is free and contains 2 cans of beer , 4 bottles of water and 2 cans soft drinks. There is also tea/coffee making facility in room. Breakfast was exceptionally good , with great choice of hot and cold meats , cereals etc. The main restaurant which serves dinner , is located on the 7th floor balcony and during the day it also offers a coffee /bar facility from there which is a beautiful location with the sun shining onto the rooftop . We decided to walk to the various sights and they were accessible as follows : Colliseum 10 mins, Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps 15 mins and we reached the Vatican in 45 mins. If at all possible I would recommend walking around Rome , as you see so much more this way. I would have no complaints at all about this hotel , staff were all very friendly and helpful , room was very comfortable and location was perfect , being on Via Nazionale and very close to Termini Station. Would certainly recommend to anybody travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Artemide Hotel, the perfect base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: OxfordNixi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Artemide Hotel and could not fault it. The hotel is ideally located to explore all the sights of Rome, we were able to walk everywhere and did not use the bus or train once! The hotel is in easy walking distance of the main station when you arrive from the airport too. On arrival, we were a little early to check in but were offered a complimentary drink in the hotel bar (a lovely and peaceful setting at the top of the hotel) whist our room was being prepared which took less than 30 minutes. All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and came with little extras such as a complimentary mini bar which is very refreshing as most hotels charge a fortune for this! Breakfast had a large selection and was plentiful. We would most definately stay at the hotel again on a return trip to Rome and would happily recommend it to anyone as the hotel of choice there. We had a lovely stay which helped to make our weekend exploring Rome a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: ljgoodsell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 10th wedding anniversary in Rome last September at the Hotel Artemide. From the gorgeous room to the first-rate hotel staff to the superb roof top restaurant, our entire stay was incredible. Just a short walk to the Termini Railstation and the Rome metro, which are super-easy to navigate. Our anniversary was made more special by another American couple who, upon hearing it was our anniversary, bought us a wonderful bottle of wine. One of the waiters at rooftop restaurant was a young man from Spain. He told us of having participated in a hospitality industry exchange program in the U.S. during the Olympics held in Utah. He said he was in the U.S. on 9/11. He told us, "I cried for your country that day. I saw the worst of humanity and the best of your country on that day." we were prepared for some to not like us instantly because we are Americans, but the Romans we encountered with overwhelmingly kind and thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victoria T
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in an ideal location in Rome .Family rooms were perfect for our family of 5. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great hotel for a City break in Rome. Only downside is that although breakfast was lovely it is very basic. If you want a good quality hotel without paying ridiculous prices then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “5 Day Stay Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: konman1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days and 4 nights along with my fiancée in January 12' , I stayed here on the recommendations of everyone on trip advisor and i was not disappointed, On arrival our bags were swiftly taken from us to our room and on speaking to front of house he upgraded us to a superior double room, gave us a 50% dinner voucher and 2 free drinks in the bar on the 7th floor which straight away put a smile on our faces. We were escorted to the room by a conslierge, who was extremely friendly and helpful throughout, our room was at the back of the hotel not much of a few but very quiet compared to the street rooms which can be very noisy at night time. The room itself was spotless, and well equipped for your every need and quite big in size for a major European city. The only thing i could fault about the room was the bed was not very comfortable to sleep on as it was very hard. It was my fiancées birthday on our 3rd day and a bottle of red wine, fruit bowl and a birthday card were in the room waiting for us when we got back from a long days walking which was incredible as we had never even mentioned it to any member of the staff i can only guess that they the retrieved the information off her passport.The mini bar was free and stocked everyday which was a nice touch. We had dinner on our final night and the food was pretty poor i have to say and wouldn't advise having dinner there but the cold breakfast buffet was well varied the hot buffet had a lot to be desired.The hotel itself is very central and on via nazionale which is a major shopping street and only 10 mins walk from termini . We were so central that we walked everywhere and you are never more than a mile from any attraction apart from the vatican which is still within walking distance. All in all we were extremely satisfied and all members of staff were very accommodating. Would stay here again if im ever in Rome, bit pricier than other hotels but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & location”
Reviews.Author: PaulAndCesca
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the hotel during our four night visit to Roma. I'm not one for wordy reviews but cant eulogise enough about the quality of service at this hotel. We found the staff to be incredibly helpful and friendly and dealt with all our requests quickly and efficiently. The room, which although was not particularly glamorous had a large ensuite bathroom and both were kept extremely clean, during this daily clean they also restock the complimentary fridge with water, fizzy drinks and beer. The location is ideal and we could walk to the ancient part of roma in 15 minutes. Walking is definitely the way to see Roma and the location comes into its own, we walked every where despite not being keen walkers including to the vatican across the city. To conclude you can probably stay somewhere cheaper than the Artemide but if you want lovely service in an excellent location from people that seem to genuinely care about your satisfaction you won't find better.

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay at Hotel Artemides,Rome”
Reviews.Author: nick f
Reviews.Content: I stayed for nights along with my 14 year old son, for 5 nights in Jan2012. We went for a superior double room with twin single beds. The hotel itself is very well equipped with all the usual facilities. It was always spotless, and maintained to a very high standard. The staff were very helpfull and always obliging, with the emphasis very much on customer satisfaction. Although we didnt ask for anything obscure or out of the ordinary, our few basic requests were greeted by cheerful smiles and actions carried out promptly and to a very satisfactory standard. I was particularly impressed by the free mini bar, every night the fridge was restocked with 2 bottles of still and 2 bottles of sparkling water, two cans of branded soft drinks, 2 cartons of fruit juice and more than ample for us to last the day whilst out sight seeing, and saving us a considerable amount of money. Tea and coffee facilities along with a variety of biscuits, peanut snacks, and finally chocolates every night - a most pleasant surprise. The quality of the included breakfast was very high, with every taste catered for. We didnt eat any other meals in the hotel, apart from one evening meal, making use of the 50% discount card for one meal for two given to us upon arrival. The food was lovely, prepared to a very high standard, from a varied and interesting menu. A top rate hotel, that i would recomend most highly. I am looking to re-book for a short break next year. You will not be disapointed if you choose to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great location, immaculate, friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: buckolfc08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights! It had every thing we required for our stay, a clean, safe place to stay with a good location. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room was a good size and kept clean to a very high standard. Would recommend this hotel. We paid £280 for our stay, so with all this in mind, I think we got excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Gbmyers
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on its glowing recommendations on tripadvisor and was disappointed. Absolutely staying here again if I come back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! a special trip made even more special.”
Reviews.Author: DLongley88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on our trip to Rome, and from start to finish we had the most amazing time. The extras the hotel did to make our stay even better was great, like returning to our room on my girlfriends birthday (now fiance) to be greeted with a bottle of wine and the hotel manager wishing her a happy birthday (fantastic touch). I would deninitely recomend staying here, great location easily walked to everything. fantastic room (complimentary minibar). Very helpful staff always very polite. All in all the best trip we have done together. Thanks to all at Hotel Artemide

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: izgalea
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we stayed in on our European trip, this was by far the best! Everything worked perfectly, the staff were helpful and welcoming, breakfast was huge and location so central that we walked everywhere! The most ingenious thing was the free minibar! Restocked everyday, my husband and I stocked up on water, soda and snacks so we never had to pay the ridiculous prices demanded by tourist food vans!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: no1mav
Reviews.Content: 10 mins walk from the main 'termini' rail station, which links fiumicino airport. 1 busy road to cross, several cobbled side roads to negotiate - don't get ripped off with taxis! effortless checking in process. really friendly, welcoming and smiling staff. very informative, give good clear, concise information, accurate instructions. received a voucher to promote the breakfast for one morning during our stay. received a voucher for free 'welcome drinks' on the roof top bar. bell boy looks after you, escorts you to your room, points out the facilities available. room was spot less (rm514), good size, great bathroom. free mini bar - topped up daily. limited, but nice gesture - x4 cans lager, x1 can of coke, x1 can of fanta, x5 bottles of water, nibble, teas and coffee facilities. great nights sleep, didn't use the air con, had the windows open all night - which was nice for a january night. over a very peaceful courtyard, minimal noise from the front of the hotel, the via nazionale. good black out curtains, good sized bed, comfy, nice pillows! great roof top bar, sheltered from the elements, with heaters. great spacious seating. great cocktails - can recommend the mojito and strawberry daiquiri! breakfast was fantastic. always been let down by italian hotels attempt to provide breakfast - this truly was the exception! great eating area. good waiting staff. great array of food! 14euros - good value! Returned 'home' one evening to find a complimentary bottle of fizz for my birthday - which was really nice, and so were the bubbles! i will stop here again!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never forget the service.......”
Reviews.Author: GabChiz
Reviews.Content: My niece and I were travelling around Italy and being the organised person I am, I hadn't booked anything in advance and pretty much relied on TripAdvisor for recommendations. We chose Artemide Hotel because of the reviews and we we're delighted. It was in a great location. Nice and close to the station so we were able to drag our suitcases without too much effort. Needless to say, my 15 year old niece was delighted with the free mini bar and all the bathroom freebies that she had been collecting on our travels. Ah - so young. I was delighted by the helpfulness of the desk staff - upgrading us to two single beds was no problem for Massimo. But the gold star service came when we had an "issue" with our passports. Our last day in Rome on our way to Doah, we arrived at Fuimicino airport, I discovered that I had left our passports in the room safe. As we had asked Reception to organise a private car service to the airport, our driver rang the hotel and the wonderful men on Reception arranged for another car to bring the passports to the airport. They were very patient with my numerious phone calls of panic, as the airport is a far way from central Rome, but it all worked out well. We made our flight (last to board), but the benefit of being rushed through security. Lesson: always give yourself plenty of time to get to the airport!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- great value”
Reviews.Author: Newmama2011
Reviews.Content: We could not recommend this hotel more! My husband and I stayed here for three nights last week, we selected this hotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to most attractions in the city, there is also lovely shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Our room (Superior Double) was lovely and surprisingly big for a city hotel, the free mini bar was also a nice touch. The rooftop terrace bar is well worth a visit. The staff were excellent and so attentive, nothing was too much trouble. If you are visiting Rome you should really consider staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: Dave2009b
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from a truly fantastic trip to Rome (for her 40th). I read the reviews of Hotel Artemide on Trip Advisor which were very impressive. They weren't wrong. This Hotel is superb. We stayed for 3 nights in Jan (great time to visit Rome as its quiet !). ON arrival, we were upgraded to a larger room, given a voucher for a couple of glasses of Fizz for the Terrace Bar (Patio Heaters & Blankets provided if needed !) and a 50% voucher off food in the Hotel restaurant. We were unsure if to eat at the Hotel Restaurant with all those fantastic restaurants near by but we did. WOW. What a culinary delight. Finally, the Hotel is very well placed to ALL the attractions. 10mins from Termini (train station), 15 mins from Colliseum, 15 mins from Trevi, Pantheon & Spanish Steps. The only one that you will require taxi / bus / more walking was The Vatican, but that would be the same for most Hotels on this side of the river. So, if you are looking for a clean, friendly, well placed hotel that is special - go here. You will not be disapointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: hlovat
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very good, convenient location. Lovely rooms and facilities. Family and I will certainly be returning. And did I mention the terrific staff?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seanyg
Reviews.Content: We chose the Artemide after reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel location is great, within walking distance of all the ancient city attractions, a good choice of restaurants and cafe's and shopping areas. The room we had on the first floor was quiet (courtyard view), fairly clean and well equipped, although could do with a refurbishment very soon. The bathroom is small however, and the TV worked intermittently, but these were not major issues for us. Breakfast at the hotel was very good, with plenty of choice despite the hotel being very busy and the rooftop bar was staffed with professional staff and service was particularly smooth. All staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Bri A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 days in Rome, and LOVED the Artemide Hotel. It was lovely! The staff were helpful, and we felt right at home. Convenient location, close walk to the Termini, as well as the Colleseum and Trevi Fountain. Decent sized room, large bathroom, and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Very good to excellent”
Reviews.Author: allexa67
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and we had excellent time.The concierge Vasile was very helpfull and breakfast was delighfull with good expresso and excellent capuccino!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ALL aspects.”
Reviews.Author: Bridie0210
Reviews.Content: We couldnt hope to find a better hotel in a more central location suitable for a family. The staff were always exceptional, from the reception to the breakfast,to room service. The location was perfect and and our family felt very safe, the free mini-bar was an added bonus to long walking days in Rome. Well worth spending the money for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: txbrandon76
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here! The rooms are a little small and not real fancy but that wasn't a big deal for us. The service was great, the price was reasonable, and the rooms were clean. It is very close to many sights as well as the train station. The breakfast is much better than any hotel breakfast I have ever had by far! I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find fault!”
Reviews.Author: Belsdad
Reviews.Content: This hotel has friendly, helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and is in a great location where you can walk to all main sites of interest. The added extras such as mini bar and chocolates at night make it good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daren l
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Artemide Hotel. It is such a change to find a hotel that tries to exceed expectations. As a family, the room was big enough and the free minibar was so handy. The kids loved the free wi-fi as well. They spoilt us with chocolates everyday and it is great to get salad items in the breakfast buffet. Close to Termini and metro. Will recommend them to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SavetheEarth
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at this hotel. I am not used to staying in boutique hotels, but I am glad I decided to stay at this one. The hotel is within walking distance to the Central Train Station. However if you have luggage, I would take a taxi to/from the train station as the fare should be less than 10 euros each way. The front desk staff are friendly in general. You can get to some of the main tourist attractions in Rome by taking the subway and walking. However if you are ever tired after a long day of sightseeing, you can easily hail a taxi and show the taxi driver the hotel's card with its address and the driver will easily find the hotel as it is located on a major road. The free minibar was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “NewYears in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: This was one of 3 hotels we stayed at for our 20th wedding anniversary trip to Italy. We stayed in an upgraded room at the Molino Stucky Hilton Hotel in Venice too and enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Artemide (in a non-upgraded room) in Rome better (the breakfast was also better). The hotel is centrally located and is close to the metro and Termini train stations. There is no grand entrance and it does not look much at all like the photo on TripAdvisor until night when they turn the lights on. We walked to the Colosseum, Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and several other sites from the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly, professional and the rooms are clean. The rooms are small, but the coffee bar, and mini-fridge items are all complimentary and were refilled every day. The one issue we had was with the size of the elevator (it is regulated to a max of 6 people and can only comfortably accomodate 2) we were on the 6th floor and had to often wait for it. Even with the elevator, we would still highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bumpy start, but overall good”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Artemide is a well-maintained and very pleasant hotel. I did get off to a bumpy start in that, booking months in advance, I'd asked for a room in the front of the hotel facing the street. Also, two days before arriving, I e-mailed the hotel to let them know I would be arriving early in the morning, and asked if I would be able to check in early upon my arrival. I received a confirmation that there would be no problem and that I could (otherwise, I would have just booked the night before to ensure my room would be available) but, when I arrived, my room wasn't ready. After the long overnight flight from the US, I ended up having to kill time for four hours until my room, which ended up being a dark tiny room in the back (facing only the back of another building), was ready. I did pitch a fit about the room, asked to talk to "il responsabile," and was moved on my second day to the kind of room I'd requested several months in advance: larger, in front, light and nice. From that point, my 9-day stay was great. Excellent service, a very good breakfast (even though I often slept through it), coffee/tea in the room. I gave the two gentlemen at the front desk (with whom I'd pitched the fit) a bottle each of Prosecco, and ended up with a bottle of a nice red being sent up to my room. All's well that ended well, but I learned my lesson: if you really *do* want your room to be available to you early in the morning, best to also reserve the night before to avoid disappointment and hours of killing time after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, but #5... really?”
Reviews.Author: bethschax
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is a fine hotel with a nice breakfast and very comfortable rooms. It's a great place if you're coming from Florence off the train - 10 minute walk - and the front desk staff are very helpful. It just wasn't as magic as the other places we stayed in Rome. It felt very ordinary and I guess we like a more magical location. But I think if you're looking for something very familiar, this is a great hotel, not too pricey and they will take great care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEB42
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel, immaculately clean, very attentive and helpful staff. Rooms were lovely. Also free mini bar in room and tea/coffee/Biscuits facilies all laid on. Hotel was in the centre of all the exclusive shops with metro 100m away and bus stop just outside Hotel. Many of the attractions could be visited on foot. Bring good walking shoes as lots of cobbled streets and very poor footpaths. This was a trip for my 50th Birthday, and the Hotel had left us a bottle of wine & peanuts in our room and gave us 50% off an evening meal in the restaurant and two free glasses of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, stylish and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: fairydust50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband in December. Our room was lovely. Having read previous reviews, the room was bigger than what I expected. We found our bed extremely comfortable. We could not fault the breakfast buffet which provided everything we needed. The reception staff were very helpful. The rooftop terrace was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Will be my "Rome Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: TheBigMog
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide was my home in Rome for eight nights in December. Thankfully, all the good reviews rang true and I had a wonderful stay. Comfy bed, great breakfast, pleasant and helpful staff. Phil

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Rome at the Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SL G
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome. We had a cheaper place booked originally but changed to this one after reading the reviews. Stayed 12/30/11 through 1/6/12. The hotel was very clean and in good location. The staff was very excellent - front desk staff helpful with all needs, breakfast staff friendly and good service, and room cleaning was top-notch. One of our rooms was first floor by the street and too noisy for me, so the staff moved us to the back of the hotel at the first opportunity. Alessandro and everyone at the front desk helped us with restaurant arrangements, taxi's, and directions to major tourist sites. Wake-up calls were always dependable and on the minute. This was our home away from home and I would recommend to any that can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: halacontemp
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in central Rome, within easy access to all of the major sites and squares. The service is PERFECT. We could not have asked for more. The hotel IS on a very busy street though, so make sure you ask for a quiet room. We were given a quiet room, so the entire experience was excellent. We will definitely choose this hotel again for our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide - All the wonderful reviews are 100% true. Even so, our expectations were exceeded! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MerryweatherBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Artemide for an eight night stay which included New Year's Eve. We chose the hotel on the basis of the excellent reviews it had received. We were thrilled with every aspect of our stay there. The email communications with Mattheo at the hotel before we arrived were very helpful, thorough and friendly. We were very warmly greeted after some 36 hours of travel and given discounts on the Roof top restaurant and other useful bits and pieces. The Hotel is a beautiful, historic building with a charming, graceful atmosphere. Our room was very quiet, peaceful, easy to completely darken if you wanted to and roomy with well appointed with lots of storage room, lots of coat hangers, and very well appointed and perfectly functioning bathroom. You are able to open the huge windows for fresh air if you wish to. The free mini bar is delightful, thoughtful and very convenient for tired travelers. The location is fantastic. Very convenient to all the Roman icons and great for shopping. We did a day trip to Venice during our stay and were able to easily walk from the hotel to the train station. I would suggest travelers consider taking the train to Florence and/or Naples rather than a tour bus - very easy, comfortable and fun. Venice is a long fast train trip but well worth it - we were back at the hotel before midnight. We took a tourist coach tour to Florence on the second day of our stay. We loved Florence and made a friend on the bus but overall decided that independent travel for day tours and to see all the fantastic sights was most comfortable and best value for money for us. Taking a hop on, hop off bus tour is a good introduction to Rome on your first day or so if you are a bit weary. We bought three day Roma Passes for the metro but only used them once to go to the Vatican. Walked all the rest of the time - fantastic! The housekeeping at the Artemide is of an astounding standard - congratulations on this to the management - far better than in any 5 star hotel I have stayed in. The breakfast buffet was consistently excellent and our room service was also good. We enjoyed the Rooftop Terrace garden for New Year's Eve dinner and celebrations. Christmas and New Year is a fabulous time to visit Rome. The Christmas decorations are elegant and an absolute delight everywhere. It is not too cold - lovely and fresh - and the crowds and queues are manageable especially before 9.30am in the morning or late afternoon. We did not have a single problem during our 8 night stay at the Hotel Artemide and were very sorry to leave. We had a wonderful time and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. We travel extensively, have stayed in many 5 star hotels for business and pleasure and I am very happy to say that this hotel is genuinely top class. We look forward to coming back for another New Year hopefully not too far in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Many Perks”
Reviews.Author: angelina0926
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from Rome and stayed at Artemide Hotel for 5 days. Although, the hotel is a bit far from major attractions other than the Colosseum, the train station is right there, which can get you anywhere. One of the biggest things the hotel has is all the little perks you get for free. The hotel has free mini bar which includes water, juices, cookies, crackers...This is a nice little perk especially when you are thirsty in the middle of the night! One of my husbands favorites was the free WiFi which we did not have in any other hotel in Europe. Along with this there is a beautiful roof top terrace, which they give you two free prosecco vouchers to enjoy on. The hotel is very well maintained and clean and the staff is very helpful. All in all its a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel in Central Rome"”
Reviews.Author: folklore38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Artimede from 12/31 to 1/5 and loved it. The hotel is a solid 4 star hotel, but the location, amenities, and service is 5+. The room was nicely decorated and had all the perks others have described, snacks, water, and soda in the free minibar. There is free Wi-Fi in the room, this was great since a lot of hotels in Rome charge $20-25 per day for WiFi. The breakfast buffet was good, I didn't get to eat there everyday since I had so many early morning tours planned. On the days I got to eat breakfast I found the food to be varied and the service was excellent. Room service was a dissapointment, the food was not good. I ordered dinner one night, since I was too tired to go out after a long day trip, the food was barely edible, but you don't go to Rome to eat hotel food, so I'm not mad at them. The number one reason you should pick this hotel is LOCATION: It is 5 blocks away from Tremini station(central station). It's within a 10-20 minute walk to most major atttractions like Trevi fountain, Navona fountain, Forum and Col. The hotel is located on Via Nazionale, which is full of buses and two blocks away from the train. I also found two supermarkets close to the hotel. I was able to buy snacks for lunch on days I didn't have time for a sit down meal. There is also a pharmacy across the street from the hotel should you need it. Staff was always helpful and went out of their way to ensure I had all I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Rome”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Rome. The city is crazy and full of tourists but Rome is always Rome! Artemide Hotel is located in Via Nazionale, a very busy and noisy street. We were given a room on the first floor facing via Nazionale. Needless to say that sleep quality was very poor... The windows do not have a blackout. Light from the street makes the room bright all night. The noise form the busy via Nazionale is terrible and could be heard all night (including the noise of the buses). The room is big although not very modern. The bed was OK. Could be more confortable. The bathroom is modern and with a great shower. There is free internet in the hotel (including rooms) and free minibar (water and sodas), very nice. Breakfast was also good for a four star Hotel in Rome. If I had to go again would definetly not stay in Via Nazionale. Too full of tourists and with one hotel beside the other. Did not like the location at all! Even though it is quite central I would chose a smaller street.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide... A great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nikidelacruz
Reviews.Content: It is pretty hard to find good hotels at an affordable rate in Rome. In our case, We found the perfect one. Perfect location, great service, very clean, launch bar at the terrace, free mini bar and a breakfast included. All for 115 Euros aprox per night. Thank you to all Artemide team!

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma, Bella Artemide Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hildigard
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week in October 2011, and we loved it. The location was central, our room was well-appointed, breakfast was delish, the rooftop bar was heavenly, the minibar was stocked daily and free...etc. I wasn't prepared for the size of the room---small compared to other European cities, but apparently the norm for Rome. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. We were there during our son's third birthday, and found an enormous bowl of fruit in our room along with a card from the hotel wishing him a Happy Birthday. So lovely...and welcome, considering we wanted him to live on something other than cheese pizza!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: amaliacas c
Reviews.Content: The room was very quiet and was clean. I requested a quiet room and we indeed got what we wanted. The room was large enough for we . It was nice to have a screened window to open at night when it got hot, even in mid-september. Breakfast was plentiful. The front desk, bell boys and hostess/servers (breakfast) were attentive. It is close to the Termini station, provided that you know exactly where to head from the Termini (when we asked for directions along the way, the Italians were very helpful). It is walking distance to many of the sights. we have booked with the company www.romeairporttransportation.com for our transfers from Airport and Port Civitavecchia

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel. Over priced. Free mini bar, Free internet.”
Reviews.Author: elvelasquez
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, Overated. Save your money! Yes, the hotel has a grand entrance, nice waiting-lounge area, marble flooring, but this dies down as soon as the elevator(very slow)opens to your floor. I expected "Grand" room as like the hotel is rated, and it felt like 3 star. We paid $145 USD a night for this hotel- I felt it was overated. The beds were softer, but again, we expected a grand room. The sheets, were clean. The bed was a queen size, took major part of the space. No iron, you must request at front desk. The UPSIDE is that it is close to the train station. About a 10 minute walk with luggage. Not bad at all. We expected complimentary breakfast during the three nights we stayed. Was not the case, we received a voucher for one free buffet breakfast for the entire stay. We wanted to try before deciding to pay for the extra two. We woke up early, turned in our vouchers, were seated by great & polite hostess. The buffet consists of eggs, sausage, mini pancakes, hot chocoloate, cereal, cold meats as well as salad. There were pastries, cookies, fruits. A variety of things to choose from. This is a buffet breakfast that charges 15 euros pp per day. We decided not to purchase breakfast for the other two days. There is sooo much to explore out there! The staff is great. They will cater to your every need! This is a plus. The airport, they say is about 45 minutes, but if there is no traffic and if the driver paces well, you'll be there in 30. It seems we were overcharged for transportation. 50 euros. Call front desk to make the reservation. Snacks are free. Coffee, cookies, water, and juice in fridge also free. But i don't think so, they of course throw that in the price of the hotel.. which i still think was overpriced, even considering location. The hotel is walking distance to Spanish steps and Trevie Fountain( about 15-20 minutes) i don't mind walking. The Vatican from the hotel is a good four miles roundtrip. Taxi about 8 euros. But they get pretty ticked off because they loose place in line to take you somewhere so close. Tip'em well if you cause them this incovenience. The Vatican is a must and make sure you go to the Cupula ( top of the Vatican) so you can take great pictures of St. Peters Square(KEY shaped)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ebzycik
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel to spend our boxing day weekend! We had such thoughtful service. Chocolates by our bedside every night, free bottle of wine, free minibar, pretty good breakfast (although repetitive), damn good service, cute little rooftop bar/restaurant, smily receptionists, small rooms but very clean. Our view was a bit depressing but who cared when there was so much to see outside? Great great great location, we walked everywhere: Spanish steps, pantheon, colosseum, roman forum, trevi fountain, you name it! The only place we took A metro to was to see the Vatican + st peters. Can't really fault this hotel. Don't be scared to book! Charming!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: pigfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed just two nights in December of 2011, with children ages 11 and 13, and the Artemide Hotel was perfect for us. The staff is amazingly helpful and always pleasant to deal with. Our room was small but lovely, and they accommodated all four of us in one room with a fold-out sofa for a reasonable extra charge. The breakfast was included and was served all morning long with excellent food and fabulous coffee! The location also works well, as it's a short walk to the train station and you can even walk to the colosseum. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Visiting Rome; delivers on all essential criteria”
Reviews.Author: FandAOF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many top-end / good hotels in Rome and were very impressed with Hotel Artemide - it certainly exceeded our expectations for a hotel in its class. Even though it is located on the busy Via Nationale, we had an incredibly quiet room and slept soundly in very comfortable beds. The room was spotless, very well appointed, plenty of storage space, warm but not hot and stuffy, everything worked and the standard of housekeeping was top class. Our deal included a free minibar and coffee/tea making facilities which were very well stocked and fully replenished daily. Our bed linen was also changed daily and toiletries fully restocked. We slept so well (never interruped by housekeeping) that we never made it down breakfast but I would assume it matched the rest of the hotel’s high standards. All the staff we met, housekeeping and front desk were most helpful and accommodating. Wifi is free is and we were not changed for using the business centre for our on-line check-in and printing of boarding passes. Front desk arranged for flat fee of €45 to FCO airport in very nice Mercedes. We would highly recommend this hotel as a base for visiting Rome.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia180811
Reviews.Content: Artemide was the last hotel of our honeymoon. The service is the highlight. We had an upgrade and stayed at the best room of the hotel and they let us a botlle of wine as welcome. We will definitely stay there again. Good location, walking distance to the main points.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , location ideal!!”
Reviews.Author: Ani22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for 5 nights. Its a good hotel. I agree with some reviews its a bit overrated. The Service i found was quite good but apart from that the rooms and the hotel facilities itself are quite ok. Please dont mistake this as rooms are not good, they are quite clean and decent its just that they arent 5 star as some of the reviews might suggest. The key for me was the location. We could walk to most places in Rome for sightseeing. There are 2 train stations which can be used and are 5mins walk from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BagSlo
Reviews.Content: Fooled by the excellent reviews and the high ranking of the hotel, I booked for a “long weekend” (Friday to Monday) stay during October 2011. Having previously very nice experiences in Rome, with hotels ranked below hotel Artemide in your ranking, I created high expectations for my stay there! It was a real disappointment! I wonder if all these people who wrote these reviews and selected this hotel as the “2011 traveler’s choice” have been before to any “good” hotel in Rome. If the reason of the high rate is the free mini bar or the free internet, I believe that anyhow these expenses are already included in the room price which is overpriced for the services and the condition of the hotel. More specifically, the reception is very small and usually overcrowded. The lift is small that means that you have to in the queue and sometimes is not working (it happened twice during my stay, not very nice to take the stairs for the 4th floor). The room is generally ok (I had only to comment that I paid for a “superior” double room and I received a room with view to some internal metallic stairs ) The breakfast is ok but with limited selection. Every day during my stay was offered exactly the same things. I guess if you have a longer stay this can be boring. The location is good, anyhow you have to walk 5-10 to any attraction point or to metro. To my opinion this is a nice 3-4 stars hotel. Definitely not one of the top 3-4 hotels in Rome as it is ranked. If it was with at least 30% lower price definitely could be a good alternative for a “budget” stay in Rome. With the room rates that they have better try some other hotels (eg in Via Veneto or nearby)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but a little overrated”
Reviews.Author: gbmateo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in late Dec. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but didn't think it lived up to the 5 star reviews and some of the more glowing ratings and a #4 overall for Rome (unless Hotels in Rome are significantly lower than other major European cities). Don't get me wrong, it was a good hotel, I would likely stay again but it isn't a "no questions asked" stay again, I would some time looking around, and then evaluate. Details are below. --Location: It was a good location, grocery nearby, good food nearby, it didn't seem to be particularly close to any large sites but not far either. It is on a very busy street but I was away from it and didn't notice --Room/hotel. Our room was large and up to date. It came with free soda/water which was convienent. The one issue (I thinkk this was the issue) is I think they used too much bleach in the towels/sheets because my wife had some skin irriation. It was either that our the soap, this didn't happen anywhere else on our long Europe trip --Breakfast. They had a large well stocked buffett with coffee pots on the table (very cool), that said, this was the weakest part for us (my wife and I love breakfast). The food quality was not high. I don't know how to describe but relative to other 4 star hotels on our trip, the quality of the meat, baked goods, fruits was not as good. It was a decent buffett and maybe we were spoiled but this was a disapointment --Service. Hotel staff was very nice and courteous. No complaints at all here.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Sabina R
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Artemide Hotel. It is such a change to find a hotel that tries to exceed expectations. As a family, the room was big enough and the free minibar was so handy. The kids loved the free wi-fi as well. They spoilt us with chocolates everyday and it is great to get salad items in the breakfast buffet. Close to Termini and metro. Will recommend them to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dakarbailey”
Reviews.Author: KCFB
Reviews.Content: What an awesome experience! Everyone is helpful and the hotel is lovely. My only complaint is that they upgraded our room and the only way to access it was up a winding staircase. Breakfast was okay, the juice variety and the fruit were delicious. Complimentary mini-bar!!! The hotel is located on a wonderful street that allows you to utilize public transportation, which is wonderful here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but very underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: NikkitheFrog
Reviews.Content: Clean but very underwhelming rooms. Too expensive and location for us was way too touristy ( that's just a personal preference )

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after reading the reviews in tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Although it was on a major road our bedroom was situated over an inner courtyard and we were not disturbed by the traffic at all. Our bedroom was lovely with excellent amenities such as a free minibar (replenished every day) and tea/coffee making facilities - something that you do not always get in Italy. As also mentioned there were lots of toiletries in the bathroom. Both the bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and I was very impressed by the standard of housekeeping. We had booked the bed and breakfast package and the breakfast was very good. We ate in the rooftop restaurant one evening and it was perfectly adequate. There was also a rooftop bar and it was nice to have a relaxing drink there every evening after a day's sightseeing. The hotel is very conveniently located for many of the major attractions and we could in fact walk to everywhere we wanted to visit. It is also very convenient to the Termini and we could easily walk to it when we arrived by train from Florence. The staff are excellent and were always extremely obliging. We left our luggage on the last day as our flight home was not until the evening and the staff could not have been more helpful. They recommended that a taxi would be our best alternative to go to the airport and organised that for us. They also told us it was a set charge to the airport and informed the taxi driver that we knew this. He then switched off his meter when we got in his car! They really were so helpful and gave us advice in the evenings for places to go for our evening meals. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are considering a trip to Rome. I can assure you that you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but on Noisy Road”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel is in the middle of Rome, making it an ideal jumping-off point. The room was excellent (two bedroom suite) and the American flag outside our room was a very nice touch. The free mini bar was always stocked (water, snacks, etc) and the staff was exceptional. We did have a problem with the guests in the room above ours (their children were being rude by jumping on the floor). The Artimede staff dealt with this immediately and effectively. The food was great and the breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day. The Maid staff did a great job, too. The bad: the hotel is on busy Via Nationale. Our room was on the second floor and overlooked this busy and noisy road. There were ambulances and car horns honking all night.
