If you're a light sleeper, I suggest you request a room that doesn't overlook this road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JCamilleri
Reviews.Content: 100% satisfied with our experience. Breakfast was very good, staff was friendly and helpful, especially Valentina & Patrizia. Was surprised by a free mini-bar stocked daily & sparkling wine for my birthday. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: rforrest
Reviews.Content: Great hotel service, everything you read about from the free mini bar, wine bottle awaiting in your room, good service is true at least for us. THey gave us room 624 which is the only room with a private terrace. It was nice to read on the terrace. The hotel is a 10 min walk from the Spanish Steps via the Quattro Fontane. Lots of restaurants down this street and around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, handy location”
Reviews.Author: kimi000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artemide during Christmas (two persons) in a three person superior room. I haven stayed in other hotels in italy (but i hqve in all the countries nearby) but this one was definitely to my liking. The location is handy, 15 minutes walk to spanish steps and many of the other attractions, less than that to termini. The service is excellent in the hotel (the biggest plus), something to be appreciated as the general level of service in italy is quite unsatisfying. As a negative one could mention small rooms with few thrills - but dont let this fact stop you from booking!

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip, will stay there again in July of 2013”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: I searched for a lot of hotels in Roma before deciding and I am glad we chose Artemide. I read so many reviews about so many hotels it was hard to decide. I usually only read the "bad" reviews before deciding on places. So it is to my astonishment that what I read and what we experienced was completely different. My wife and I went to Roma to get married, and to do this in Roma is not easy. Without the help of the front desk, (Big Thanks to Mario and Alessandro) we would never got all the paperwork done. They went out of there way to help us with everything. Can not express how great the entire staff was. The room was great and clean, I can see someone complaining about the showers. Ours was small but very adequate. If you are a large person it might be difficult or If you are elderly or have a hard time lifting your legs it might be hard to get into the tub/shower because of it's high lip. The shower did leak under the gasket so it made the floor wet (ask for extra towels) and the bed is on the rather firm side. Something us american's aren't used to. We left everything out in our room, computers (internet worked all the time), souvenirs, items we brought from Hawaii, everything and had no problems at all with the staff. Get the room with the included breakfast, as in Roma breakfast is usually a pastry and caffe. Which I love. The breakfast at the hotel was outstanding for a buffet style. Overall my only gripe would be the limited menu at the restaurant up on the roof. Other than that stay here if you can. Close to the Roma Termini, 5 minutes walking time. Thank you Artemide, without you and your staff our trip would not have been so successful. Mario and Alessandro you guys are the best. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever”
Reviews.Author: Tom U
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. The service was excellent, local romans who knew about their city; they were able to help us to a great dinner at a nearby restaurant, one night we needed to go to the hospital and they made us aware that it would be better to catch a taxi than an ambulance (ambulance would have cost 100 euro, we are from australia and at home they are free so we would definitely not have known that). The wifi was fast and reliable, good for travellers needing to contact home. The little things also made the stay more enjoyable, for example the drinks in the minibar were free, and in the room there are free pairs of red slippers! The rooftop bar also had great views (don't quote me on this, but I think you could see St Peter's..). It was in a great location as well, Via Nazionale has some fantastic shopping along it. It's quite easy (depending on how fast you walk and how long you stay at each place) to do a nice 2 hour walk including the spanish steps, victor emmanual monument and trevi fountain. The only downside we experienced was that there was quite alot of noise when we were getting to bed, might have been a noisy building next door or something, but it felt as though every night someone was moving house. Apart from that, it was a fantastic stay and I would most certainly recommend it to anyone looking for a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: 3Bergen
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just returned from a 5 day trip to Rome and this hotel. We booked the hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the fact that we got a great discount from the hotel for staying for more than 3 nights. The hotel is based in the centre of Rome, great for sight seeing and the Monty area is just around the corner for some great restaurants. The rooms seem to be updated recently, the room we got was very nice, spacious, clean and modern. Free wifi and complementary minibar are big plusses! We did hear the people in the room next to us quite clearly, but we were so tired after walking all day that we slept anyway. The public areas in the hotel are a bit dated but clean. All in all a very good tourist hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, good value and super-accommodating staff make Hotel Artemide a top choice for Rome. Easy access to the Metro, but also easy walking to most major sites. Matteo and Valentina priceless help with all sorts of things (taxis, directions, lost luggage, reservations). The service alone is worth another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel, Five Star Service”
Reviews.Author: sunki33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artemide for only one night but has left a lasting impression on me and my partner due to their impeccable service. From the moment you walk in, you'll be greeted by friendly staff and top quality service. The room/bathroom was clean and well equipped with everything you need. The lifts were a bit confusing to use, never seem to reach our level when trying to go down so we just took the stairs considering our room was only on the 1st floor. Breakfast at the hotel is also of high standards, there's a great selection of breakfast food and juices. Service as the breakfast room cannot be faulted as well. The hotel is conveniently located in terms of transport. It's a 2 minute walk from Republica metro and 10 minute walk from Termini Station. There's also a major bus stop 30sec from the hotel with access to 20-30 buses. Some of the sites in Rome is also walkable distance (<15minutes) from the hotel e.g. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. Can also go to the Vatican directly from Republica Station. However the Metro (Line A) stops running at 9pm in Rome due to construction of a new metro line till Mid 2012. Overall, I highly recommend Artemide Hotel if you want good service, good hotel and good location.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel & GREAT Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JStein76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Artemide Hotel for three days last month (November). All we can say is that this is really a great hotel. Right from the moment we got their, they were attentive to our every needs. They upgraded our room for free, gave us a free bottle of red wine, and gave us two complementary glass of wine to claim at their rooftop bar (all as a token of congrats for our honeymoon). Their customer service was impeccable. One night (it was very late and not sleepy because of jetlag), we were so hungry and all the nearby food establishments were closed. The hotel staff working that night shift gathered a goodie bag full of cookies, crackers, jams, etc. The staff also gave us valuable information not just for our stay in Rome, but for our stay at the other cities we would visit. As for location ---- we could not complain one bit. We were able to walk to every and any site in Rome --- with the exception of the Vatican, for which we took the subway which was right around the corner from the hotel. As for the room, no complaints at all. They were spacious, clean, and comfortable. And lastly, their customer service was great. If you look up customer service in the dictionary, you'll see Artemide Hotel in the definition. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and position”
Reviews.Author: Poppy8888_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent position for sight-seeing, breakfasts were of a high standard, nothing was too much trouble. The room was well equipped and you were able to open the window for fresh air but it did have to be closed for the night. In the summer when it is ver hot I doubt if you would open the windows or the window shutters. Staff were very friendly. I would happily stay at this hotel again. We were left complimentary sweet/chocolates each night which is always a nice extra that only a few hotels actually do. It can end your day of sight seeing feeling a little bit special.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jansotir
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Artemide. Enjoyed every moment of our stay there. The hotel was centrally located and very clean, with friendly, courteous staff. Sound proofing between rooms is excellent. Breakfast is first class with great coffee, and the buffet was constantly refreshed. The management very kindly had a bottle of wine sent to the room as a gift for my friend's birthday. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough - will definitely stay there again on any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Quiet, clean and comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: MattandGina11
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Artemide Hotel. Their service and attention to detail were what one would expect of hotels costing twice as much. The service, from the front desk, to the rooftop bar/restaurant to the cleaning staff, was amazing. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever been in, and that says a lot. The many good reviews on Trip Advisor are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: npmtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in Sept, 2011. Hotel was great. Friendly staff. We arrived early and our room was ready and quite large. Free minibar was a treat and Breakfast which was included was excellent. Shopping on the street outside the hotel and plenty of restaurants within a short walk - would definitely stay there next time i am in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “As excellent as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Artemide Hotel. Next time I am in Rome, this is where I will be staying. We had a room on the 4th floor (403), on the street side (Via Nazionale), with a balcony. I had requested a street view, so this was perfect. I have read a lot of reviews about the noise from the street, but to be honest, we did not have any issues. The window has a outdoor shutter that will completely cover the window if you so desire. I slept like a baby. No complaints. The bathroom was the largest out of the three hotels we stayed at in Europe. Lots of counter space, and lots of free toiletries, and very clean!The complimentary mini bar was excellent. Bottled water and soda seemed to be so expensive, it was nice to be able to take a bottle of water with you everyday, and the mini bar would be restocked by the time we got back. This front desk staff were awesome. Valentina, Matteo, Alessandro, and another gentleman whose name escapes me right this moment, were very helpful and accommodating. They assisted with restaurant recommendations, confirming our guided tour appointments, and contacted our travel arrangements to make sure they were correct. ( they weren't.. which could have been a disaster trying to get to the airport..but Valentina was on top of it.) Breakfast was included with our room, and it was very tasty. It was nice to be able to tour the city after a nice meal. One of the days, our guided tour was picking us up before the breakfast was served, so the hotel delivered to our room a take away breakfast. Very nice! The location of this hotel was perfect. We walked to a lot of places, but were lucky that our guided tours would pick us up and drop us off at the hotel. We were also right up the road from the "hop on, hop off" stop, and were about to get around to all the major attractions this way. Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay at the Artemide Hotel, and would def recommend to anyone visiting Rome. Jessica P

Reviews.Title: “A nice centally-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: AprilinPortugal
Reviews.Content: Great amenities in a location good for shopping and sight seeing. Dining at the rooftop restaurant and breakfast buffet were both excellant. We made good use of the free wifi during our stay. We were able to walk to many sights over a 4 day stay. Shopping is right on the same street. But, we had a bad experience with one of the hotel's elevators. We were going down to the lobby from our 4th floor room one morning and the elevator stopped between the first floor and the lobby. We were rescued shortly by a bellhop and maintenance man who lowered a chair for us to climb on to get out of the elevator. They were very solicitious and courteous towards us. But we were surprised and disappointed that no one from management (who we knew were aware of the incident) apologized or asked if were okay. The button in the elevator which we pressed when we were trapped did not signal any alarm or speaker to let us know that someone was aware of our predicament. So, beware of the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, good for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: The most helpful staff, free internet, free minibar and close to Termini railway station but, for me, the staff were the most outstanding part of the whole package. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal !”
Reviews.Author: jojoLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right in the heart of everything . Could walk to all major sights within 15 mins, Although I would recommend a tour bus to see everything . Very near to central bus/ train station and easy to find . A bus from either airport takes you within 5-10 minute walk of hotel for €4-€6 . We were given a free up grade , a free breakfast and drinks on the stunning roof terrace . The room and bathroom were modern and very clean with everything you need included. The free mini bar was a nice change too .A few soft drinks, beers ,nuts and biscuits to go with the usual hot drinks . I would definitely recommend the Hotel and will stay again if I'm ever back in the stunning city of Rome .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Hevold
Reviews.Content: From extremely helpful staff, to beautiful rooms and central location, we don't need another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best city break yet”
Reviews.Author: snakedoctor85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend on a four day break to Rome and couldn't recommend this hotel enough! The free welcome drink, the free mini bar and breakfast buffet were very nice touches. The staff were more than helpful. I recommend getting the hotel car to the airport..its door to door for 45euro and hassle free. compare that with getting the metro and train (cost about 35euro for 2persons) its well worth 10 euros for not having to drag the suitcases for ages! Rome is an amazing city and staying in this hotel will add to that!

Reviews.Title: “Solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: movilla
Reviews.Content: A solo traveller, I stayed here for 4 nights (Dec 7-11) and had a good stay. The hotel was as described by many other reviewers. Good location (just 15 minutes walk from Termini, the first station from Fiumicino airport), the staff were excellent and the rooms were perfect. The bed was firm (I think this is common to all rooms in the hotel) but I don't mind that. My room's window faced into a non-descript couryard but that didn't bother me since all I cared about was having a quiet room. Some people have suggested that rooms that face onto Via Nazionale can hear the street below but the windows are quite hefty so I think any noise would be minimal. Food-wise, the buffet breakfast was unbeatable, probably the best I've had in a while. Plenty of choice and a great start to each day. I tended to be out all day photographing and then come back to the room late-ish. I don't use the restaurant (I hate eating solo asides from breakfast) and usually use room service. My only criticim here was the room service menu for evening meals was rather disappointing. Breakfast and snacks are good but evening meals was limited to 2 unexciting pastas, some beef dish and lobster. No matter how hard I stared at the menu options, I couldn't entice myself to order any of the meals and I ended up popping out to get takeaway pizza, and using an Irish bar nearby to get food. There needs to be a few extra meals to make me want to use the evening meals menu. Finally, the bar on the 7th floor was interesting. I like to be anonymous and mind my own business. I'm not into meeting strangers and having a swell time. As I want is to wind down, have a glass or two of wine by myself and reflect on the day. However, as soon as I walked into the relatively small 7th floor bar, it was packed, full of couples, with random people in dressing gowns on the outside part. It felt like I'd walked into a bad episode of Friends. I reversed walked out of the bar immediately. Overall, it's a really good hotel and I'd come back again. The 7th floor bar weirded me out a bit but that's just me. I'm sure other people would probably love it. I'd give the hotel 4.5 (but there's no 4.5 so rounding down to 4).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, tremendous value, Roma at its best!”
Reviews.Author: GA1926
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is an excellnet four star accomodation with large, plush rooms and a free mini bar to boot. They offer a nice Italian continental breakfast and their staff is very accomodating. The hotel is well positioned to use the train or the subway system. We were traveling on a second honeymoon and took tours of the Vatican which can be reached by an easy cab ride or metro. All other key Rome sites were easily accessible by bus or subway. People were always eager to offer directions although Romans sense of distance and non-specific directions can offer some fun challenges. A car in Rome would have been a nightmare so Hotel Artemedi made a terrific choice for overall comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “3 day break in rome”
Reviews.Author: stuart h
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel with very friendly staff. nothing too much trouble for them. continental breakfast has everything including bacon and sausages. views from outside roof bar and restaurant great. i would class this hotel as 4 to 5 star rating. maybe not the cheapest but treat yourselves. metro station for all major sights just over 100yds away with an irish bar next door. would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: JDinHouston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple nights in July as part of my own European tour. I wasn't sure what to expect, the reviews were all rather glowing, but I've learned to be a bit suspicious. Well, I have to jump on the band wagon with everyone else, this is a great place to stay! I did a slight upgrade on the room, so I had a large room for a single, and I think it was worth it. A little more space, great bath and amenities, heck, I even brought the slippers home with me, and I'm not a slipper person! Arrival at the hotel was a busy street, and the entry a bit non-descript. I'll admit that had me a little nervous, but the reception welcome and the room made me feel right at home after an international flight. The restaurant/lounge on the roof was great, the open air spaces and the sofas and seats outside really took advantage of the coziness, and after a drink or two the limited view became quite charming. :-) The bed was comfortable, windows didn't look out to much so I mostly kept them closed, but the design in the room was modern and warm colors. The breakfast room was bright and always busy, and every person working there made me feel very welcome! On my first morning I even finished my meal and the waiter convinced me to continue to sit and enjoy another cappuccino! I've never had someone encourage me just to stay and enjoy, especially as I was traveling alone and had a table for two. The location was great. Easy walk up to all the tourist buses and subway, or, if you are a walker like me, a great stroll through neighborhoods to the Colosseum (about a 30 minute walk, being lazy and stopping at various places poke around). Another plus, if you go out the front and left along the street you will find a nice wine and small restaurant shop. They were very helpful in describing wines and I got a great bottle to take along on my journey. Overall, I've traveled all over the world, stayed at some top hotels, and I would gladly go back. hmmm, I think I want to go back now!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TexMargo
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from an absolutely wonderful Holiday in Italy for our 25th Anniversary. We spent 7 nights at the Artemide after a magical weekend in Venice. the Hotel Artemide was perfect! The staff is friendly, helpful and always available for all guests. Special thanks to always cheerful Mario, the beautiful Valentina and dear, dear Paolo. I cannot say enough about how knowledgable, helpful and friendly they all were during our stay. The room was spacious, and very clean with a lovely private terrance to sit and enjoy a beverage from the free mini bar or a wonderful dinner sent down from the rooftop Terrace. We were greeted with a bottle of Red wine and a special note from the staff for our 25th. The hotel is a perfect location to launch day trips, hop on-off bus tours and very close to the Termini. We walked everywhere with in a few minutes walk, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. We will definitely stay here when we return! By the way...The beds are WONDERFUL!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ARTEMIDE-ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: KiPeRi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at. Location, staff, room, breakfast - everything! A wonderful experience. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “most excellent”
Reviews.Author: Catherine D
Reviews.Content: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. We had a lovely warm welcome from the staff on arrival and were upgraded to the honeymoon suite. This is on the 5th floor and has a terrace with outdoor seating which faces the road. The jacuzzi hot tub was great and the complimentary wine went down very well! The breakfast was extensive and delicious. The location is perfect, within walking distance of all the main sites and very convenient for the main train terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: It's really nice to arrive at an hotel and be greeted warmly by the reception staff which was definately the case at Hotel Artemide when we visited on 3rd December. The room (superior) was located on the third floor facing a central courtyard; not great is your immediate impression but then you get absolutely no noise from Via Nazionale which is a bonus. The room itself was lovely and the mini bar is free! The mini bar is one of my real bugbears in hotels when you, the guest, is treated as having indulged even when you may never have touched the fridge. Yet you always feel that they don't believe you? Here, at Hotel Artemide, there is no such problem. Also a free bottle of Chianti was awaiting us in the room. On the whole one of the nicest city stays I've had in a long time. Oh, Rome was good too (but then Rome is always good).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff & location”
Reviews.Author: MCelineC
Reviews.Content: In early Nov, my mum, aunt & I stayed for 4 nights in a triple room to celebrate my mum's 75th birthday. From the time we arrived till we checked out the hotel staff were terrific. We availed of the car service to and from the airport which I would also recommend. The room was large and clean, and the fridge and tea making facilities excellent. This was my fourth trip to Rome and the Artemide is the best hotel I have stayed in! I would highly recommend it and hope to return soon. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms, central location”
Reviews.Author: mizzisf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days last week in a two-room suite. The location is very central and both the metro station and central railway station are within walking distance of the hotel. If you do take the taxi, beware of the taxi drivers who will try to overcharge you for the trip from the Termini train station to the hotel - it should not cost you more than 7 euros. The hotel is on a very busy street, so if you prefer a very quiet location, this is not it. We could hear the traffic in our room and at times it would wake us up. However, once you get used to it, the location will make up for it. You can walk to the Colosseum, Pantheon, and the Spanish Steps from here. The Vatican is a short 15 minute metro ride away. The staff of the hotel are fantastic and very helpful. They helped us with directions and reservations, advised us how to deal with the dishonest taxi drivers of Rome, and sent free breakfast boxes to us one morning when we had to leave for our train before the 7am breakfast opening. They have a nice roof bar at the top floor, and they offer gluten free bread options at breakfast (you have to ask for that separately though), which seemed to be very rare in Italy! Overall, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Explorer_from_Boston
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Artemide Hotel on Via Nazionale with a friend. The room was small, but clean and the bathroom was great. Decent sized, all marble, very modern. Sleep Quality I rate average because it is Europe after all and the beds are not like the US. The breakfast was excellent - couldn't ask for anything else - and the staff was wonderful. They helped with everything. They even arranged a complimentary box breakfast be sent to the room the morning of an early tour. If you get a chance, explore the Monti area "behind" the hotel, on the way to the Colliseum. Lots of fun little shops and really great restaurants. More value than the VIa Veneto and we thought nicer and hipper than Travestere.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jstanton8869
Reviews.Content: Just comleted our 2nd stay at Hotel Artimide and happy to report it was as good as the first. Terrific service, great location, we will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “One Step Ahead”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel was a great score for us in Rome. They are convenient to the main Termini Train Station which is less than a 10 minute walk, so it is a great place to get to, and for us it was perfect coming from Venice via Train. It is also very convenient to explore other sites outside of the city since it is close to the station. Most importantly, it was complete service, and very cordial from the beginning to end. We stayed there 5 nights, and had a cool view from our window. The room was very comfy, and the bathroom was nice and spacious. The breakfast was included and so fantastic! It had 8 juices, tons of breads, sweets, croissants, cereals, eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, salads, fruits...it went on and on. Great coffee and cappucino, and the gentleman who hosts it was fantastic as was the rest of the staff. They were extremely swift to get us coffee every morning. Then when we had to leave early to catch our flight on the last day, they had us packed a breakfast to go! We didn't even ask for it. They were always one step ahead! They also provide complete complimentary beverages and snacks in the rooms, so anything you enjoy in your room and refrigerator is included in the price.....yes, even the 2 cans of Italian beer! And they replenish it daily! Our room was very quiet, even though we were on the main street. They have those automatic blinds, which you can press a button and it completely seals your window, in addition to your drapes. The service was perfect and our room was great every day when we returned from exploring the city. The front desk folks were perfect as well. And Valentina communicated with me prior to the trip via e-mail, which gave me comfort that everything would be ready for us when we arrived. The other gentlemen at the front desk were always smiling and helpful. They took care of mailing our postcards for us, and their supportive staff was there for any of our needs. Staying at a place like this totally allows you to get the most out of your vacation. The price was totally worth it, and a great deal when compared to many of the other hotels in the city. We will definitely stay with them again if we are fortunate enough to get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Rhianna P
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, helpful staff and good location! Some reviewers have mentioned that the rooms are small, they are but that's to be expected in Rome! Beds were really comfy, clean rooms, lots of toiletries and its a nice touch that mini bar is free! Breakfast was really good, there is everything that you could possibly want for breakfast! The reception staff were very helpful, made restaurant reccomendations and even called to make our reservations. Easy to walk to all the main sights! Only thing this hotel is missing is a pool and jacuzzi!!

Reviews.Title: “Location,service,price-great!”
Reviews.Author: AndaluciaDubai
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is my first hotel in Italy and i am more than pleased to write this reco. Its on Via Nazionale which is 100 m from the Repubblica Metro station next to the beautiful Piazza della Repubblica. The rooms are quite, staff are very helpful (mario and matteo at the reception). I arrived early in the morning (6 am) and couldnt check in but they stored my luggage , gave me a complementary coffee and use of their business centre. The room was small and adequate for me as a single traveller, the bathroom was the best part...chic and very clean. The whole Mini bar is complementary and wifi in the rooms makes it really easy...Also get a free welcome drink on teir 7th floor terrace bar that overlooks the vatican... I walked all of rome in 2 days and whenever i was tired i could always take a metro right back!! Would def come back here...

Reviews.Title: “surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: lachoirboy
Reviews.Content: I read many favorable reviews and booked this hotel. I am thrilled with my selection. Great location, staff and accommodations. The breakfast buffet was super too. My only disappointment was that I only had one night in Rome. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott P
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights at Artemide Hotel in November 2011 and would certainly recommend it highly. The rates were extremely reasonable, being much cheaper than the costs one would outlay for a similar level hotel in the centre of cities such as Sydney, Paris or New York. Indeed it was even better value because of the first rate buffet breakfasts and the generous free mini bar - restocked daily with beer, soft drinks, juices, bottled water, mineral water, nuts, crackers, wafers,biscotti etc. The rooms are clean, modern, comfortable and spotlessly maintained. The hotel is in a great central location on the via Nazionale in a nice part of town with clothing shops, souvenir shops, ATMs and even a Despar mini mart close by. It is only a 10 minute walk from the Termini Railway station, about 5 minutes walk to the Metro at Repubblica and less than 10 minutes walk to nearby attractions such as Colonna Traiana and the Fori Imperiali, the Palazzo del Quirinale, Palazzo Barberini and Santa Maria Maggorie. The hotel roof top bar and restaurant are top class with nice touches such as a welcome drink on arrival and we were also offered 50% discount on food AND wine for dinner at the restaurant one night. It was actually one of the nicest meals we had in Rome. We had pre dinner drinks and an antipasto platter on the terrace, a three course meal in the restaurant (including lobster and steak) wines by the glass for each course, and finishing with liqueurs and coffee for a total cost of 66 Euro for two. Amazing value and superb quality.The hotel also arranged for a car to collect us from Fiumicino airport at an acceptable rate (60 Euros) which was much appreciated having arrived in Rome at 7AM after an exhausting 30 hours flying time from Australia. We were also offered an additional breakfast at that time while our room was being prepared. We would definitely stay at the Artemide again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: iterfacere101
Reviews.Content: I only have positive things to say about Artemide Hotel. Fab location, it's easy to get around the city either on foot or by metro which is right up the street. The rooms are small, yes, but then you are in the middle of Rome. Extras add a nice touch, such as free water, free mini-bar, etc. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. Our room faced a courtyard and was very quiet. The breakfast buffet offers many choices, especially for Italian standards. And they can mix a good cocktail both in the rooftop bar as well as in the bar downstairs. We had a very pleasant stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: RussellF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for a night en route to a cruise from Cicitavecchia. The first pleasant surprise was an email from the hotel a few days before we left offering a chauffeur-driven transfer from Fiumicino airport to the hotel for just a bit more than the taxi fare, (which we accepted with haste as the day of our arrival was one of Italy's many general strike days!). The next surpised was that when we arrived, we found we had been upgraded to a delightful mini-suite with free minibar. Plus there was a voucher for a complimentary welcome drink to meet the other guests on the rooftop terrace area. And the breakfast (also included) was excellent, too! The hotel itself is well worthy of its four star status, situated right in the heart of the city on the main Via Nazionale not far from Termini train station and handy for all the sights of Rome. We wished we could have stayed longer but our ship was waiting. However we will definitely be staying at the Artemided the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HarjandJazz
Reviews.Content: We took my mother in law to Rome for her 60th birthday and stayed at the Artemide Hotel. I cannot praise the staff enough. They really were wonderful. Our triple room was very clean and spacious. Our housekeeper Christina was a lovely lady, who even with a language barrier asked us numerous times if we needed anything. Upon returning from our tour of the Vatican a card and lovely fruit platter awaited my mother in law from all the staff wishing her a very happy birthday. So nice! They were so helpful with booking our tours and telling us where the good eating spots were and where we should avoid. Termini (Central Rome) was a dive. You have to be very carful with pick pocketers there, but everywhere we went looked like a dump, especially near the central station. Try and avoid staying there! The Artemide hotel is centrally located (Republicca - one stop from Termini on Metro A) so the metro and buses were easy and so economical, yet miles from the dump of Termini. Avoid taxis as they rip you off! There are lots of nice shops and eating places in the area with a lovely wine bar across the road, who do the best Pina Colada's I've had. There were some real dives of hotels that we saw, so were so relieved at this pleasant and comfortable hotel. I would definitley recommend this hotel to all family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, with some qualifications”
Reviews.Author: TBearden
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a pre-cruise stay based on the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. I don't regret staying here and agree with many of the nice things people have said, but thought it would be useful to list some of the things I don't think are worthy of rave reviews. First, the room we had was very small--so small that it was something of a challenge to place our our three pieces of luggage where they wouldn't be in the way. The free Internet access was extraordinarly slow--almost uselessly slow at times. I didn't find the location to be as wonderful as some other reviewers. It's a 20-25 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon, and that includes a pretty steep hill. It takes 25-30 minutes to walk to the Coliseum and the Forum. Finally, $1,223 for four nights (including breakfast) during the off season isn't exactly a bargain. But all of that said, this is a nice hotel with a very friendly and accomodating staff, the free minibar is a nice amenity, and we found the buffet breakfast quite good and the service in that dining room to be outstanding. And that small room had an extremely nice marble bathroom with excellent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome with colleagues”
Reviews.Author: Aigars Z
Reviews.Content: I really liked our stay at Hotel Artemide - welcome drink, fruit basket in the room, rich breakfast, tidy and spacious rooms, convenient location and very helpful staff. Altogether that was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsM0nkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 10 other people. The rooms were TINY but clean. We walked everywhere which was very handy. Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. The website is very deceptive. the hotel is NOT as lovely as it looks online and the roof bar has views of pilons, satelliite dishes and a church bell and little else. Breakfast was ok, nothing to shout about but I have had worse. The dining area is small and gets very crammed in the morning. Staff were pretty helpful (we spent a lot of time in reception calling other rooms to meet our friends) Elevator was tiny and so slow. We were on the 5th floor and it was hard walking up the stairs after a full day sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great decor - but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. The location is absolutely great for shopping and sightseeing - many of which are walkable or you can hop on various run-around buses from outside the nearby station terminal. Inside the decor to the common areas is very presentable and tasteful. Same comment with the bedrooms - but we found the latter rather small (we had three twin rooms) - even for a capital city. Fine for a long weekend stay but not for any longer period where you might be in your room for more than an overnight sllep. Shame as the bathroom is very nicely tiled and fitted out..Breakfast which was included is a perfect start to the day with good service and wide range of varied food options. There is a small bar/restaurant on the top floor which we ate in the first night. Food very average and little or no ambience which is a shame as the outside addition bar seating are on the roof garden is pretty nice. Although there were heaters for the evening they struggle to be effective so you need to wrap up to really enjoy this outside of the summer/early autumm. Overall enjoyable but doesn't quite get top marks for the rooms size and roof garden restaurant. Also wasn't too impressed when the bellboy came into the downstairs lounge while we were watching a sports match to put an alternative channel on with his favourite team - without even asking if we minded first - that wasn't clever.The cost of our three nights varied massively for each night, so some careful choice of dates might provide better value for money. Final note, can there be a worse airport ever than Rome's Fiumicino? We allowed two hours to get from Terminal 2 through check in, security and passport control - and we only just made the gate an hour and a half later. The three lines of security dropped to two when one team went off for a 20 minute break - just as the queue reached it's peak. Nice trip other than the Rome airport experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler11_11
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Front Desk helpful and experienced. Free newspapers, free mini bar, free welcome drink on the roof top restaurant and free fruit plate upon arrival. Room was large and nicely decorated and the maid was great. Our room was in the back of the hotel and it was very quiet, a plus on via Nazionale. Breakfast was well organized and a good assortment of food. Will go back and stay again next year. Only complaint was the TV, the remote was hard to use.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Jill_8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four wonderful days in Rome staying in the Hotel Artemide. The staff were so very helpful when asked any question, which made our stay easy. We received a very warm welcome from everyone. We ate in the restaurant in the evenings where the food was freshly prepared and good. We had asked for a quiet room at the back of the hotel which, although small, was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were substantial and good quality. We thought the location was perfect on Via Nazionale with a short walk to the Metro. Would highly recommend the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Leopoldo H
Reviews.Content: After 15 days in Italy i have no doubts it was one of our best choices. All the people make their best to make us feel good (and they got it). The room was not big but good enoght, perfectly clean and the ubication of the hotel is just perfect. The breakfast is very complete and the bar and restaurant in the last floor are very good and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TommyBurns
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Rome, after a six hour delay due to an October snow storm, was relieved when we found our driver waiting for us at the airport. The hotel arranged for reasonable limosine service to and from the hotel. The room was away from the noise of the street, clean, and the bed was quite comfortable. The staff was quite comfortable with English, courteous, friendly, and all the service was wonderful. The roof top restaurant was very nice, but the breakfast buffet terrific. A bottle of wine was complimentary as well as the beer and soda in the minibar. Getting around Rome was easy as the hotel is centrally located. Cabs came in two minutes. We stayed three nights and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really is worth all the praise.”
Reviews.Author: ianwebzell
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in Artemide, fantastic hotel. Comfortable, clean, helpful, nice staff. Every detail was superb and the icing on the cake was the free mini-bar - a very nice touch. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience ...”
Reviews.Author: ebtric
Reviews.Content: I have started this review about six times. Each time I begin writing, I remember one more pleasant thought that must be said about the Artemide. I need to simplify ... The hotel: The facilities are clean, stylish and more than adequate. You'll not find a lot of wasted lobby space but you'll not find yourself wanting for a specific facility, e.g. restaurant, health club, bar, etc. The rooms: Guest rooms are the same. Filled with amenities, it's clear that the Artemide wants you to feel comfortable. The staff: They could not have been more attentive and friendly. When they (somewhat accidentally) learned of a birthday in our group, they sent a fruit basket to his room with their personal wishes for a happy birthday. No one asked them to do it, nor did they try to take credit. Only when we asked did they own up to their generosity. The location: Excellent. Walking distance to many sites. Close to both Metro station and Termini. Via Nazionale is a main traffic artery and one doesn't feel unsafe walking it. The value for your money: Could not be better. Rome can be expensive yet the Artemide offers reasonable rates and includes almost everything a traveler could want, e.g. breakfast, mini-bar, etc. Summary: It's often little surprises that turn average into good. The Artemide was so filled with these little surprises that I can only think of it as excellent. Our family could not have had a more pleasant experience. As others have said, I'll not consider staying anywhere else on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great...”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, within easy striking distance of many of the sights. It's located on a very busy road and the facing bedrooms have poor double glazing - so, if you're used to peace and quiet at night, ask for a room at the back (the very helpful staff allowed us to move after our first and disturbed night at the front). The rooms are clean and comfortable - but the flashing red lights over the bed (fire alarm?) annoyed us. Breakfasts were OK - somewhat uninspiring but very generous offerings, with a background of intrusive 20th century "Italian music" - quite an insult to the many great Italiian composers past and present.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: Kuwait4me
Reviews.Content: An incredibly Stylish hotel with a Staff that will stop at nothing to assist you. It was the perfect location for our 4 day romantic get away in Rome. The hotel has earned its 4 star rating beyond question. I will surely go back and never consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and the staff were just great”
Reviews.Author: Fvelji
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Oct 31-Nov 4,2011. I highly recommend this hotel. The breakfast buffet was great and the staff was friendly. The free wi-fi anywhere in the hotel is a big plus. The hotel is very clean and the customer service was just great. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KScarpetta
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day/4 night stay at Hotel Artemide and we could not fault it. The staff were exceptionally helpful - a special mention to both Alessandro and Mario. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We are not big beer drinkers and when I asked if we could possibly have soft drinks in the free mini-bar instead this was immediately done. From organising the transfers for the airport to helping us get bus tickets all was done with a big smile. We had a superior double room which was very large and the bathroom, with jacuzzi bath was a treat. We faced out onto the road but had our own balcony and whilst you could hear a slight bit of traffic noise, it was not intrusive. The soundproofed rooms mean that you certainly do not hear the other guests. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and whilst it is not the cheapest in Rome, you do feel that you get what you pay for. It is the little things that make a difference to me when staying in a hotel and with Hotel Artemide not only were the main areas like comfort and cleanliness covered but also the smaller things - free mini bar, free wifi, sweets on the pillow, toiletries that were replenished daily and the great variety for breakfast. I will be recommending this hotel to all I know who are going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home when in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: This jewel of a property located in Via Nazionale is truly fantastic. The rooms have a classic italian decor, with floor to cieling marble bathrooms. The roof restaurant has a great menu together with a fantastic view. The breakfast is first class, and the staff will accomodate all your requests, from the the ordinary to the peculiar . The front office staff are extremely professional, Paolo the night manager, is a wealth of knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pinot_Chris
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Rome and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Artemide. A quality hotel in a great location. We would have no hesitation in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: david_delange
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel based on reviews for TripAdvisor. Very friendly staff. Room was fine. Room was clean, water was fine. Room was cleaned everyday with no issues to report.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Linha
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful, and that's regarding everyone we've had contact with. At the reception, doorbell boy, at breakfast (waitresses and maitre), at Rooftop restaurant. No exceptions at all. The hotel is very good, the family room we've asked for was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The room and bathroom were very clean (there is a smelling issue I'll mention bellow) and it's a treat to had the items in the fridge for free as well as bathroom, vanity and other personal care items too. The Rooftop Restaurant is very good as well, it does worth a drop by in a day you are too tired to go out for dinner. Wi fii is free and the signal is great everywhere at the hotel. The hotel didn't got an excellent review because it's expensive and also because as the windows do not open the bathroom had a persistent bad smell of humid place that's closed for a long time that even though we poured some scented water and perfume in some spots it didn't got any better.

Reviews.Title: “really good location, great breakfast and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scotchpiners
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were very clean, and so was the bathroom. The breakfast spread was really good. The free minibar really made the kids happy. Small gestures such as putting Italian candy on the pillows every night - and for both the kids really made their day. Wonderful hotel to stay in as a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sgpoonch
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel was that the pictures of the exterior looked better on the website. Because the windows could not be opened, the rooms felt dark all the time. (something which I did not like) The bath-tub drainage was also very slow... & for a tub filled to 1/8 of its capacity, we waited about 15 minutes for the water to drain. Having said that, we liked the staff at Artemide. They were friendly and ever willing to help. The breakfast spread was great too. Everything from the mini-bar was free! (something that is not normally the case) Location-wise, we managed to walk from the Rome main station to the hotel in about 10 minutes (with luggage). Some of the sights (Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Roman ruins) can also be reached by foot.... about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the free mini bar”
Reviews.Author: Angeline13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had two rooms. In the kids room there was a welcome fresh fruit platter which I thought was a really nice touch. Our room had a bottle of wine and some nuts. The rooms were on different floors, both close to the elevator and so we got quite a bit of noise from the elevator. Our room, on the top floor (there were only two rooms on this level) could only be reached by stairs (elevator went to the 4th floor and we had to climb the last level). It worked out fine for us but something to consider when making a reservation if you have difficulty with stairs. It was also very dark which some people might not like. Bathroom was well stocked with slippers, shampoo, conditioner, hand soap and hand sanitizer. Plenty supplied and restocked daily. The minibar had soft drinks, waters and juices and it was so nice to come back from a long day of touring and be able to have some refreshments (for free!) without having to leave the room. The in-room coffee maker was also nice. Breakfast buffet was fine. We enjoyed complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar. The setting on the rooftop was very relaxing and we enjoyed spending time there. While I would never tell anyone that the just had to stay at this hotel, it worked for us and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great location-Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hazel G
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we chose this Hotel using the reviews form TripAdvisor. It was advice well worth taking. We chose a superior room which was not huge but very well appointed and immaculately clean. All the little extra touches such as the free mini bar , the welcome drinks and half price meal and the complimentary bottle of wine helped make our stay extra special. The hotel staff were superb - friendly and helpful, they sprang into action on discovering that the airline had lost my luggage- ringing the airport for us and organising taxis etc. Everyone from the bell boys to the cleaning staff had a smile for us and we felt both welcome and well cared for. Breakfast was excellent - good quality with a very wide range of food and the rooftop bar/restaurant was a wonderful place to relax after a busy day sight seeing. The dinner menu isn't extensive but I had one of the best risottos ever on our first evening there :) In summary I would heartily recommend this hotel - it's location,staff and presentation considerably enhanced our trip and we will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Richgl36
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend here, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Location is 15 mins walk from termini station and relatively easy to find. All but one of the staff were excellent (think he was having a bad day!). Our room was small and the bathroom tiny, but they were excellently presented and we could obviously have gone for a more expensive option if space was that important to us . Free safe, free refreshments, restocked every day. Free wifi. We were located at the back, so not much natural light, but it was reasonably quiet at night for a busy city!. We never got to find the good restaurants in Rome, think we should have asked the staff!. However, the service overall in this hotel is excellent, which is why we would go back. Great base to get to all the main tourist sites too; Trevi 15 mins, colosseum 15 mins, Spanish steps 20 mins, Vatican 40 mins walking distance. We got a bottle of wine free for my partner's birthday and a card (I had not prompted the staff, they obviously checked the date in the passports), nice touch, she loved it. Ps. Loved the comment from another reviewer about too many americans!?!...I mean how dare they also go on holiday to the same hotel as you!...next they will be allowing other nationalities to stay there too....possibly best to stay at home with that attitude! Hope you are not from the uk too...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nataliemae
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the reviews at TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is lovely and the customer service is outstanding. We chose upgraded rooms and they were small but beautifully appointed. The breakfast is outstanding, the rooftop restaurant is a wonderful place to go for a glass of wine after a long day of sight seeing in Rome. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb.”
Reviews.Author: hjujhj
Reviews.Content: Great. Everything you need. Not the cheapest but the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central hotel, still hardly deserving the outstanding given reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Europeaken
Reviews.Content: Very small standard room. Clean and quiet, but bathroom smelled slightly moisture damage. Great portier, rest of staff also quite good. Breakfast was fine. Good standards overall, but honestly: hardly worth the high prices, did not quite meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: gingerjinx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for our honeymoon (4 nights) and were happy to find that the reviews were accurate. On arrival we were told we had been given a room upgrade and when we got to our room we had a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us. The location is fabulous and is within walking distance of all the main attractions. We dined in the restaurant every evening and found the staff friendly and helpful. The food was lovely and having looked at restaurants in the area, competitively priced. We were also presented with complimentary glasses of Limoncello one evening. This combined with the complimentary glasses of Prosecco on arrival, free mini bar and snacks in the room and free Wi-Fi made our stay very enjoyable. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Roma”
Reviews.Author: tryon_2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Artemide prior to our eastern Mediterranean cruise. The hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up at FCO and also took care of booking a driver to the port of Civitavecchia. Everything was reserved via email ....... the hotel staff were awesome. We had a superior room on the sixth floor that was very clean and quiet. The seventh floor roof top restaurant and lounge made our stay. What a great way to finish our long days of touring around Rome. We had dinner at the hotel one evening that was excellent. Check out their house Chianti wine .... you will not receive a better pour anywhere in the world. If you are looking for a clean, quiet stay in Rome at a reasonable price the Artemide is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto !”
Reviews.Author: ELREY123
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome earlier, but my hotel choice was never lucky. This time, I hit the bullseye. I checked out Tripadvisor of course, and this one came out as nr. 1. This hotel in Via Nazionale is well located, between the Termini Train Station and the heart of the city. The Spanish stairs are at about 15-20 minutes walking. Colosseum about half an hour. Taxis are cheap and easy to get. The rooms are tidy, modern and quiet enough. The staff is very polite and speaks very well English. I reserved directly at the hotel over the internet and everything went smoothly. The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant on top of the roof. The breakfast is plentyful and coffee is great here (as it should, in Italy). All our requests and wishes were instanty carried out with a kind smile. The only point of improvement could be the elevators, which are a bit slow to arrive. In big cities like Rome you can not be careful enough picking your hotel. I can highly recommend hotel Artemide to any traveller, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Artemide”
Reviews.Author: CaryTravler
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviews on Trip Advisor, we spent our last night of vacation in Rome after a cruise at the Artemide. It was a great experience from the moment we stepped into the lobby. The staff were very helpful, upgraded us to a junior suite - well worth it for the space since we had a lot of luggage. Ask if you don't get it automatically. Well-appointed room - nice bathroom with a jacuzzi - roomy for European standards. Got a good night's sleep on a good bed with nice sheets. View from our room was over the Via Nazionale - but not a noise problem or light problem since they have nice blackout curtains to pull. Had an excellent late lunch in the rooftop garden restaurant. Will definitely stay here on our next visit to Rome. Staff very pleasant and helpful. A great breakfast room - and breakfast was included. Try the Artemide - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for all the sights!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nts in January 2011. We were very impressed with this hotel. Service was fantastic. Rooms very clean. We only had breakfast here and was the usual continental style and was nice. The gym was small and basic equipment was there to use. The reception staff were always very friendly. Our room did not have a view but this did not spoil our stay due to the location to the attractions. The hotel had a roof terrace but unfortunately closed in the winter. We will return in the spring to try this out!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel, friendly staff, good location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Aswakelin
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for good value with excellent service. The location is good for all the main sites, the staff very welcoming and friendly. Our rooms overlooked the main Via Nazionale and were clean, fresh and well appointed. The free mini bar and wifi are nice touches. We shall definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great....but”
Reviews.Author: Edwers
Reviews.Content: All the reviews about this hotel are right on....but. One reviewer recommended opting for a larger room if you are staying for more than a couple of nights. We were there for six and the classic double was tiny, too bad we didn't listen. Additionally, it was in the back. No daylight entered the room. In fact, we had to go to the front door to get a feel for the day's weather. I was told that I had a good-sized classic room.....but. I was paying $325+ a night!! The front desk was efficient and helpful but was certainly far from friendly; cold might be a better description. They did their job.....but. We loved the personnel in the breakfast room, breakfast was always great, the wifi worked flawlessly, location was A-1, clean to the nth degree (look under the beds and you will see a card telling you that there is no need to worry, the staff has taken care to clean that space too). Call me nitpicky but just be prepared for the room size and the front desk but otherwise enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing first impression but then it improved after a change of room”
Reviews.Author: traveltwotoo
Reviews.Content: We had been travelling for over three weeks with nothing but positive thoughts about our choice of hotels in Italy when we arrived at the Artemide Hotel for our nine night stay. Do not stay in Room 115 ( bottom floor) unless you wish to hear the sound of water in the drainpipes that are right outside the window, late into the night and to awaken you very early in the morning. However we have noted that another reviewer thought this room was terrific - we were amazed when we read that. This room also had other minor problems BUT the staff promply changed our room with great efficiency when we spoke to them the next morning. Our room on the third floor was certainly cleaner and quieter, with everything in working order, and we had to wonder why we had not been allocated this room in the first place, and why we had paid 300 euros a night for rm 115. The hotel is in an excellent location, breakfast was good and the staff unfailingly helpful but maybe the person who allocates the rooms should consider whether rm 115 is a good choice for guests staying nine nights. We never asked for anything more than a room change and the hotel management was most apologetic when we explained our concerns.Good for them.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Got It Right Again!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 650TheCastros
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay in Rome and one of the best things about this visit was the Hotel Artemide. Trip Advisor is always "my first choice" when planning any trip because I have never been disappointed with their reviews. In this case, spot on!!!!!!!!!. Incredible staff in all areas of the hotel whether it be the front desk, porters, breakfast room, or roof table bar, great location, clean comfortable rooms with free mini bar. The hotel staff took care of each and everyone of our requests be it the transfer from the port, guided tours, restaurant suggestions, transfer back to the airport with notifcations to us every step of the way including before and after our trip. If we ever get to visit Rome again it will be because we want to return to the Hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city centre hotels we’ve stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Sub_three
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Artemide (on our first ever visit to Rome) due mainly to the positive reviews from fellow Tripadvisor travellers. We arrived ahead of schedule and were very quickly checked in by the front desk who handed us a useful map and details of local tours etc. We expected to have to wait for a room to become available – although after a couple of phone calls between the front desk and housekeeping it wasn’t long before we were despatched with one of the porters to a room at the front of the hotel on the third floor. We enjoyed having a street view and whilst there was a small amount of traffic noise at peak times (it IS a city centre hotel after all) it was hardly noticeable due to the efficient double glazing and didn’t bother us at all – we had no problems sleeping and I enjoyed waking in the mornings to the hubbub of the city gradually stirring itself into life. Things that we liked: - the location – plenty of interesting attractions within easy walking distance - very convenient for the Termini and for nearby subway and buses - friendly and efficient staff (always a smile and a friendly greeting) - clean and comfortable room and bathroom – not the largest of rooms but well equipped with everything we needed - the complimentary mini-bar (much appreciated) and tea/ coffee making facilities - the breakfast buffet – plenty of staff on hand and a very good selection to choose from – even for late-comers like us who struggle to get up in the morning - the complimentary glasses of sparkling wine in the rooftop bar – a nice way to sit and relax after a tiring day. Although there is nothing about the hotel we didn’t like, we found that some of the restaurants in the near vicinity were of a very poor standard - on reflection we wished that we had tried out the hotel restaurant on at least one evening of our stay. Overall the Artemide is one of the best city centre hotels we’ve stayed at (and we’ve stayed at quite a few). We found it to be a welcoming and relaxing place to return to in the evenings (an oasis of calm in an otherwise frenetic city) and we have no hesitation in recommending to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liudmilla_2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide was everything you need on your holidays. Welcoming staff, healthy and tasty breakfast, clean comfortable room with nice and roomy bathroom, and wonderful location. Close to train station(Termini), only 20 min. walk to Spanish Steps and Victor Emmanuelle; only 5 min. walk to Teatro Dell'Opera Di Roma(you actually can wear high heals), good shopping and restaurant area. We would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, friendly staff and clean fresh hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Craig D
Reviews.Content: We booked this from tripadvisor and were definitely not disapointed from the reviews. Very good first impressions. good location, friendly helpful staff, and clean and tidy hotel. Our only regret is that we didn't have an opportunity to have dinner at the hotel as it looked fantastic and very reasonable prices. I would certainly recommend this hotel and if we did return I would definitely stay at the Artemide. I would find it difficult for anyone to fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLK2000
Reviews.Content: We very pleased that we found this hotel on Trip Advisor. It is well worth the high rating given here. We found the hotel to be modern and clean. The room was spacious which we have not always found in other European Hotels. The room had a free mini bar with snacks and drinks. There was free wi fi and breakfast. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. When we had difficulty using at atm, they allowed us to use their phone to contact the bank.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: rudge38
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Artemide for four nights in a superior room. From the begining we felt at home, helpfull staff were always friendly. The room was bigger than expected well set out with a comfortable bed. Transport is close if needed but for us average type walkers the major sites are easy to walk to. The Vatican area is a bit further, however allow a little more time, stop for refreshments along the way and enjoy the Roma life. Eateries, Bar's and shopping are all close by. The restaurant/bar is a great place to relax after sightseeing and the breakfast was the best of the three hotels we stopped at in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MissMagPie
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. We stayed in many 5 star hotels during our 30 day European vacation but this hotel ranked up there as one of our favorites. Traveling with a 16 year old daughter it was nice to have a large room with an area for her. The location is wonderful, very central especially if you like to walk. We had the hotel arrange for a private tour guide for 2 days to explore the Vatican and the Coliseum area. Daniella was fabulous and made our stay here so memorable even in the 100+ temps of July. The hotel staff were always very helpful. Breakfast was very good. I would agree that if you would like a memorable dinner do your homework. The restaurants they recommended were adequate but not great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome. This was our first visit and it was a perfect home base.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelgreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for three nights and had a great time at this place. Staff was very friendly and eager to assist. Location is very central to explore most of tourist attractions and its only a stroll to Metro. We would definitely stay here again on our future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide hotel Rome October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Barney J
Reviews.Content: The Artemide hotel is a very nice place to stay. Once off the busy Via Nazionale you get a nice surprise as the reception area is spacious and well decorated. It looks like a very 'up market' hotel. The staff were very helpful and all spoke excellent English. The rooms are well appointed with many useful features including tea and coffee facilities. The rooms have satellite TV and Wi-fi. Allessandro in reception, is particularly helpful and sent us a number of emails prior to our stay to help us with airport transfers which they kindly arranged at a cost of €60 euros to be picked up and €45 euros to be dropped off at the airport. The pick up and drop off service is very efficient with Mercedes being the mode of transport. The transfer takes about 45 minutes. WARNING - the 3 night stay was booked in the UK via Expedia. The fee was paid as described BUT there was no prior warning of The Rome 'Room tax' that all visitors have to pay in top of their agreed package. Neither was it made clear on booking that the hotel will charge you different rates for each night you stay with them. For the three nights there were three different room rates. The middle night was as much as £100 more expensive than the the previous night. This is not what is expected when you have confirmed and paid for a hotel stay. Their explanation was that this is because of 'supply and demand' - this is a strange logic. Once a fee is agreed on a B&B basis it shouldn't vary because of 'demand' as you have already booked your nights at the hotel. BEWARE - Some restaurants will add a 15% surcharge for 'Service charge' but they will still expect a tip on top of that. Check before you make your order. At the Collaseaum beware the 'Tour Sellers' encouraging you pay €27 euros to skip the queues outside. They will tell you that you can avoid the 3 hour wait by taking their 'Tour'. The queue doesn't take 3 hours - ours was 40 minutes! To gain official entry costs €12 euros per adult plus €5 euros if you wanted an audio device ( very handy)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel professionally run”
Reviews.Author: Passionatehawker
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be all we hoped for on our last 3 nights of and 8 week European trip. It was very centrally located, our room was quiet and had everything we could have wished for - free wifi, free mini bar, comfortable, large bed, plenty of toiletries. Staff were very helpful, nice breakfast, turn down service and some nice "extras" such as a bottle of complimentary wine, vouchers for the roof top bar (you can see St peter's from the rooftop) and a 1/2 price voucher for their restaurant. Very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: skisunday19
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel as part of our honeymoon. The honeymoon suite with garden room and roof terrace with (two sofas) were spacious and high quality and we loved it.They gave us champagne, chocolates and flowers as well as a candlelit dinner. This all made us feel very special. The accommodation was a good standard and stylish. The roof terrace bar and restaurant are lovely and very pleasant to spend an evening on. The food was good and reasonably priced on the terrace and the breakfast was brilliant with a very large choice and very fresh. The staff were very knowledgeable. helpful and spoke good English. We also found the location to be within easy walking distance of many of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: caro089
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate hotel especially if you can get a promotional price. Definitely 4 stars, well located clean services fantastic rooftop scenery and very reasonnable price for supper. One of the few hotel rooms where it is really quiet and you can sleep soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Best & highly Recommendable Hotel. Excellent, Caring Staff & Services”
Reviews.Author: darshanaps
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome in Oct. 2011 for 3 nights. It was an excellent location, with extremely caring & helpful staff. We were in the Family room which was very comfortable, ready when we reached & was always kept clean & tidy by the housekeeping staff. All the needs of the tourist are taken care & kept in mind & provided for by the hotel. It was really nice to see the care & concern of the hotel staff for its guest, especially when their was protest in the City. Breakfast was really nice with a lot of variety and a wide spread and choice. Definitely a must stay place in Rome. Made our tour really memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: travnutz
Reviews.Content: Our home in Rome! Decided to stay again at Hotel Artemide in Rome. My husband and I stayed here the same week as last year for our anniversary. Good location. Very clean, top notch hotel. Fantasic service, breakfast, amenities (free bottled water too!). We corresponded with Alessandro at the front desk prior to both of our stays at this hotel and he took very good care of us. Actually, Alessandro gave us the most excellent restaurant recommendations based on what we were looking for on any particular evening and the restaurants were superb. No request was too big or too small while we were there. He also gave us a tip on some of the best Gelato in Rome. We love this hotel and its staff. Whenever we have an opportunity again to come to Rome we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Booked this after reading other TA reviews. Very glad we did. We had room 623 which had a view of the courtyard, but didn't spend a lot of time in room. Spotlessly clean; free mini bar very useful; comfortable king size bed. This room only had a shower which was a bit of a let down as a good soak in a bath would have been nice after walking so much in Rome. Hotel full apparently, so no chance of a room change. The room isn't huge, but this is central Rome. Staff wonderful, and very good selection at buffet breakfast. Roof terrace nice and relaxing, and complimentry drink on arrival was very much appreciated. No noise problem in room either. My partner had a birthday during our stay, but no freebie bottle of wine. Then again we didn't "tout" for any freebies, but during our stay witnessed others who appeared to be doing so. Each to their own! One minor gripe. Our soap was replaced every day. Very nice, but a little bit wasteful perhaps? Stayed 15 - 22 October 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nada R
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in this hotel! We arrived early before check-in time, so the friendly staff offered us free breakfast ! free internet access all the day and the hotel location is great and close to everything special in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Its all been said before”
Reviews.Author: Epags
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Artemide (Sept 21-Sept 25). Having emailed in advance that we were celibrating our 18th wedding anniversary, when we checked in, our room had a lovely bottle of wine and wine glasses waiting for us. All the other reviews re. frige and the free beverages, the lovely food, the great service all were right. We were lucky enough that Rome was experiencing a heat wave and the hotel had kept the 7th floor outside lounge and dining area open. A real treat to watch the sun set over St Peters while dining on great food. I believe someone complained about the breakfast offerings. Do not know where they eat but having traveled extensively and have eaten at 1 star and 5 star hotels, there was nothing to complain about here. If you wanted something, just ask the dining room manager Pasquale. FYI we had room 516 which was designated a "Superior Room" . King bed, a second single bed which we used for clothing staging, frige, free WiFi, bath with tub/shower combination and double or triple paned windows/heavy blackout curtains/fabric covered walls creating a dead silent sleeping environment. Will stay here everytime we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Free mini bar & wifi all day long!”
Reviews.Author: Thor11
Reviews.Content: Still staying in this hotel while writing this review. Honestly speaking, I'm missing my favorite hotel chain ie Park Hyatt and Grand Hyatt. The room is quite ok. The decor looks quite outdated and needs a major uplifting. However, the service in this hotel makes up for it. Staff are very helpful and efficient. My clothes from the laundry were returned to me on the same day even though it was stated that laundry sent before 10 am will only be ready the next day. The front desk officer did not even bat an eyelash when I requested for more pillows ie 3 extra pillows. The mini bar was great and free of charge! Furthermore, the hotel provided a kettle in each room! That's very uncommon in European hotels. But it was greatly appreciated. I need not pay €5 for a pot of hot water like I did in Westin Paris!
