What a rip-off! I also appreciate the wifi here. The speed was fast and thus enables me to chat with my friends back home and of course, writing this review which I hope, will be useful to all my fellow travellers. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service!”
Reviews.Author: 2ozgypsies
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really no how to look after guests. Nothing is too hard and it's all done with a smile. In our case it included a free international phone call when one of our wallets was stolen on the metro. The Artemide was fairly expensive accommodation for us at almost €200 a night for a small double room but it was beautifully fitted out and maintained. We also acknowledge that most accommodation in Rome is pricey. An unexpected bonus at the Artemide was free minibar use. There was a very good range of English language TV stations and in-room wifi was free and fast. Breakfasts were excellent but cost €14 per person. We also used the hotel restaurant (7th floor) twice because the meals and service were so good. We very much enjoyed the generous prosciutto and mozzarella entree and the lamb cutlet mains, but we particularly recommend the lemon sorbet - very creamy and served within the deep frozen body of a lemon. Bottles of wine range upwards from €12. The hotel is centrally located, within comfortable walking distance of Termini train station, Trevi Fountain, Colosseum etc. The metro is just a few minutes walk away to visit more distant sites. Highly recommended for a touch of luxury and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Close to, if not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JLSToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved it. Hotel is clean, bed and room is very comfortable, great breakfast spread, central to major landmarks, too close to shopping :), staff were very helpful and polite, computer terminals and printer were helpful for on-line check-in, rooftop restaurant was great for a nightcap after a long day of sight-seeing...what more can I say? We highly highly recommend and we will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: chattercafe
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at Hotel Artemide between September 12 2011 and September 15 2011 and enjoyed our stay tremendously! We had a triple room with 3 twin beds and found the room very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel arranged for a van to drive us from the airport to the hotel and for a van to drive us to the cruise ship pier which was such a great help. The hotel is centrally located and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. The breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious and had a broad selection from which to choose. We became quite fond of fresh ricotta and fig preserves on rolls. I had never seen green apple juice but it was delicious. The staff was friendly and efficient. We had dinner in their rooftop restaurant and the food was good and so was the view. The only warning that I would give is - don't order the steak. We would go back to the Artemide in a flash and will recommend the hotel to all friends going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “pre-cruise rome stay”
Reviews.Author: freddiemacEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: hotel artemide lived up to all expectations based on recent reviews,from the minute you step in the door the staff are so polite and helpful,the rooftop bar/restaurant was lovely ,in fact the entire hotel was very elegant .easy to access due to its proximity to roma termini. via nazionale is an ideal base for strolling around rome . we ate in est est est a 5 minute walk away in via genoa ,unfortunately people were queuing for to eat al fresco so we decided to dine indoors in the traditional italian restaurant and would recommend it for a basic italian meal.a stay in the hotel artemide was a perfect start to our holiday, and the 12.00 checkout allowed us a relaxed morning in rome before heading to civittavechia to catch our cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sse1209
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Artemide Hotel for a long weekend in October and we would return in a heartbeat. The Superior Room was spacious (for Europe) and the bathrooms modern beautiful. The front desk was always helpful in making dinner reservations or locating a car service. We had breakfast in the hotel every day which we enjoyed immensely. The best aspect of this hotel was the beautiful rooftop bar and lounge, which we took advantage of every afternoon. The panoramic views of St. Peter's were the perfect backdrop to recharge with a lovely drink while we made evening plans. Really lovely little hotel and we will be staying again when we return with our children to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location Awesome, Breakfast Good, Staff Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: need2trvl
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to train station. Our room has a private terrace that really made our stay much more pleasureable. European size room and bathroom=meaning space is a premium. Room was quiet. Wetbar is complimentary nice to have that service. Breakfast has good choices. Paolo the night man and most likely in charge of your reservation was outstanding in assisting us in changing our reservations to move up our arrival stay. Paolo was so good he would anticipate our requests for wake up calls. Only hotel (one of 5) in Italy to have WIfi in our room and it was free. Great hotel for Rome. Note: Upon check in the staff will recommend Ciao Roma, a tour bus service. Do not take this recommendation. Ciao Roma does not run buses every half hour like thvey state. On Trip Advisor Ciao Rome has very poor scores and do not rate an good or excellent. This hotel does itself a disservice recommending this copany.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only had 1 night in Rome. The staff here was very friendly & helpful. The rooms were very clean. The roof top bar is nice & we appreciated the free Prosecco. They packed the mini bar with munchies/ drinks & it was free! We had to get up early for our flight the next day & miss the hotel breakfast. When we checked out, they made us a big to-go breakfast bag - so thoughtful. The location is great too. If we ever go back to Rome, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “1000 Tripadvisor reviewers are not wrong”
Reviews.Author: BobandGina
Reviews.Content: Great hotel inside Rome. Everything good: welcome; breakfasts; free wi-fi; LOCATION. Can walk here from Termini station, and can walk to every sight in town. Comfortable, clean, nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Hiromi C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, traveled from Naples, Italy by train. Train station, Termini station, was not far from the hotels by taxi (be careful with taxi who can rip you off even thought such a short distance). Most of sights except Vatican city are walking distance (some streets are hilly but manageable). If you want to take a train (Metro) which is 5 minutes by foot and bus stop is about 7 minutes by foot. Location is perfect for most of sights. Breakfast which I was not impressed by since hotel in Naples was much better. If you are expecting a good cup of coffee or strong coffee, you will not get it in this hotel. Breakfast starts from 7am which is kind of late if you have to leave for guided tour. We had 8 o'clock guided tour at Vatican city & we were able to stop by breakfast room to grab some fruits and pastries. They even gave me a small cup of coffee to go. We had 9:15am flight back to Los Angeles, CA and car service needed to pick us up about 5:00am. About 5am, door bell rang and there was a hotel staff who gave me a breakfast box for both of us to take with us. I was not expected anything breakfast but it was very nice suggestion and great service. Hotels is located in very busy, main street, but I requested to have a quite room which what we got. We did not hear any noise from street at all. I heard air conditioner's noise since it was warm days during our visit. Bathroom was large enough for European standard. Bath tab was nice to have to soak in legs and feet from walking a lot in hilly Rome streets. Every staffs in this hotel were very nice and helpful. Alessandro, who was very helpful to recommend us places to eat. We enjoyed all of his recommended restaurants. We heavily relied on restaurants information from Rick Steven's guide book but found it out some info. are not correct. Local information is better and most current. We went 2 times in the same places Alessandro recommended because it was so good. We enjoyed food, wine, and lemoncello. Around the hotel, there are some good places but we end up eating out places were not close to hotel. We got a great service by friendly staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week as part of our European honeymoon and were very impressed. The hotel location was fantastic and is a few minutes walk from the Rome Termini train station (or even less from the Repubblica tube station). It is on via Nazionale, which is a busy street so don't expect total silence if you get a room with a street view. On arrival we were warmly welcomed and checked in very early, about 11am. We also were welcomed with a bottle of wine in our room which was a nice touch. The location also provides easy access to all of the major attractions either by walking or using the buses that stop just down from the hotel. There is also a pharmacy across the road if you need anything and fruit stands just around the corner for any late night cravings. The free minibar is very useful (as others have mentioned it is water, soft drink and beer) for water bottles for daily outings (although the fountains in Rome have the best water to top them up with) and it is nice not to have to worry about additional charges at the hotel. In the bathroom you will find conditioner which is very rare for Europe and Italy in general! The bathroom was big and had probably the largest range of products I've seen in a hotel. The rooftop bar and garden is a great place to go and relax. It is also very good value for money, we had a few drinks and the sliced meat platter and being 'foodies' didn't expect too much from a hotel, however, we were pleasantly surprised and it was a big serving and great quality and value for 10 euro. The room was very clean - and if you stay there make sure you look under the bed! (Spoiler alert: there is a little card under the bed saying they make sure they check everywhere!) Each day the cleaner personally leaves a card with their name and the two we met were both lovely and friendly and seemed to really enjoy their jobs which is in contrast to some of the other hotels we have stayed in. The breakfast has a really wide choice and the double espresso's kept coming! Good products and everything was fresh and tasty. On their website, the hotel say you receive 'complimentary smiles'. This doesn't sum up the hospitality you receive in this place. All of the staff, without exception, were lovely, friendly, helpful and genuinely did everything to make our stay as great as possible. Particularly one of the doormen who was really a great laugh and extra helpful! The only negative, which has nothing to do with the hotel at all, is that is not in the best spot for some of the better restaurants in Rome, but they are only a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SmartieBanchory
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a 5 night stay based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Location was great - within walking distance of all the major sights. Family room was a good size, beds were comfortable. Free wifi and mini bar were nice. Breakfast very good. Couldn't ask for any more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LionaAberdeen
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - perfect for our holiday in Rome. Location is spectacular with most sights in easily walkable distance. The family room we had was great - really spacious and a separate area for the children which was great! The jacuzzi in the bath was welcome after a long day's sightseeing! The rooftop bar was a must every either for a wind-down beer or a pre dinner prosecco. Our room was on the road side, but the fabulous view more than compensated for the slight traffic noise. Plus - fantastic location for shopping! Ladies can venture out and spend more than you can imagine in a very small amount of time while the boys chillax in front of the TV! Breakfast was fantastic - so much choice that just added to the ever expanding waistlines! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AmyLou1993
Reviews.Content: Me and my family decided to visit Rome this summer so we stayed here! It's located very close to the main train and bus station on the Via Nazionale, a main road in Rome - beware as it's extremely busy and the way they drive in Rome is crazy! Via Nazionale is full of shops and restaurants and most importantly for me, it's within walking distance of most sites in Rome. Me and the family walked everywhere except to the Vatican (we went on the underground which is really easy to use since there's only two lines) and to the Piazza Navona (we got a bus). The hotel itself is lovely, clean and cool (which is very important when you're visiting in summer :P). A lovely member of staff took our bags up to the room for us and showed us how to use everything in our rooms, like slotting in the card to activate the air-con. The rooms were nice and comfy with free mini-bars (I find this is quite a rarity in European hotels as everyone I've been in so far has charged me for everything, even bottled water) and a lot of free soaps/body lotions etc. I had a problem with the kettle in my room but it was solved immediately by a staff member, who was really helpful and friendly. :) The food at Hotel Artemide was excellent - we never stayed in to eat as there were so many great restaurants nearby, but the breakfast was fabulous (especially italian bread with the scrambled eggs!) and occasionally me and the family would come back after a long days sight seeing and sit on the roof-top bar and order some drinks with a sandwich platter which came very quickly with a free bowl of crisps. Great service! Overall, I highly recommend Hotel Artemide if you choose to visit Rome. :D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: CattleSpeed
Reviews.Content: This was an AMAZING Hotel and to sum it up, I have nothing negative to say. The hotel was very near the train station and was also close to our tour bus stop not to mention a ‘healthy’ walking distance to the colosseum, which we stumbled onto on a night stroll on our first night. It was a whole is kept in good condition. The rooms were neat and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and kept clean (the hair dryer overheats and stops to cool after a while). The BONUS was the complementary mini-bar restocked daily with cool drinks, water and local beer all completely free. The daily breakfast had a large variety (I am a vegetarian and I was catered for) The staff was friendly and helpful, even when it came down to marking places on the map and advising on the intricacies of taking a train to other towns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Smatthews6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights here during our trip to Italy. This was our first stop and we were nervous about how the hotel was going to compare to a 4 star hotel in the US. We were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly and helped us during a transportation strike in Rome. The location is great. The rooftop bar is very chill and the drinks are strong. The free wireless worked better than any of the other 4 hotels that we stayed at in Italy. The also have a business center that we used to upload our photos to an external hard drive which helped save room on our camera. The FREE mini bar was a nice addition. The only downside was the shower was small and the bed wasn't as comfortable as some of the other Italian hotels but we walked and drank enough to put us asleep. If we venture back to Rome, we will stay here again, no question!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aimeezing1NYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for three nights recently and were very pleased by the property and lovely service we experienced. Staff helped with restaurant recommendations and reservations. We were upgraded to a junior suite (much appreciated since my husband is an early riser and I am a jet lag sufferer!) and the room was lovely and spotless and quiet, in spite of being right on via Nazionale. We stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews and because our usual hotel (just off the Pizza Narvonna) was fully booked. The free minibar is a great idea - costs very little to supply water to guests yet it is a very welcome perk. Think that this has just become our new "usual" hotel in Rome. Whole heartedly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelingERnurses
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a visit to Rome and stayed for 3 nights at the Artemide Hotel. I can't say enough good about our stay there.The hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport, and staff were helpful in any way possible. The hotel is beautiful and in a very central location,close to many attractions,I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda B
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: KBSyd
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel was really lovely and in a good, safe location close to restaurants and shops, as well as key tourist locations. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious, plus the mini bar was free! The room was clean, modern and comfortable. It was slightly small but I believe that is what most hotels in Rome are like and we didn't need a lot of space anyway. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JessieandPaul
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We stayed at the Artemide in Rome for our honeymoon. We receieved a complimentry room upgrade, which was a lovely suprise! The hotel is in a perfect location, 15 mins walk from the Trivi fountain, 20 mins to the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine hill. The staff are so helpful and friendly!! They would reccomend great restaurants, days out, and book reservations for us. Nothing was too much trouble, they really went out of their way to help us. We had a fantastic time, and when we return to Rome we shall be staying at the Artemide again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our Honeymoon. The location was excellent- very central and within walking distance to a lot of the sights. The staff was nice and helpful, but the service was nothing special. The room was small, but it had a nice, updated bathroom. The bedroom itself could have used some updating, but the bed was fairly comfortable, and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip.”
Reviews.Author: Bollybat
Reviews.Content: Our stay here began a surprise trip for my husbands 50th birthday and I am so glad I booked it. Alassandro had arranged a car to collect us from the airport which is well worth doing. It is in a fantastic central location and everywhere is within walking distance, including Vatican City but allow an hour. I had booked the Honeymoon suite with its own roof terrace which was wonderful. Sitting late at night watching the bustle of Via Nazionale is great - look out for the Jazz player who sets up on the corner and plays great sax. The minibar is stocked with everything from prossecco to spirits to chocolate and restocked daily. The coffee maker in the rooms is great also. We ate in the restuarant twice, once as a gift from the hotel. The food and service were excellent. There are also some fab restuarants within a ten minute walk in the back streets behind the hotel. We left here to travel to Venice for a few days then came home from Venice on the Orient Express - the service in the Artemide was certainly of an equal standard. Staff without exception were helpful and cheerful and we look forward to returning on our next visit to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ellenandrob
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel to return to after a long day sightseeing. Complimentary minibar was a great touch too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous spot”
Reviews.Author: speechcindy
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Artemide is the best. They are friendly and extremely helpful. The room was lovely and very clean, the bed comfortable, the Mini-bar free and restocked each day, The hotel is located in a convenient spot for sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Solid with nice perks”
Reviews.Author: SteveVinDC
Reviews.Content: The good: Free minibar. No booze but the bottled water is key when you spend your days walking the hills of Rome in August. The rooftop patio. Good view of Rome and the Vatican. Great place for some vino. The location: not in the heart of Rome, but on a lively street with good shopping and close enough to everything that you can walk it. The bad: not much. Our room was smallish but not cramped. Breakfast was kind of weak.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to...Everything”
Reviews.Author: Ravin12
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. We had a a Double Superior room which was a bit larger than I had thought it was going to be based on prior experience with European hotels. The room (115) was beautifully appointed and had it's own terrace with a table and chairs. Located at the far end of the hall it was also very quiet. The bed was a little harder than I would have liked but big enough for my wife and I. The staff was great form the front desk to the folks working the breakfast room. Rooms were always cleaned and the mini bar restocked every day. Breakfast was very good with a decent selection and probably the best coffee in Rome. The location is selling point of this hotel. A couple of blocks from Termini and walking distance to main reasons you go to Rome - The Pantheon, The Colosseum/Forum/Palatine Hill, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and all the museums and galleries. The kicker was that on our way out to catch a car to the airport at 6:00AM they presented us with 2 bags of fruit and water and other items so we could have breakfast on the way to the airport. I've never heard of any hotel ever doing that. It was a very nice touch. Whatever hotel you decide on be sure to visit the Galleria Doria Pamphilj on Via del Corso. It is a private art gallery with works by Carracci, Caravaggio, Bernini and a most astounding portrait of Pope Innocent by Velazquez. Unlike some other galleries in Rome there are no crowds and you can really take your time and enjoy some real masterpieces.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide”
Reviews.Author: Jarno L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and service! Also in very good location for sightseeing and shopping

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a GEM!”
Reviews.Author: TNSunshine79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find, within walking distance to all of the major tourist attractions and on a major shopping street. The staff is very courteous and helpful; we were assisted with our bags on arrival and departure, and provided with easy answers to suggestions for sightseeing and dining. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the bathrooms more than adequate, and the internet access is free. The price includes a wonderful breakfast buffet containing a good selection served in a beautiful dining room. There is a roof-top restaurant and an inside/outside lounge and bar where the service is congenial and the food good. Further amenities include a gym, a business room where three computers are available for guest use, and a very comfortable sitting area. We stayed in Rome, Venice and Milan on this trip and this hotel was, by far, the best and the least expensive. I would recommend it in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kinsie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the front desk gave us a free room upgrade, which is always nice. All the staff are very nice and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious, especially the washroom. The washroom was very clean and spacious with a jacuzzi tub.The windows look out onto the main road (Via Nazionale) but was well sound-proofed. The complementary mini bar was a nice touch since it meant we didn't need to get bottled water and such. The complementary breakfast was also a nice touch. It's also located in a central location close to the metro and train station. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wedding anniversary to remember”
Reviews.Author: VinnyCelino
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel in Rome, we were greeted by friendly and courteous staff, I had emailed them prior to our arrival and was pleasantly surprised to find they had upgraded us at no extra cost. The room itself was clean, comfortable, with champagne, flowers and strawberries prepared on the table - this was not expected but the small touches make all the difference between a good hotel and a great hotel. I cannot fault any aspect of our stay - the hotel itself is perfect and the staff make it exceptional. Grazie !

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: AngloAsian
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we booked this hotel based on earlier reviews. We certainly weren't disappointed, although our "Classic Room" was smaller than we'd expected. We had just enough room to move around the comfortable king size bed, but the bathroom was nearly as big so plenty space there. Furnishings and decor were good and everything was nice and clean. Our room was on the fourth floor and overlooked the main road (Via Nazionale) but we weren't troubled by traffic noise at all because of the effective double glazed windows. All the staff were friendly and helpful, so full marks to them. I'd mentioned in our booking that we were arriving on my wife's birthday; it was a nice surprise for her to find a birthday card and bottle of Chianti in our room. The "free" mini bar was a nice touch, although it didn't contain much of a selection: beer, cola, orangeade, water. Breakfast was very good, with a choice of fresh fruits, salads, pastries, cold meats, cheeses and nicely cooked eggs, sausages, mushrroms, bacon, etc. Slightly disappointing was having my coffe served in a large jug so by the time I poured my second cup it was going cold. At just over GBP700 for three nights in late September/early October we were hoping for something exceptional, but perhaps everywhere in Rome is this expensive, no matter what time of the year. Our flight back to the UK was in the evening and we were able to leave our cases at the hotel after the 12 noon check out. We were also able to use the gym shower to freshen up and change before final departure. The hotel offers a limo service to and from the airport at 40Euros that we booked for the return after having to pay 60Euros for the tatty cab ride from the airport. I'd read that the fare should be 30Euros but the cabby at the front of the line said that it was "on the meter". Not wanting to argue and with people queuing behind us I reluctantly agreed. For some reason our hotel limo didn't turn up when we left (probably because I only booked it 30 minutes beforehand!) so the receptionist hailed a cab and made sure we only paid 30Euros. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Artemide and loved Rome. There may be better value hotels, but we had no complaints so would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieSunderland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disapointed. The hotel is in an excellent position. our maid Betty kept our room spotless and the mini bar was a great perk. We found the breakfast spot on plenty choice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We will recommend this hotel to our family and friends and hopefully return again. Thank you to everyone at the Hotel Artemide

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: On our way through the magnificant City of Rome from the airport we passed by many of the city's incredible sights. When we turned onto Via Nationale on the beautiful the cobble stoned street we marveled at how old and anticient Rome was. So imagine our surprise when the cab stopped at the Artemide Hotel smack in the middle of a beautuful area. The doorman chearfully welcomed us and when we walked through the doors we felt like we were home. The desk manager was very nice and he gave us a couple of complimentary drink vouchers for the rooftop resturant. The bellcap led us to our room which was small but very clean and sunny. The bathroom was very well stocked with soaps, lotions, shoe cleaners and other essentials. The mini bar was also stocked with juices, waters, sodas, and local beer. It is all complimentary. The style of the hotel I would discribe as boutique. While I'm sure that there are much larger and more modern hotels in Rome, the Artimide Hotel makes up for it in service. Free wi -fi in every room and cable TV which did have a couple of English speaking channels. But I really enjoyed watching an old Peter Lorre and Sidney Greenstreet film dubbed in Italian. Fun. Our 4th Floor room offered no view other than an old wall of the next building 20 meters away but it was very sunny. We wasted no time in visiting the rooftop resturant and as the sun was beginning to set if offered up beautiful views of the Vatican routunda. After exploring the neighborhood a little and dining on some fantastic Italian food we decided to get some rest and sleep off our jet lag. The bed and linens were very clean and confortable. When we got up the next morning we discovered another fantastic aspect of the Artemide Hotel. When we upgraded our room to Superior the deal also included free breakfasts. In the states what they call a "continental breakfast" usually includes pastries, fruit, and coffee. The Artemide Hotel offered a very bountiful bufet breakfast that included everything one could wish for...eggs....bacon, wonderful breads, cheeses, meats, yogart, pancakes, Italian pastries, fruit..fresh juices, and coffee. What you didn't see you could ask for. Italians love their coffee and it was easy to see why, expresso, cappachino, and a pot of coffee all served with a nice small pitcher of steamed milk. It was always a wonderful start to our days in one of the world's most beautiful cities. The hotel is centrally located to most everything in Rome and is within walking distance to many of the main sites and good resturants and shopping, and just a short walk away from the central terminal. We will more certainly be back to Rome and when we do, we'll be staying at the Artemide Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tazz13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011. The rooms are obviously not five star, but comfortable, there was good AC, and a free minibar that was restocked. Location is right next to the underground station, and most sights can be reached by a short walk. The train from airport arrives a five minute walk away. The breakfast buffet was really good. The staff are friendly and all speak English. The only reason that it is not getting 5/5 is that the rooms were of a slightly lower quality than I had hoped for, but for the price they were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: WakefieldYorkie
Reviews.Content: As usual, read the reviews here to select this hotel for our 3 day trip. And they were all spot on! On a busy main road in Rome so easy to find and definitely within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions and historical sites - Trevi fountain is 10 minutes mostly downhill; the Coliseum 10/15 minutes downhill; Vatican City allow 30 minutes. We booked back in January and got a 50% reduction for 3 nights and well worth the money in an expensive city. Our room (105) faced into a yard so no view but it was large, at the end of the corridor and amazingly quiet. The bed was firm but comfortable and the minibar has been reviewed many times by others. Well stocked bathroom too. Cannot disagree with the reviews about breakfast choice and good entertainment watching the staff cope at busy times in their chaotic but courteous way. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Although the road - Via Nacionale - is busy with traffic and noise, once through the doors you are in an oasis of calm. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Oakville877
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights while on our first visit to Rome. The hotel has a great location on a main street with good shopping. Easy access to the local Metro subway within 5 minutes walking distance. The main Termini train terminal is then one more Metro stop away. You could walk to the train which takes about 15 minutes but taking the subway to the Replica stop is much closer. The main tourist sites with the exception of the Vatican are all within 15 to 20 minutes walking distance. The hotel is very clean with nice rooms. My wife and I were very impressed with all of the staff, from the front desk to the bellboys. They were very helpful and obliging, it was very welcoming. We had a very early flight to Venice and the hotel arranged their driver to take us to the airport for a very reasonable price. There is a roof top bar and restarant which we took advantage of after a long day of sightseeing. The breakfast room was very nice with a wide variety of fresh fruit, cereals and some hot items. For me a good breakfast it important. Overall we had a great time and I definitely would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great 40th birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: gossemar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of |September and loved it here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My boyfriend had lost his suitcase at the airport and the reception staff were very kind and would ring up the airport daily to see if there was any sign of it. They never refused to do anything we asked of them and they even made a few phone calls without being asked to. We couldnt recommend this hotel enough. Ok the room we had wasnt very big but then when your in rome you dont spend much time in the hotel! the free mini bar was very much appreciated and we made full use of it every day. There was a lovely roof top terrace which was very relaxing away from the hustle and madness of the street below. Alessandro and Pino in particular were extremely helpful. The location of the hotel was good with everything close by. We caught a taxi to the Vatican for an early morning walking tour and this only cost 9 euros there and a little more to return back to the hotel. Will def be returning to this hotel and i hope i dont have to wait too long either!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Service, and a Good Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: SalishSea101
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hotel Artemide showed this hotel to be everything we needed to start off a great visit to Rome. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The room was clean and of good quality. We particularly appreciated the ability to access the internet using a keyboard provided in the room. The offer of a prosecco on the roof terrace and free treats from the mini bar were nice touches. Breakfast was a generous continental spread with the addition of eggs and Italian sausage. Service at breakfast ranged from excellent to haphazard, depending how busy the breakfast room became. The location of Hotel Artemide on Via Nazionale was convenient enough to allow for access to many of Rome's attractions, and right around the corner from le Quattro Fontane and Bernini's great little church of San Carlo. We managed our pilgrimage from the hotel to the Trevi Fountain, which was a good hike. Most other attractions would not have been within easy walking distance, but we made use of public transit to get around as the hotel was only a few blocks from Piazza della Repubblica with its Metro station and Via Nazionale is on a couple of useful bus routes. The one drawback to our room was a bed that was very firm, something we found to be common in the hotels we stayed in. Other guests submitting reviews obviously found the beds comfortable so this is a matter of personal preference. Overall an excellent experience and I would recommend this hotel to someone looking for a good quality hotel in a reasonably convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calltest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Artemide and we really loved it. The rooms are spacious and clean. Staff is very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was fine with something for everyone. We also enjoyed the rooftop restaurant with its good food and a nice panarama of Rome. Trip Advisor was right on the mark with this hotel. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Polargirl151
Reviews.Content: Three adult ladies stayed at this hotel Sept. 12 - Sept 15, 2011. We couldn't have asked for more. We shared a room on the 6th floor and we had more than enough space. The beds were comfortable. The mini refrigerator in the room is free and stocked daily with juice, beer, water an snacks. The breakfast buffet was absolutely abundant! Anyone who has any complaints about the buffet didn't eat here! Everything was super fresh and the variety of items to pick from was huge. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was centrally located and we used the subway, buses and taxis. We all agree that we will return and stay at Artemide hotel!! Great choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great HOTEL & Service”
Reviews.Author: love_food415
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Artemide Hotel Rome for 3 days with my sisters and we had really relaxing time there! They upgraded our room to a Junior suite for free! Plus they gave us a free drink coupon for the lounge at 7 floor where you can get nice breeze. The room was very spacious and clean. And beds were very comfortable. Some rooms are facing to the noisy street so if you are sensitive to noise, request a room not facing to the street. Peoples working at this Hotel are Really helpful and friendly. They will arrange a VIP taxi (Mercedes Benz) to FIUMICINO air port from the hotel and the price is 45 Euro which is normal cab ride price. I highly recommend this hotel. We felt very safe and relaxed staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for English speaking tourists”
Reviews.Author: laminicooperman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Artemide for almost 5 days and loved it. From the complimentary drink on the romantic terrace bar to the excellent "American" style breakfast in the morning, this hotel was a godsend. The staff spoke very good English and they were all extremely helpful with directions, calling cab service and restaurant recommendations. The location is very good (short drive or not too bad walk to the Termini Station). The hotel is a short walk to the Republicca metro stop and only about 10-15 minutes from the Trevi Fountain. Only complaints (nothing major): the bed is a little hard but otherwise we slept very well, the temperature control for the water in the shower/tub was a bit difficult and the shower did leak water onto the floor, and the storage space for clothes is limited. Pluses include the free minibar snacks and drinks, the free breakfast and the very nice and interesting guests we met each night (like Julian and Helen from England!). Highly recommended if you can swing the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff & Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stardust80
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome in August 2011, with my husband. We stayed at the Artemide Hotel for 4 days and had an amazing time. The staff was friendly and very helpful! The mini bar was more than adequate and FREE! The location was incredible, we literally walked everyone, however the subway is close by and easy to use as well. We traveled around Italy after our stay here and the main train station was also within walking distance. I have friends in Rome that we met up with and I was pleased to hear that when they found out what hotel we were staying in, they told us we made a great location choice! When we arrived we received free welcome drinks up on the terrace which was beautiful and I highly recommend doing this if you stay here. We actually went back to the Artemide at the end of our trip because we had left something there and again the staff was incredible, even though we didn't stay that night they helped us to get a cab to the airport and even stored our luggage for us for a couple of hours. This was the best hotel that we stayed in throughout our 2 week Italian vacation and I highly recommend it! When I go back to Rome this will be where I stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: cedars52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise in August 2011. Check-in was quick and efficient after a 10 hour flilght even though we arrived in the morning. The room which overlooked the street was large and modern with lots of space for luggage. Despite being on a busy street I did not have a problem with street noise. It was convienient to many attractions. Staff were professional and helpful. Breakfast exceeded expections. The bed and pillows were again top notch. We had emailed the hotel that we were celebrating our 25th and within 1/2 hour of check in a lovely bottle of wine and card appeared. Thank you- toop notch! The only reason I did not give it a 5 was that the bathroom though lovely, large and modern was lacking any place to place your cosmetics and creams etc. Thank you for a lovely time and if we are ever back we will stay with you again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Termini”
Reviews.Author: jbailey25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with excellent service and very quiet rooms. The breakfast was very good, with excellent coffee and cappuccino. Our rate included our breakfast. We had very good pizza across the street and up a few yards. The hotel arranged transportation to the airport for E45, a Mercedes with a super driver. You can walk to many interesting sites, but we recommend a good map, as the free one provided at the desk can be really confusing and it's easy to lose your way. We didn't read the instructions for the in-room safe, thinking it would be like all the others - it is different! Be sure to read before you lock it up.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: LZeisloft
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this perfectly located hotel for five days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The staff were very courteous and tried to anticipate every need. The hotel is located in the perfect spot far sightseeing with transportation very close. The room was very comfortable with enough space to spread out a little, air conditioning that provided relief after a long day, a nicely stocked minibar and a rooftop terrace that was a nice place to unwind after a long day. We had breakfast and a few dinners in the hotel and enjoyed both as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DocMcL
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in September with another couple and even though we had read reviews on TripAdvisor, we didn't expect the level of service that was provided by the staff. Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly offering advice on restaurants, tours (great Vatican tour guide) and good shopping areas! The rooms were lovely and the free mini bar (restocked daily) and free wifi were incredibly convenient and generally unheard of in most hotels. We also loved the roof top restaurant bar. Location was great and within walking distance of most main attractions (Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Colosseum) and restaurants weren't far away. All in all, our experience was almost faultless and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulpearson56
Reviews.Content: Arrived early so expected to wait for the room, not the case. The room was ready, the reception staff were very helpfull at all times, they explained everything about the hotel and gave us a voucher to use in the roof top cafe. The room was of a high standard with a FREE mini bar which was filled everyday. We had out free drink in the bar and we purchased a lite bite. All was just excellent. The Hotel his within easy reach of the various sights, with the bus and Metro stops just a few minutes walk away. Remember as with any City please watch out for pick pockets, we knew of two crimes whilst we had our little break, but don;t let that put you off, Rome is a beautiful City and if you stay at the Arimide you won;t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Jormakka
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near everything. Buses just next from door, subway 200m and most attractions in walking distance. Breakfast like in nordic hotels, dinner is next you need after that. Excelent service with transportation to airport. The staff was friendly an helpful. Airconditioning in rooms!

Reviews.Title: “"Good" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris074
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. I can sum up the hotel as "Good" - everything about it is "good" - not great, and that is exactly what you need in Rome, because let's face it - you are in ROME and should only be sleeping in the hotel - the rest of the time you should be out seeing things! Clean; Good service; central location close to the station. It met our requirements exactly.

Reviews.Title: “Ten days at the Artimede by a very fussy traveller”
Reviews.Author: limousin
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review whilst still staying in the hotel. We were picked up from the airport by the hotel car (60 euros) with no problems. We have been here for five days so far with five more days to go and I am very impressed with the level of service, cleanliness and food at this hotel. Nothing seems too much trouble for the staff. Every request we have made from wanting extra pillows, hangers and a problem with the WIFI has been dealt with within minutes of the request. I had emailed the hotel in advance of coming to ask for a walk on terrace for our superior room and a room away from the lift at the back of the hotel which does not have a view. Thank you to other tripadvisor reviewers for giving us this tip. On arrival we were warmly greeted and told that we had a room on the 6th floor with a walk on terrace and away from the lift - that is very good service. The room is a decent size and well furnished with a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival. The wall between us and the next door room is padded so I assume it is sound proofed. Is is very quiet in room 624. The furniture is in excellent condition. All the usual toiletries, slippers, bathrobes, tea and coffee (with biscuits and nuts on a tray) are in the room not to mention the free drinks in the fridge which are topped up daily. The bed is extremely comfortable (king size) with good pillows and the sheets are changed every other day. The bathroom is a good size with a full size bath with a shower and also a hand shower. The towels are changed daily. I must compliment Alina the room maid on her excellent cleaning of our room with lots of extra little touches. Please be aware that if you are in your room then the afternoon maid will not come in to tidy your room and leave sweets as they are forbidden to enter the room if you are in. Breakfast is excellent with a great buffet - please note that you can order omlette, fried or poached eggs at no extra cost if you prefer. I must commend Admir, Lara and Pasquale the head waiter for their attention to detail in the breakfast room. The food on the 7th floor terrace restaurant is excellent as is the italian coffee! The prices are very reasonable. Reception staff are amazing and have many suggestions for trips and can seem to arrange absolutely anything you want to do. I cannot single out one in particular as they are all so good. They organised tickets to La Traviata at the Salon Marguerita which was excellent. If you do not want to go to a full opera then the episcopalian church next door to the hotel holds opera aria evenings at various times. I would recommend this hotel. It is not the usual seaside luxury large chain hotel and does not have a pool. It is an excellent city centre hotel very close to all the attractions. Beware of buying drinks and food at restaurants close by to the main tourist sites - their prices are very high. Walk a little way down a side street and the price for a cold drink is half the amount.

Reviews.Title: “5 Days in September”
Reviews.Author: BobMerc
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel before our trip and was not disappointed.I booked well in advance and got what I considered a very good price. An excellent hotel, spotlessly clean and in a very good location. The furnishings and decor was lovely. The rooms was good and the free mini bar appreciated. The staff are excellent and the buffet breakfast was extremely good. The bottle of wine on my wife's birthday was a nice touch. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for family while visiting Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Aldo D
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 teenage children stayed here on our 4 day tour of Rome. We had a family room with a sliding divider to make two rooms for the 4 of us. Great location in downtown Rome as a base to tour the city with the subway in walking distance. Great inclusive breakfast and the wifi was free. Clean, safe hotel and a friendly staff always available for questions and recommendations. A secure parking garage was just around the corner and driving back to the airport from there was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Sightseen in rome.”
Reviews.Author: tulip24_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 11.30 which was long before check in but they not only checked us in but upgraded our room many thanks! We really enjoyed our stay this hotel is very central for getting to all the wonderful sights. All the staff were so friendly and helpful many thanks especially to Alessandro on reception who answered so many questions for us (and we asked a lot) Also to Vasile who helped us print our tickets for going home. Room was immaculate and free mini-bar great. Would reccomend to friends and hopefully will be back many thanks. Galway Ireland guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie a
Reviews.Content: Great location - shopping right outside the front door, walking distance to Coliseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, many shops and restaurants. Free minibar is a nice perk, breakfast was fresh and delicious! Spacious rooms. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshirePacker
Reviews.Content: An excellent base to visit the great city and sights of Rome. Good location, not far from Termini station. Staff very helpful, hotel extremely clean, room very quiet (despite being on a busy road), food at breakfast good. Free mini-bar great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location near the Termini”
Reviews.Author: 150Riverview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 5 nights last week and loved it. Having arrived by train through Termini we found it easily and it was a short walk pulling our suitcases. It is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and Colleseum from here as well as many other attractions. We loved the room and the amenity that we like the best was "FREE INTERNET" for our entire stay. We did not eat the breakfast , $14/E each , was not in our price range but Flanns Irish Pub on the corner offered breakfast . The staff was wonderful, very polite and professional and arranged our taxi (Mercedes Benz Black Car) to FOC on our departure day and it was wonderful. It is on a bus line on Via Nazionale but we walked everywhere. The only drawback was that the elevator ran a bit slow, but the stairs are right there for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KitchenerWelshguy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Italy. Our first stop was the Hotel Artemide. This is a great place, and we heartily recommend it. It got off to a good start, because the upgraded us from the `classic` room to the `superior` room, which was spacious and comfortable ...surprising for a European hotel.The staff were friendly, efficient, and speak just about any language their clients speak. That was a bit disappointing. I was hoping to practice my Italian, but the entire staff seemed fluent in English. I got lost of chances to practice later in our trip. The all-you-can eat buffet breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, had HUGE variety, and was excellent. I defy anyone not to find something they like. Everything from bacon and scrambled eggs to fruit, yogurt, cheese, sliced meats, a variety of breads, sweets .... you name it. Oh, and great coffee. The hotel has a wonderful roof-top terrace/bar/restaurant where we usually ended our day. The service was exceptional, and they offered a variety of antipasto-style dishes as well as classic Roman main courses. Both were delicious. Good assortments of wine, beers, mixed drinks, and liquors as well. Speaking of which ... free mini bar in the room. Location wise, the hotel is close to many attractions without being so congested on the street you can`t move. If you like to walk ...which we all did in our party.... you can get to the Trevi fountain, Forum, Coliseum, etc. etc., in less than an hour (we could have made better time, but it was HOT while we were in Rome, so we were more inclined to stroll slowly). Good restaurants are all over the place near the hotel. They are also near the main train and bus stations as well as the metro. Two minor nits. The hotel elevator is VERY small. A maximum of four people, or two people with luggage. Also, the room we staid in had no view ...basically a wall. The last was no big deal. If we wanted a view we would go up to the terrace. Price was very reasonable for Rome. Next trip, we are definitely staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to base yourself in, for a sightseeing trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vanessacmc
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an ultra luxurious hotel to be pampered and treated then this isn't the place for you. However If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Rome, with good staff and service, then I would recommend staying here. Some of the plus points... Breakfast is included, good selection of food for all tastes. Free minibar in the room, which gets restocked daily. We must have saved a good few euros by taking the water with us every day rather than buying it! Free Internet Complimentary drink on the rooftop bar, which was a nice way to start an evening before we went out for dinner. Very nice staff. The day we picked up our hire car (which was the biggest hassle ever), we drove back to the hotel to pick up the luggage. The hire car people, even though they were around the corner, didn't tell us it was a controlled zone and that if you don't register your vehicle you have to pay a fine! The hotel very kindly told us this and registered our car, so we wouldn't be fined! Reasonable location. Not near the Vatican, but plenty of buses and metros nearby. Very good for the colosseum, palatine, roman forum etc. Even the pantheon is only about 15mins walk. So not too far! A couple of negative points The rooms are on the small side. However you don't really come to Rome to stay in your hotel room. So this wasn't a big issue. We did find the walls paper thin. The first night our neighbours were so noisy that we had to call down to reception and ask them to sort it (something I've never done before). The next few nights we had a couple with a crying baby, again we heard this loud and clear! If we came back to Rome for another sightseeing trip then i'd have no issues staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Glenn-fi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artemide for 7 nights at the start of September 2011. We chose it because of the reviews on Trip Advisor praising the quality of finish and staff with the bonus of the complimentary mini bar. All was as described, the staff were at all times prompt and pleasant in answer to our requests and queries and our room was quiet and spotless. The hotel was on a good bus route, albeit the 64 was packed most of the time, but made getting about easy and speedy. We used it to get to the Vatican for the excellent tour (book with the Vatican, you get a great explanation of the Sistine Chapel by their guide before you go in, as there is no talking inside) and Trastevere which we visited on a couple of evenings for the great bars and restaurants. The metro was less than 5 minutes walk - another bonus. There is also a great osteria around the corner called 'Rizzi's? also known as Est est est, with great wine and food and plenty of character. The complimentary arrival drink on the roof bar was a lovely touch with a view of a belltower. The breakfasts were varied and gave plenty of choice for all nationalities and set us up for a full day of sightseeing. All in all we would highly recommend the hotel and would happily stay again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel: Location, Room...”
Reviews.Author: Hibiscus99
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at this hotel and had a great stay. We were upgraded to a superior room (not sure what that means) and it was roomy and clean. My only complaint was it smelled of cigarette smoke for the first few days. The room had a large bathroom (with bidet) and a king bed with a very, very firm mattress. The pillows were a bit on the thin side for my liking but there is an extra one in the closet. Like other guests, we received a voucher upon check-in for a free glass of prosecco on the roof-top terrace (which is very nice). We went back to the terrace at sunset a few nights for the great view. We did not eat there as it was very expensive and there is a ton of great food in the area. The breakfast is great. Lots of variety. Fresh, quality food. Coffee and / or espresso-based drinks are included in the price. The danger is to not eat too much! The toiletries, much heralded by other guests, are a nice touch. They look great and were replenished daily, as were our towels. Like many hotels you have to enter your key in a slot just inside the door to power the lights and the indicator outside your door that says if you are in your room or not. The good thing is this device does not control the air conditioning, so your room will be nice and cool when you get back from a long, hot day of walking. There are three elevators on the property. They are small and slow, but effective. The in-room TV was fine. A fairly new flat screen with good reception and sound. The staff is very friendly, helpful and all speak English - no complaints here. Our room was made promptly daily (sometimes before we returned from breakfast). For those arriving from the airport, the hotel has a private shuttle that is €45. This works out to be able €5 less than a taxi. You might want to arrange to take it if ou can. All-in-all a very good stay in a very accessible location. My complaints are small and I think you can do better or comparable for the price (our stay was €1,400). Next time I think we'll rent an apartment. NOTES: WI-FI: Ask for a code for each device you have that requires a connection. These are available at no extra charge and are necessary as the codes cannot be shared amongst devices. We had three devices and needed three unique codes. Wi-FI #2: The wi-fi is very good! We found that we could stream video and download movies from iTunes with no problem at all. You'll want to bring a tablet or a laptop (see tour note below) Iron: Bring you own. As with most hotels (I gather) in Rome, irons are not available at all. Anything you need ironed has to be sent to their ironing service and it's not cheap! Irons, however are. We bought a little travel one around the corner for €16 and it paid for itself many times over. Promoted Tours: The hotel will give you a pamphlet at check-in recommending a few tours. Be smart and do some research on any you might be interested in. We found that many of them have exceptionally low scores and you might want to avoid them (like we did).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristin-tom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Artemide in May 2011, as Rome was the first destination for our honeymoon. The front desk staff was very friendly, accommodating, and helpful. They spoke English very well, and were prompt in their service. Prior to arrival, I emailed the hotel regarding transportation to the hotel, and they were very responsive. The hotel itself is beautiful, and decorated nicely. The rooms were clean, the mini bar was refreshed daily with no charge, and the bathrooms were decorated really nice. You can smell sulfur from the water in the bathroom...but that's something that may be unavoidable in such an old city. The breakfast buffet was HUGE! There were pastries, eggs, potatoes, small salad bar, fruit bar, and lots of juices to choose from. The cappuccinos were excellent also. We found the location of the hotel to be ideal. It was on a busy street with cafes and shopping. There is also a super market across the street that we bought snacks, wine and water (much cheaper than purchasing from street vendors) We decided to have a picnic in the park near Villa Medici, and the hotel lent us a wine bottle opener, napkins and such. We were able to walk to every site we wanted to see within the city from the hotel. The longest walk was probably to the Vatican, but there is a train station very close by the hotel, so you can take that if you don't want to walk. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never!”
Reviews.Author: RusLadyLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome in April 2010, during Easter holiday. The first impression was very nice as the hotel is stylishly decorated and we got tickets for a welcome drink from the reception, very sweet. We chose to have coffee (a perfect one!) in the hotel bar next to the lobby. The location of the hotel is very good - Colosseo, Trevi fountain, Palazzo Barberini and Palazzo Venezia are all within walking distance. We took a taxi to Vatican, of course, but Rome is a huge city, you just can't have everything round the corner. We travelled with the kids so had 2 rooms, not connected, but on the same floor. Rooms are not very spacious, however when in Rome you don't spend much time in the hotel. We usually came back at about 5-6pm, had a little rest and then went for dinner outside. Breakfast here is pretty good, but I wouldn't say so about dinner. We had it there on the very first evening being exhausted after a long day, it was OK however slightly overpriced and basic, nothing to write home about. Since that we went to different place every night, most of them recommended by the hotel staff, and really enjoyed our meals there. One day we wanted to try the Roman specialty "coda alla vaccinara" which is a slowly braised oxtail, and the receptionist booked us into a tiny Italian eatery somewhere in Trastevere. The food there was truly yummy! The other day we had a problem with a taxi driver who was trying to deceive us. We had to pay 14 Euro for the ride when somehow he swapped 50 Euro we had given him with a 10 Euro note (perhaps he was a part time magician) and kept asking for more money. After 10 minute dispute I asked the hotel porter to sort the problem out, and he was very efficient, I must admit, the incident was solved within a second and we got our change back. But the worst happened when on the evening prior to our departure we got the news that the icelandic volcano had erupted. Our flight next day was cancelled, so we had to spend long hours on the hotel Internet trying to book train tickets for the way back, and we got the Internet access for free on the night, so we managed to book everything we needed. I am very grateful to the hotel staff, they did their best and came in handy every time we needed them. It's been more than a year since our visit however I keep thinking about the hotel. When we go to Rome next time I'm pretty sure we are going to book Artemide again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with free minibar”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to public transportation. Free minibar was a huge perk and little touches like that make you remember a place. It was quite comfortable for our stay in Rome and having internet access was perfect for looking up restaurants and things to do. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Sweet bedtime hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennisaceColumbia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Location superb! Front desk offered umbrella not just to use but knowing we were leaving to go to another city to just take. Free drinks in room were awesome when drinks are so expensive throughout Italy. Snacks good. Very clean and comfortable room. I was so happy that I used Trip Advisor and this room delivers! Italy was fantastic and use trip advisor because whatever we did everything turned out great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and stellar breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Thierryslove
Reviews.Content: We sayed here in late August of 2011. The location, staff, hotel amenities were all excellent. The little perks they give (free minibar supplies and tea setup) were really appreciated after a long day of sight-seeing. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we have had all over Europe.

Reviews.Title: ““Charming and homey, very personal experience!””
Reviews.Author: gordonjoh1
Reviews.Content: The service was lovely, and the general feel of the place was so nice and laid back. We felt very at home there. It is right next door to a lovely cafe with tables outside and some basic sandwiches and stuff. The other advantage was that the bus stop was just across the street and so going to the center of town was really easy and comfortable. The neighborhood was peacefull and it is just far enough away to be able to feel close but without the noise.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: dhnBrazil
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with clean rooms, great location near the meain attractions. A good staff. Free mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: erindalian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon trip to Italy and France for 4 nights in August 2011. We got a great suite with a walk-out terrace. We were welcome with a bottle of wine and a congratulatory letter from the manager. The room was spacious, clean and modern. Our favourite part is that it is replenished daily with our favourite beverages and snacks without any extra costs!! The hotel was very clean, nicely designed and spacious. The breakfast was excellent (oh, the cappuccino was to die for!). We tried their roof-top restaurant twice - while the food is good, we thought the portion was too small and the waiters were a bit snooty. The front desk staff however, was friendly and helpful. It was our favourite place in Italy (in comparison to Venice and Florence, which are the two other places we went to). The hotel was located on a busy street with various shops ranging from high end brands to bargain brands as well as cafe and restaurants. It was walking distance to many landmarks and tourist sites. Despite the hustle and bustle, we felt safe and there was never a noise problem. The hotel is approximately 45 minutes to the airport so expect to pay around 45 euros in taxi fee. In sum, we highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things..”
Reviews.Author: Irish222
Reviews.Content: There is nothing really spectacular about this hotel. It's pretty average in looks and decor. What they do to make them stand out and make you want to come back is they treat you well. They have very clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff that make you feel welcome.. they give you a few free drinks and snacks each day in you room minibar.. they have free wifi...and they give you a hearty breakfast to get you started each day. It all helps..little things do make a difference. We ate in the rooftop restaurant one warm Rome evening and while the the atmosphere was very nice the food was very average. But everything else was above average in this average looking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: 5807tripper
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful - all advice was spot-on! Location great - convenient walk to all the important sights. Rooms a bit small and dowdy but very clean. Bathroom spacious and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Abby82_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on all the positive reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! We arrived on an early morning flight and the hotel stored our bags until the room was ready. Check-in was quick and we got the courtyard facing room we had previously requested in an e-mail. I would recommend this if you want a quiet room as Via Nazionale is quite a busy street. The room won't have any view but the sleep quality was the best I experienced in a big city hotel. In fact, the room was so quiet and the bed so comfortable, we overslept past breakfast time on the first morning. However, the hotel staff still served us a great breakfast. The free mini-bar was a great feature, was restocked daily with water, juices, beer and snacks. The selection of toiletries was above average and was also restocked daily. The hotel slippers were also a nice feature. Breakfast was definitely above average (e.g. selection of 8 different fruit juices). Wait staff were very attentive and always asked us if we wanted another cappuccino or needed anything else. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to all major sights. The subway is about a 5-minute walk and Termini about 10 minutes. This was convenient for us as we continued our trip via train. If you have a lot of luggage, I would recommend taking the subway to Termini. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Artemide and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: richman707
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Artemide and I believe we picked the best place to stay in Rome. A nice room, extensive free breakfast, free mini-bar - soft drings and beer restocked every day, a newspaper every morning, and a VERY helpful front desk staff. The staff called numerous restaurants for us (were the open during August vacation time?) and made reservations. Always with a smile!. They even reminded on restaurant of my wife's birthday. Also suggested and secured a private car to the airport for only 5 euros more than a taxi. All major sights were in 15 minutes walking distance and a subway stop/taxi stand was 2 blocks away. Termini train depot just a bit further but too far to walk with luggage. The price was reasonable (for Rome) and a significant discount is provided for stays over 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we have stayed at in rome”
Reviews.Author: kilsoj
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night after doing a cruise with royal caribbean. i have stayed many many times in rome, but this was the best hotel we have ever been to i the city. the room was spotless, and huge by standards in rome. on arrival the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, even upgrading us to a better room. the porter was brilliant, very very friendly and helpful. we have found the perfect hotel for us for our future visits, as the location is perfect too, easy walking distance to everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Bad food.”
Reviews.Author: AmaWW
Reviews.Content: Artemide Hotel was one of the hotels we stayed in Rome during our honeymoon. We booked 3 nights which included a free mini bar that was restocked every day and romantic dinner for two on our balcony and breakfast. The hotel is located right on a main shopping street, close to the train, and is quite close to everything. When we arrived at the hotel the staff was extremely friendly. The check in process was quick. For the romantic dinner, it was a 3 course dinner that my husband and I had to choose and for which date we wanted it. The bellmen brought us to our room and made sure we were happy with the room before leaving. The hotel knew we were on our honey moon and had a beautiful bouquet of flowers on the bed, a bottle of Champaign and fresh fruit in the room. We actually got a really great room on the top floor with its own personal balcony. The bathroom was large, and had a Jacuzzi tub. The whole suite was very clean. The balcony we had was very large. For the dinner on our balcony, we thought we would have to wait for the staff to come through our room. Next thing we know we had a phone call saying that food would be brought out to our balcony shortly. When we went out to our balcony the candles were all lit and set up. Staff has a separate entrance to the balcony. The setting and atmosphere was great. Unfortunately the food was not that great. The restaurant redeemed itself at breakfast, as the breakfast selection is quite large. For some reason my husband and I thought we would try them again for dinner. We ordered 2 pasta dishes and were quite disappointed. This hotel is excellent. The service is excellent. Unfortunately the restaurant needs a little work when it comes to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for 1st time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: psalmist3
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and it was a delight! We had a large kingsize bed in the room with a small twin/daybed conveniently situated. The mini refrigerator was stocked and was all available at no extra charge! The breakfast in the dining room had a good variety of hot and cold foods with excellent cappucino! It seemed like all the major sites were about a 15 to 20 minute walk from the hotel. We walked to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Pantheon, etc. By the end of our trip, we called taxis though because they are pretty inexpensive and our feet were wearing out! We arrived by train from Venice and were able to pull our suitcases to the hotel (the hardest part was crossing the cobblestone streets)! Make sure you see the HUGE McDonald's which is beautiful! Also there was a great lunch place a couple blocks out the door of the hotel and to the left - I think it was called the White Bar? It had a case full of yummy sandwiches, pizza and some great salads. This was a very expensive hotel but then again it seemed like they all are! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay All Too Brief”
Reviews.Author: hornytoad117
Reviews.Content: My wife, 17 year daughter and I stayed five nights at Hotel Atemidi and found it splendid and just fitting our needs and expectations. The staff was professional, friendly and accomodating.. All services were first-rate, the food in the restaurant quite good and the rooftop bar a casual and comfortable place after a day of exploring the Eternal City. Rome is not inexpensive, but the Artemidi is very good value. Its quiet and tasteful and well-located. Highly recommended.We hope to come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: rush2112
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Artemide at the end of August and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Getting there was so easy; just get the train from the airport to Termini station (14 Euros return) and it's a 15 minute walk to the hotel. We had booked a superior room for the additional space but the room we were allocated was a lot smaller than that stated on the website. We were told by the reception staff that there were a variety of superior rooms and the one we were allocated was smaller but had a balcony overlooking Via Nazionale. We told the reception staff that we were more concerned with having a larger room and I must say that they were very attentive and went out of their way to get our room changed, although this had to be done the following day due to the hotel being full. We knew from other reviews that the minibar was complimentary but the complimentary glass of Prosecco, evening meal voucher (including drinks) and bottle of wine in the room were really nice unexpected treats! The bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in when away on holiday and the room amenities were what you would expect from a 4 or 5 star hotel with a free safe, free WiFi, tea/ coffee making facilities with biscuits and complimentary toiletries. The only thing missing was a hotel information guide, which wasn't available through the TV either. Breakfast was very nice, with plenty on offer to keep everyone happy. The unlimited refills of cappuccino were great. The food on offer in the rooftop restaurant was of a good quality so if you're pressed for time or too tired to head out, it is well worth considering as an alternative. We'll have no hestitation in booking this hotel when we visit Rome in the future; the Trip Advisor reviews are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “A real four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlslb
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on all the excellent reviews from tripadvisor and paid top dollar for this hotel. It was easy to locate since we opted to take the train from the airport (14 euros p/p) to termini station to avoid traffic so we can go straight to sight-seeing since we only have three nights in Rome. The hotel isn't necessarily a central location to the most popular sights in Rome but certainly walkable and very close to the metro (if you opt to take the trains which come very frequently ~ 6 min). We walked everywhere just to explore but definitely bring comfy shoes - the cobble stones are tough on both feet & legs! Our room is quite small (the tiniest bathroom I've ever seen) but very nice and that's probably why they gave us complimentary breakfast for our entire stay which is very nice. We faced the back and was very quiet. Also, things are more expensive in Rome then some other EU cities. There are shops along Via Nazionale so you don't necessarily need to go to the Spanish steps for shopping unless you're shopping for designer wear but since we're from NYC, we have lots of those shops. Of note is that this hotel doesn't nickel and dime you. There's free wi-fi, the oft mentioned free minibars & vouchers for welcome drinks at the roof-top bar. We arrived before noon and they had a room ready for us which is a really nice touch to just drop off your luggage and freshen up. Overall, this hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: drkunk
