Reviews.Content: I am pleased to add my voice to those who have already written so many favorable things about the Hotel Artemide. Though having been to Rome only this once, I have nothing to compare to. However, I can hardly think I would stay anywhere else upon returning to Rome. Service and amenities were excellent, breakfast was likewise excellent, and the rooftop bar was a wonderful touch as well. Recommendations from hotel staff were quite good, and they tried very hard to be helpful. I am not necessarily in agreement that Artemide is "centrally located" as others have commented, and that may be the one small issue we had ... many attractions are not within easy walking distance. But the bellmen are happy to call taxis, and the Republica metro stop is quite close (we had no issues with the metro, other than its limited capabilities). Please know, of course, that you will be paying top dollar for this establishment, particularly these days with the weak dollar. However, it was certainly worth it, and it was a pleasure to come "home" each day and night to the Artemide after sightseeing, dining, enjoying Rome, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU DON'T STAY HERE YOU'RE A FOOL!”
Reviews.Author: pldippolito
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Italy. We stayed here and were totally blown away. The customer service is impeccable and go above and beyond what is needed without having to be asked. Months prior to our arrival I had a lot of questions and concerns about our trip in general since it was our first time to Italy. This hotel is in the PERFECT location! In walking distance of EVERYTHING in Rome (except the Vatican, 40 min walk). I was in constant contact with Alessandro who answered everything with detail and certainty. They arranged for a car to pick us up to and from the hotel, taxis to take us places at a moments notice, arrange dinner reservations every night, called to make sure restaurants were open for us, made sure we knew where we were going everyday, gave excellent dining tips, told us where to stay away from, kept checking up on our flight home (hurricane Irene). The hotel rooftop restaurant is DELICIOUS and should not be overlooked. This restaurant has some serious top notch cuisine for a good price tag! They even researched with us (for about 20minutes) how to get to and from the island of Ponza, because my girlfriend and I wanted to travel by ourselves one day instead of with a tour. Rooms were VERY clean and nice size. Free mini bar, buffet breakfast every morning was delicious as well! To everyone that helped us: Alessandro, Mario, Valentina, Paolo, Matteo & the bell staff, Thank you SO very much for making our first (of many) time(s) in Rome a memorable one and we WILL be staying with you again! ~ Paul from NY

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks at the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: william434
Reviews.Content: Checked out the Artemide on this web site. Saw the previous ratings and took a chance and booked it for two weeks in August. It was wonderful from start to finish. The staff responded to all the email queries & requests (airport car, site reservations, day trip, etc, etc) promptly and positively. We got there early and they had the room ready to go. The free mini-bar was great: Several waters, a couple beers, snacks, etc. All restocked every day! The American-style breakfast buffet was the best we had in our European travels. Fresh goodies every morning--and free--if you book the right size room. You can eat light with the fruits and breads or heavy with the eggs and meats, etc. Order up a paper every night--it is free! The drinks upstairs in the rooftop bar/lounge were great. More than two and it is nap time. It turned out that the hotel is in a great location. Train station is about three blocks away. We walked down to the Colosseum to see that sight. After the Forum, we walked back to the hotel. No problem. In addition, there are several other top-notch sights even closer than that to the hotel. There's several good restaurants close by. All in all, we had a great time at the Artemide. Everyone on the staff--front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping did a great job making our stay pleasant and enjoyable. We have done a bit of traveling and scour the web sites for ideas and we take reviews with a grain of salt. I know this gushing review makes things sound too good to be true, but we were pleasantly surprised to see that the reviews by others were right on the money. The Artemide surpassed all out expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms,”
Reviews.Author: DavidTahiti
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in this perfectly located hotel You are short walking distance from all the major attractions of the city (except Vatican and Villa Borghese) Very friendly and helpful staff, you receive a voucher for a drink at the rooftop bar when you arrive, very nice attention. Very good room, complementary drinks in the minibar (remains basic: water, beer, sodas and few snacks, but it's always nice to have it for free and refilled everyday) excellent bed, firm but not too much TV: hotel system is not very friendly, hard to get it working Breakfast is excellent, all you need is available... pastries are average but rest is very fine! A real 4* hotel and not completely overrated like most of the italian hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service at a centrally located hotel that caters to business traveler and tourists”
Reviews.Author: laura32846
Reviews.Content: Superb service. Great location. Very clean and comfortable rooms with relaxing rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Adam3434
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel and were impressed from the second We walked in. Staff was extremely friendly and gracious. We also happened to have been stranded in Rome due to the hurricane on the east coast and the staff did everything they could to assist. They got us in touch with the airlines as well as tried to search for other flight possibilities. Special thanks to Mario! Overall a great hotel, great location, great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Emjoyed our stay and would highly recommend to friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: Diane604
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience upon our arrival. The staff was friendly and the rooms are immaculately clean. Rooftop Terrace is a must see. My friend and I had dinner there on our last night and enjoyed our last official italian pasta dish. The prime hotel location is on a main street...costs 1 euro for the bus or metro. Special thanks to the staff... Giovanni, Paolo (Porter) and 'Super' Mario for helping me locate the Roma Jersey with Totti #10.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location for wife's 40th birthday in Rome, strongly recommend !”
Reviews.Author: guidedug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with young family in August 2011 as part of celebration for my wife's 40th. Excellent location on Via Nazionale in central Rome. Easy walking distance of major sights such as Trevi fountian , Spanish steps and Colosseum amongst others. Very handily placed for undeground , Repubblica, and main railway station. Very friendly and helpful staff always wiling to assist whenever they could. Room easily accomodated double bed, bed settee and baby cot . Good sound proofing means that street noise was no issue. Free mini bar stocked every day of stay and godsend of air conditioning helped us cool down after the heat of the city . Breakfast was self service buffet and a mixutre of continental and cooked food.There was plenty to eat with a good selection for kids . Very nice roof top terrace bar with distant view of St Peter's Basicilica gave great photo opportunity at sunset. We would certainly stay here if returning to Rome, excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Deborah178
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in Rome at the Hotel Artemide. Great location, close to Trevi Fountain, plenty of shops and trattorias close by. Rooms of good size (we stayed in superior room), plenty of bathroom amenities, free mini bar (re-stocked daily with water, soft drinks and beer), free wi-fi in room, tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was plentiful and included cereals, pastries, cheeses, ham, breads and also bacon, eggs etc. Every member of staff was cheerful and extremely helpful throughout our stay. The only slight niggle was the air conditioning, which never seemed to quite do the job properly! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon we will be back”
Reviews.Author: chippy40
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my nephew and his new wife as a wedding present, emailed the hotel before asking if I could have a bottle of wine put in there room, they e mailed me back straight away saying it would be their pleasure to do this free of charge and did I want to leave a message with it, which was really nice of them. They also gave them a room upgrade which was brilliant. These are excerts from e mails recieved from them after they came back ' they gave us a superior room which was huge and it had a big jacuzzi bath too and overlooked the main street, it was gorgeous, the mini bar was free too and was re stocked everyday which was great' and the roof top was amazing, we went for drinks there quite a bit as it was so lovely sitting on the couches drinking prosecco,we want to go back!.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved this hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Birgit1965
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our wedding anniversary. I chose this hotel because of its many excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. On arrival we received a complimentary drink and a bottle of wine in our room. The hotel was located 15 minutes walk from Vittoriano monument , 25 minutes from the Colosseum. We bought a Roma Pass at the airport which gave us unlimited travel on bus/metro/trains and discounts at various sights within de city. The air shuttle bus was not included but only cost 14 Euros return per person. The airport bus stop was a 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was spacious, very comfortable, clean and quiet. The free mini bar was an added bonus and so was the free wifi. Service at the front desk was fantastic and they were very helpful. We would definitely return to this lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PK_time
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and the comments by others were spot on. It's in a great location, only 15 minute walk from Rome Termini and walking distance to plenty of eateries. The room was very comfortable and housekeeping staff were very quick to tidy the room when we were out. The roof top bar was another highlight. Service from Renato, Emilio & Co. was first class. We would definitely stay here again, a very good hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Draxanoula
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value for money choice! Good location, very polite and smiley staff, rooms clean and quite spacious. The most strong point however was the incredibly rich breakfast, which was the best we have ever tasted, superior to what many luxury hotels offer in their buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: JMRDB
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at this hotel on our way out of Rome on the advice of a friend. We wished we had more time here. Our room was spacious, very comfortable, clean and quiet. Service at the front desk was fantastic and they were very helpful in organizing our travel to the airport. There was a lot of choice at breakfast (one of the first times we saw eggs and bacon in Italy). The location was good, but for our purposes not outstanding. One a main street near the train station proves very convenient for some travellers, depending on your purpose. We walk everywhere and the walk to many of our preferred destinations was quite far. But as i say this is very much dependent on your interests and purpose - the proximity to the train station is important for many travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect ending to three weeks in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: BBatts621
Reviews.Content: My family of four just returned from three wonderful nights at Hotel Artemide, staying in a family room. We have stayed in "family" rooms before, which can often consist of two beds pushed together in a single room. Our family room at Hotel Artemide had two distinct sleeping areas separated by a wall, which provided welcome space after a long day of touring. The breakfast buffet had a great selection of hot and cold choices to start the day, and the free minibar in our room was re-stocked daily. We found the staff to be most helpful and friendly. We will definitely return to Hotel Artemide the next time we visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Reasonable Location”
Reviews.Author: Tinkmuff
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor Reviews. Art deco hotel is good and very well cleaned. We had room 115 a triple room which was excellent for us as a family with one child and the room had a terrace. Free minibar and wifi excellent, as was breakfast. Had evening meal twice, in hotel, was pricey but no more so than the rest of Rome. Reasonable location for sightseeing - Colosseum and Trevi Fountain close - easy walk. Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Spanish Steps - medium walk. We used a taxi to get to St Peters at a cost of 10 euros but we wanted to get there when it opened at 7 am - used the metro back which was clean and efficient and only a couple of euros. All in all a good hotel to stay in - only thing lacking was room service. After sightseeing in Rome in the hot August sun it would have been nice to have the option of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Should be No. 1!”
Reviews.Author: SuperFurryAnimal
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our high expectations. We were in Rome for a birthday treat and to do some sightseeing. The hotel is perfectly placed to get around the city, just a few hundred yards from the termini if you need a bus or train and central enough to be able to walk to all the sights. A cold complimentary prosecco on the roof terrace was lovely after a hot day's sightseeing, (it was 36 degrees when we were there!). Our room was at the back which meant no view but it was lovely and quiet. There was no iron which I understand is the same for all Italian hotels (some silly safety regulations) but otherwise it was clean, comfy and well-equipped and we made full use of the free mini bar! The staff were fantastic, they organised our shopping trip out to the factory outlets of Castell Romano and fixed up a great driver to take us back to the airport so we didn't have to suffer another grumpy taxi driver. I can honestly say they laid on the best breakfast I've ever had in Italy, it was easily as good as one you'd get at a Fairmont on Intercontinental. Would love to go back, perhaps when it's a bit cooler!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable stay, great breakfast, fantastic location and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MinkenExperience
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked based on the highest number of reviews that satisfied our requirements. All we can say, it was the best, most comfortable, very clean, fantastic breakfast to satisfy every need, best service and guidance from staff. Outstanding! Couldn't agree with reviews more. The location was fantastic for shopping and getting around, very central and convenient for various sites. Very pleased and would definitely come back to the same spot. The only small issue we had was if you wanted to sleep in the morning ask for a room not close to the elevator, but we had to get up anyways so that wasn't an issue. As food is important to us I have some pictures of breakfast. Thank you so much for making our stay so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Sonia F
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last stop on our honeymoon and by that time, I was sick of planning and simply started at the top of the Trip Advisor list to pick a hotel. I think the reviews have been so great it actually made my expectations a little too high but the whole experience was still very good. We had mentioned we were on our honeymoon and I was expecting an upgrade no problem but we didn’t get one. When we got to our room it was pretty small and the window opened up to alley which really bothered me. I went back and asked for a different room, preferably one with a balcony. They said they had no open rooms that night but that they could move us the following day – which they did at no charge so I was happy! Even though the balcony faces the busy Via Nazionale, we had no issues with noise – and we really enjoyed the balcony. We had wine out there every night or just people watched from up high. One bit of warning though, the room was even smaller than the previous room we were in – I think the balcony took up a little room. As everyone mentions, there’s wine waiting for you and all the snacks and drinks in the mini bar are free which is nice. You also get a glass of champagne on the rooftop bar. The location is also great, as everyone has mentioned. A few block from the main train station, a couple blocks to the subway, and every single sight is within walking distance too. We even walked back from the Vatican one day – but my feet did hurt a little. My only teeny tiny complaint – which some may not even view as a complaint – was that the breakfast was very “Americanized.” After spending a week and half in Tuscany enjoying the amazing food – the breakfast here just didn’t cut it. But I saw many people enjoying the scrambled eggs!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and realy nice people”
Reviews.Author: Johan V
Reviews.Content: We had pre-booked a driver via the hotel and that went pretty smooth. Once arrived we got a nice upgrade to a junior suite without any surcharge, and that room was great. It gave us and our 9month old baby the space we needed. Maybe one small minor remark is the breakfast. The offer in sandwiches once the first big load of guests past, was somewhat dissapointing. Since dining out with the baby is challenging, we orded room service the first night, and this was realy good food! We are very satisfied guests, and are looking forward in having a next stay in this very nice hotel located closeby all the mean attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: thejessies
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled to Rome this August. I used tripadvisor to find our hotel. The Artemide had very good reviews , so I kept reading the up to date reviews which were always favourable.We booked for 4 nights and we were not disappointed. The hotel organised an airport pick-up service. The driver was waiting fro us when we landed. Our room was a superior triple, it was clean and quite spacious, we had a free mini bar which was re-stocked everyday and the room was very quiet. The hotel included breakfast in the price which was a buffet style, with plenty of choice.They even had Earl Grey tea! We could easily walk to all the places of interest, except the Vatican. We caught a bus from the Via Nazionale. It took about 15 minutes. The buses get very crowded, you have to buy your ticket from a tobacconist first, then once the bus arrives get on at the back of the bus and validate your ticket. There is a yellow machine in which to do this. You can be fined if the ticket is not stamped. We had an early flight to Crete and had to leave at 4.00am. The hotel organised the pick-up to the airport, The car was waiting for us when we came to check out. The bill was ready and a surprise, 3 little carrier bags with a take-away breakfast for us all. I would recommend the hotel to anyone coming to visit Rome. We had a wonderful stay and the Artemide was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dionne H
Reviews.Content: What can I say!!!!! We are two families traveling together and chose this hotel based on others comments! From the time we walked through the front doors of this hotel we felt thoroughly welcome! The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and spoke good English! The spiral staircase up to the rooms (or old fashion lift) were stunning and we were not disappointed when we opened the door to our room! Great location also. Would love to stay here again and would definately recommend to all. Extremely happy travellers!!! Aussie visitors

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ziggystardust69
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Artemide for 3 nights and could not fault the place. The location is excellent on the Via Nazionale, within walking distance to the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the fabulous Monumento Nazionale. The rooms were spacious, nicely decorated and the bathrooms clean. On arrival, you receive a welcome drink at the stylish cocktail bar and the staff are friendly and helpful. We enjoyed a few drink in the bar before we went out in the evening time. Breakfast is excellent, everything you might want, fruits, cereals, pastries, hot food etc. We had a wonderful time here and and definitely recommend the Artemide for an enjoyable stay in Rome. I'll definitely try my best to get back for another visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: travlinf00l
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at the Artemide in August, 2011. The hotel is in a great location - walking distance from Termini station as well as most of the major attractions in the city. There are several good trattorias in the neighborhood and none required reservations at any time. The hotel has offers a terrific breakfast, and has a nice rooftop bar for relaxing at the end of a long day of touring. The hotel staff was excellent as well and the property was maintained in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heymish
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Artemide Hotel. Our room was luxurious and very comfortable. We were sorry we only had 1 night at Artemide and in Rome. The roof top bar and restaurant was well worth the visit and a hiden gem with lovely views and friendly staff. We would definately stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected! The staff are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: 6West
Reviews.Content: Location is great for walking access from the train station and for all attractions. Check in at hotel was quick and friendly, we (and our luggage) were shown to our room and air conditioning controls, lighting, operating safe etc was explained well. Mini bar is stocked every day with fruit juice, soft drinks, water and beer. the room was kept clean with fresh linen and good sized bathroom with added extras like slippers. Had great first day of sightseeing but unfortunately had wallet pick pocketed whilst going back to hotel in the evening (don't use the 64 Termini bus!) Hotel reception (mainly Alessandro) was excellent and provided us with information and support (and map to the nearest Police station - where the Police officer there was also very helpful). Overall, we had a good visit to Rome and stayed in an excellent hotel. Recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: SARNIE66
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with superb, friendly staff. Return visit for us and will return again and again. Thank you Artemide and your fantastic staff!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to come back and relax in after a day sightseeing Roma!”
Reviews.Author: B P
Reviews.Content: Was a relaxing stay in Roma thanks to this hotel. There was three of us in the superior triple and was suprised how big the room was. Was a partition between king bed and separate queen size roll out bed which made it feel like a second area [almost]. Nice big bathroom, room very quiet and could control via A/C perfectly. All staff spoke good english and were very polite and always ready to assist. Free wi-fi was great and i think should be something all hotels take up. Breakfast was included and was very good. Scrambled eggs could have been fresher, however we did arrive at breakfast towards the end. They would make us cappacinos throughout the breakfast which was great. All staff very friendly and courteous. I would stay at this place again if I found myself in Roma based on this stay, also its in a good location for walking around and seeing the sights. Thanks for making our Roma stay a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: racar22
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Room rates are fair and you will get more room for your money than most nicer places in Rome. I think the location is not as good as most others have suggested. The hotel is in a busy and noisy commercial area that is less convenient to the sites than others in which we have stayed. Breakfast was superb, the staff response and helpful but the A/C was a little iffy in warm weather. I think this is an A+ commercial hotel but not necessarily an obvious choice for the tourist trade.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Monika S
Reviews.Content: When I first got to this hotel I fell in love the building itself is breath taking the staff was helpful i wish i could go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DSawyer16
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grandson and I stayed for two nights in the Artemide Hotel while we toured the city of Rome on our vacation. We found the location to be convenient for touring the city on foot or from a cab. Our rooms were beautiful and contained many free amenities--a real plus! The buffet breakfast was perfect. Your entire staff provided us with outstanding customer service during our stay. I highly recommend the Artemide Hotel to everyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, great location, with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Fahren F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my partner for his birthday, and booked for him to see the sights of Rome. After our nightmare traveling, because of the snow issues in the UK and cancellations, we were happy to touch down in Rome. The staff were amazing and so welcoming, and the chef Massimo put together a wonderful coconut cream birthday cake with candles and surprised us at breakfast with a bottle of champagne for free! Pasquale, the head manager was a lovely gentleman and we enjoyed his company. We stayed for 3 nights, and each morning they remembered what time we would go down and what I wanted for breakfast every day (e.g. poached eggs) im not fussy or anything like that, but I was so impressed that they put in this extra touch. Ive never seen such a pretty poached egg! :D The hotel is located on the Via Nazionale and is a brilliant location. Its only round the corner from the Metro which stops at all the sights including St Peters Basilica at the Vatican and you can just walk to the Colloseum. It really is a lovely hotel and they couldnt have made our stay more welcoming. My partner said it was the best hotel he had ever stayed in so I am glad that he enjoyed the stay and Rome. It couldnt have gone any better.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: hazzy424
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a junior suite. The room was excellent - Everything went so smoothly.The staff were very friendly.Hotel is near Termini and within walking distance to major attractions. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Rome, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveller3870
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Rome, 5min walk from repubblica metro station. Lots of shops & places to eat nearby. Room clean, modern and mini bar free! Staff very helpful and provided useful information. Free drink on roof a must do aswell, great to relax after hard day of sightseeing! Only issue was safe didn't open twice, had to be reset twice due to battery running out, but all items safe at all times. Stayed here twice during trip. Would recommend to everyone I know. Good hotel, good location, good service, good spot!

Reviews.Title: “The service was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Clada66
Reviews.Content: We ordered two three person rooms and they were perfect. The hotel was beautiful, the rooftop bar delightful and the front desk so helpful. I will go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: desiree1022
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It's near Termini and within walking distance to major attractions, but that's not the best of it. The hotel itself is wonderful. The room was not the largest I've seen, but it was adequate. The bathroom was large. My only complaint was how the shower wall was situated. It was a movable door that only covered half the shower so the floor gets wet if you're not careful. There were plenty of goodies in the room and the minibar is FREE! The staff is very responsive and very helpful. The breakfast was the best we'd eaten in the two weeks we stayed in Italy. We had bacon, sausage, and eggs! Woo HOOOOO! You know how us Americans like our big breakfasts. I wish I had been able to spend more time at this hotel. We had a very early flight and the hotel staff made sure to have a cab and a boxed breakfast waiting for us when we checked out. Of course, you will need to eat it all before going through security, but it was really nice to have something in our stomachs before getting on the plane. I really appreciated that service and I would definitely return to this hotel if I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - recommend it highly !!”
Reviews.Author: Millfarm6
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very central location, everything within walking distance. Hotel staff were very friendly espec Paulo, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast is excellent , the mini bar in the room was very welcome on our return every evening and the roof top garden is a must to relax after a long sight seeing day. A bottle of wine was also left in our room as it was my birthday !! Nice touch !! Great value for our 4 nights too compared with other hotels in the area. Overall we had a fab trip and I will def be recommending this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: broomsmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in a superior room for 5 nights in early August. The hotel was clean, comfortable and well serviced. The recetion staff in particular were outstanding, nothing was to much trouble. They were informative gave great advice on sights and tours and booked everything for us. The room was spacious modern, clean and comfortable. All major attractions were easily accessible from the hotel, if you had to take a cab maximum cost was 10 euro's. Trains and buses are nearby. Breakfast was great with a wide variety of food available. The hotel has a roof top restaurant which was competively priced and very pleasant. To the staff "thank you" you made our stay in Rome something we will always remember

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: ShawnCornell
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We easily walked from the train station, with our luggage, and arrived at the front desk before noon hoping that they would be able to take our luggage until check-in time. In fact our room was ready, and check-in was easy and quick. Though the room was small, we really weren't expecting anything else. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathrooms were nice, with plenty of hot water, though the shower door did leak water on the floor, which was annoying, but livable. Breakfast, not included, was served on the main floor and was fine. The rooftop bar and restaurant was pleasant for drinks or dinner in the evening and we visited it twice during our short stay. The fitness area was very small. The service was amiable from everyone at the front desk, restaurants and front door - even for us who cannot muster more than a few words of Italian. They booked a car for us to the port without any problems or millions of questions. The location cannot be beat and we will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsC333
Reviews.Content: Central location close to termani and republica metro stops. Nice staff and free wi-fi. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: FionaMW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide from 20th July for 6 nights and were happy with the hotel and service we received. I had booked the hotel based on such good reviews on Tripadvisor. I agree with all the positive feedback, it is a good clean 4* hotel. I wasn't blown away by it but after walking past some shabby looking 3* hotels I definitely wouldn't settle for less than 4* in Rome. My last two holidays were in America and I guess the standards there are quite high so I suggest no less than 4* if you like the same. We had the larger double room and I imagine this was a good decision as it wasn't overly big so the standard (small) double must be tiny. Free mini bar was stocked daily with cans of cola, bottles of water and fruit juices (couple of each), which is a nice touch. TV channels in English are only Sky News and BBC News and 5 euro movies (about 25-30 to choose from). Bathroom was always clean but on the last two days there was quite a bad smell when the toilet was flushed- not from us! I imagine there may have been a leak or something somewhere. It wan't so bad that we chose to report it but if it hadn't happened on nearly the last full day we would have. The staff were all friendly and helpful when approached but otherwise don't bother you or make conversation, rather they just say Hello- which is fine by me. WIFI access via the TV was free the first day then 5 euro an hour which was a little steep and also I don't think it allowed you on all sites. There are computers down in the lounge area however- not sure the cost for these. Overall- would recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for luxury though, better search a well rated 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Kongski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, and the rooms are nicely decorated, with decent air-conditioning - a must when the temp outside reached 36C. The minibar items as well as wi-fi were all free: a very big plus! The breakfast buffet was excellent. The location is also convenient: 15min walk to the Spanish Steps, and close to Termini metro station. Service was mostly friendly and efficient. The only minus was that they double booked a Vatican tour for us, such that we ended up on a rushed large group tour, and missed a private guided tour. However this may have been due to the language barrier, and we didn't have to pay anything extra. All in all this is an excellent hotel in a good location and is well worth considering as a base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: canuck64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights with my wife and daughter. It was our last leg of a two week trip in Italy. The service we got was excellent. The front desk helped me return my car rental at Termini train station ; Emilio was great ! The breakfast room is very efficient, very clean with lots of choices, and well run. Our room was very nice, however, my wife noted it was a little dark. The location is great, and you can walk or take the metro to anywhere in Rome. The rooftop restaurant was very good, and quite affordable. Front desk also made our dinner reservations, and booked a private mini van to drive us to the Fiumicino airport. This is a great hotel in a great city !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandandsunloverMD
Reviews.Content: Aside from the noise from the main street during the night...it was a great stay! Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper -- the plugs worked great for me. Enjoyed the very efficient breakfast manager who was prompt and pleasant. The food was good for a buffet. The rooftop restaurant was a nice respite in the evenings that provided a wonderful view of the city. Location was good. The free snacks/drinks was a perk in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value!”
Reviews.Author: Jean R
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the room, and the service, especially considering the price. Good proximity to the central train station, shopping, and other eastside sites; one easy bus to St. Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent family-friendly hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Geraint_Rees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (6 & 8) in a junior suite. The room was excellent - the layout with a double sofa-bed in a separate area with sliding partition was one of the best we've stayed in for getting the kids off to bed while allowing the adults to stay up! Free wi-fi and free (basic - beer + soft drinks) mini-bar for the duration of our stay was very nice. The room was facing onto the street (third floor) but sound proofing meant minimal street noise and excellent sleep. Extremely friendly and helpful staff (thank you!); good breakfast (full selection of all usual stuff); nice roof terrace + bar. Hotel clientele a mixture of nationalities, families + couples (both straight and gay). The hotel is very convenient (<10 mins walk) for Termini station if you're coming from the airport or leaving by train (like us) but walkable to all the main sights and directly on the main 40 bus route to the Vatican (going via places like Piazza Navona). All in all a great four star hotel in a fantastic city...

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: aliwally
Reviews.Content: After working on the inaugural sailing of one of my company's ships - I needed to take a day off to unwind and decompress, so I picked this hotel on the basis of other reviews. Whilst it was my fault to get hopelessly lost on the streets from the Termini Train Station, the front desk couldn't have made my check-in any quicker - I think they clearly saw I needed a shower and rest ASAP. The room was perfect and I was delighted by the free mini-bar options - how nice to get something like this! Plenty of water, and even a couple of Italian beers if you wanted. And unlike many European hotels, the bathroom came stocked with essentials like body lotion, cotton balls etc. In fact, bathroom was positively huge - and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was included in my price - a mere 118 euros for the night as a single room (but with a queen sized bed) and that was perfectly good too. Location is great - had no noise issues, and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Rome and wanting a place close to Termini, as well as access to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: tracyo6618
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this beautiful hotel. It was extremely, clean, neat & comfortable and in a wonderful location. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast buffet, including latte's each morning had a great variety. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Dinner in the roof top restaurant was also a pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and a brill breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jjaxmaxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brisk 5 mins walk from the main train station so is great when you arrive by train from the airport. We were transferring to Venice by train for part 2 of our holiday and this location made it very easy. The underground system is less than 5 mins from the hotel should you want to use it. The area around the hotel is busy with lots of shops and bars. Rome is best explored on foot and strolling to the Trevi Fountain and the Parthenon took around 20mins. The hotel is a clean, friendly and relaxed , it is well run and has a nice bar area and reasonably sized rooms. We had a standard double and it was great for the price and the complementary mini bar with daily water and soft drinks were most welcome. Unfortunately the airport in Rome lost our bags EEEK! We got nowhere trying to get info about when we'd get our bags back. The hotel staff were genuinely concerned, said this happened a lot and that the bags would be in the airport somewhere. They rang the airport and shouted at them on our behalf, demanded the bags were found and delivered pronto and as if by magic they were couriered to the hotel within hours. Phew! Breakfast was good, hot/cold buffet selection, fresh fruit and freshly made hot choc and cappaccino. The hot drinks are waiter service. The restaurant manager runs a tight ship and his management of a stream of sometimes confused hot drink delivering staff certainly adds entertainment value. He also randomly plies guests with delicious treats from the previous evenings dessert tray Yummm! Overall a well priced hotel in a good spot, great service and a good breakfast. We'd definately book it again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: maroDublin
Reviews.Content: centrally located hotel just 10 minutes walk from the termini station, clean and comfortable with a lovely rooftop restaurant. friendly helpful staff, loads to choose from at breakfast . I would definately recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable, and placed well between northern Rome and Ancient Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TJrater
Reviews.Content: Four nights in this hotel, and all we have to complain about is the noise in the morning for room #300. It's right next to the staircase, so naturally people are obnoxiously loud in the stairwells. I'm not sure how that can easily be fixed, but I won't fault anyone at the hotel for that. Just avoid the room if you can. The staff were very friendly. We've stayed at 12 hotels in our one-month European visit, and this hotel ranked near the top, taking price into consideration (we stayed in only 4-5 star hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sizzlemon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the good response it got on tripadvisor - I was not disappointed. The staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms were very clean and my teenagers thought that free mini bar was great. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for every cents !!!”
Reviews.Author: rajmonek
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Artemide in December, 2010. We chose this hotel after reading a lot of very good reviews here and we can say that, our stay was just fantastic. It is not by chance, that there are no "terrible" or "poor" reviews at all !!!! We booked the hotel via bookings.com and just some days before arrival they sent us an e-mail that they appreciate to welcome us soon in Hotel Artemide. And it was in the same way, when we arrived home - a "thank you for choosing us" e-mail arrived. Good location, nice rooms (small, but anyway it is in Rome !) with free minibar, "good night chocolates" by the evening, fantastic staff, delicious breakfast, fast check in and out (we got an upgrade for free because of our 1 year old little son, they took us in a peaceful corner room), convenient airport transfer, nice baby cot, etc.etc. There are no cons just pros! No doubt, if Rome again, defenitely Hotel Artemide!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing that you could want from a Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: MangoChutney
Reviews.Content: Without repeating all the comments from previous reviews all that we can do is recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome: ~ Efficient check in ~ Friendly staff ~ Great room ~ Free mini bar ~ Service in the breakfast room especially brilliant ~ Roof Top Bar a great place to relax and the food is great too! Well done to the Artimede for getting the basics right coupled with staff who actually seem to enjoy their jobs. We would not stop anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, stay at the Artemide”
Reviews.Author: Silvana_Michel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was very rewarding. The staff were incredible, our room was beautiful, free mini-bar and snacks, complimentary rooftop coffee or drink - the hotel did everything to make our stay memorable. The hotel is centrally located-you can walk very easily to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venezia, Roman Forum, Colosseum in a few minutes time. Many wonderful restaurants are also nearby. We are in Rome quiet often and would not think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay.”
Reviews.Author: CookiesReview
Reviews.Content: Friendly & helpful front desk staff. Thank you Mario. The BEST breakfast & coffee and service staff. The room was very comfortable with good linens & pillows. A nice (small) bar/lounge area on the roof top, to have a cocktail or coffee. Thx Renato. At check-in you receive a card for a free prosecco or coffee for the roof top.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ErnstDeJongen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at an attractive location. Staff very service-oriented. Great rooftop terrace, with view on the San Paolo dentro le mura (next to hotel), Italian government buildings and San Pietro (Vatican). Close to Termini and the city centre. Only negative side is breakfast: very much oriented on Americans (meaning: lots of sausages/calories, hardly any bread,no real coffee), quite crowded and indoors (which is a pity with such a great rooftop terrace!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LydiaLucero
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and always helpful. There is a view from the rooftop, though a bit obstructed; it's a great place to unwind and have a bottle of wine before bed. There were plenty of shops to look at along the street, and it was convenient to bus routes because of the main street (passes can be purchased down the street a bit at the visitors' information booth). The food was okay, but I would suggest going to the many placed outside the hotel as that food is much better. Over all, it was a great choice, and I would encourage others to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Riaboni
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in walking distance of most major attractions. The staff was amazing especially Matteo. My husband and two sons couldn't have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamCheadle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for 3 nights having taken advantage of an excellent rate on Expedia. From the friendly staff on the front desk, to those in the restaurant, we experienced excellent service and help when required. Our room was most comfortable and clean; we'd asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel and it was! The mini bar was stocked with snacks and soft drinks and all of these were free! A lovely touch. The hotel was in a convenient location for sightseeing.........a 15 minute walk from the Colloseum. Couldn't recommend this hotel more and can't fault it. Go stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: karladale
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our stay. The room was elegant and very comfortable, breakfast was amazing and the staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. The location made walking or hopping on the metro easy to get to all of the major sites as well as the quiet backstreets. The rooftop terrace was a bonus for relaxing in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for part of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bruins7701
Reviews.Content: This place was beautiful and the location was great. Perfect walking distance to everything except the Vatican, although we did end up walking home from there one day so it's not impossible if you love to walk. Also close to Termini train station. Not many restaurants right on this street, but plenty of good shopping. Staff at the hotel, especially the young woman at the front desk, were all extremely nice and helpful! We can't say enough nice things about this place. Because it was our honeymoon, they even upgraded us to a suite, gave us a bottle of wine and a nice note, and also a certificate for 2 free drinks at their garden terrace Breakfast in the morning was excellent as well. Awesome hotel! Mille Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: maustin8
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel was a perfect option for our three night stay in Rome. It was beautiful, accommodating, and was in a great location. The Location: This hotel is on Via Nazionale. It is within walking distance of everything except the Vatican. Ancient Rome and the Colosseum are 10 minutes walk, and there are some very beautiful piazzas close by. We chose to explore Rome on foot instead of risking the taxi run-around, and found that the hotel was centrally located and convenient. The only REALLY long walk was to the Borghesse Gallery/Spanish Steps. I would recommend a taxi for these trips. The Hotel: Was BEAUTIFUL! It was clean, large, and felt safe and secure. The gentlemen behind the front desk were helpful and accommodating, and took charge of securing taxis and giving directions. The rooftop restaurant was an American menu, which we thought was a little weird. But if you have a picky eater it might be nice. It was a good place to have a drink though. Breakfast was a large buffet with hot and cold items, and espresso/cappuccino was available by request. The Room: Very large (for Europe) with a nice bath. Safe was included in the room. The bed was a bit firm for my taste, but all in all it was a fantastic room. It contained a mini-fridge with complimentary water (still and sparkling) and a few sodas. Also, they provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service from extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mrsangelab
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Artimede as a group of 13 for my wedding. Both before and during our stay the staff were extremely helpful in recommending and booking hairdressers and restaurants for the whole of our group and were happy to make changes last minute without any fuss. All recommendations were fab! In addition the hotel was in a great location was lovely inside and had a fabulous roof terrace with a view out to the Vatican. Lastly, the breakfast buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StevenandCecile
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect, near the train station, near a metro line and close to the attractions. The hotel itselft is great as well, very clean, nice rooms (especially the bathroom!), free minibar (believe me when it's close to 40 degress out, you appreciate being able to pack a few water bottles and juices!..and beer ;)). The staff is excellent, they answer any questions you might have and assist you with everything you might need. If we ever visit Roma again, we will stay at Artemide!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: cbusfamily101
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed at this hotel and we loved it! We booked the 'Family Room' (Room 202) which has a balcony, 2 bedrooms and a large bathroom. A little noisy being right in Via Nazionale but we're city people so we enjoyed it. Nice rooftop for an evening drink and the free mini-fridge was a huge help. Air conditioning was great and strong water pressure in the shower. Just a few blocks from the metro station, but walking everywhere was easy too. We stayed in 4 hotels throughout our travels in Italy and the breakfast at Hotel Artemide was our favorite. Lots of choices. Front desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about...”
Reviews.Author: magestic14
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my fiance as a last stop of our four city italian vacation. We were so tired from the trip and really was looking foward to a nice, relaxing few days at the end. The hotel is about a 15 min walk from the train station, maybe 20, but pretty centrally located. The room was just ok, and our first three keys did not work. The mirrors in the room all have an odd design on them, at first i thought they were super dirty but then i realized that is how they were supposed to look (odd though) The bathroom was spacious and had a lot of toilitries if you didnt bring any. They only cleaned the room once a day after the first night, and our towels from our morning showers were never replaced. I had requested something from the front desk and although they said they would send it right up, it never happened. The mini bar in the room was nice, free cookies and water was a plus. The breakfast was just ok though, and it was tough to get a waiter for some coffee. If you are looking for a decent place to just sleep, then i would recommend this hotel, otherwise i dont think we will be returning. Four star it defintely is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: famBristol_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in july 2011 and could not fault this hotel. The hotel is in a great location with many of the main tourist attractions within walking distance. The hotel was very clean, we had a room on the sixth floor at the back and it was very quiet. The buffet breakfast (included in the price) was excellent and we ate at the rooftop restaurant one evening. The staff are helpful, esp the lady on reception. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - excellent services, location”
Reviews.Author: gina-schmitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at this hotel prior to heading home from our vacation. Hotel Artemide is a beautiful hotel! It is centrally located - we actually walked from the Tremini station to the hotel. It was able to be done, but if you hate chaos, crowds and traffic, take a cab! We spent five hours basically running all over Rome - as time was limited - and Artemide was in a great location to enable us to do so. There is also alot of upscale shopping in the area. When we made reservations, we let them know were were in Italy on an early anniversary trip. They left us a complimentary bottle of wine from Montepulciano in our room along with a personal note. Soda, water, and beer are free in the fridge. I would not hesitate spending the night here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Carolgir
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. Comfortable clean rooms. Wonderful breakfast. All minibar items are included in the price of the room. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel throughly recommend to stay there”
Reviews.Author: 255068Sharon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room at the Artemide Hotel and it was fantastic (mother and two daughters -we had single beds for all). Plenty of space and the room itself was very modern. The Artemide has a terrace on the roof top which provided lovely breezers during the hot summer. The service was excellent. Eugino the bar staff man was great. He gave us plenty of advice where to eat, places to see and couldn't be more helpful. We opted to include breakfast with the stay great idea as we ate big and then put our walking shoes on to see the sights for the day. Location is great. Close to shops, restaurants and also the hop on hop off bus which I would recommend to anyone. Great way to see landmarks within a city. We also toured the vatican city guided tour with Happy Travel - Guy called Simon was amazingly knowledgeable and probably the best guided tour we have been on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Shannonlg
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the train station and the Colosseum, this hotel was a perfect home base for a trip to visit the sites of Rome. We enjoyed the lovely lobby, nicely decorated rooms, helpful staff and free wireless internet. Be prepared for being situated on a fairly busy (noisy) street, and enjoy the sounds of the city!

Reviews.Title: “A really very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GYK
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked a 4 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is near enough to the Termini station to be good for bus and train transport but far enough away from the station as to be safe. The street that the hotel is on is safe to walk on at all times of the day.The hotel is very well maintained with friendly and helpful staff at all levels. Our room was a moderate size, comfortable and spotlessly clean and the air conditioner worked quietly and efficiently - very important if you're visiting Rome in the summer! We had a room at the back of the hotel which didn't offer a view but which was quieter than facing the very busy Via Nazionale street. The bathroom was fully equipped with good quality towels and all sorts of toiletries and slippers etc. The TV had all the English news stations (CNN, BBC World, Sky + more). One very pleasant surprise was to find that everything in the refridgerator could be taken free of charge - fruit drinks, beer and bottles of mineral water - and it was all restocked the next morning. There was a kettle and a free selection of teas,coffees, biscuits, crackers and nuts. A buffet breakfast was included in the price and offered a good selection of hot cooked food, cheeses, meats, cereals and fruit etc. The position of the hotel made it possible to travel to anywhere in Rome so we purchased a 3 day pass for 11 Euro each which gave us unlimited travel on all public transport. If you purchase a ticket don't forget to vaidate it on your first journey as, apparently, they don't accept ignorance as an excuse!! If you ask at reception they give you a code and you can have 15 minutes free time on the computer in the foyer - enough to check on emails etc. The day before we left I wanted to print out our boarding cards and they opened the business centre up for me - again free of charge. If you want to use your laptop in the room then you can, apparently, pay a fee and receive that service. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant which is very attractive and which serves very good food. It's a few Euro more than you could possibly find in the city but after spending a full day sightseeing we appreciated not having to go out searching around. On the day we left we ordered a cab though the hotel which cost 45 Euro (inclusive of luggage) and was downstairs waiting for us at 6am. As we were missing breakfast we were presented with 2 full bags of crackers, jams, fruit, biscuits and mineral water to take with us. This is a hotel I wouldn't hesitate to recommend or return to ourselves. Not the cheapest but the service and standard was worth paying out for. TIP ONE: If you are a UK senior citizen (or any EU country) and over 65 years, take a photocopy of your passport with you when visiting the main sites in Rome. It's not shown on any of their entry price boards, but when you get to the ticket office show them your passport copy which shows your age and you will get a free entrance ticket. TIP TWO: Almost opposite the hotel is 'Doveralu', a restaurant that serves good food at a reasonable price. However, it was their icecreams that we found addictive and which became a daily dessert!!!! TIP THREE: ALWAYS check your restaurant bill as on 2 occasions we were charged for food we hadn't had or for two items when we'd only had one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fifty Birthday Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy190725
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a trip to Rome for my sister's 50th Birthday and we couldn't have stayed in a nicer hotel. Before we travelled I emailed the Artemide asking if a birthday cake and a bottle of sparking wine could be in my sister's room on arrival. I received a reply from Matteo who said 'no problem' he would arrange it all for us. Just before we travelled Matteo emailed to suggest that we had our surprise on the roof top terrace as it would be a nicer atmosphere - it certainly was! The cake was amazing (not the jam and sponge I was expecting!) - a delicious cream and fruit creation, and both the cake and the sparking wine were arranged for us with the hotel's compliments which was such a lovely added extra. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff - we asked them to arrange taxi's, give us directions, and also we arranged an open top bus tour through the hotel - a definitely 'must do' in Rome! Another lovely 'touch' is the notice in the bathroom to say that if you forget something - toothpaste, toothbrush, etc - just give them a call and they will supply with their compliments. My daughter also loved the free pink slippers in the room! They definitely earn their fantastic rating and I'm so pleased I looked on Trip Advisor before booking our trip. We would definitely stay there if we are lucky enough to travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulamariarock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice place to stay in Rome and to feel good. The staff are very friendly and helpful especially in the restaurant. My husband and I suggest this accomodation if you would like to stay in Rome and you need the best. Thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay here”
Reviews.Author: Brommers
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city and so the customer service provided by the Artemide was particularly welcome. The judge of any organisation is how they perform when things go wrong and when the plug stopped working they were there straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trock24
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel we stayed in for our 2 week adventure in Italy. We chose this hotel because of all the TA reviews and the hotel did not disappoint. Rooms were clean, and the breakfast was great. The free minibar was also a great touch. Hotel is within walking distance to all the major sites, and close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic”
Reviews.Author: flor24e
Reviews.Content: I was here with my husband for some days. We loved the bar and the old part of the hotel, its very well kept and you feel like on another world. the location is perfect for visiting and the breakfast is well worth!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the quality & genuine love of this hotel to its guests”
Reviews.Author: Katerina49
Reviews.Content: Artemide hotel impressed us with its personnel.Each one of them, from cleaners ,porters to the restaurant managers and receptionists showed us an amazing love to what they do. We kept asking ourselves -how did they manage to train these people - each of them to be so genuine & kind to the guests? Then we concluded it's just a beautiful culture of the hotel and its employees. They were available to us instantaneously, surrounded us with warmth and family like welcome. We have 2 highly energetic kids, 2 and 5 year old, and it was our first time with them in the hotel. We loved it. Spacious clean room, re-stocked treats in the room every day (proved to be very handy and useful for the kids to munch on). Superb. No words. Just thanks. And thanks again. As I mentioned to the Management of the Hotel my eldest daughter didn't want to leave the hotel. She loved it so much! We too. May your business prosper Best regards Katrina Mark Mila Elena (Malta)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel with a modern twist”
Reviews.Author: Feeny4
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old daughter and I stayed in a triple room, which we loved! It was a L shaped room which was spacious, super clean and modern. My daughter loved the privacy she had in her own "section" of the room,. not a lot of closet space but that seems to be the norm in many of these updated hotels. Upon arrival we went upstairs to the lounge for our free drinks. A very cute place to unwind. Great bathroom, great shower, and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and they served American coffee. We used 4 water bottles a day plus snacks from the mini fridge, which saved us at leave $10-15 Euros per day. The location was a $10 euro cab ride from Termini. It's not in the middle of everything, but the walks are not bad - about 15 minutes to the major sites (20 min to Colosseum/Pantheon), and 5 minutes from the Metro. I'd rather walk 5 minutes more and stay at an upscale hotel. We used their private car service for 45 euros for a ride to the airport. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Steve52787
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base for exploring Rome. We walked almost everywhere (Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc.). The only place we didn't walk to was the Vatican, and for that we took the Metro - - the stop for which is only a very short walk from the hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had the "family" room on the first floor and it worked well for my wife and me and our daughter and her friend. (There was a moveable wall that separated the girls' room from ours.) Also, there was a little balcony that overlooked the street; it allowed us to take some pretty neat pictures. The mini-bar was (as "advertised") free and re-stocked every day. It is a nice little touch. Also, we really enjoyed the breakfast. There is a lot of good food and the very professional wait stuff buzzes around getting you coffee and clearing the plates. And the maitre d' is a delight - - welcoming you each morning and making sure that everything is just right. In fact, great service seems to be a hallmark of this hotel. Every person we came into contact was very helpful - - from giving us restaurant recommendations to getting us a car to the airport to giving us sightseeing tips. These are hardly unique things, but were all done very well and with a big smile. Finally, I would be remiss if I didn't mention the complimentary bottle of wine that the hotel provided to us during our stay. (My wife and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary.) All in all, I simply could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city stays we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: sprouley
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner work in long haul travel and know the importance of great customer service. From post booking to returning home, everything was faultless and staff at every level couldn't do enough for us. We arranged a private car to and from the airport which was worth every penny, especially as our time was limited and we wanted to arrive in a bit of style. Check-in was smooth, fast and informative and because we were celebrating joint birthdays we were upgraded to a stunning room with a private roof terrace with amazing views over the Via Nazionale and a complimentary bottle of red wine. We took advantage of an offer advertised on Trip Advisor which also meant that the Mini Bar was free during our stay, which was a magic touch. There was also free WiFi during our stay which was useful for google maps to plan trips, checking metro details and booking restaurant and much more. Breakfast was provided and catered for all needs whether continental or cooked, and obviously with plenty of coffee. We both love Rome and now that we have found a hotel in a great location with great staff we will be returning and will definitely be staying at the Artemide. We can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel (read end of this review for excellent service).”
Reviews.Author: Theresa166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this Hotel for a Silver Wedding Celebration. From the moment we arrived we could not have been treated better. We were taken to our room which was lovely and clean, and a complimentary bottle of wine and a letter from the Manager wish us a Happy Anniversary was presented to us. The Hotel was a fabulous roof terrace (everyone is given a token on arrival to have a complimentary drink upon arrival) - lovely touch). The meals on the terrace are really good value and lovely (a bit too handy after a long day out and about, that you end up eating there instead of going out to other restuarants). The cocktail and to die for and the waiter service is very friendly (especially Euginio, who was so polite and friendly). The breakfasts are buffet style and there is something there for everyone. WHAT MAKES THIS HOTEL SO AMAZING ..... I have worn a necklace to Rome that had great sentimental value to me and on being home about fice weeks I went to put the necklace on and could not find it .... turned the house upside down .... on the off chance I e mailed the hotel and gave them the dates and room number of our stay and had I by chance left it in the safe in my room? Within two hours they e mailed my back and said I HAD LEFT MY NECKLACE in the safe and they forwarded it on to me. WHOW how is that for service???? We had already said when we go back to Rome we would stay in this hotel again as it had been so clean and tidy and lovely feel to it - but after this I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you Artemide Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: dazell
Reviews.Content: All staff are very friendly and helpful especially the three guys in the rooftop bar and restaurant

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rabczak
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel was an excellent base to tour Rome, close to the railway station and Metro line, but within walking distance of the Coliseum and old part of the city. Upon arrival, we found all the staff to be friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, with the bedroom to be of a good size and extremely clean. A free mini bar and the bed sheets changed daily – attention to detail. Deserves its 4.5 star on Tripadvisor. Yes would not hesitate to stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best Trips We Have Ever Had, Staff and Hotel Were Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dandoo62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Anniversary between 14th and 18th June. We have grown accustomed to having to put in to our holiday reviews... all was ok, BUT ... . I can honestly say there is no but when i say the hotel room (room 401) was exceptional. The staff were better than exceptional. they were very accomodating and helped us whenever we asked them for assistance. whether to locate an address, book a restaurant, help us with directions, nothing was too much trouble. We booked a deluxe double room and as we were informed, there would be an in room bar/fridge and as they state it was replenished every day with beers, wines, beverages and snacks. Our room was cleaned and spotlessly tidied daily. The hotel is suitably placed within walking distance of most of the attractions. Those that aren't nearby, can be reached easily by the metro station, a few hundred metres close to hotel. As part of our booking, we had complimentray breakfast every day. This consisted of a wide variety of hot and cold buffet, always accompanied by a lovely capuccino and pot of coffee. The maitre d was very nice, helpful and extremely attentive. We had a fantastice roof terrace bar, where a lunch or snack and the odd prosecco or two could be had. We are certainly wanting to revisit Rome, as there are many other things to see and do, and we will surely return, staying at THE ARTEMIDE HOTEL, without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: usclakertraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a fantastic location, great breakfast buffet, nice rooms, and just generally provides with everything anyone could need. There was a lounge on the top floor which was very nice and comfortable with good drinks, and the staff was always attentive and said good morning or good night every time I walked by. Overall, this hotel was small yet not too small and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will stay here again if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we had in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher7-Sue
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all expectations. Hotel has excellent service, rooms are clean and air conditioned, morning breakfast has great variety, and free room bar and internet are appreciated. Location is a few blocks from the Forum. If we come to Rome again, we will defintely stay here -- great qualtiy for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KTDNeath
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for all sightseeing. Room spacious, very clean and extremely quiet at the rear of the hotel. Staff helpful and kind. Breakfast is delicious. Will stay at the Artemide Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ant_Craig
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel purely on the trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. stayed in a classic room which was very clean and tidy. The only real popular attraction not in walking distance is the vatican, but this can be accessed via the underground which is about 3-5 mins away at the top of the road. went to Rome as it was my wife and i's 20th wedding anniversary and was pleasantly surprised to receive complimentary bottle of red wine and typed letter in our room when we checked in. Overall very enjoyable stay, would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Lovely city too !

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: LASTrafzer
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4-night stay at the Artemide Hotel in Rome, and I cannot say enough how wonderful this hotel is, both because of the lovely rooms and the truly engaging and helpful people working there. We are traveling in Italy with 6 adults, ages 20-nearly 80 (the trip is for Grandma's 80th birthday!) and what a great way to start it off! Check out my pictures for an example of the beautiful rooms, one of which was upgraded to include a small patio. Air conditioning was a must, as June in Rome is hot and muggy! The beds comfortable, the room exceptionally clean, free basics in the fridge, safe in the room, satellite television for when it was just to hot to go out, and a lovely, full-out breakfast the downstairs (which was the best money spent I think as it got us off to a great start and allowed us to put off eating until later in the day). The people working there go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and well taken care of. Cabs arrive within minutes of being called, which was nice as Grandma's knee tends to limit her long-distance walking. When one of our party injured her foot, the men working at the front desk kept us supplied with ice packs filled with ice. I could go on and on, but really, this is a superb hotel. I've stayed in places across Europe and the Americas from hostels to 5-star resorts and everything in between, and the Artemide Hotel has it all, plus it's in a great location. 10 minute walk to the Colosseo and ancient Rome, even less to the main train terminal, and much else is within a short hike. We will stay here again in a heartbeat. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Good Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: gillwWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Artemide Hotel in late May. The hotel is well located and is only 10mins walk from the Termini station & 5mins walk from Republic Metro station. Some of the main sights such as The Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Roman Forum & Spanish Steps are all within easy walking distance (approx 20min walk). A trip to the Vatican would require a bus or Metro ride. The hotel deserves its 4 star rating as it is clean & very well run. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a superior room which was larger than most European hotel rooms. Our room had a free small mini bar which was restocked every day and we were also offered free wifi & newspapers, all of which saved us money. The TV had the most channels I have ever seen on a hotel TV, with a good mix of channels from different countries. The bathroom was a good size and had a good range of toiletries & slippers for you to use. Complimentary welcome drinks were served on the day of our arrival in the rooftop restaurant (together with some lovely chocolate covered strawberries). All food served by the hotel was well presented and of a very high standard. There was a large choice at Breakfast which was mainly continental, but did include some hot food such as scrambled egg & bacon. One evening, we had a meal in the rooftop restaurant and the food was excellent. We felt the staff went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. They were all very friendly & accommodating. We found they all spoke English well and offered good advice on how to get about in Rome and were happy to make calls to enquire or book things on our behalf. On our last day, they arranged for the hotel’s private car to take us back to the airport. Although this did cost a little more than a taxi would, it was well worth it as it was a much nicer experience. In summary, this is an excellent hotel which is well located for easy access to the main sights. We would strongly recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: libbyc123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly staff could not have been more helpful. We had a small suite, very comfortable and spacious, good bathroom and the free mini bar really was! Excellent breakfast. Wonderful position for exploring Rome which is what we did mostly on foot. The only thing that we would change was the tour company that the hotel did our tour bookings through. It was called Ciao, guides were excellent, but we ended up with 50 odd people. The logisticsof keeping this number together etc.... Speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here ! Pefect Location, Clean Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: honestcritic0
Reviews.Content: Through Trip Advisor I looked at hundreds of hotels to stay in Rome, If I knew what I know now I would of saved heaps of time. Definitely stay here when going to Rome. Alessandro is the best conceirge anyone could wish for being a tourist. 5 star service and cleanliness for a 4 star hotel, breakfast is great too !! A tip - Basic room is a little small try get the next step up.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when sightseeing in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: hannahm90
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable and provided a great base to see the sights. Lots of places in walking distance from the hotel. Room was very clean and we particularly enjoyed having a drink in the bar upstairs on the roof! Very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: pasweet
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two week Mediterranean cruise out of Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Artemide in Rome for three nights a before the trip. The hotel is located very centrally--we walked to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi fountain and the coliseum with no trouble at all--about a 15-20 minute walk to each place. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a standard triple and it was more roomy than many hotels we have stayed at in Europe. The decor is simple but tasteful, with lots of light wood. The cleanliness standards were high at this establishment. The breakfast buffet offered extended hours and a wide selection of juices, rolls, salad fixings, as well as standard American breakfast fare. The food was very tasty. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful, offering us maps and directions to sites as well as restaurant recommendations. The hotel has a bar/small restaurant on the top floor which is very pleasant--a patio location with good views of the city. The food and drinks were reasonably priced and more than acceptable. The staff offered frequent coupons for free coffee and/or prosecco at the bar, which was a nice touch.
