We would highly recommend staying here to anyone and we will stay here again the next time we are in Rome--which I hope is soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mommyhedrick
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is wonderful. All staff was exceptional and very helpful with dinner suggestions. Within walking distance to many area attractions. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, comfortable rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug290584
Reviews.Content: We are checking out today from the Artemide hotel and we dont want to leave. The location is great- walking distance to almost every site. All the staff are lovely, the rooms are clean and well appointed. We asked for a quiet room and were placed overlooking the inner courtyard- not much to look at but definitely peaceful. Great shower, not much room to move but the pressure was as good if not better than my shower at home. Staff are all extremely friendly and helpful. Lots of selection at breakfast. And they have a gym and sauna. We will return on our next visit to Roma. Thankyou to all the staff for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Friendly Ambience. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: SandL6969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Artimede for 12 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every one of them. This is a gem of an hotel, friendly, happy and helpful staff make this Hotel a delight. Comfortable rooms are well serviced and the basement breakfast and rooftop restaurant and lounge are both delightful. A casual, relaxing and happy base from which to explore Rome's magnificence, all within walking distance. Located on a central street and surrounded by all necessary services and dining options, the location can not be bettered. The abundant generosity of the Hotel is a rare treat to find, we had half priced restaurant meals whenever we wanted, a range of free coffee vouchers, more than we could use, and complimentary bottled water, fruit and nuts each day. The complimentary mini bar contains beer and fruit juices also. Do not miss this hotel when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome and Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patdovebowers
Reviews.Content: Alessandro and Vittoria scheduled tours of beautiful Rome for my family and our experience was unforgettable and perfect. Hotel room was very clean and nice. Location is within walking distance of Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Don't miss Capuchin Crypt!! Drinks and snacks provided in room free of charge. Alessandro recommended wonderful restaurant within walking distance. My daughter and son used internet for short time each day free of charge. Breakfast is included and rivals a pricey cruise ship. Artemide Hotel's staff is their best asset.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Psychick79
Reviews.Content: We arrived very jet lagged and were told we'd been upgraded to their top suite and had a balcony on the top floor. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast gave us the caffeine and energy to explore Rome. The beds were very comfortable, the room immaculate and the perfect base to explore Rome. I would have preferred a less American breakfast but there were a lot of options and this is really nit picking. We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: kgdmdunn
Reviews.Content: It was our pleasure to stay at this hotel last week of may then return for 1 night beginning of June. Special thanks to Alessandro, Pino Christian at the front desk. The roof top terrace was very nice and the morning breakfast top notch. Hotel is in a good location for walking to many attractions. Room was neat and clean. Free mini bar and in room coffee was a plus. Hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Acolpitt
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms and the bathrooms are over sized. This hotel offered a great location and value along with ample amenities like free wifi and mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city break”
Reviews.Author: frottie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and was a perfect location as a short walk to main sights or the metro for the Vatican. The hotel was faultless, the rooftop terrace was perfect for pre dinner drinks and the rooms comfortable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good - the best?”
Reviews.Author: PS62
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2011 in a Classic room. Room was comfortable, reasonable size with air conditioning and free mini bar. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet (not street facing). Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was good - wide choice and nice atmosphere. A couple of minor issues - bit of a bad drain smell on first entering the bathroom. Very narrow bath (and I'm not massive - only 5' 3). Location is ok - but while everything is 'walkable' in rome - you have to consider the heat and the cobbled walkways, which double the amount of time it takes to walk anywhere. Having said all this, the roof terrace was very pleasant and there wasn't much to complain about overall. I did expect more based on previous reviews, but it still warrants a 'very good' rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location, more than we expected...”
Reviews.Author: vscavo
Reviews.Content: It can be daunting to find the "perfect" hotel in Rome, Artemide is an excellent choice. The staff is A+++, they cannot do enough for you and are always happy to oblige. Everything is included in the room fee - the mini bar drinks and snacks were a nice touch that our kids enjoyed. Clean, comfortable, near good restaurants and transportation... everything we needed and more :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hospitality and a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LizCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a wonderful welcome from the staff - hotel was exceptionally clean, spacious, cool and provided so many extra touches, we felt very special. The staff are excellent - special thanks to Allesandro and Valentina - and couldn't have been more courteous and helpful. Great location - we walked everywhere, or hopped on the Metro. Believe the reviews - this really is an extremely well run hotel, with great amenities, superb service and delightful people.

Reviews.Title: “THE SPACE AND THE VIEW AND THE SERVICE WERE OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel because of trip advisor and were impressed by the feedback. We found the hotel to be excellent. We were given the top floor room which had its own lounge and rooftop garden all to ourselves. So we were blown away, we loved the free mini bar and fridge. The concierge were most helpful booking shows and events for us. The taxi drivers are very forceful and you can choose from many. You will pay for trip and per bag on top

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: NCtravelerRaleigh
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research, I settled on the Artemide Hotel and it was awesome! The staff was great from the time we checked in until the day we checked out. This hotel was warm, welcoming and very pleasant. The staff was great! The breakfast and minibar were nice additions. And thanks to others on this site who posted your feedback which helped me in making my decision. Would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews---this is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa53933
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Artemide in early June 2011. We found our entire stay pleasant. The staff at this hotel are top-notch! They made our stay comfortable in every way. The only thing they didn't do for us is the sightseeing itself! This was our last stop on a 5-city Italian tour---so our travel-weary selves were ready for a bit of pampering and found this at the Artemide. The breakfast buffet was by far the best we had in Italy. The selection each day was vast and varied---there was something that each and every American traveler would find yummy and fulfilling.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMaitland
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel with outstanding service, yes it is expensive but so worth it. We were going on a cruise and contacted the hotel before leaving and asked if we could leave an extra suitcase with stuff we didn't need. This was no problem,when we came back we found our suitcase waiting in our room, now that is customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice of Hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Janice51
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our recent night's stay at this hotel. It is a very good location for walking from the train station (Roma Termini), and to many of the special sites of the city. The staff were very friendly and efficient, plus helpful when required. The only thing is the complimentary mini bar might have included some wine, which it didn't, but since we were there for such a short time, it didn't matter. The buffet breakfast was very substantial. We were told we were being upgraded for our room, which was very nice of them, but when you have never been to the hotel before, one does not know what the room 'might have been like', but the room we did have was very nice, thank you. The dining lounge/bar was quite nice to go and enjoy a drink and those people who were dining looked like they were being served some delicious food. When I return in Sept. with three of my girlfriends, we will definitely try this dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alibobsManchester
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week at the artemide hotel where we celebrated our silver wedding anniversary. I would give this hotel 10 out of 10 for everything! The hotel was beautiful, the room we stayed in was spotless and very well furnished. They had a frree mini bar that was stocked up every day and there were toiletries in the bathroom which were replaced everyday if you used them. The breakfast was excellent and there was everything you could possibly want. The roof top bar is a great place where they serve some gorgeous food as well as drinks and cocktails. The staff are all lovely, everyone wasso friendly and helpful. The Artemide is a very central hotel near to most attractions. The hotel was a bit more expensive than we usually stay at but it was so worth it. If we go back to Rome we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find - would certainly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: JREDartford_Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here - the room was as booked, non smoking with twin beds, very clean. The porter spent time explaining where everything was in the room, made sure both cases were placed so we could open them and dashed off - no lurking for a tip. THe room was quiet and the air con worked efficiently and silently. Front desk staff were always helpful and friendly - in fact, this applies to all staff. Ample breakfast included in the price - large choice of fresh food. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The location is excellent - less than 5 minutes to the line A metro, also on main bus routes. It is, however, possible to walk to most places in the city, but nice to know that the metro is nearby and at only €1 - this was used at the end of the day! There is a restaurant on the roof terrace - food and service both very good. There are several restaurants around this area with prices to suit all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a City Break!”
Reviews.Author: BillyNellie
Reviews.Content: Having not been to Rome before we did not quite know where to stay. We checked out Trip Advisor and found this one read well so gave it a try and we weren't disappointed - good central location close to the train/bus station. The room was small but very nice and clean, no view as it was tucked away at the back but this meant it was very quiet. The buffet breakfast was excellent - lots of fresh fruit. Staff all friendly and helpful. Got a free bottle of wine for our anniversary and a complimentary drink on the rooftop terrace. The only moan was that the bed was VERY firm and gave me a slight backache but other than that very worthy of the 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrnealusa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is a fine hotel located close to the Termini (Rome train station). We found all the sights very accessible from this hotel. The accommodations were well appointed and ‘as advertised’, and we were greeted with champagne, flowers and fruit in the suite we booked. Overall the staff were very friendly. Our major complaint was the hotel’s lack of responsiveness to our request for a late check-out – the desk clerk said ‘no’ to our request without even checking which room we were in, or the expected check-in arrivals.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - expensive - but worth it if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: VTJedi
Reviews.Content: The only way I could afford this hotel was by getting a classic room 60% off by booking early through the hotel website. It was totally worth it! The staff is friendly, speak excellent English, and will help with anything. The manager of the breakfast room is very nice and if you stay for several nights will probably remember your drink order! Speaking of breakfast, it was the largest and best offered that we encountered in Italy. Eggs, sausage, bacon, yogurt, cheese, fruit, meats, pastries, breads, croissants, cereals, water, milk, juices, and more! It has a great location just near the train station. 5-10 minutes walk. All the major sites are not far. We walked everywhere except to the appian way and Vatican. Metro stop is close by if you prefer. The metro is fast and efficient. The hotel can reserve restaurants for you, but we found in mid to late may that it was not necessary at all. Do yourself a favor and try navona note for the best pizza on a back street near the piazza navona. Our room was a classic and was big even by European standards. Cleaned each day and restocked with waters and sodas and beer in the free mini bar. That saved us money there! The bathroom was large and a nice shower and tub. The toiletries they gave you were of nice quality - more than just shampoo but body lotions and bubble bath too. It was a nice touch. Everyone was super friendly and we would hands down stay at this hotel again in the future when visiting Rome. Not just for the friendliness, but the great location, amenities, quiet rooms, and nice price deals available too! Oh, and the Internet was fast and worked well. It was reliable and very nice to have!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by warmth and friendliness of staff”
Reviews.Author: Abigail02
Reviews.Content: All three of us were very impressed by the welcome and the warmth and friendliness of all the staff at Hotel Artemide. We also loved the breakfasts - my sons highlights were the range of croissants, pastries and pancakes and then fruit to make us feel healthy! The rooms were very spacious - the only slight downside being that it was a bit noisy on the front but we got used to that and the fact that it was so well placed more than made up for it. We were able to walk to all the sights including Vatican City and now feel like we know that part of Rome very well. We would certainly recommend it to any family and friends visiting Rome and would love to go back there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to explore Rome from”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner a few days ago and we were very happy with it. From the hotel it was less than an hour walking to many sites, or a 5 minute walk to the metro station. On our last night there we walked back from dinner in Trastavere and it took about 40 minutes! Via nazionale is a busy street but the room was quiet and comfortable, and very clean. It could probably be updated but we were happy with it. Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was great (and included in the price). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Treatment & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Island04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the middle of Central Rome, we walked everywhere. Our room was larger than most hotels in the area & the front desk staff went out of their way to help with directions and restaurant recommendations. Our room had a welcome letter addressed to us with a complementary bottle of wine, the mini-fridge is also stocked daily with complementary beer, water, juice and soda pop. The daily buffet breakfast was delicious and filling. It was offered to us at no additional charge, even though we didn't sign up for it on their website. The outdoor rooftop restaurant/lounge was a great spot to unwind at the end of the day. It was well worth the money to have a clean, comfortable room, & wonderful queen size bed to come back to after an exhausting day on the streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: luh11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide from 3rd-7th June, in a double room on the 4th floor. The hotel is located in the Quirinale district and within 10-25 minutes walk of all the tourist sights. Just walking down the Via Nazionale, turn left after the museum and at the end of the road....there's the Colleseum! Turn right through the tunnel and you're heading towards the Trevi Fountain and most of the other sights which are close together.We even managed to negotiate our way on foot through the back streets from the hotel to the Vatican and back, which is closer than you think if you read the map properly (head for the Castle then turn left!). We also used the 110 open tourist bus, which is a great idea for a tour to get your bearings around the city before you set out on foot. You can also decide from this what you want to go back and take a closer look at. It's €20 per person, and lasts 48hours for repeated hop on/off use. The staff at the hotel are lovely, very friendly and happy to help you make the most of your stay in Rome, especially reception who helped book a tour for us and reconfirm our shuttle transfer back to the airport. The room was a reasonable size, if a little dark, no noise from the street that we experienced. If you are British, beware there are only news channels in English. The pay per view movies are pretty recent, €5 a go. Feel free to send me a message if you have any specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay-would highly recommend the Artimede and can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: trvldrms2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Artimede Roma for eigth nights in May. We picked this hotel because of the great reviews from other travelers, and and our raves to the list. The hotel was centrally located-an easy walk to buses, train and walkable to many sights for most people. (I have a pain condition, so for the most part we took the buses with no problems). Our room was spacious and very clean. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel -or anywheare for that matter! The breakfast buffet was very bountiful and delicious each day. The complimentary items in the room bar were a huge help each day -a very nice touch that really helped to make our stay more pleasant and memorable. Our every need and wish was met beyond our expectations. The entire staff from the front desk, bellhop, breakfast staff and host, cleaning staff were very kind, professional and helpful. We had dinner at their rooftop restaurant after a particularly long day of sightseeing, and it was very enjoyable and relaxing. To sum up, I was very impressed with this hotel-it was all that I hoped for and our home away from home in Rome. P.S. Rome was amazing! A must see.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rome base”
Reviews.Author: 2011Doc
Reviews.Content: Great base for touring Rome. We stayed there twice (either side of a tour of the south of Italy) and both rooms were small but comfortable. The first time we were at the back of the hotel and it was surprisingly quiet. For the second stay we were at the front of the hotel and there was a gentle hum of passing traffic. Didn't affect our sleep, but those that need perfect quiet may prefer a room at the back. Staff were always friendly - and free access to the daily-stocked beer, water, soft drink, nuts and biscuits in the minibar was appreciated. Free wireless internet and daily newspaper were also bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Travellomaniac
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find anything to complain about after staying at the Hotel Artemide. However, it's equally difficult to find anything to justify a 2nd visit. To summarize, this is the essence of our stay: The good: - Waiting in our room upon arrival was a complimentary bottle of Italian red wine with compliments from the hotel manager as we had informed the hotel that this was our anniversary (nice touch, appreciated). - Free WiFi and minibar are also appreciated, beats some other European hotels (I've been charged up to £15/day for internet access). - Upon arrival we discovered that the drain in the bathroom sink appeared to be clogged. We informed the receptionist before going out for a walk, and came back to find everything in order. - The bathroom was very nice - spacious and with the combined shower/bathtub you're hoping for when you see the pictures on their website. The ok - Service was good, can't complain, can't say we were amazed either. One of the bell boys and one of the receptionists (young guy who tipped us on local markets) stood out a bit from the rest. - Beds were ok, from reviews of other hotels they seem to have been the usual Italian kind. - Breakfast, which has been raved about in other reviews, was unfortunately also just ok. The selection was adequate, the quality was ok, but it didn't live up to our expectations as it seemed to be a high point of this hotel judging from other reviews. - The location isn't bad, but not ideal if you wish to mainly be walking between the different sights. About 10 minutes from Termini, 10-15 minutes from the Fontana di Trevi, 15-20 minutes from most other sights like Piazza Navona, Piazza di Spagna etc. The not so good - The TV in the room (yes, it's a minor detail) suffered from an incredibly long latency. All in all we had a pleasant stay, but for the price (approximately €250/night for a double room) there was the expectation of something to make it stand out a bit from the rest, unfortunately we didn't find that at Hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Excellent Staff & Service”
Reviews.Author: Sue&Kev1
Reviews.Content: Agree with all good things already said re this hotel, if returning would definitely stay again. Not a 'luxury' hotel as such but for the price they were very nice rooms (we had superior which was very spacious, clean and comfortable with all the nice touches as referred to in other reviews). Rome is expensive so our room at an average of €248 per night B&B I feel was reasonable. If there was one area for improvement all I could think of would be the slow service on the roof terrace when it didn't look actually very busy, but not a real issue unless you are in a rush, which we weren't! Maybe take some earplugs if you're light sleepers in a front facing room, did the trick for us! These are small details only though... really liked the hotel and the staff went above and beyond to make you feel welcome. In fact I'd go as far as to say it was one of the best service experiences we've received in any European hotel, and we've stayed in many. Special thanks to Alessandro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TedsMum40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, had friendly and helpful staff, a lovely breakfast and well equipped (if a little small) rooms. The bed was surely the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in! The roof-top terrace was a lovely place to enjoy a glass or two of Prosecco in the evening, and the prices were reasonable considering the location. The breakfast was good, with a large selection of breakfasts to suit every mood - and the hot chocolate was delicious. I would stay here again without any hesitation and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great hotel in a fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenAsher
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff.... Perfect central location near many sites! Free minibar is a real perk! Highly recommended to all potential travelers.........

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I have ever stayed in perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonamadLizzie
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from The Artemide due to TripAdvisors recommendation, so glad I changed my hotel to this one it really is the most perfect hotel,staff wonderful especially Matteo who arranged a birthday cake and champagne for my friends birthday for free!! breakfast was in another league for the choice, rooms lovely and big, bed soo comfortable couldn't fault anything with this hotel just wish I was back living there permanently!! will always stay here no hesitation for future Rome trips without doubt brilliant memories

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all the way around”
Reviews.Author: SandraAnneSanDiego
Reviews.Content: As everyone has said this is a great hotel with great service. Friendly, helpful and fun. Our room smelled like smoke and I have allergies so Mateo moved us to a suite at the front of the hotel. Gorgeous room with a balcony. Comfortable bed and great bath and shower. Great location. Very quiet even though on a busy street. Definitely would stay here again! Thank you for taking such good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! Comfortable rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: twiggers77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days in May 2011. We originally booked a double and were upgraded to a larger corner room with our own private balcony (1st floor). Not sure why, but we'll take it...especially given how expensive it was (compared to US hotels). We arrived quite early (10 AM) and our room was not ready, but they stored our bags. We came back at 1 PM and everything was ready. They walked us to our room and showed us how to work everything. The room was great. We had a hallway and the bathroom was VERY large with a toilet, bidet, tub with shower. Good water pressure and always had hot water. The bed was comfortable. Nice, comfy down comforter and soft pillows. Hubby said the bed was a little hard, but not horrible. Mini fridge was free. Had Italian beer, still water, bubble water, orange/peach juice, regular coke, and regular fanta (no diet). Some biscuits and nuts. Refilled every day. Flat screen TV with limited English channels. Really nothing but news was available (we knew this and downloaded movies before we left). Breakfast was included and it was just OK. The scrambled eggs were runny. But it's a hotel, what more can you expect? We ate a lot of toast :-) Location was great. Lots of shopping nearby and lots of restaurants. The hotel always recommends one right down the street and it was VERY good. Gelato also nearby. Colloseum was 15-20 minute walk. Trevi fountain about the same. Termini was about 10 minutes. Bus stop was a block away and then it was about a 10 minute bus ride to the Pantheon and 15-20 minutes to the Vatican. Overall, I was VERY happy with my decision. My only regret was not being a little closer to the heart of the touristy areas. But my husband needed certain amenities and this was the hotel that fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel .....well located”
Reviews.Author: golffla
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! It was clean, comfortable, well appointed and reasonably priced in a great location with great service! I've been in the hotel business for 40 years and enjoy it when a hotel not only meets but exceeds your expectations. My wife and I love to walk so we chose this hotel because of it's centralized location. 15 to 20 minute walk or less to most major attraction sites. The service was great and the staffs recommendations for dining were excellent. There are more expensive hotels available but this is a first class experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Staff Friendly, Breakfast Great!”
Reviews.Author: VeneziaGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this property. Here are our Pros and Cons: Pros: *Good, central location - easy to walk to sites, catch a cab or use the metro & bus *Staff friendly & helpful - all were bilingual - knowledgeable about the City *Hot Water & Good Water Pressure *Clean, comfortable room *Breakfast was included -- scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pastries, breads, hard boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, coffee to order, fruits, etc. GREAT! *Fridge in the room *Pharmacy & Grocery within two blocks Cons: *We were in one of the larger, corner rooms - no internet service reached the room unless we stood in the hallway. Yes, we could have stood in the hall or gone to the lobby, but -- inconvenient when we had planned to use the internet in the room. *Metal shutters that are noise-reducers outside the windows at night were broken. Maintenance explained the whole hotel had broken shutters. This caused the police sirens, fire sirens, etc. to be very loud every day & night. We got used to it -- but, be aware. We will come back to this hotel again. Good value and we liked the location. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cook69
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night but could not fault it. Rooms were clean,bathroom was of a good size for Rome with a good range of products supplied, Bed was firm(which we like) pillows were feather and down,Breakfast was ideal, staff were great-very helpful and spoke English well, hotel was in a great location for walking every where touristy, for shopping and eating out. You need to spend more tin Europe than would in other countries so your money does not go as far, but this was worth what they charge by Rome standards. Would stay here again. Just don't expect a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Premier location, great service, so-so restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: coolmoris00
Reviews.Content: Without repeating other travelers' comments I will stress out the most important ones: probably one of the best locations in Rome (lots of shopping boutiques), very good customer service, fast check in- out, roof terrace is good for a drink or two but not for dining, unless one is very hungry and it's pouring outside, free wifi. Theater Dell Opera is 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and this hotel was better than expected mainly due to the outstanding buffet breakfast that had many types of hot & cold food. The room & bathroom were adequate. Complimentary drinks & snacks was a surprise. We also were very satisfied with the restaurant - good food and service. Very good value. Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic service and location”
Reviews.Author: Rusty_NO
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor and we just loved it !! We stayed for 3 nights.The service was fantastic. Staff always smiling and helpful on every request for touristinfo. They booked us on guided tours, resturants, car service to airport and more. We stayed at rom 419, and it had good sound-isolation. No noice from traffic or from other rooms. Free softdrinks/beer in the mini-bar. Free Wi-Fi with good availability The breakfast was great... ate there every moring. Location was fantastic ... in walking distance to shopping and a lot of attractions (ps: bring good shoes) We will surely return upon our next stay in Rome. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our Rome weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ersol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our weekend break in Rome. The best feature was the knowledge, enthusiasm and courtesy shown by the reception staff - it could not be faulted. Our room faced the Via Nazionale on the 4th floor, where we had a great view, very comfortable extra large bed, decent bathroom, and free mini bar! The breakfasts were comprehensive and the service was swift and efficient. We hope to go back!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN A PRIME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ang12333
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel as we were early and our room was not quite ready we were given our complimentary drink token and sat up on the roof terrace bar until we could check in. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and all members of staff were polite, friendly and could not do enough for you. Our room was clean, spacious and had the added extra of the free minibar along with the usual tea/coffee making facilities which were re-stocked every day. The breakfast was good quality with a varied choice which was great to fill up before a day round Rome. The hotel was within easy reach of all the major sights and we walked to/from most of them and did not use the metro although this was near the hotel. We had an enjoyable 3 nights in rome made even better by our stay at the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jwatt1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the reviews on here. It was a really enjoyable stay. We stayed in room 101 and you can hear traffic outside although it is not loud enough to bother you. The walls are soundproofed so you do not hear any noise from other rooms. The room was a good size, the bed is super comfy and the hotel give you all you need for a comfortable stay. They even gave us a bottle of wine with a message to wish my husband a happy 40th birthday which was a lovely surprise. The hotel is in a central location and the staff are polite and very helpful - nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast was good, and the free mini-bar in the room is great! We had 2 lovely nights there and I would thoroughly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: sndabroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artemide from 13th of may for three nights with my wife ,daughters and their partners. from first entering the hotel,all staff were very attentive,front of house on check in were quick at their job,and helpful throughout our stay with any info needed,only ate breakfast at the hotel,but this was plentiful,and a good standard of food to please everybody.All staff especially the barman always greeted you with a smile. Rooms were of a reasonable size,with everything you would need,and kept to a good style and quality,including mini bar fridge,which is included in the price and restocked daily. Location ideal for main attractions.If its Rome,its the Artemide for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in central Roma”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide is centrally located in Rome within easy walking distance of major attractions such as the Colosseum and Roman Forum. We had booked a standard room which was ample for the four nights. All rooms have free mini bar usage including 2x soft drinks, 5x bottles of water, juice, snacks and 2x cans of beer, all restocked daily. Upon arrival a 20% discount is offered for the rooftop restaurant as well as a glass of prosecco for each person for free. On the first night our Airconditioner broke down (it made a loud noise when on) so we were upgraded to a junior suite and offered a free drink at the hotel bar as an apology - very nice. The second room was larger than our first with a separate lounge and a spa bath. Staff were all very nice and very professional. Breakfast is offered in the breakfast room and includes a cooked and continental offering. In all a great stay at a very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaGoSooners
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Artemide Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. The breakfast was outstanding. The location was pretty good. The street was kind of busy with shopping and pretty far from most of the tourist attractions. It was about two blocks to the train station, so that was convenient. Wi-fi was available for a small fee. This was our favorite hotel in Italy. The bed was a little hard for my taste and the room could have been a little cooler, but I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Ollyviews
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Artemide, for a long weekend to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. I'd read all the reviews about how helpful the staff are......and it's true, from the warm welcome (& glass of bubbly)nothing is too much trouble for the attentive but not intrusive staff. The staff are beyond helpful and friendly, service really does come with a smile. The hotel is ideally situated for all the major Rome attractions and the metro and rail stations are nearby if you want to venture further away. The room was extremely comfy, large bed, free mini bar, toiletries all replenished daily. Rome itself was wonderful, I was concerned about pick pockets etc but need not have worried - as long as you're sensible you should be okay & the city is well served with police which are on almost every street corner. All in all an wonderful few days & we hope to go back and will definately stay at the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: perrubud
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a very convenient touristic area ideal for first time visitors to Rome or those in Rome for a short stay. Rooms were comfortable, service more than affable, and breakfasts extremely generous. Our positive stay was marred by one thing, which was soundproofing between our room and our neighbor. At eleven thirty at night, we could hear his television program to the point of knowing what language it was in. We asked the hotel to help and they could not have been more helpful. They sent a staff member to the room in question to ask the person to turn it down, which eventually worked. However, the hotel brochures state the rooms are 100% soundproofed, which is obviously not the case. We heard no street or outside noises, however as we were on a courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieandMarc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very convenient location. The hotel is not spectacular but it is good and the staff was helpful. You can't beat the location

Reviews.Title: “The icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: threadsofawen
Reviews.Content: I booked Artemide Hotel as a surprise birthday present for my Husband... I'm glad I did, we were both more than happy with this hotel. The staff at reception were welcoming and friendly. They gave helpful advice and the one request we had (an extra pillow) was dealt with promptly. The little touches, for example the welcome drink when we arrived, added to our stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. (we booked the economy double room). I left the window open at night and had no trouble sleeping as there was very little noise outside our window, despite the hotel being on a main road. The free mini bar was a welcome addition as the temperature at night was very warm and the cool drinks in the room were refreshing ! For sightseeing it was ideal. We walked everywhere and from the hotel we were approximately 10 to 20 minutes walk from most of the popular sights such as the Colosseum, the forum, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps. The train station from the airport was only a 10 minute walk. We feel we couldn't have stayed at a better hotel. Rome was amazing and when we return for our next trip we are going to book this hotel again. I would feel comfortable recommending Artemide Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: svm38
Reviews.Content: This hotel got a 5 star rating from both of us for the staff's superb service. Nothing was too much trouble and for the three nights/four days we spent our honeymoon there there was nothing we could fault them or the hotel on.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: CEHBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Hotel Artemide. The staff was very friendly, an full of great recommendations and tips on how to best navigate the city. The rooms were comfortable, more spacious than I was expecting, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Townsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during a recent trip to Italy. The hotel is in a nice central location that is within walking distance of most things - 10 minutes from the train terminal, 10 minutes to the Colleseum and Forum, 15 minutes to the spanish step, 20 minutes to the Pantheon, took us 45 minutes to walk over to the Vatican (but we're fast walkers). The rooms were nice, but nothing really fancy - ours was quiet with a comfortable bed and lots of space. The hotel stocks the minibar with water, pop and beer which are free - great idea and not sure why more hotels don't do this. We received a bottle of wine on arrival as well. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel With Great Service and Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSteve_o
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in many places, but this one takes the cake. To be brief: you are out of your mind if you don't stay here. The service was amazing - from the desk staff who were always pleasant and helpful with maps, change for the subway and helpful advice, to the bellman who took time to explain everything about our room. We really recommend this hotel and were really surprised at how quiet our room was and how comfortable our bed was. The free stocked mini bar didn't even enter into the equation but was a nice touch (water on tours was great). Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice (hot, cold, pastries, fresh juice, fresh fruit, with a choice of espresso, cappuccino, regular coffee, etc.). Wireless internet is free. To top it off, the bartender (Eugenio) has travelled the world and is a great person to spend time with. The Manager even left a bottle of wine in our room with a nice note and was able to upgrade us for our anniversary. The bottom line: everyone here is proud of their hotel and has good reason to be. It's convenient to the subway and you can walk to attractions if you want. We really recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: cal260
Reviews.Content: athis was the best hotel we stayed in in Italy. Complimentary drink on arrival, complimentary bottle of wine and free fridge offerings. Excellent breakfast. We ate in the dining room each night and found the food and service was top class.

Reviews.Title: “Top-quality 4* hotel near Piazza della Repubblica and Stazione Termini”
Reviews.Author: atwc
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We stayed 4 nights. The room was spacious, attractively furnished, quiet and comfortable. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was unusually varied and of very high quality. Very well run hotel. We'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: tmhs
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Rome and experienced great service at Hotel Artemide. The employees in the reception provided excellent service when it came to restaurant recommendations and bookings. They were really friendly and outmost servcieminded. The hotel has nice rooms, clean and well equipped. The hotel even spotted my birthdaydate in my passport and brougth cake and champagne to my room in the morning of my birthday as a greeting from the hotel! Through my job as a personal assistant I have been in contact with many hotels in Europe and Hotel Artemide gave a very good impression!

Reviews.Title: “20th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LeonelMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th anniversary here. They gave us a bottle of excellent chianti and treated us like royalty. The staff especially, Mario are fantastic! We frequent the Four Seasons, Ritz, and Park Hyatts when we travel. This establishment has nothing to envy. Food Is great too! L. Vasquez, Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “The Artemide Hotel saved our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: tboxwit
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've written on trip advisor, but since this was the best hotel experience in my life I have to write one. I was impressed with the staff, rooms, hotel ambience, food, bar and location before the accident, but I didn't know the level and importance of customer service until my new bride broke her ankle while touring Rome on only the second day of our eleven day honeymoon. She couldn't walk ten yards even with crutches. We don't speak Italian and I was worried about finding a rental wheelchair on short notice. The hotel front desk handled everything extremely well by helping my wife change many of our travel plans and by loaning us a mobile wheelchair for the remaining 8 days of our trip. They didn't have a wheelchair, they quickly purchased one in a few hours and got it to the hotel. I was thinking a rental would be at least 400 euros and they loaned it for free, no questions asked. We travelled with the wheelchair thoughout Tuscany. So if you want to stay at an excellent Hotel and enjoy 5 star quality, the Artemide Hotel could be your best friend in Rome, like they are mine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but really the best in Rome ?”
Reviews.Author: Discerningtravel07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four four nights at the beginning of May. We booked a junior suite, thinking we would splash out. The room was nice and well decorated, the bathroom worked, the bed was very comfortable and the staff always helpful. The breakfast is very good. However, our room was on the third floor, overlooking Via Nazionale which, for those who don't know Rome, is a busy thoroughfare both day and night. The double glazing to the windows was not up to the job and we needed earplugs to sleep which was disappointing for the price we paid. Hotel Artemide is unquestionably a good hotel but the Tripadvisor rating implies it is the best in Rome and I find that difficult to believe.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: The Artemide meets all one's expectations of a four-star hotel; it does not exceed them. Our room was smallish but had a good size bathroom and was very well decorated and equipped. It overlooked an unattractive courtyard but was quiet. The staff were all professional and helpful. Although service at the bar was often slow in coming, I suspect that was because the barman had other duties, like room service, to attend to. But he was a delight when he arrived. Best breakfast that we encountered in two weeks in Italy! Returning hot and footsore, from a day of walking, we were so looking forward to taking a couple of cold beers up to the roof garden "with fabulous views" as described in the in-room brochure. Imagine our disappointment to find it closed for renovation! Within minutes of us advising the front desk of our displeasure, a written apology and a bottle of wine from Ms Spaltro, Hotel Manager, was delivered to our room. Full marks for responsiveness and caring.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pambellina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-placed for a sightseeing trip to Rome - central, within easy reach of the nearest metro and walking distance to Termini (the main railway station) as well as some of the key sights, including the Capitol, the Pantheon and the Coliseum/Forum/Palatine Hill. On a busy main street, with a handsome entrance between stores, it is nonetheless, a peaceful haven inside. Our room was on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel, and was air-conditioned and quiet. It was well-stocked with a free mini-bar( beer, juice, water and coke/fanta) , coffee and tea-making facilities and various snacks. The room felt spacious and was elegantly decorated. The bed was so comfortable that we never wanted to get up! Breakfast was included in our rate and was an excellent buffet, including hot food (sausages, eggs, bacon, beans), cold buffet ( cold meats and cheeses), various breads and patisseries (toast, croissants, small pancakes, doughnuts, tarts, cakes), cereals, juices and fresh fruit. A complimentary daily newspaper was delivered to the room and there was free internet access which was very useful for sightseeing information. The service was uniformly very good, efficient and friendly. Staff were attentive, smiling and helpful. The reception staff spoke English well, and were knowledgeable about local matters. The bar was a lovely place to unwind on our first night after a day of travelling, and the barman was charming and attentive. The cocktails were good and all drinks were delivered to the table with a tray of mixed snacks ( nuts, pretzels, etc). Our only slight criticism was of the restaurant in the evening which was a bit disappointing. We decided to eat there after our first day of sightseeing, rather than going out, which was probably rather unimaginitive. The restaurant was very quiet and lacked atmosphere, and the food was fine, but not very inspiring. The other high point was the beautiful, old-fashioned lift just off the entrance/reception area - we seemed to be the only people using it during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eastyellow
Reviews.Content: The room was to small (smallest I've ever stayed in- seriously), the shower wasn't working 100% and it took some practice to work out how the toilet worked. All of this would be ok for a 3 star hotel -but for a four star? The location was good, but not perfect - a 10+min walk to everything. Breakfast was good, service and cleanliness were both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelfiendNJ
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the beginning of our trip at the Artemide and loved everything about it. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful and informative. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy. The room was lovely and well-appointed. The free mini-bar and wifi were a plus. The location was perfect. We spent another night at the end of our trip and the experience was just as wonderful and we received a very warm welcome back as well as an upgrade. The Artemide deserves the high ratings it consistently receives on Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “English language friendly hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike_B_077
Reviews.Content: Booked direct on a half price room offer for stays over three nights, making the superior room pretty good value. The staff were warm and friendly, the location just a short walk from the rail and bus station and convenient for exploring central Rome. Good breakfast; really stocked up for the day and didn't need lunch. Really good, strong, hot shower which was bliss. The bed was seriously comfortable - nice and firm with just enough give in it. Slept like a baby... Fairly standard fare with regard to the room and bathroom, no views and internal facing windows in 311. Satellite TV, but only news channels in English. Great to be able to use the water and soft drinks in the mini bar each day as part of the room deal, and plenty of snacks too. Free WiFi worked well. I'd probably have given higher marks if I hadn't just stayed in a fantastic Sofitel the night before flying out... now that was five star! Still, for what it is - a small, friendly four star kind of place - then I'd recommend a stay based upon our experience. It was a great location from which to explore Rome, which is fantastic. 'Very good' sums up our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: kgosalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and loved everything about it. The service was fabulous. I would call them for something and would hear a knock on the door in the next 5 minutes. They stock the fridge with beer, bottled water, soda, juice etc. every day and everything is free. Same for the cookies. Internet is free as well and they provided beverage coupons for the bar downstairs! The location is great and we could walk to most of the places. We took a taxi to some of the locations and it didn't cost much. We did it because it was easier to do so with my daughter. The concierge we talked to were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We wanted to buy wine and biscotti and he gave us directions to various options and all of the suggestions were great. All in all, I would absolutely stay here again if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lupinrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide over the Easter weekend and LOVED the hotel despite our very early impressions. Firstly, the hotel is on a busy road which made me worry that the rooms would be noisy... I had no need to fear. The rooms were beautifully quiet and I had no problems sleeping (I can be a light sleeper). Secondly, at check in we were told that the card we'd secured the booking with had expired (we booked months and months in advance and hadn't realised) and that they would have resold our room if we hadn't turned up within the next two hours - not the best welcome - and this is despite us emailing the week beforehand to confirm our reservation and receiving a response from them that all was fine and they were expecting us. Apart from these two early worries, the hotel was wonderful. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed was very comfortable, the toiletries were of a fantastic standard and plentiful (the hair conditioner was particularly good) and the free mini bar that was replenished every day was a great bonus - there was beer, coke, fanta, water, salteens, biscuits, peanuts, wafers, tea and coffee. There was even a bottle of wine to welcome us. They did a turn down service two of the three nights, with chocolates on one night and mini Easter eggs the next with a 'Happy Easter' card from the manager. A lovely touch. We also had the free welcome-glass of prosecco at the bar. Very nice too. However, the very best thing about this hotel is the breakfast... It has to be seen to be believed. The selection is astounding. At least five cakes, pastries, cheese, hams, salamis, eggs, bacon, sausages, mushrooms, tomatoes, breads, jams, mozzarella, yoghurt, fresh fruit galore and you simply must not miss the freshly squeezed orange juice. Oh my. That was good. They bring you a cappuccino to your table and ask if you'd like another when you've finished. The staff are so polite and incredibly efficient, the food is replenished regularly and it is all orchestrated by the wonderful breakfast manager. He was our favourite member of staff - the best at the hotel. He was very welcoming, had a great sense of humour and somehow managed to keep the busy breakfast time ticking over brilliantly whilst still having time for a smile and a joke with us. The location of the hotel is about a fifteen to twenty minute walk of all the major sites and only just over a five minute walk to the station which was perfect for us as we were taking the train to Florence for the next leg of our Italian tour. If we go back to Rome, we'll definitely stay here again. The Artemide was comfortable, quiet and incredibly hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: monkeyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here, having read the reviews. Stayed there with my sister and elderly mum for 4 nights. It's a nice hotel, with a central locations, close to main attractions. However the staff were not as friendly as I expected. Our check in was fine but I wouldn't say it was a warm welcome at all. No real greeting at all. Generally we didn't feel there was much interest shown in us. Same with bar staff. We popped in to the bar a few times and we had to hang around a bit for the barman to appear. I would call the service perfunctory. Staff at breakfast were much warmer, efficient and brilliant selection at breakfast. We had dinner in the hotel two times during our stay. First time, the food and service was great, the second time however it was like we were in a different hotel. The food was not great and we waited 50 mins for out dinner with no acknowledgement that this was a long wait, despite the fact that there was only about 3 other tables. This was our last night in Rome and it was hard not to be sad that we didn't have a nice last dinner experience. The room are large, but be warned that they are very warm at night. Nice touches with chocolates and mini bar. All in all, a good hotel but let down but I was very let down by the lack of interest shown to me and my family as guests.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best. Must stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: VinTris
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon was made extra special by this hotel. In fact were still here and were reviewing it already because theyre amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HIDogLover
Reviews.Content: Artemide Hotel wrote the book on excellence. From the moment you step through the doors, you are greeted by a friendly but professional front desk and bell service. Clearly, they understand the meaning of customer service. The hotel decor is simple but tasteful w/ all of the amenities that a visitor would appreciate - ample toiletries in the bathroom, robe and slippers, a safe, a mini-bar stocked w/ water, beer, sodas, and treats which come in handy for those tours of Rome's best attractions or afterwards when you are trying to relax in the comfort of your room. The complimentary breakfast buffet is also spectacular - juices, coffee, pastries to tantalize your tastebuds, scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, and even a salad bar w/ cheeses and salamis. The location is a short walking distance from the train station and the hotel is situated on a major street for shopping. And yes, the Colosseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps are all a short walking distance away. Let Artemide Hotel serve as your home away from home in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iriscin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April/May 2011 during a very busy time in an already very busy city (it was the Beatification of Pope John Paul the II - something we did not know until we arrived in Rome!). That said, you would have thought we were the only guests in what was a full up hotel, the other reviews you read are true - they are that good. The staff was friendly, helpful and willing to give suggestions. The bartender was spot on and fun to talk with. The rooms are good size for Rome standards, small compared to US size, but rated next to others in Italy in the same star catagory they are larger with good sized bathrooms, clean-modern design and fixtures. Even being on a very busy Street it was cozy in the room and you could not hear the outside noise. The free breakfast had many choices and the free wi-fi as well as free mini-bar add up in a city where a Water/Coke is commonly $3-$4 euro per bottle/can. They helped to make the hotel an overall top value compared to others we have stayed at in Italy. The location is great, right in the heart of the old city. 15 minute walk to the most the sites and 25 minute walk to the further out areas, like the Vatician. We walked alot, but it was also only a few blocks from the main Metro stop with the Red and Blue Lines if you were feeling tired or lazy :) The front desk was very helpful in getting reservations to local resturants, telling us spots to see and even arranged for a car service to take us to the airport at the same cost a taxi would have been!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jraill
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent as was the food in the restaurant and the only downside was that the classic rooms were very small, but they did manage to upgrade us despite the hotel being very full. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - friendly, warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: copsy25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel run by staff who care. The room was large and nicely furnished. The only slight concern was a little traffic noise, but that's Rome bambino. Breakfast was great. Nothing was too much trouble for the front desk and the bell boys. It's well located for the main train station and all the sights. Simply put - highly recommended. It deserves the excellent ratings it gets on here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: gordykathom
Reviews.Content: A stay here is great. Nothing to worry about. Your every comfort is cared for. Worth every penny. Breakfast is very good and don't forget they will bring you expresso as many as you want, just ask for it. I could go on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Was in the cheapest, smallest room yet it was still really good!”
Reviews.Author: TheQuietObserver
Reviews.Content: I prefice this by saying we booked a late deal in which we only had a standard room so expectations were not high however this hotel really does deserve all the good things said about it. We had the smallest room standard room booked which face onto a courtyard. The Room: Well furnished and modern fittings, air conditioning, a large double bed and spare pillow, large TV with movies and internet. Desk with chair, safe, large closet space and a very nice bathroom which was stocked daily with complimentary shampoo, body wash, lotion, shower cap, amenities and fresh towels daily. The mini bar is complimentary in the hotel and is stocked daily, WIFI is also free throughout and they serve breakfast in your room plus your chosen newspaper. The Hotel: Very clean and well presented with an art deco theme throughout. Breakfast was included and although the room where you eat it is small and suffers slightly when busy service did not suffer at all despite being very busy. The breakfast was varied and catered for most tastes. Drinks in the hotel range from 6 euros for a beer to 10 euros for a cocktail, upon arrival every guest was given a coupon for a free cappuccino or glass of champagne free at the bar. A very good map is provided by concierge of all the sites and they have a buzzer to hail a taxi whenever you need it. The Location: It is walking distance to all the major attractions however I would suggest either best walking shoes on or cab a little way. A cab to the vatican or spanish steps or colosseum is 8-10 euros. There was a problem with the TV and after reporting the problem to the repair man fixing it and leaving elapsed all of about 7 minutes so really good customer service. The only downsides to the hotel is the fact that there is a really poor choice of TV channels in any language quite frankly. Conclusion: A great hotel for your rome city break.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: malcolm911
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful, friendly and professional. check in very easy. Room appeared newly refurbished, facing the inner courtyard, so although no view was very quiet. No noise from other rooms. Room and bathroom although not the largest were big enough, Kingsize bed was very comfortable. Free mini bar consisting of water, soft drinks, beer and a bottle of wine a very nice touch, as were chocolates and the useful shampoo, shower gel freebies. Nice breakfast choice and even made up a breakfast to take away for an early start. Good location, walked to everything from there, including the vatican! loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CardiffZorro
Reviews.Content: Like many others we really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Artemide. We had pre-booked a superior room for 4 nights, and via e-mail had requested a quiet room - and we were not disappointed. Rome is a brilliant city and we were able to walk from the hotel to the Forum, Colloseum, Vatican, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain which was really great, and taxis back from restaurants/drinks after midnight were all less than 10 euros. Hotel was spotless, king-sized bed exceptionally comfortable and the bathroom very good, with good products and robes etc. The rooms are certainly not cheap but they are very comfortable and bar prices are less expensive than most other bars we visited. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay at Artemide when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not out of this world”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIrelandRosie
Reviews.Content: It is hard to say much bad about the Artemide. The staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms clean and well appointed, the location is fine in that most tourist attractions are walkable from there but it is hard to see it as the second best hotel in Rome as per the Tripadvisor ratings and no doubt many people - including me - booked on that basis. It is however a bog standard four star hotel with very little personality - the rooms are comfortable but characterless. Like a previous reviewer the rooms along the Via Nazionale are noisy at all times - ear plugs helped and the breakfast though perfectly adequate was disappointing. Very little fresh fruit, unappetising hot eggs/bacon and a poor toaster. I didn't find it great value for money but then again compared to other Roman hotels this may be wonderful. If you are looking for an adequate, clean, safe base with helpful staff then I recommend it but for any Roman character, quaintess or a quiet haven it isn't the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, great location and great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: orangeyellow
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who travel to rome. First, it IS in the center of everything as the hotel claims itself. Since I travel with my two boys - 10 and 9, we had to take taxi most of the time and the price is always within 10 euros except Vatican. The breakfast has everything including hot and cold food plus 5 choices of juices - orange, grapefruit, multivitamin, mix and pineapple. We really enjoy the breakfast very much. There were two morning we were leaving the hotel early for Pompeii and Pisa. The hotel very nicely prepare us breakfast in a bag which we brought with us on the road. The food selection in the bag was also incredible - water, cheese, bread, cookies, jam etc. There is even free soft drinks in the room fridge - cokes, fanta, water and juice. There is also a convenient store near by on the via Nationale nearby where you can get things such as drinks, cookies, fresh fruits, milk etc. We tried the room service once and it was great. The most important thing about this hotel is it's service. They have the most efficient and friendly staff in the world which I would highly recommend. Every time I made a call for some help, their people always turned up in front of our room in 1 miniute. And the problem is always solved within seconds. We really like this hotel and would recommend anybody who is visiting Rome is the near future.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: jobje123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated at the Via Nazionale not far from the station and bus stop(open 110 tourist bus). The staff is very friendly. But, the rooms on the street side are very noisy due to old windows that don't close properly and let the street noise come in, and this is a busy street even at night. breakfast and the restaurant are ok but not extraordinary. This is just an avarage four star hotel to European standard. Main plus is the location and the very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our high expectations -- terrific hotel in central location!”
Reviews.Author: WMK3
Reviews.Content: Our family went to Rome for the first time for my husband's 50th birthday, so we wanted to stay somewhere special. Hotel Artemide exceeded our high expectations (based on all the positive reviews on this site) and provided a very comfortable, friendly, central base for our sightseeing. The hotel itself is just the right size -- big enough to provide all the services you might need and small enough to be friendly and personal. The staff is superb -- everyone we met was helpful, efficient, and friendly no matter what the request or need. In particular, our son woke up the first morning with a case of allergic conjunctivitis in his eye. With just a few days in Rome, we did not relish the idea of spending half a day in an emergency room to get medicine. The front desk staff helped us arrange a private doctor (via the Roma Pass -- get it, it's worth it!) to come to the hotel. But in the end, we didn't even need the doctor because the hotel recommended we check with the pharmacist across the street (who speaks English) -- so we did just that, got the medicine (which is usually only available by prescription in the US), cancelled the doctor appointment, and were able to enjoy most of the day as planned. The front desk also helped with dinner reservations, airport transportation, etc. and were also extremely prompt in their email correspondence leading up to our visit. We had two rooms for five of us (a standard double and a triple), which was perfect. We all appreciated the free mini-bar (especially the excellent chocolate cookie wafers), free WiFi, and free newspapers. The hotel also gave us a lovely bottle of wine and a nice note for my husband's birthday. Very clean, elegant rooms -- not very large by US standards, but large by European standards. The location was perfect for exploring most of the ancient Rome sights -- we walked almost everywhere except the Vatican. With three kids, it was essential that we have a place to rest in the middle of the day if we needed to. Via Nacionale is a very busy, central street, but our rooms were very quiet (it faced away from the street). We ate at a few neighborhood restaurants, and all were very good. The breakfast buffet was a huge hit with all of us -- there was something for everyone (a big plus for people with children), and ensured that we had a lot of energy for all the sightseeing we were doing. In fact, after eating a breakfast, we wouldn't really have to eat lunch. The freshly squeezed blood orange juice was amazing -- even the kids loved it! All in all, Hotel Artemide provided a great value and really helped make our first visit to Rome very memorable and enjoyable. It is not inexpensive and it is not highly luxurious, but it is a much better value than other centrally-located, high-service hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: LDANYC
Reviews.Content: Room was attractive, clean and comfortable. The service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Amenities and Service outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Amandi34
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Artimide the people at the hotel were excellent especially the bartender Eugenio and a night doorman that my Husband can't remember his name... The room was tiny, but sufficient! The free drinks in the in room fridge are fantastic, as well as some snacks. The room has everything you need! The business center also fantastic, as my husband was able to watch the NBA playoffs that he was sooo missing..even being in Rome! Location is great! We took a cab to hotel from Roma Termini but we definitely could have walked...or taken metro to Republic terminal and walked. Metro system in Rome is great. The hotel arranged a car for us from the hotel to the airport. We could have taken Leonardo Davinci Express; however we had some Euros left to spend and since the exchange is so bad, went for it. This hotel is above average and definetly one of my favorites in our 2 week trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Abbie_x006
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome, in March 2011 with my mum as a city break for four days. We chose to stay at the hotel artemide, and although i expected it to be good, and four star standard, I would argue that what we recieved was more like 5 star standard. For the money we spent on the accomodation I couldn't believe how lucky we were. On the busy via Nazionale, its central to everything, and literally you could walk everywhere. Yet at night i heard not a sound from the busy strip. The hotel was sparkling clean. The staff would go out of their way to make you feel at home, and the rooms were gorgeous. The little bar in the hotel was a favourite, and although expensive, which is what you have to expect anywhere in rome, it is quality. The cocktails were so nice! We chose to eat out 3 out of 4 nights, yet on the final night chose to eat in the restaurant. It was our best meal in Rome by far. Beautiful food, and in comparison to what we ate elsewhere better value for money unbelievably! The breakfast was wonderful, everything you could possibly want, from hot food like bacon toast egg etc to fruit to croissants pancakes and continental breakfast. All washed down with practically any drink you wanted including lovely fruit juices. We had the most amazing time in Rome, and was hugely because this hotel was brilliant. Faultless!

Reviews.Title: “At the Artemide by accident but it was a very good one!”
Reviews.Author: squirrelchops
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Rome and we were booked in to the Artemide's sister hotel the IQ Roma, however on arrival there we were asked if we would mind going to the Hotel Artemide for 1 night. We were helped with our luggage and given a room upgrade to a Junior Suite and also breakfast included. The room was very spacious with a large bed and separate living area. The room faced onto the Via Nazionale which was perhaps the only negative - it was noisy at night. Apart from the that our stay was faultless. The staff very helpful. They found from our passports that it was my partners birthday and sent up a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom included a jacuzzi. We could also have free drinks from the mini bar. The hotel is near to the main train station - Termini. One tip we realised is that if you get the Leonardo Express from the airport, don't leave the train station at the first exit you come to, onto Via Giotti - this means you have a long walk around the outside of the station, over very busy roads whereas if you go through the station itself to the main entrance/exit you safe that dangerous walk. The breakfast at the Artemide was excellent. A huge choice of fruit/dairy products/pastries and cooked items. Very good quality tea and hot chocolate too. All in all having to move hotels on your first night when you are tired could be a nuisance, however it turned out to be a really lovely way to start our holiday. With the exception of the traffic noise we would have been very happy to have stayed there for the duration of our stay in Rome, but sadly our budget wouldn't have stretched to the junior suite for 4 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hallnextyear1
Reviews.Content: Brilliant stay at this lovely hotel. Staff were great as was the room and the superb breakfast - the location of the hotel was excellant also. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “AN ADORABLE HOTEL IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: samontana
Reviews.Content: We visited Artemide Hotel for leisure purpose and from our first step till the last, all staff assist us in the kindest way and provide the comfort with suprises all the time. I am also in hotel business and as a hotelier we use to see and care every details even we do not want to :).. And I can honestly tell you that they are doing an adorable work in Artemide.. It's not only the design or the furniture that was used.. It's about the sincere smile that all of us really like to see every time.. It takes max 15 min. to reach Spanish steps and 10 min to Trevi Fountain by walking. You will find more than you expect at breakfast. Two little chocolates in our room with a kind note was really impressive. I hope to have another chance to come again. Actually I had done my job in this way and threw my coin to Trevi to come back :)) and stay in this hotel again.. I can highly recommend this hotel for the ones that wants to have that kind of unforgetable stay in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant, very nice hotel, centrally located in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Byrdwrites
Reviews.Content: It's only two blocks from the train station on the Via Nationale, and within easy walking distance of the major places tourists want to visit in Rome: the Unification Monument, The Coliseum, the Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, the Capitoline Museum, the Trevi Fountain, The Spanish Steps, the Via de Corsa, the Pantheon, Plaza Navone... The staff is always friendly and helpful, the hotel is beautiful and elegant, the breakfast in the morning very good. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, within walking distance to almost everything”
Reviews.Author: SheriN56
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, mini-bar that was free, great buffet breakfast, Termini station was a 10 minute walk. Uncomfortable bed for us, all three hotels we visited had uncomfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, all you need to travel with a baby”
Reviews.Author: BenedicteG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and 4month old daughter. Without asking we got a free upgrade to a bigger room, as i had emailed that we wanted to use a babybed. The room and bathroom were very clean and spacious. In front of the hotel is a pharmacy,small supermarket and 1 block away there is a Prenatal shop, with all you need for babies and small children. As we traveled with a baby this made Artemide an excellent choice. From the hotel we walked to every place of interest in Rome: villa borghese, pantheon, colosseum, even the vatican was at walking distance. Italians really adore children and people do everything they can to make your stay as comfortable as possible and at Artemide it was no different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busylizzieEastbourne
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, as others have said. We asked for a quiet room and got it. Free minibar and coffee and tea making facilities were very useful. The bus stop is very near, but a 5 min walk to the bus station is worth while to get on the bus early - they are very crowded (to maximum capacity possible). Apart from the Vatican, everything is in walking distance. On off tour buses are useful but expensive. Very little to complain about with the hotel. Free wifi useful for getting info.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, understated elegance with an exceptionally warm and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: behanm
Reviews.Content: Loved the complimentary prosecco on arrival. The breakfast was excellent. Leaving too early to take advantage of it on our last morning, we were surprised and delighted to be given a generous take away bag with juice, fruit, toast, cream cheese and jam, and a variety of other treats.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Landyman4x4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Artemide. The reviews are true! Superb hotel, great location in walking distance of most sights and the metro is just a few minutes away. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful, the rooms are comfortable, and well equiped with everything you need. The complimentary Prosecco in the bar complete with nibbles and chocolate drizzled strawberries was a wonderful start to our break. The complimentary mini bar in our room was super after sightseeing with both still and sparkling water, juice, coke, fanta and beers and little nibbles, everything is replenished daily. Our room was exceptionally quiet. The highlight has to be the breakfast with everything you could ask for and more.
