The breakfast manager and his team are curtious and efficient, everything is always plentiful and they are frequently asking if you would like more coffee etc. The cappucino is excellent! After the fabulous breakfast we couldn't eat any lunch. We had a wonderful stay at the Artemide and would definitely stay there again. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent location for our first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: tonyHerefordUk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the service fast, willing, courteous and extremely helpful, in all departments. Our room was delightful, spacious and scrupulously clean. Equally so was our bathroom. The location of the hotel, at the upper end of Via Nazionale, was perfectly sited for exploring the city and its antiquities whether on foot, by underground train, or by bus. Within easy reach is a multitude of pavement cafes offering a variety of foods if one chooses to eat al fresco. Little can be said about what we liked least - perhaps the view from our terrace could be improved if the walls visible could be re-painted. In fact, the terrace was one of the things we liked best about our room. Particularly gratifying was the bottle of wine and the kind greeting in the room on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff and good value. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: sagra28
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor originally and booked it solely based on reviews. Our stay was really great - the staff are super friendly and the hotel provides a lot of nice perks: free breakfast, free drinks in the room minibar, take away breakfast pack for early flights etc.. The hotel location is also a 10 - 15min walk to most of the sights which makes is ideal. The rooms are big and clean - while the decor is a bit dated and the beds are not super comfortable its worth staying here based on all the other benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-round”
Reviews.Author: OPJ101
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here and enjoyed every aspect of the hotel. Most importantly, the rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable with decent sound-proofing and a nice spacious and attractive bathroom. Although we didn't really take much from the mini-bar, the option to take whatever, whenever and for no charge was a real bonus and gives you the feeling that the number 1 priority of the hotel management is to make the guests feel as happy as possible, rather than make extra cash like the rest of the hotels we stayed in during our stay in Italy. In fact, out of the 7 hotels we stayed in during our month in Italy, this was the best by a long way. Top marks also to the breakfast: staff were friendly and efficient and the spread was good with fantastic orange juice: a small detail but, again, demonstrates the hotel's commitment to the guests. Top marks to the management and all the staff, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in a big city”
Reviews.Author: greybeard50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March 2011 for three nights. A professionally run and very comfortable hotel. The only hotel I have ever stayed at that offers a free mini bar, just don't expect spirits etc but a very thoughtful gesture for weary travellers. The morning we left we had an early flight so didn't have time to wait for the breakfast sitting. As we were packing there was a knock on our door – a porter was delivering us a takeaway breakfast in carry bags, how considerate is that, other hotels could learn from this. Thoughtful hotel, certainly would recommend this hotel and if we are lucky enough to return to Rome would stay there again. Rome is a magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: mdirelandmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Artemide Hotel for three nights at the end of April,party of three to celebrate my sisters birthday.Two rooms booked on Standard one Superior ,both room's were very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was excelle,nt service was great from all the hotel staff who attended to our need's.The welcome from reception until we left was excellent helpful in every way.Location perfect for seeing the sites of Rome I highly recommend this hotel and i will stay hare on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: wisewanderer565
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we could have expected during our stay in Rome. The room was immaculate, the staff was helpful and kind, the breakfast was hearty and the rooms larger than you would ever expect in Europe. This hotel does all of the little things well which makes your stay much more enjoyable. Some examples include complimentary drinks (water, Coke, beer, etc) in the room replenished everyday, fresh sheets and towels daily and quality and plentiful toiletries. The hotel also is two blocks from a Metro stop as well as 15-20 walk to most tourist attractions. You truly could not ask for a better hotel to stay at while visiting Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: a2b4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March 2011 on trip advisors recommendation and were not disappointed. However the first room we had only had a small bathroom with no bath only the smallest shower I had have ever been in. We asked to move if possible and Mario said they would try. We left our bags packed while were out for the day and we had been moved on our return. Larger room with a bath. Both rooms were spotless and at the rear of the hotel so very peaceful. First class breakfast. Visit Est Est Est closeby on Via Genova in for excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel that I can't say enough praises about!”
Reviews.Author: ross_808
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this was the best hotel we stayed in during our three week trip to Europe. The room was absolutely fabulous and the breakfast buffet offered a huge variety of food including hot dishes, cold cuts, and a variety of breads, cereals, and fruit juices! The room was immaculately clean and the bathroom was huge. The bath robes and room slippers were added unexpected bonuses! It is in a fantastic location on Via Nazionale, only about a 10-15 minute walk from the Termini Train station and centrally located to many of the popular sights in Rome. Learning how to use the local bus system is fairly simple and the bus stops are only a few blocks away from the hotel entrance. The hotel has wireless internet throughout making it very easy to utilize web resources for directions, restaurant tips, and bus directions. If you are heading to Rome, I highly recommend choosing the Hotel Artemide for your choice of accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Artemide - Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: abroughton
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent four nights at the Artemide. I chose it based on the amazing reviews and the price, which was very reasonable for a hotel in Rome. We arrived by taxi and were met at the door by several helpful porters. Due to our overnight flight, we arrived several hours before check-in time. Alessandro at reception told us that our rooms would be ready in about an hour and sent us to the "restaurant" for complimentary breakfast. As noted by other reviewers, the complimentary breakfast was a delicious feast of pastries, fruit, juices, coffees and teas, eggs & bacon, cheese/meats, etc. After breakfast, we were escorted to our rooms by the porters who explained the particulars of the rooms. The hotel is, indeed, quite central and a ten minute walk from the main tourist attractions - except for the Vatican. Around the hotel are neighborhoods with excellent family-owned restaurants. Right up the street is the train station and Piazza della Republicca. Right down the street is Trajan's Markets. Rooms were serviced in the morning and tidied in the afternoon. Beds were turned down and a little piece of chocolate placed on the night table each afternoon. Requests were addressed quickly and competently. Each of our mini-bars was restocked daily and it was nice to have beveraages and snacks available after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was friendly and courteous at all times. Alessandro, Matteo and Pino were all gracious and efficient hosts. Overall, Hotel Artemide is a great place from which to base your Roman adventure. I will note that Via Nazionale is a bustling city street which is noisy at all times. Additionally, it is not as charming as some of the smaller neighborhoods near the Spanish Steps or Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in good location”
Reviews.Author: russ2000_uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was in a very good location, although, in truth, Rome is so large and full of wonder, that any hotel will be quite close to something you will want to see. Walking is certainly the best way to see the city, but the transport system is good, so you don't have to. The hotel is only a few minutes from a Metro station. The room was a bit small, but was clean, tidy and had everything we could have needed. Besides, you will probably spend so little time in the hotel it won't really matter. Although not cheap by general standards, it's very reasonable for an establishment of this quality in Rome. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, although we wary of the tours they promote because better deals can be found elsewhere. Other than that, the service was excellent. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SpiderPrincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 3 nights during our first trip to Italy, and could not have been more pleased with our stay. The staff were wonderful and very helpful (particularly Mario!) and ensured we had everything we needed. We walked to everything from the hotel with the exception of the Vatican, which is only a few stops away on the Metro (which is close by). The breakfast was wonderful with more options than we had at any other hotel during our stay, including a great selection of fresh fruit and juices. We had the most basic room, but it was very clean and comfortable and perfect for what we needed. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the beautiful city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MellynNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old son and I stayed here at the end of March 2011. The location is very convenient. We walked from Termini station, to Trevi Fountain, the Coloseum, the Forum and to the subway at Republica for the Vatican. The breakfast is very good with cheese/ham choices, various baked goods, salad, yogurts, scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and beans. When we checked out very early in the morning before breakfast was served, they presented us with three shopping bags with a "to go breakfast" of melba toasts, cheese spread, jams, apple and a juice box. This was a wonderful surprise that got us to the airport. The snacks and drinks in the room are a wonderful bonus at the end of a long day of touring. Would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawkinsfeb81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artemide for our 30th wedding anniversary and they made our stay with their hotel from begining to end wonderful. We had a upgrade, the room was plush and had a patio / sun deck area with views of the city,which was perfect, also perfectly placed in the room a lovely card wishing us happy anniversary with wine for us to enjoy :) very thoughtful ! The hotel location was ideal, walked easily to all major places, Trevi Fountain , Spanish Steps , Coliseum etc ... The staff were very attentive and breakfast was excellent, looked forward to it each morning ,which was heaven sent as we were very disappointed with the food at the restaurants we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: beachman77
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is centrally located within walking distance of most everything in Rome. The staff were were very friendly and accomodating. The room we had was spacious, clean and quiet, with a modern bathroom. There was a huge buffet selection for breakfast with many types of fresh fruit. There is a nice restaurant across the street and around the corner. Overall we had a very pleasant stay, no negatives at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our second visit.”
Reviews.Author: kmtYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here following a visit last May, and liked it just as much. We got a good deal when booking as we booked early and stayed four nights. The hotel is lovely and we like the location a lot. The free mini bar and tea tray are most welcome and service in the Bar and at Reception are excellent. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and the most interesting church of St Paul within the Walls, with its lovely mosaics by Burne Jones is almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but bijou ! Excellent hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: banky52
Reviews.Content: On arrival we received vouchers for a welcome drink ( Prosecco or tea or coffee).Free minibar and free internet access in bedrooms, a wonderful breakfast until 11 am ( freshly undiluted read orange juice), very attentive waiters and reception staff. Bedrooms were a bit on the small side but the beds were enormous and extremely comfortable. The location was very good as we could easily walk to the Forum and Colosseum and Piazza Venezia and Capitoline Hill. All in all , we were more than satisfied with our stay in this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HIltonMagic
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Artemide this week and had a great experience. The hotel is in a great location on the via Nazionale and only a couple of blocks from the Repubblica metro stop. Our room was one of the "basic" rooms which was smaller than the others we had on this trip, but very clean. The bathroom was large and spotless as well. The hotel does offer breakfast for an additional charge, but we did not utilize it. There are several places within a block or two to grab breakfast before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: sam1277
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in every way. Walking distance to many historical sites, restaurants and great shopping. The staff was very helpful with tours, and great places to eat. They all spoke perfect English and couldn't have been kinder. The rooms were lovely and the beds comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: dreamvacation1
Reviews.Content: I have been lax in posting my reviews as I have been so busy of late but decided today to get them all done. We stayed at the Artemide three nights post cruise in August and it was just great. We had a junior suite which was ample room for two adults and a teenager. We had a beautiful balcony that looked out onto the street and you could view the Piazza from there as well.The hotel was very clean, the free mini bar a big plus and the location perfect. It was just a short walk to reach most of the major attractions. The breakfast was very nice and the staff very friendly. There is a great little restaurant two streets up with authentic Roman food and a pharmacy directly across the street. I would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Of all the many hotels I have stayed in this is one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: dumbledorePolzeath
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for sightseeing (many are within walking distance). The rooms are good - tea/coffee making facilities, toiletries etc all replenished each day. Buffet breakfast excellent. We ate out in the evening at various restaurants but on the last night we had dinner in the hotel and it was so good we wished we had dined there every night! As far as all the staff were concerned nothing was too much trouble. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: Zubat
Reviews.Content: I was going to use the title "Just Ask", as my experience was that as long as you ask for what you need the hotel staff will do their utmost to help with no fuss. Via Nazionale is a good location for a short break in Rome. We stayed 3 nights and requested a quiet internal room, which is exactly what we received. I am not sure I would have liked a room overlooking the road as it is very busy with traffic. The hotel website is very clear regarding room sizes and amenities. Ours was a so-called Classic room and everything worked which is always a good sign of a well cared for hotel. Good pizza restaurant within 2 minute walk (Est Est Est). For all the glorious shopping opportunities in Rome we returned to Via Nazionale to collect our bags and did all our gift purchasing within a few hundred yards of the hotel. The museum gift shop on the opposite side of the road a few hundred yards away was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: aparkerw
Reviews.Content: This hotel served its purpose in that it was a comfortable place to sleep at night. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfast buffet was the best we had durring our trip. The subway was very close and the walk to the Forum and Colosseum was not so bad. Finding the hotel was a challenge (my fault). One thing to note is that Via Nazionale has street numbers in the 100s on the north side and in the sub 100s on the south side. Across the street were the 200's and 300's even though the address was 22 I think. The biggest disappointment was how far it was (with luggage) to get to termini. It is not as bad as other locations for sure, but the 1/2 mile seemed like forever. Having a tight schedule to/from the station I'm sure didn't help. If you're new to Rome, it was a fine stay and you'll be able to recoup from your adventures out in the city at Artemide for sure.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tlc240
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel very centrally located in Rome. It was the best hotel my boyfriend and I stayed in during our vacation in Italy, and it truly lives up to its 4 star rating and trip advisor reviews. The front desk was very helpful and welcoming throughout our stay, no other hotel in Italy made sure we had maps and pointed out key attractions when we checked in. The room was immaculate, they had a free mini bar with beer ( the boyfriend really enjoyed that!) and free Wi-Fi. The room we were given was nice and quiet and faced a back courtyard (a very needed change after our noisy room in Florence). The room was large enough for us, and there was plenty of room to put our bags and clothes. The bathroom was also huge. Housekeeping was wonderful as well, she cleaned and organized everything and made sure to replenish the minibar and shower supplies. The safe was small, so we left out laptop and iPods out every night and there were never problems. I had heard so many stories of theft and bad hotels in Rome that I was worried about our stay at the Artemide. They were completely unfounded and my only regret is not saying there longer. The hotel is also very close to the train station, my boyfriend and I rolled our suitcases to and from the station without problems. We went past the piazza navona area each night for dinner, and it was a short 20 min walk. We walked to and from the Vatican twice and that was less than 45 min. The décor and ambiance of the hotel was smart, elegant and classic. Check in and check out was a breeze, at each of the other hotels in Italy we stayed at, we had to wait in a long line. I would recommend it to anyone and look forward to another stay at hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and spacious hotel with considerate extras provided within the price.”
Reviews.Author: Xgrayx
Reviews.Content: The complementary drink on check in was thoughtful. Our room was upgraded as they had the space without us requesting it. The free mini bar is a great touch and the bath products were nice. The room was spacious and clean. Location was ok and exploring the city was easy even with a child. The staff were friendly and helpful, overall, a lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free beer!”
Reviews.Author: dmuga34
Reviews.Content: Location - Old Rome within walking distance. Vatican slightly farther away, but there's a metro stop only 2 blocks north of the hotel. Very close to main train station. I spent 4 nights, walked everywhere. Room was on the smaller side, decoration is nothing special. For being in the middle of Rome, it was surprisingly quiet. Minibar is free, which means free beer! It's restocked daily with 2 beer cans, 1 can of Fanta, 3 water bottles, a couple of juice boxes, and 2 bottles of sparkling water. Although breakfast is reputedly great, it costs 14 euro, so we decided to skip it.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Get Any More Centrally Located Than Here!”
Reviews.Author: OCragazza
Reviews.Content: Artemide Hotel is a beautiful hotel located literally in the heart of all the sights. It's a mere 15 minute walk to the Coliseum / Ancient Ruins, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and right around the corner from the Opera Theater to name a few. If you rent a car, park in the garage behind the hotel. Unfortunately, it's 17 Euros/night to park, but it shouldn't be a surprise to pay a premium for parking in a major city (Europe or US for that matter). During our one night stay, we found an excellent restaurant across from the Opera Therater called La Matriciana. If you're looking for non-tourist cuisine, you will really enjoy this restaurant. The nice perk about the hotel was the complimentary drinks in the mini bar and small assortment of cookies/crackers next to the coffee maker. When you arrive, you also receive a coupon for a free glass of Prosecco or coffee. Having said that, breakfast is not included (and is 12 or 14 Euros, I can't recall specifically, but it's a little steep). This hotel seems to cater to a lot of business travelers as there is an area for meetings. Unfortunately, I can't comment more on that since I didn't use any of those services and merely noted upon passing. Our room was second to least expensive, so it may feel on the smaller side for those who are not used to European sized rooms (it was essentially a standard European room). The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom felt in size to be on par with an American sized hotel. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast or the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. The only negative comment was that our room smelled of cigarette smoke. I tried to briefly air out the room by opening the windows, but the weather was rainy on/off, so I didn't want to leave the windows open while we were out sightseeing. Nevertheless, Europeans smoke and the smell wasn't too bad after a few minutes. I probably could have asked the front desk to see if there was a non-smoking room, but I didn't, so I suppose I am to blame. We stayed during low season and enjoyed a very nice discount on our room (We paid 209 Euros for a room that can cost upwards to 450 Euros during high season). As much as I did truly enjoy staying at the hotel, this hotel is definitely worth staying at the price we paid. Having said that, my review would probably be less favorable if I spent 450 Euros/night (I think I would draw the line at 280 Euros for the next to smallest room). I hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: houmus13
Reviews.Content: The room was ready for checkin when we got there at 2pm, even though technically, checkin wasn't until 3 or 4. Room was cleaned each day, and the mini bar was restocked too. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially Punto and Alessandro. They spoke English well. Food was descent and the hotel is walking distance from the major sites; the hotel is located on a bus route; and it's only about a 10-15 minute walk from the Metro

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok. Website pictures - a little decieving.”
Reviews.Author: EBNY_15
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome with my husband in March 2011. After much research and review reading I decided we should stay here based on the fantastic reviews it appeared to receive on Trip Advisor. However, from the moment we got there it failed to meet our expectations. Everything, from the appearance of the hotel, to the checking in, to the rooms, to the bar; it was all just ok. The people working at the front desk didn't appear to be that happy to have us check in, the room was not what it looked like on their website, and quite noisy from all the outside traffic, the bar drinks were not that good. Nothing was done to make this hotel stand out, and for us to say, "this is a great hotel, we have to come back!" The positive highlights of this hotel: The bell boys are very nice & friendly, there's free wi-fi, and the breakfast is very good. Also, the breakfast manager is very nice & professional. All in all, if and when we choose to return to Rome, we will definitely stay somewhere else. I have to believe something better is out there for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MadSteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and the central location. Easy walk to Spanish Steps, Coliseum, etc. and close to the Piazza Repubblica metro station. Staff was just wonderful - from providing umbrellas and an adapter, restaurant reservations & recommendations, to making our teenage grandson feel comfortable they were excellent in every way. We arrived before our room was ready and were invited to enjoy their breakfast buffet as a welcome gift. The breakfast is extensive, with all the things Americans like plus traditional Italian delicacies. The Junior Suite was perfect for us, 16 year old had his own space and so did we! The bathrobes and slippers make you feel so cozy.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Oslo, Norway, Norwegen, Norge, Noreg, Noruega, Norvege
Reviews.Title: “You can't spell Artemide without the A for Amazing. Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: HenrikSR
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the tripadvisor for introducing us to such a great hotel. Since traveling in mid-march must be considered as low season tourist wise, we book a superior room at the Artemide Hotel. I'm filled with superlatives about the quality, the service and the location of this hotel. Since this hotel is so close to the Termini station, you save a lot of taxi money, by just walking. Not far at all. The complimentary mini bar was also positive. It's not too much in the refridgerator, but enough to satisfy your needs. 2 beer, 2 pack of limonade, 1 coca cola + 1 fanta, water bottles. The breakfast at the hotel was superb. The red orange juice became fast a favourite for us along with the cappucino. The food selection was good. Bread, fruits, ham, salami, cheese, eggs, bacon etc. The reception clerk was helpful with pointing out the direction the fastest walk to desired sight. The free Wi-Fi connection was also great. My overall opinion about this hotel would be: Fantastic Walking to the hotel (10-15 min) from the Termini Station. From Termini, follow the platform (5 min walk) to the main entrance/exit, otherwise you would have to pull your luggage up some narrow streets up hill. Next door irish pub/ Flann O'Brien You can watch champions league soccer (Sky sport) matches on many of the big screens. Best bus "Hop on and Hop off" by my opnion. Due to all the critism of the "Hop on and off" bus companies on tripadvisor, we checked out one of the companies with positive feedback. The yellow busses offered by Roma Cristiana was for us as perfect as it gets. They were on time, not major waiting at stops. The only problems which may arise is bad signal to the headphones. But you will probably find this problem on any bus in any town. The best thing was that this was a cheap way to travel around the city. We paid only Eur17 for 2 days. I'm not sure if this is the normal, but this was how it was for us. The nearest Roma Cristiana Bus stop, is at the Republicca, 100m from Artemide Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Welshtraveller111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Artemide hotel in March 2011. After a smooth check in the receptionist gave us vouchers for a complimentary welcome drink and explained the hotels location with a map of the area. The room was small but had all of the usual facilities such as a flat screen television, complimentary safe, toiletries etc. The complimentary minibar was an added bonus & the drinks were replaced every day. The room was a little warm, unable to control the temperature but you could open the window. The room was quiet at night providing you have a room away from the main road. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, especially reception and the restaurant manager. Breakfast is served from 7am, very good selection with the usual bread, cheeses, cakes and a small cooked breakfast. The hotel also made a special cake (see photograph) to celebrate the 150th anniversary for the unification of Italy which was a nice touch. We had a lunchtime snack from the bar menu and the food was mediocre & the bar man was very miserable. Perhaps he was having a bad day. Did not eat in the hotel during the evening but I noticed the restaurant opened at 7.30pm. We ate in an excellent restaurant called Strega (turn left out of the hotel, first road on your left). The hotel is located in a very good location close to the main attractions such as the Colosseum, Trevi fountain & Spanish Steps. The Vatican is further away but there is a metro if required. Booked a private transfer (€45) from Ciampino airport with Rome’s cabs, extremely impressed and would use them again. The hotel charges €60. I enjoyed my stay in the Artemide, very good hotel in a fantastic city. If you have any specific questions about the hotel contact me and I will try to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Provides comfort, elegance, convenient location and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_fiesta
Reviews.Content: I really appreciated the thoughtful little Lindt chocolate that was left in the room every evening. The bed was huge and comfortable. I enjoyed the beautiful lounge in the hotel and the complimentary drink on arrival. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, comfortable accommodation and genuine value for money"”
Reviews.Author: Annie55Findon
Reviews.Content: The favourable reviews we read persuaded us to make the Artemide our base for a three night stay and we did not regret the decision. It was clear that staff are well trained, from the courteous and helpful reception staff to the super efficient maitre d'. A well appointed bar is obviously popular with guests and the restaurant puts on a good evening meal as well as astonishing breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: zyquix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide Hotel for five days in March 2011. Overall, we were pleased with our choice. Staff were very helpful and not over fussy, which one can get at some hotels. We would say this is solid 4* hotel. Location very good for most sights of Rome and near main rail station. We had a large room at the front of the hotel and, be warned, if you are a light sleeper, the traffic noise - particularly emergency vehicles - can be very loud. Overall recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in Rome - Artemide is just Priceless”
Reviews.Author: James1503
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. The staff couldn't do enough to make our trip special, the concierge always helpful and giving great tips on where to eat etc. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would fully recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bubbles1049
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel to all types of traveller - great location, large rooms (complimentary fridge - soft drinks, water, beer refilled daily), very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Buffet breakfast is also fab - high quality food with a staggering aray of choices. However these are not the best points of the hotel - it has to be the staff. Very helpful and attentive (without being intrusive), extremely politely and, every member of staff met always greeted us with a smile. True definition of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “It's a cracker. Highly reccomended .”
Reviews.Author: David98
Reviews.Content: Free wi fi and minibar. Great location. Genuinely interested staff. Lovely bar with great cocktails. Superb value. It's not the Ritz, but more than makes up for that with it's service and value for money. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast comes with your stay!”
Reviews.Author: make-more-art
Reviews.Content: The breakfast room is filled with homebaked apples, pastries, pancakes, breads, a table of cheeses and meats, fruit salad and yogurts, cereals and juices, eggs and bacon and sausages. Then, the coffee! The Italians love their coffee and the Artemide serves you all you want and many styles. The rooms are spacious, clean, fresh linens every day, robe and slippers. A nice quiet and comfortable sleep each night. The help at the desk for restaurants, tour reservations and even a room change was met with helpfulness and general interest that our stay be comfortable and enjoyable. Convenient to trains, and a pretty central location. Ah, Roma, thank you Artemide Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever been to!!”
Reviews.Author: fraggle82899
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is awesome!!! Right in the heart of Rome and super close to most of the big attractions. The metro in about a block away and extremely easy to use. We received a warm welcome and were treated like kings for the next 3 days. Staff was super friendly and super helpful! Everything in our mini bar was free and we were able to ask for refills every night. The only thing this hotel needs is it's own parking garage. I would have been happy to just arrive at the hotel and drop the car off instead of having to leave it in a public parking garage around the corner. The hotel is surrpunded by boutiques and cute shops. The price of the hotel may be a little steep for some but in my opinion it is worth every penny. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip an wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: stiner21
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service!! The most hospitable hotel I've ever stayed at, and the hotel is so clean and nice! Located halfway between the major sights, this is a hotel that is perfect for tourists. Though, I would recommend others to stay in a room that don't front the main street, when the traffic can interfere with the sleep.The breakfast is great, and there are also several good restaurants around the hotel. A perfect hotel in a perfect city!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are not fake.”
Reviews.Author: bmwmc
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is as other reviews described. Excellent location, service, cleanliness, and value. Breakfast is very good value and a great start to a long day of sightseeing. Don't miss Fratelli Ricci Via Genova 32 for excellent pizza's and pasta right down the street. P.S. if your given a street side room don't hesitate to ask (quickly) to be moved if you don't like the traffic noise. I did and the hotel staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerriejo13
Reviews.Content: We have just retrurned from a four night stay at the Artemide and could not be happier with every element of the hotel. The service was amazing. The room was beautiful, the second best hotel we've ever stayed in (it was pipped to the post by a suite in the Wynn, Las vegas). We loved the whirlpool bath, the robes and slippers and the minibar. The bottle of wine waiting for us in our room was a lovely surprise. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day. The breakfast provided a great selection of food and was served until 10.30am which was much appreciated as we are not early risers! Every member of staff was friendly and extremely helpful with recommendations for restaurants, a car back to the airport and even providing free umberellas.The only service they couldn't provide was contolling the elements! (it rained for about 80% of our visit) The only slight negative was that our room was first floor and on the main road so the traffic was fairly noisy but I think we only noticed this so much because we live in the countryside so are used to pretty much silence at night. However, the hotel is on a main road, its central location is another one of its plus points, so there is nothing that can be done to avoid the noise in certain rooms. It certainly doesn't reflect on the hotel and its services. I would have no trouble recommending the Artemide, there is a reason it is so highly rated on Trip Advisor. It lives up to all the expectations these good reviews create.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was exceptional. Hotel was spotless. Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: KarenDoveCanyon
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and I was extremely satisfied with the hotel location (perfect), the hotel staff (friendly, professional and helpful), and the overall cleanliness. Very comfortable environment for female travelers. Hotel staff's recommendations for restaurants were perfect! Wonderful experience and wonderful stay at the Artemide Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: thumpergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my father, as a treat for his 50th. I had read the reviews and had high expectations, which, if anything were exceeded. Upon arrival, we were presented with our drinks vouchers, and as our room wasnt ready for a further 40 minutes, extra drink vouchers too! The hotel bar was lovely, they told us to sit down and bought over our drinks and little snacks. When our room was ready, they had upgraded us to a junior suite, and a bottle of red was in there with a card, wishing my father a happy birthday. A lovely touch. The room was more than sufficent, and the bathroom lovely - we made great use of the bright yellow slippers, fluffy robes and dad even treated himself to a jacuzzi bath. The only downside was a bad connection for the wi-fi, but whether this was his laptop or the hotels connection we are unsure. But, at the end of the day, if you are sitting in your hotel room online when you are there for a break, you are doing something wrong! The breakfast was vast to say the least, the service friendly, though the hot food was more on the lukewarm side. This was the only slight downside l could find. We checked out, and they kept our bags for us until we were ready to collect. One more drink at the bar, saw us with more lovely snack and a lovely plate of fromage. I can not fault the staff at this hotel. The customer service was excellent, and l would not hesitate to recomend for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: JaneEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights to celebrate my birthday. It was our first time in Rome and I chose this hotel after having read the Trip Advisor reviews. It is central to all the attractions, and we walked everywhere, other than when we took the metro to The Vatican. The hotel is very attractive, the rooms are well presented, and it was so quiet at night.Our room felt very hot when we first arrived, but a very helpful member of staff advised us on how to regulate the heating. The staff were very helpful, especially when we wanted to check in on line for our return flight. The breakfast was amazing, so much choice, and plenty of it. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel, can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: MunsterRugby
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as a treat for my girlfriend for her birthday and it didn't disappoint. Location was perfect (you could walk to almost everything), the breakfast was great, the room was clean and comfortable and the staff were so obliging and pleasant. I really can't fault it at all. I was worried that the busy road outside would keep me awake but that wasn't the case at all. The guys in reception gave us great advice and seemed to genuinely care that we were having a good trip. The manager even left a nice bottle of wine and a note for my girlfriends birthday. Thank you for that! We had two friends staying in a 5 Star in Rome on the same weekend, and whe I went to see it it reaffirmed my opinion that we were in a great hotel. Theirs was further away from the sites, in a quite part of town with no atmosphere, the room wasn't great for the price and it was €25 for a glass of wine!! When we return to Rome we will definitely head back to the Artemide Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: sgdream52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights at the Hotel Artemide in Rome. The rooms were clean and attractive. The king size bed was firm and very comfortable. The breakfast was very nice and constantly replenished. Service by both the front desk and the restaurant was outstanding and friendly. After a day of touring around you really felt like you were home when you got back to the hotel. We requested a room away from the street and it was honored. The mini bar was free as was WiFi in your room. Our room had a large flat screen TV and a separate seating area. The only negative was that for a couple a days we had loud neighbors and we could hear them as well as doors closing in the hallway. Despite that I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews”
Reviews.Author: TKCA
Reviews.Content: No complaints from a 4 day/night stay. Great location which allows you to walk nearly everywhere if you wish. Very close to metro stop/train station. It's a great combination of being in the heart of things along with being just slightly off the busiest streets. About a 10 minute walk from Termini station, so take the Leonardo Express from the airport instead of a taxi and save the money. Complimentary drinks when you arrive, and excellent service all around. On our first day in Rome, we had a hotel staff member go way out of his way to help us out while he was on his way home from work when he spotted us looking at a map at the metro station. He recognized us instantly from our arrival at the hotel and made sure we knew the best way to get to where we were headed. Very pleasant surprise. There is a fantastic restaurant very close by on a quiet street (via del Boschetto) called La Taverna de Monti. Excellent service and friendly staff along with very good authentic Italian food made it our favorite restaurant during our time in Rome. Also, the hotel breakfast was a perfect way to start our days. We highly recommend the Hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and clean as a new pin.”
Reviews.Author: Verm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well maintained and our room was immacualte. It wasn't a huge room, but good enough for a city break. We found the memory foam bed very comfortable and the free minibar, TV and other bits and bobs were welcome. The location is fantastic and it is possible to walk to nearly all of Rome's attractions. The Metro is on the doorstep for the Vatican and longer journeys. The rail terminus for the airport is 10 mins. walk away. We found the staff charming and helpful. Once, the maid forgot to leave us clean towels but within minutes of asking, they were delivered to the door. The breakfast was very varied and I defy anyone not to find something they like: hot or cold, sweet or savoury. A good way to start the day. There is a bar area and lounge, which are very pleasant, although possibly a bit small if the hotel is full. All in all, we would recommend the place and we would stay again if ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All good!”
Reviews.Author: likestoptips
Reviews.Content: Were pleased with every aspect of this hotel. The staff were friendly, food was good, location was fairly central and an easy walk to main train terminal and sights.

Reviews.Title: “The Artemide greatly added to our positive experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Widget66
Reviews.Content: Our highest compliments to the staff at the Artemide. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, everyone was courteous and helpful. The room was quiet, clean, and nicely appointed. The breakfasts offered good selection of hot and cold items, and the breads and coffee were especially delicious. We would highly recommend the Artemide Hotel, and we look forward to future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would not provide comp breakfast as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Chino019
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend hotel as we were treated poorly. Staff was plesant and helpful, however we were expecting breakfast as their website states but were informed by the front desk and later the manager that we were not allowed the comp breakfast. Not sure what complementary breakfast means but was told that we had to pay for breakfast. Room was small and cramped but very clean and staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful except for the clean but smelly toilet”
Reviews.Author: kcf21
Reviews.Content: they upgraded us to a room that could fit 3 twins. it was huge for european standards. it was clean, newly renovated, facing inside so very quiet. couldn't ask for more honestly for the price, that was until we started to realise odd smell from the bathroom. the toilet smelled like a public urinal, we thought it was coming from the bidet at first. asked the front desk to take care of it and they also sent a maintenance team to see what is the problem, in addition to housekeeping. mind you, the toilet looked very clean, but i think there's probably something wrong with the plumbing. however having said that, i don't know what kind of plumbing problem would make the toilet smell so horrible. it really smelled like weeks of urine collecting somewhere. but the floor the walls of the toilet and everything was clean. anyway after they sent some people to check/clean while we were out, we came back at end of the night with a toilet that smelled like heavy duty scrubbing cleaner. but after a couple of flushes of the toilet, the public urinal smell came back. we are both women so it's not like we were "careless" when using the toilet and making a mess ourselves. so just don't stay in room 524. i don't see other reviewers with the same problem so probably just that room. otherwise all the raving reviews are pretty accurate and not surprised it is rated #1. great breakfast selection and the maitre'd for breakfast was such a nice older italian man, made us feel very at home and welcomed. the front desk staff was very helpful with our reservations etc. the night shift front desk guy was a bit more impatient but still pretty good compared to most people in italy. overall it was exceptional value for money except for the stench. if all the rooms had the same problem then i would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel that provides pretty good value.”
Reviews.Author: EagleRayHayfork
Reviews.Content: The staff is professional, and the rooms are well-maintained, if small. The staff is uniformly competent and polite. The breakfast is abundant and well-prepared. The walls to the rooms are thin, and noise can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: VB1306
Reviews.Content: I just would like to echo everything said in the previous reviews - this place is just lovely and superb value for money. Great hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: popsjo
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from staying at the Artemide Hotel over Valentine's and I could not have asked for a better hotel. It's location is perfect for walking to ALL of Rome's historical sights, main train station and shops/restaurants. The staff could not have been more helpful and the food in the restaurant to die for! I can't find any fault in this hotel, it is a must if you are going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dollydalts1407
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel for a variety of reasons. The location was great, we walked everywhere from here and it's close enough to the bus tours should you want to hop on one of those too. The service was top drawer! On arrival we were upgraded without asking and were given a super king room with a roof terrace. Every member of staff was friendly and could not do enough for us. The breakfast was fab! Lots of choice and delicious too. We had plenty and didn't feel the need to eat much else all day until our evening meal. The bar serves excellent coffee and nibbles, great when returning from a long walking stint. You are also given a complimentary drink on arrival which was a nice touch. The room was clean and spacious by city standards with a lovely bathroom. Lindt chocolates were placed by our bed each day and the mini bar was complimentary - very unusual but really welcome. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfaction - marvellous staff”
Reviews.Author: suspat
Reviews.Content: Just back from great weekend in Rome. Booked a superior room in Artemide and was delighted with our choice. Room no 115 was a lovely quiet room, located at the end of short corridor away from the lift etc, inside the room was a generous hall-way with fridge, tea & coffee selection, free mini bar (beer, water, soft drinks and juices, snacks), safe and wardrobe. Bathroom was well stocked & immaculate - & though the good shower was over the bath, there was a glass (rather than curtain) screen. Bedroom was good and very comfortable - mattress was on the hard side of medium which I like and the TV had 3-4 English language channels. And finally off the bedroom was a very decent sized outdoor patio area - totally unexpected bonus though I expect it gets minimal sun between the buildings. However the outstanding feature was the staff. Apart from the bell-boys, all were experienced, mature professionals who were in total control, able to answer all questions, recommend tours/restaurants, supply plug adoptors etc, all in a courteous helpful way. Reception never had a queue, and breakfast was first class, again well staffed, with a fantastic selection of different breakfast types - buffet style. We are very fussy travellers who have more than once been let down by reviews/hype but this one prompted me to write my first ever (glowing) review. This is a genuinely good 4 star hotel with 5 star service. Final Tip : Thinking of visting the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel etc, there is an enormous amount to see there - we booked a tour (Maximus Tours - Joanne was our guide) and she synopsised it all into a fab 3 hours tour - it was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: Richfulf
Reviews.Content: Just thought I would ecco what others have said on here and confirm that this really is a great little hotel. We have just got back from a three night stay, and had a brilliant time. The hotel is ideally located - Via Nazionale is a really nice street, it is within walking distance to all the touristy stuff, and you have the lovely neighbourhood of Rione Monti right on your doorstep. It is also easy walking distance from the Termini, saving you cash on Taxi's to and from the Airport. The actual hotel itself is very classic European in style, the rooms are comfortable and decorated tastefully, and the little touches such the free minibar and bathrobes underline this hotels strengths in doing the simple things well. The main selling point though has to be the staff, who are all absolutely excellent. Friendly, helpful, efficient, and they seem to be genuinely passionate about doing a good job. In summary, we are already planning another trip to Rome for next year and will definitely be staying at the Artemide again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel...couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: Chose the Artemide Hotel after reading reviews on here and they were not wrong. we stayed here for 3 nights having just returned on the 14 February. Everything about the hotel from the location to the helpful friendly staff was perfect. The nice touches just make this hotel even better including the free mini bar, which does get refilled every day to the selection of toiletries in the bathroom. Even the TV has a wide and varied selection of channels to choose from. All in all we had a fantastic time in Rome and would return staying in this hotel without hesitation. It really is the best..

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's in Roma - Artemide made it perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MackieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome and stayed at the Artemide. The trip was amazing and our choice of hotel made it perfect. The pics in the website doesn't do it full justice. They have an excellent, friendly team of staff, bedrooms are clean and luxurious and attention to detail is never missed. The breakfast choice is amazing and will be missed! Location wise couldn't have been better - walking distance to everything and just around the corner from the Metro. Via Nazionale has many shops and a good choice of restaurants and bars but we tended to go more central for dinner. The little 'so called' Irish bar on the corner was great for late night Pizza and cocktails ;-) I couldn't fault this hotel at all. I have already recommended to many people already - some friends are attending a wedding in June and think my mum and her friends are going to book for this October. I should be on commission! I noticed the review regarding the graffitti - we too were a bit shocked and disappointed to see this aswell but would highlight that this is no where near the hotel - only in a section from Campinio airport to behind the Termini bus station. (I am sure all cities have this kind of problem including homelessness within their poorer parts)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: MalmesburyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: A short or a longer stay the Artemide hotel will not let you down. Arrival starts with the helpful blue uniformed porters leading you to the reception desk that houses a team of charming and knowledgable staff. Take the lift to a very well appointed room, spotlessly clean, spacious (ours was Superior variety) and a bathroom lacking for nothing. In common with many hotels it was too hot but open windows normalised that small problem. Bar and restaurant will please, indeed the dinner matches the best on offer within the city. Not the responsibility of the hotel but how sad it is to view the mindless vandalism that has been allowed to tarnish this once gracious and beautiful city. From airport to hotel every flat surface is adorned with grafiti, a sad reflection on the human race.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ngeary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stood at Artemide hotel for the weekend (Jan. 30 & 31st) before he had to go to his business meeting at another hotel which was also in Rome but on the outskirts and not close to anything. Comparing the two and other hotels we have stood at in Rome in our travels there three years prior, Artemide is one of the best in Rome! The hotel is on Via Nazionional which offers a great place to shop and eat. It is also very close to walk to the Termini train station to take the Metro. If you prefer you don't even need to take the Metro as most of the major attractions are an easy 10/20 minute walk. We chose to have them pick us up at the airport that Sunday morning. Alessandro picked us up and was very prompt & polite. The room was comfy and they had a nice free mini fridge set up along with great smelling tolietries. Alessandro and Giovanni were very friendly and helpful at the front desk and took care of anything that you need with sincere courtesy. The breakfast was wonderful - my favorite was the warm baked apples! I would definetly stay with this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: 67GG
Reviews.Content: Excellent locations close to Fontana di Trevi, very friendly and helpful staff, appropriately sized room, quiet as requested, good breakfast, good and free wifi connection, good additional resources for those who need it (business centre, minigym, sauna)

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: emilybmaass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Artemide. Our experience was very positive. The staff was extremely helpful, attentive and pleasant.... but never overbearing. We booked a standard room, which was perfectly comfortable considering how little time we actually spent there. The room was, compared to American standards, on the small side but the bed was comfortable, the shower had both great water pressure and was nice and hot, and the wardrobe was ample. There was a small charge for the internet (I think it was about 9 Euros for our entire stay) but our connection was excellent. Also, there is a free minibar that is stocked daily with water, soda, snacks as well as coffee and tea. The bathroom is also well-stocked with free vanity kits, shower caps, soap, shampoo, lotion and shoe-shine kits. I agree with one one reviewer who said that that rooms can become uncomfortably hot at night. Thankfully, we were able to just open our window and let the winter air in to make the room more comfortable. The location of the Artemide is great if you like to walk, which we do. You are close to the Barberini Palace, Quirinale, Trevi Fountain and various other sites. The Via Nazionale consists of many stores and several good restaurants (bordering nearby side streets - near the Opera). We opted out of the breakfast at the hotel and headed each morning to Castroni, a charming shop/cafe, down the street for our morning cafe and pastries. From there we headed, mostly on foot, over to other parts of town, which were easily accessible on foot if you like to walk to offset all the calories you will consume indulging in the great food Rome has to offer. All in all, it was a fabulous experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location - stay here”
Reviews.Author: GooseLimerick
Reviews.Content: As this was my wife's birthday I wanted us to stay somewhere nice. This hotel was ideal. The location was great, the staff were very helpful and the room was compact and clean. The free mini bar was a nice extra. They even had a complementary bottle of Prosecco in the room for my wife's birthday. I couldn't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: feek1910
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fabulous three night stay in Rome. We chose the Artemide after studying several hotels on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very well located on Via Nationale, close to the Termini Station and Republica Metro Station. A main stop for the tourist buses is a short walk away, and the area has many excellent shops and restaurants. From arrival to departure the service from hotel reception was as good as I have experienced anywhere in the World. We were a couple of hours early but our room was ready so were checked in straight away, and given vouchers for welcome drinks in the bar. We had a standard room which was a little small but very well appointed, and more than adaquate for the amount of time we spend in it. The free mini-bar and wi-fi in the room were another bonus, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. We had a problem with locating the office for a three day pass we had booked on the internet with Terravision, however the helpful receptionist made several telephone calls on our behalf and provided detailed directions to the companies offices. Rome is a magical city and we had a wonderful stay, made all the more enjoyable by this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PracticalHacks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 4 nights in June, 2010. The hotel's location is great: about an 8 to 10 minute walk to Termini station, and a similar distance to the Trevi Fountain and a number of very good restaurants. Our room was a "Superior" room; it was spacious, and the marble bathroom was large. As others have noted, the mini-bar was restocked daily with a couple of beers and sodas. The temperature of items in the mini-bar couldn't be characterized as "Arctic-like," but when in Rome... The hotel has a restaurant in its basement which served a wonderful breakfast; I can't recall if breakfast was included with our room, however. Check the hotel's website. The staff was helpful and courteous. We particularly enjoyed chatting with the gentleman who manned the small bar off the lobby; I'm afraid I can't remember his name, but he was delightful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Artemide, and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional friendly service, Good location, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: sca6431
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Artemide Rome with my husband for my 40th birthday. On checking in, we were told our room had been upgraded as it was my birthday. A complimentary bottle of wine & nuts were also left in the bedroom for us. A lovely little extra! Room was a nice size with a comfy bed & marble bathroom had the bonus of a jacuzzi bath which was a great relief for tired legs after a full day sightseeing. Breakfast was good, self service selection of fruit,cereal, meats & cooked items. We found all the staff to be expectionally friendly & accomodating & would definately recommend this hotel as it was also in a good position,within walking distance to most attraction with bonus of Metro station being 2minute walk up the street. Can't wait to return!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Roycroftmom
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 was extremely impressed with the hotel. The service was outstanding, the breakfast superb and the thoughtfulness of the staff exceptional. The wi-fi was always available, the mini-bar terrific and the rooms were comfortable. We have stayed at hotels costing significantly more than this hotel, but this hotel is top-of- the line in terms of doing everything possible to make your stay enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway. Location is great, Great service, Great food & Great rooms! A*”
Reviews.Author: Truemaniser
Reviews.Content: A very nice 4 star hotel. The decor is quite standard, i was expecting it to be wow but , it was immaculate, very clean and staff were very helpful. The free mini bar was very useful, but dont expect too much, it is free after all!! (coke, fanta, water, beer, nuts, crackers etc). Rooms were really spacious, king size bed, dressing area, large bathroom and tv. Only criticism would be the lack of english channels other than the news. Breakfast was continental but was fantastic, so much choice. Eggs, bacon, sausage or cereals, pastries, fruit, yoghurts etc. There was loads of choice and it was all yummy. We didn't try the restaurant for an evening meal as there are so many restaurants within walking distance, but the menu choices at the hotel did look good. There was also free wifi which was fantastic and we used a lot. Location is great, short walk from the bus shuttle drop, close enough to resturants and fairly close to most of the attractions., I would definately stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide, bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: jaywill147
Reviews.Content: As a journalist who has traveled extensively but never before to Italy, I must say with great love that the Hotel Artemide was the perfect place for myself and my daughter. Allesandro and Matteo at reception could not have been more helpful and friendly. The room was ideal for us, two comfortable beds at back of hotel off the street noise of the Via Nazionale. All room amenities were excellent, and the free minibar a bonus. The breakfast is outstanding as is the man who is the maestro of the room and his wait staff. I had never before thought of a baked apple for breakfast. I had three in three mornings. Location is excellent, 10 minute walk to Termini Station and certainly within a healthy walking distance of the Colloseum, and the great ruins. Also, nearly next door is St. Paul's, where small opera performances are given and we went to one that featured the great arias of many operas that was excellent. There are doubtless many fine hotels in Rome, but when we go back, we will always stay at Hotel Artemide. Jeff Williams, New York

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the ideal place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: formuladick
Reviews.Content: A great experience from beginning to end! We received a reminder e-mail to confirm the booking approx a week before the due date, and all pre-arrival questions I had (amily to do with arrival time) were promptly and politely responded to. We arrived at about 11:30 am, which was a bit early (check-in was at 2pm), and although our room was not quite ready, a quick call to (presumably) the cleaning staff provided us with an idea of the likely time we could get to the room. (At this point I didn't realise that check-out was noon!). Anyway we were provided safe-haven to leave our bags, whilst making use of the complimentary vouchers in the bar to have a coffee or wine. I believe our request for a hot chocolate for my son, to go with the 2 coffess wasn't strictly in the deal (as the book price was a bit more expensive) but the bar-tender quite happily gave us one. The pastries offered with these drinks were a nice surprise, but I was fully expecting to get a bill for those! No they were part of the deal too. In fact because we had arrived early, reception gace us 2 lots of free vouchers (so we used the second set whilst awaiting the taxi to pick us up). We got to the room and it was, for us, perfect. Large, and very very comfortable king size bed, and a larger than double size sofa-bed for my 13yr old son. But please don't think of an ordinary sofa-bed. It was huge, substantial, solidly built and as per my son - more comfortable than the new bed we'd just bought him. Everything was clean and crisp and to be honest I was thinking at this stage that the reservation I had made, and total price MUST have been either for each of us or only one night, instead of 3 people for 2 nights. Especially when the nice touches like a FREE selection of drinks in the mini-fridge (beer, water, coke,fanta,orange juice,nuts etc) and slippers, bath robes, a huge selction of bath creams, gels, shampoos, conditioners, sponges and stuff all manner of assortment of tea & coffee options were there in abundance and re-stocked. To confirm the bill was as per the mail and sill now i am expecting an email from the Hotel saying that I had underpaid! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, and seemed genuinely happy to be so - no evidence of forced courtesy here, and this included the cleaning staff as well as reception, bar and restaurant staff. What can I say about the breakfast. Well apart from the fact we went in early to beat the rush (based on experience of other hotels) the hospitality of the staff was exemplary, and the options of food was huge. I can recount freshly squeezed orange, apple, grapefruit, pinepple, boild & scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cold turkey, chicken, a selction of salamis, cheese, an assortment of bread rolls, bread slices, sweet breads, fruit breads, croissants, fruits and at least 5 different cereals. No limit to the amount you could have - the only restriction was the amount you could fit in. The hotel was in easy walking distance of the Colloseum, Trevi Fountain & Pantheon, with Castel St Angelo a bit further (but we still walked) All in all a perfect holiday, just wish we were there for longer

Reviews.Title: “gracious and generous staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanettesable
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the desk staff and their help with our first trip to Rome. The hotel breakfast was delicious and beautifully served. There were common rooms to relax. Our room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: pwsroberts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for my birthday. Could not have been any better. The staff would do anything for you to make your stay as good as possible. We could walk everywhere, used the tube once to get to the vatican, station 2 min walk from hotel. They gave me a free bottle of wine to celebrate my birthday, free minibar is a nice touch and breakfast has plenty of options. We be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL !!!”
Reviews.Author: Markk2011
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Amazing the best hotel we have stayed in..very good location in the city! hotel was right next to some very good place to eat out at night. one place to check out is Denelli italia the food was great and good value for money Marks

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise, great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SunCoaster
Reviews.Content: It was my third time in Roma and my partner's first. We caught the train from the airport to Termini (central station), from which the hotel is an easy walk, even with wheeled bags. I quite enjoyed this hotel, from the amazing breakfasts, to the flamboyant Italian staff (with perfect English), and the clean, quiet and cool rooms. The location is excellent, and it's a good looking building with an imposing street frontage. With the "Wedding Cake" (Vittorio Emanuele's building) at the end of the street, it is easy to get back to after a day walking around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, old stylish hotel. Great location and great breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: Iamthemixer
Reviews.Content: Rooms not huge but functional and quite stylish, in an traditonal manner. Possibly the quietest hotel I've ever slept in. We were in an internal room, with no view (backed onto internal lightwell) but this meant at night there was no sound at all. We were there in mid-winter, and I found the general level of internal heating throughout the hotel to be a little high, but the female members of the party thought it was fine. The staff were helpful, polite, and friendly. The breakfasts (included) are first rate, providing a great start for long walking days in Rome. The location is great - very central and easy walking distance from Termini, even when pulling baggage.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and staff combine for a terrific experience.”
Reviews.Author: ynotrvl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times on previous trips. On every occasion we have been impressed by the level of service, from the front desk to the breakfast staff and all others. We have always been made to feel like their most valued guests (not customers). Every request has always been granted with a smile and we have never been dissapointed. Amenities, such as the free minibar and free welcome drink in the bar, make an already perfect experience even better. The included breakfast is one of the best we have had in all of our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, outstanding breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Passim123
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for three nights, based on the recommendations here. Thanks, everyone. This hotel is an absolute gem! If you can find a nicer hotel for the money in Rome, I'd be very surprised. The location is fantastic -- super easy walking distance to just about anything. There is even a nice little grocery store right down the block. I never took a cab the entire time I was in town. I arrived early in the morning, around 6:30 a.m. Obviously, I was not expecting to check in at this hour, but the desk staff was extremely helpful -- allowed me to store my bags, offered me a bottle of water and a free city map that was great. I was told to come back at 11:00, long before the normal check in time. I got back at that time and my room was clean and ready. The bellhop was extremely helpful and showed me all of the bells and whistles. He clearly did not expect a tip for this, either, although I made sure to give him a nice one. He was great. I booked a double room (for one person). It was very large (by European standards), with a king-sized bed, excellent furnishings, a free mini bar stocked daily, and an outstanding bath with every possible amenity you could ever want -- robes, slippers, you name it. The room was very modern -- this is not an old-style hotel, but an up-to-date model. The bed was very comfortable and had really nice pillows, sheets, and a duvet. Definitely not the standard gross hotel fare. My room was facing the street, but I slept like a baby -- it was very quiet. For business travelers, they have free Internet service in the rooms, and a nicely stocked business center. Use of the business center -- which has everything from computers with microphone headsets to a printer -- costs 12 Euros per day. The front desk staff was kind enough to let me print my boarding pass for free. No hassles whatsoever. That's what you call service. The also have a gym and a spa, but I didn't have time to check it out. If it's like the rest of the hotel, it's top notch on all fronts. It's been mentioned here many times, but I'll mention it again -- the breakfast has to be one of the finest meals in all of Rome. Wow! I couldn't believe you got all of this for free. I've done a lot of traveling, and this has to be the best free hotel food of all time. Eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh squeezed juices of all varieties, fresh fruit, cereals, every time of bread, plus all of the usual pastries, croissants, muffins, and other goodies. That barely describes the extent of it. You will not possibly go away hungry, although you may have to tear yourself away from this massive feast. Yeah, it's downstairs from the lobby. Big deal. The breakfast service staff was amazing, and you just will not believe the quality of the food! What a pleasant surprise. The entire experience was amazing -- I felt like a Roman king! Believe the hype -- this is the finest hotel in all of Rome! Thank you Artemide for making my stay so very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JeevesTravels
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. The hotel itself was very nice and quiet despite being on a busy road, but the real value at this hotel was the great service from the hotel staff. Each and every staff member went out of their way to make sure you had a great stay. The breakfast buffet was tremendous. The location was convenient for nearly all of Rome's sights and very close to the train/bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service makes this a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RamaDrama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in December and the helpfulness of all the staff were excellent. We would like to thank Alessandro especially for guiding us to the right places and hotels. You are walking distance away to Colosseum, Trevi and hiring a tour guide for all these places is total unnecessary. The only place we would recommend having a tour guide is Vatican tour. Overall a great place and location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: franktipt
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable , Hotel has a modern, hip feel to it, and we enjoyed our stay there. Good services and very good location just near termini station !! Very Good !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would defintely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MikeSF
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The location is good, close (but not too close) to both the Republica and the Centrale metros. Free mini bar, free wifi, great breakfast, great service. Everything was great. The only drawback was that we couldn't adjust the room temperature, so the room could get a bit stuffy (we stayed in winter). The fitness center is small, OK for a couple of people at the most. We stayed at 4 other hotels in Italy and this was definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: APMoscow
Reviews.Content: At first the room turned out to be very small but then after a little while we got used and i wouldn't say that it's too bad. Service - good. Amongst the negative sides can only name that rooms are a bit noisy (you can hear what's going on in the adjacent rooms) and actually are a bit to hot (we had to open windows and then it would become too cold etc.). Well the price is indeed not low, but i suppose really worth it given the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “why would you want to stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: joannajane
Reviews.Content: i took my partner to rome for our anniversary, being a poor student (with luxury tastes) there was no way i was going near anything that didn't look great. i booked a 'no-frills' room and was slightly worried about what we would actually get. the location of this hotel is ridiculously perfect. 5 minute walk from the termini (we got a coach from the airport - 8 euros for a single, very reasonable), 10 minute walk from the trevi fountain, 15 minute walk to the colosseum...the only time you may need to get a taxi (9/10 euros) is to the vatican city. on check in the reception staff were very friendly and provided a map (without us asking!) of rome and he circled the main attractions and explained most of them were within walking distance. they also gave us some information on tours etc. now onto the room. i would say if you're vaguely claustraphobic - beware. there is nowhere to look, the window had shutters over it and the room was just big enough for a small double bed, a small desk, and a small sliding wardrobe. the bathroom was very nice (extremely powerful shower - i miss it, and a toilet and sink). the room was very clean and practical, nicely designed, just a bit small. we were told the mini bar is free, which it doesn't say on the website for this particular room but it was! free water, coke, fanta...a very good idea and it certainly helped us out. free wi-fi connection was good, nice to check things online in your room. infact the whole room was very pleasant, the only thing i would have to complain about is the walls. you. hear. everything. at 7am every morning we were woken up by next doors/upstairs wake up call on their telephone. the walls are so thin we both thought it was our phone ringing! there was a baby crying from somewhere...could hear other peoples mumbled conversations...really annoying. the breakfast was very nice, everything you could really want for breakfast, although i wish they had slightly more fruit, and bigger plates!
