don't italians eat huge breakfasts? we felt quite restrained and greedy, as we wanted to be fueled for the whole day! the hotel was, i'm guessing, full when we stayed as it turned out it was an italian national holiday. the service was near perfect the whole time. our safe was broken and they allowed us the use of one of their safes, INSIDE their own safe, at the back of reception. there is also somewhere to store your luggage when you check out. we were even surprised with a bottle of red wine and some chocolates as they knew it was our anniversary. all in all, a really pleasant stay and a very convenient place to stay in rome. i will stay again if we return to rome, although i'd book a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “Artemide Hotel is the place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: shoelee
Reviews.Content: The benefits of this hotel are endless; · Excellent location (within walking distance to Rome’s places of wonder) · Superb customer service · Cleanliness and comfort · Amenities (free mini bar in your room) · A great breakfast full of varieties (make sure you drink a cup of cappuccino) Booked my flight and selected the Artemide hotel based on www.expedia.com /trip advisor recommendation. Well we were not disappointed! I work in an environment where customer service is the foundation of our business and so I was immediately impressed by the quality of service given! The staff were patient,informative, courteous, tactful and listened attentively to our questions with ease, their positive attitude was above and beyond. Thank you Matteo, and other front desk staff, head porter, Ashok, Pasquaille, housekeeper to name a few for your pleasant personality and warm appearance during our stay at the Artemide Hotel. You made our stay a happy one indeed. Great value for $$$$ spent. We will be back. Happy Canadians, room 514, (My coworker has already booked her vacation at your hotel for June 2011)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: ronacom13
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel on trip advisor and it suited our purposes perfectly. Prices were reasonable although the hotel is very attractive and the rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished. Definite plusses are the inclusion of a sumptuous breakfast buffet and free mini-bar in room. Front desk staff were efficient and helpful, understood English better than we spoke Italian and there were always several of them available and visible. The hotel location is on a busy street that is central to shopping and numerous museums and walkable to almost any destination within Rome. (we like to walk) Bus and train service is also at the doorstep. When we needed a cab the desk called for one and it arrived in less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: quoadhoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Artemide Hotel for two days in late 2010 - one day before and one after a cruise. I was very happy with my stay at the Artemide. The first day, I arrived at 10am, well before check in time. To my surprise, the room was already ready. It was a relief to be able to go up to the room and get settled after a long flight. I booked a lower priced room, which did not include the breakfast, but did include the free mini-bar. The room was small, but comfortable and had a double bed. The second day, I arrived at 11am and the room was not ready. However, the front desk took the bags and put them into locked storage. They gave us a room key and said that the room would be ready in 45 minutes and that they would bring the bags up to the room. I was a huge relief to come back to the hotel in the evening and have the bags set up. After an exhausting day walking around Rome, the last thing I wanted to deal with was checking in and dragging luggage up to the room. The hotel is nicely located. I was able to walk to the Colosseum and the train station. I felt perfectly safe on the streets near the hotel. The hotel's street also contains high end shops. The staff was very friendly. Bellhops took the suitcases immediately and appeared to be genuinely friendly as opposed to just looking for a tip. The desk staff immediately gave us a map, marking the hotel's location. The hotel also has a car service, so I was able to book a car to take me to the airport on my last day. The car arrived promptly and charged the standard rate for going from the center of Rome to the airport (can't remember if it was 40 or 45 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BeijingDB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide was our first hotel during our two week trip around Italy. The front desk staff was extremely nice and helpful. The mini-bar is free and included in the room rates (first time we've experienced this benefit!). We live in China and my wife booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor ratings and I was very happy to find out that the rating and reviews were a good prediction of our experience. The only negative is my wife worked very hard to book us into "Family Suites" during our trip around Italy but when we arrived at Artemide we were put into their "Triple Room Superior" (based on web pictures) rather than the Family Suite. The room was still very nice so I was fine with it but my wife was unhappy because it clearly wasn't the Family Suite we booked. The Front Desk told us that our room was much quieter than the Family Suite (which overlooks the Via Nazionale) but they would move us into the Family Suite if we really wanted. I convinced my wife to stay where we were since we were only in the room for sleeping...otherwise our hotel stay was very pleasant and they did have the best buffet breakfast of all the hotels during our Italian holiday. The location is very convenient to the Colosseum/Forum and within walking distance to many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing-Utterly Perfect! Thank you Hotel Artemide!”
Reviews.Author: LouHeap
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Artemide. The Hotel is amazing, the staff are exceptional and the location is perfect. All of our needs/requests were catered for with diligence and thought. The staff provide a first rate service which is second to none. Breakfast was incredible and so varied. Our room was beautiful, spacious, and very clean. Quite honestly, it is the best hotel we have ever stayed in, and we are both frequent travelers. Thank you to Alessandro and the staff of Artemide hotel who made our stay a very special and memorable one. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: isabellamalta
Reviews.Content: I always take TripAdvisor's opinion before I choose a hotel. And to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, I chose Artemide hotel. And we weren't disappointed! The location is perfect as it's near the station and it's easy to find in via Nazjonale - about 5 mins walk. Artemide is also near other main tourist attractions like the Colesseum and the Trevi fountain. In fact we walked everywhere and used the bus just across the road to go to the Vatican. All the staff were polite, friendly and helpful. The receptionists excelled in their job and dealed with every difficulty or inquiry that we had. They even provided umbrellas for us when we hadn't noticed that it was raining. The room that we stayed in was a classic double. It was very clean, quiet and had all the extras mentioned, like the free mini bar etc. The bed was very comfortable and the AC worked perfectly. You are spoil t for choice at the lavish breakfast. There was everything that one could wish to have for a breakfast. Scrambled or boiled eggs, sausages and bacon, baked beans and mushrooms, fresh vegetables like carrot sticks. 3 types of bread, butter, jam or soft cheese, yogurt, salami and slices of cheese, fresh and canned fruit, ricotta, different types of pasties, juices and tea and coffee. And the service was impeccable. Well done to the man in charge. This was a hotel that welcomed you and you enjoy coming back to after a long day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: travelinmeme
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in the door, the staff at Artemide knows what you need and goes beyond expectations to help you in every way. A warm and inviting atmosphere in all the public spaces, the best breakfast maitre d' in the business, the welcome drinks upon arrival, the free mini-bars, the nice toiletries just add to the experience. The room was modern and comfortable. Nice bathroom. Good location for public transit (esp if you have a Rome Pass). If you like to walk, many sites are accessible. We were there at Christmas and a good four course meal was offered for 40 euros, all inclusive. Stayed in 5 different hotels on this trip - some more expensive some less - what set this one apart was the service and friendliness of the entire staff, all the time and their desire to make sure that this was the best stay possible. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you very much to save our holidays!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juanjo12
Reviews.Content: We were forced to change the hotel while in Rome and we were so lucky to find a room at the Artemide Hotel (it was in the afternoon on 31 December, having found a room so easily was something really incredible!). From the very moment we entered in the hotel, we were treated with a lot of kind attention and we felt, why not say it, we felt like prince and princess. The staff was very friendly and we felt very comfortable there. We had been informed that the minibar of the room was free of charge and would be refilled every morning. And although it might sound unbelievable, it was exactly like this. We were also given a voucher for a cup of coffee or a glass of sparkling wine in the bar of the hotel. As it was New Year's Eve, we were also given a bottle of champagne and chocolate pannetini. There was plenty of sweet and salty biscuits and peanuts, coffee and tea facilities in the room. Something very typical for a 4* hotel. But there was much more, which you do not always find at 4* hotels. In the bathroom, apart from the usual little bottles of shampoo and shower gel, there were beautiful slippers and, in case you had forgotten ANY item (shaving foam, toothbrush etc.), you could request it free of charge at the reception. The room and the bathroom smelled very nice, as there was a scented oil with wooden sticks in the bathroom. Everything was very clean and the bedsheets were of a very good quality as well. As for the breakfast, it was NOT the typical simple continental breakfast. There was plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables, bread, pastry, warm meals, yoghurts etc. The service at breakfast was absolutely perfect, plenty of waitresses at our disposal. We are writing all this because when leaving for the airport we felt as if we were leaving our home. And staying at the Artemide Hotel did make us feel at home and very happy and wall the staff took a good care of us. We were sorry to leave, but we will definitely come back. And we will recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel-they are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: cmcaudillo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide was all that we had hoped for and more. After reading reviews, I was sure that this would be a great place to stay, but I was still amazed at how helpful the staff was. I must have asked for help from Matteo at least 3 times per day to get directions, advice, or call a local establishment for me; he always smiled and was eager to please. The room was upgraded upon our arrival and was very comfortable and clean. We stayed on the interior rooms with windows that opened for fresh air and drying out our umbrellas, etc (it rained most of our trip), there wasn't much of a view, but with as little of time that we spent there, it didn't bother me in the slightest. The room was quite comfortable and I loved that the minibar always had a new stock of juice and bottled water-try the blood orange juice if you can, its excellent! I wasn't crazy about the Italian beer in the fridge, though I'm a darker beer drinker. The bar downstairs was a great place to start the evening and get a nice glass of wine. The location is great, very central to just about everything, we walked everywhere, even the Vatican-though we are quite athletic and enjoyed the long stroll. We did also take the Metro a few times when we had less time, the Termini station is close by I hear, but we usually used the Republicca station, which is just a couple blocks away as well. We only had to take a cab or bus a couple of times (to the Appian Way and the Futbol stadium). I hope that we make it back to Roma soon, when we do, we will stay here again. I will always have the fondest of memories in Roma, and the Artemide is a large part of that. Thank you Matteo, Pino and other Artemide staff-you are all wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheMcHales
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artimede is located on one of the "most happening" streets in Rome. It is central and within walking distance to most anything you'd want to see or do. The hotel had a fantastic buffet breakfast with lots to choose from and something for everyone. Even better - the room had a free mini bar with tons of drinks and some lite snacks - replaced daily. The staff was very helpful and informative. The one and only con: The bed was very firm. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Prithie
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Artemide Hotel in December. I loved the location -a walk away from the Colloseum and major attractions in Rome. We booked a family suite and were pleasantly surpised at the size of the room. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly and the service was good.Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Canadians_who_travel
Reviews.Content: We took a mediterranean cruise which ended at the port in Civitavecchia (near Rome, Italy). We decided to stay at Hotel Artemide. We could have hired a car or taxi but both tend to be expensive from the port (approx. 100- 150 Euros). We decided to take the train. Five of us shared a 10 min. cab ride to Civitavecchia train station. The ride to Roma Termini cost us about 10 Euros. From there we walked to Artemide in 20 minutes. We could have taken a cab but we love walking in Rome. If you do decide to take the train, be prepared to walk up/down stairs with your luggage. Also, depending the time of day, Termini can be extremely crowded. However, our trip was pleasant and we would repeat it. Artemide's front desk staff can be summed up in three words: classy, friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent! I wish all continental breakfasts followed these standards. The pastry, bread and fruit were all fresh. The (espresso) coffee was excellent and served the way you want. The servers were friendly and service was quick. At first sight, the breakfast manager can appear to be rude, but after a quick "Bongiorno" and a compliment he warmed up quickly. I think he simply wants everything to be right. It was our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel's suite was very cozy and comfortable, even by North American standards. The air conditioning worked very well, which can be a challenge in Europe. The room was spacious and well layed out with a large bathroom. The hotel had an excellent room top restaurant/bar. It was a very relaxing visit. The waiter was friendly and service was very good. The area around the hotel had many shops and restaurants (try "il Posto Accanto" but make sure you reserve). Many tourist spots are within walking distance. Metro and train service are close by. Our thanks to the staff of Artemide who made our Rome visit very memorable; we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: EKPK
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our honeymoon. Spent 5 nights here. First stint in Europe so my reference point is US hotels. Clean room. Bed was not comfortable, but then none in Italy were. Breakfast was good and handy, but got tired of it by 5th day. A short walk from the metro from the airport, so no cab needed. We don't mind walking so everything was in reach for us. It seemed based on my experience this was a good hotel for Italy, but the bed comfort situation there needs help. Would probably look at other places just to try something new. Would recommend with stated reservations. Irish bar right near by for a good drink.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie-William
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide gave us a wonderful experience. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and thanks to the staff we had a wonderful stay. They all went out of their way (upgraded room, complimentary wine, and card). The front desk staff are so nice and really helpful. The bartenders (especially Eugenio; not sure of the spelling but I think that's close) were fantastic. We've recommended this hotel to several others and will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel. It is close to so many things and in walking distance to pretty much everywhere. (I would pass on the restaurants near the hotel as they weren't anything spectacular and lacked in service... but the staff at the hotel can help with other recommendations. )

Reviews.Title: “A gem worth trying”
Reviews.Author: leslewisw
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights while in Rome. I read all the reviews before booking and based on what everyone wrote here I booked. The staff were exceptiomally friendly and helpfull. My daughter left her boots n the room and they shipped them on their own dime. The rooms although a little small were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was a buffet with a goos selection of hot and cold and included in the room price. The hotel is fairly central and most areas are a 15 minute walk or less.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: hassanScott
Reviews.Content: Normally I can think of something for improvement, but honestly this hotel was exceptional. I want to pinpoint one person, but really from top to bottom they are completely focused on the customers experience. I am impressed. Obviously this comes from top management. We were there at an unusual time - there were demonstrations in town, and the airport of our next destination, Athens, was closed due to protests. They were helpful throughout. There was plenty of food nearby, metro not too far away, Mcdonalds nearby, near everything... rooms were also decent sized.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: shimon53
Reviews.Content: Great location near stores, buses, and metro; very helpful staff at reception; quiet, comfortable, well-lit room with a comfortable bed and well-stocked bathroom; full, quality breakfast served by a friendly, polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, with a few kinks”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took a long weekend break away from families to enjoy Rome for the first time. The Artemide Hotel was a good choice as the location is really convenient - easy to find, in a great neighborhood, and centrally located to many attractions and also the metro and buses. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the free buffet breakfast was good with plenty of choices (although a bit of a tilt towards UK tastes in the hot choices). The room itself was somewhat small, although well appointed. At check-in, the room was made up as a double bed, which needed to be adjusted to two singles by the staff - which took a while and was annoying because the reservation request was so clear about that. Also, the free minibar, while certainly a nice touch, wasn't refilled on a daily basis, leaving me to wonder if that was really an oversight or not. Overall though, these minor flaws were just that, and both Rome and the Artemide deserve another visit. Also, we used the Roma Card for transportation and museum entries and felt it was a good bargain. Try to get a good metro and bus map if you can - it is easy to get around once you get the swing of things, but we were never able to find an easy-to-read bus route map, which would help since the hotel is on a street with several major bus lines on it. That said, even if you end up in the wrong place, this being Rome, you'll still be near some amazing ruin, interesting church, and fantastic restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Warm friendly staff - Just perfect and great location”
Reviews.Author: KDUR123
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying here at this great hotel. Service - Booking via the website was very easy. They emailed confirmation, and then again a few days before. They were very helpful, and gave directions to get there. They offered a taxi service too. Location - The location is perfect, its walking distance from the metro, just 5 mins up the street. Getting from airport. Its 45 mins in a taxi from Campinon airport. Taxi (booked by the hotel beforehand) was 60 euros, and they will stay there til you arrive. Expensive, but the easy option. Its only 40 euros from the hotel to the airport as there's no waiting involved. If time isn't important you can get the bus 8 euros one way, run every 45 mins, or you can get the train into Termini station for 18 euros return. So the taxi is expensive, but it meant we didn't waste any time! Check-in - Quick, we were early(11.30am), and had to wait 15mins for our room, but they give everyone a complimentary glass of sparkling wine etc so it was not a problem. The staff are exceptionally friendly, all of them were superb, so helpful. Room was lovely, very warm, clean, we were shown to our room and everything was explained to us. Room contained a safe, which was free to use. Lots of toiletries, free slippers too. Mini bar is completely free to use, and refreshed daily, inc beer, water, nibbles etc, very nice touch. Sauna (big enough for 4) and gym (treadmill, cross trainer, bike and one other i cant remember) were small but perfectly formed, lots of clean towels, a nice clean shower in a private room so you can get clean afterwards. Breakfast - Fantastic, so much choice, self service, hot bacon, eggs, fresh fruit, cakes, you will be spoilt for choice. Dinner - The menu looked nice, but I didn't try it so cant really comment. - I went to Est Est Est Ricci on Genova street, turn left out of the hotel and its the 2nd or 3rd street on the left, fantastic place. I think there was internet access, i could see a room with 6 PCs in it, but i didn't use it. This hotel should be very proud of its staff, I have never been to a hotel where they are so attentive and friendly. I stayed here as 2 people I know had been here before and recommended it, and I certainly will be going back there at some point!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MiriamGallo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Artemide for 3 nigths;The hotel is excelent:location close to everything:metro,Termini Station,Touristic buses,sightseeing,restaurants,stores,...You can walk to many places.The staff is very friendly;the hotel has many facilities,free mini bar,coffee and tea in the room,...everything you can imagine;the room is very comfortable and breakfast is excellent!They do everything for you feel well and for my surpise they put a flag of your country in front of hotel.When I saw the Brazilian flag I feel very very happy.Thank you Artemide!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LouizaLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Artemide for 3 nights. From the moment we walked in the staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful throughout our stay. The hotel services are very good. We stayed in the small double room, small yes but perfectly formed with good sized shower room. The touches like free minibar and complimentary bottle of wine for husband's b'day made our stay very welcoming. Location is good 7 mins walk from Termini station and tour buses, 4 mins from metro. But must attractions within a 30 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the desk and with the breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: dpgjr
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend someone to stay here as the location of the Hotel was excellent and within walking distance from the METRO station.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest”
Reviews.Author: FCARBS
Reviews.Content: i honestly can not say enough good things about this hotel ! the staff was marvelous ,,,, Every single last one of them !!! everybody from the romanian cleaning lady who pleasently greeted me every morning to the desk personnel (ALLESANDRO, PINO, all of them) which handled my every need, assuring me time and time again that i was in good hands. Those wonderful bell boys that catered to me , even the driver you guys got me for the trip to the airport !! aaaaaa+++++ service , facilitys , and location ! i am so happy with my stay that i cannot wait to return. You made my family quite happy and very comfortable. I CANT SAY THANKS ENOUGH!!!!!! everbody was fantastic ,, Idid although get a chance to know one of your employees a bit better because my family and i sat with him on a nightly basis. His Name....... EUGENIO ...... WHAT A PERFECT GENTLEMAN THIS WAS. I really could not of met a better man to wind down with at the end of everyday. After long days of seeing the sights it was a pleasure to sit with this man and feel the warmth of his heart ! HE IS A TRUE GEM ! It was also very nice to enjoy those fantastic tasty treats that Emilio whips up. EMILIO IS A FOOD ARTIST TO SAY THE LEAST .. Rome was a beautiful place but honestly it was the people and staff handling my stay which made this trip what it was to me and my family.. GOD BLESS ALL OF YOU AND THANKS FOR THE MEMORIES, WHICH BY THE WAY WE WILL HAVE MORE OF .. THANK YOU AGAIN AND SEE U ALL SOON !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in prime loaction for city break with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Joanna_H23
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for a romantic city break with my boyfriend to celebrate our first year anniversary. It was our first time to Italy and we had great epectiations - and we were not disappointed! On arriving to the hotel we were greeted by the friendly staff and offered a room upgrade, as they knew we were celebrating a special occassion! Our bags were brought upstairs by the helpful staff and we were shown to our room. A kingsize bed awaited (extremely comfortable!), in a fully equipped room. The bathrobes & slippers were a much welcomed touch! I had forgotten my adaptor and called down to reception to say as much and within the hour they had one brought up to me. The only negative comment on the room is that there was no daylight as the blinds were fixed - I assume the view wasn't the best outside! From start to finish we were both impressed with the service and amenities, the location was superb and we would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel..”
Reviews.Author: contactjasonr
Reviews.Content: Exceptional customer service, great location, very clean and classy, but not stuffy. We were very happy with this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: erebec11
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff gave us excellent suggestions of what to do and where to eat - they even called restaurants and made reservations for us. The hotel was comfortable, but the rooms were small. There was a complementery mini-bar in the room that was refilled each day with flat and sparkling water, beer, juices and snacks - very nice ammenity! The hotel arranged transportation to and from the airport for us, but the driver dropped us off at the service entrance to the airport and we had to walk a half mile to the terminals, carrying all of our luggage. Hotel Artemide was very gracious and refunded us all of the transportation cost because of this mishap. All in all, a very friendly place and a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: uerbaogoid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from November 27, to December 2, and I believe this hotel hasn’t got much to improve on. It’s very well located, central, near the train station (but not too much – walking distance), metro and bus lines. The hotel, for its kind, has every amenity you can think of (gym, bar, wi-fi, business center, restaurant) and the treats are amazing (little chocolates every day and a mini-bar plus snacks restocked every day and included in the price). The reception staff is very kind, competent and professional, and has no problem with any language. The maids are also very competent and our room was neat and spotless, every day The breakfast is also great with a wide selection that doesn’t bore you even if you stay a few days like we did. It has pastries of all kinds, eggs (scrambled and boiled), mushrooms, sausages, bacon, etc. It’s a very good buffet. The breakfast staff is also very kind, capable and qualified. The only thing we have to point out on the negative side, and this is being very, very, but very picky, is that besides the wide selection of TV channels, it lacked one in Portuguese. But, as I said, this is being very picky… In conclusion: This is a great hotel to stay in if you’re going to rome on vacation (like we did) or if you go for business reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - such helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rineei
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels I've stayed at on my recent trip to Europe, this one has been one of the least expensive and the best. Such great service from reception offering free brekky when we arrived too early to check into our room (to which we were also upgraded) and helpful trips and maps showcasing Rome. Breakfast was even sent to our room when we had day trips which started earlier than the breakfast buffet! Now that's service! Liked it so much felt compelled to write a review on tripadvisor - will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “4+ star friendly ,spotless with extra amenities included ideal location”
Reviews.Author: HampshireDenise
Reviews.Content: An excellent 4 star hotel which lives up to the expectations and beyond . Friendly and very helpful reception staff,excellent breakfast best ever had.also very attentive staff.Rooms equipped with tea /coffee and biscuits soft drinks etc.which was really appreciated Rooms spotless and quiet.Ideal Location close to Rail Station and central to shopping and within walking distance of most tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: supercassie
Reviews.Content: i have been a silent lurker in TA but i just had to make an exception about this hotel. we stayed for 5 nights until december 1.everything about this hotel is excellent: location, breakfast, amenities, name it. but what really takes the cake is the service. nothing was too much for them. without you even asking, they will provide you an umbrella when they see that it's raining. they give you tips on the best way to get to the sites. we love the lindt chocolates at night and the free mini-bar. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JPRam454
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artemide Hotel for 6 nights and were incredibly pleased with the experience. From the moment we walked in (very tired from a long day of travel from the States) we felt welcome and at ease. We were given an upgraded room, which meant a king size bed and a view of a courtyard. The hotel was clean and quiet, which is my two most important aspects of a hotel. The breakfast buffet was great. The servers in the breakfast area always made sure you had a delicious cappucino or coffee with your breakfast. The food was fresh and filling (bacon and eggs for us Americans that are used to a hearty breakfast) plus pastries, fresh fruit, yogurts, etc. The location was also great. It's a short walk from the Termini train station, which is where you catch both local subway trains and regional overground trains. Its a short walk to the Colosseum, Roman Forums, Trevi Fountain, and many more great sights. There is some great restaurants, markets, and clothing shops nearby. All in all I can't recommend Artemide Hotel enough. You will definitely enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: YoCio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on a family vacation and we simply had the most wonderful time. The location is perfect! We were able to walk pretty much everywhere from the Trevi Fountain to the Coloseum, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese...basically we only had to take the subway when we went to the Vatican. The rooms are nicely furnished, clean and all three rooms had huge beds. The bathrooms are quite big for Europe and decorated very tastefully. You will appreciate the free minibar (beer, soft drinks, sparkling & still water) and snacks, as well as the miniature Lindt chocolates housekeeping leaves in your room every day. The hotel also offers free WiFi and free breakfast. We loved the breakfast buffet (huge variety and very tasty), as well as the lovely staff in the restaurant. The hotel staff in general is extremely nice and attentive and they will do their best to make you feel as comfortable as possible. We'll definitely stay here again on our next visit to Rome. A big thank you to everybody at Hotel Artemide!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Artimide”
Reviews.Author: belmontking
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Hotel on our visit to Rome, we were both impressed by the location, service, food and courteous staff. Great location for seeing the sites all are within walking distance if fit and able, if not Metro stop is just 200 metres away. Rome is a fabulous city with great sightseeing, we managed to see the main sites in the three days but it was hard work, much better if you have a few days longer to stay. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “our hotel for the future in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jggi
Reviews.Content: free wifi and breakfast included in the room rate, efficient staff. fine shopping surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Cannot praise this hotel enough!!”
Reviews.Author: happydonegalcouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a busy street but you would never know it in your room. Our room was spacious and very clean. The staff cannot do enough for you, they may look a bit snobby but they are lovely. The breakfast was fab and service is excellent. It is a 2 min walk to the Metro which takes you to the sites if you are not into walking but if you dont mind walking it is ideally located for all the major sites. I was not sure this hotel would be worth the €150 per night but we saved so much on taxi fares as we were able to use our legs instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a fantastic experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taggart_donna_l
Reviews.Content: After travelling around Italy for a week my Mother and I arrived in Rome for our final days abroad. We were greeted with wonderful service from the front desk who noticed that it was my mums birthday the following day. What a great surprise the next morning when we went to breakfast to be greeted by a birthday cake and champagne. The best service of all hotels in Italy. I would highly recommend this hotel for its service, location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Roma in 4 days”
Reviews.Author: GheorgheniJeno
Reviews.Content: The services of Artemide hotel was very good ,the staff friendly , the location of hotel is same perfect. After one day we recognized that all famous site could be visited by relaxing walking from hotel. The recomanded fish restaurant same good but all other restaurants/bars arround Artemide same good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Service Oriented! You get what you ask for and more!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLady8888
Reviews.Content: Excellent service...above and beyond exceeding your expectations.... Breakfast was the best out of the 3 places we stayed in Italy.... a full spread with HOT food too! Location is walking distance to all major attractions. Lots of restaurants close to the Hotel... and a free mini bar in the room with a coffee maker. We stayed at all high-end places and this was the only one with an in room coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel in wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: Skinto11
Reviews.Content: I had contacted the hotel a couple of weeks prior to our arrival and mentioned that I was planning to propose whilst in Rome - I received an email within 24 hours advising that they would do all they could to make our stay as special as possible. On arrival we were upgraded to a lovely room with a terrace and at this point I decided to propose on the terrace as it was so perfect. I'm pleased to say that she did say yes. During the remainder of our stay we were looked after incredibly well and the hotel staff assisted with restaurant bookings and recommendations. They were able to give us helpful tips and assistance when visiting the numerous places of interest that Rome offers. The location of the hotel means you can walk most of city's highlights and we found ourselves barely using the subway. Little touches like the complimentary mini-bar were great and the breakfast options are plentiful. Rome is a magical city with so much to see and do and the Artemide was the perfect accompaniment. A wonderfully located hotel with incredibly friendly and attentive staff that were always willing to listen to our questions and offer fantastic advice. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and a little more!”
Reviews.Author: FinnMale
Reviews.Content: We stayd two nights at Artemide. Have to say that it's one of the - if not the - best hotel I've ever visited. Clean, classy, excellent breakfast, good service, nice location etc. Yes, you get that in many places, but Matteo and all other at the front desk really did extra! I wrote them before the trip that it would be to celebrate our engagement. Well, our room was upgraded and naturally there was a bottle of sparkling and a letter waiting for us at our room when we arrived - without any extra charge. And since we decided to spend an extra night in Rome they booked us a very good offer at a hotel next door (Artemide was full) and took care of our luggage to that hotel. Also the pre and post stay messages makes one feel respect as a customer. We can defenately recomment Artemide for anyone - and will for sure be back there when we visit marvellous Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free mini-bar, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KRIE08
Reviews.Content: Believe me when I say I searched and searched numerous hotel sites trying to work out where to start when choosing a hotel in Rome. After lots of comparisons I chose this fantastic hotel, and am really pleased I did! The staff on the front desk were really helpful and on a couple of occasions they googled information for me that I needed. Free minibar was fab in the room, and breakfast was plentiful. We were also given a free up-grade which was a lovely touch. The room was spotless. We had to check-out in the morning but they stored our luggage and we were able to shower and change in the gym area prior to going to the airport which was great. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic and well priced hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLou
Reviews.Content: There's not much I can add to the glowing reviews of this fantastic hotel. If you're going to Rome and want to stay at a centrally located hotel which is very clean and comfortable, look no further! The hotel staff was super friendly and very helpful with all of our requests. Breakfast was phenomenal and included in the room price! There's free wifi access throughout the hotel and the room frigobar is completely free! We're looking forward to staying at this hotel again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “so much to offer”
Reviews.Author: heatherben1113
Reviews.Content: We just returned and there are so many things this hotel has to offer. It does have a free minibar with soda, water, and beer that is refilled every day. Nice decorations. Business center and a computer for free 15 minute use to Internet. Close proximity to many of the sites. Great breakfast. Rooms were very clean, and they had so many little bottles of goodies in the bathroom. They have a blow dryer in the room, and anything else you could possible need. I found the front desk staff were rude. I am not sure that they liked having a woman ask them questions. All male staff at the check-in. They were willing to help, and gave good food recommendations. Spoke English very well. But, we left every conversation thinking they were completely put off by our questions. Great service by the bell boys (not sure if that is the best term) and the staff in the restaurant. I read somewhere to take the Leonardo Express from the airport. However, this was not eay with heavy luggage. It was a long walk (with luggage) to the train stattion and then you need to take the Metro to get closer to the hotel. I would recommend taking a taxi, which we did on the return trip to the airpot. This cost us 40E. The hotel has a shuttle for 45E. I would recommend staying here again, but it felt a little cold. Keep in mind we had just come from a hotel in Paris with very warm & friendly & helpful service. So, there was some comparison easily made.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyF64
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice from the moment we walked in - we arrived at 9:30am after flying all night. The staff was so friendly - they sent us off for breakfast and our room was ready an hour later. Looked newly remodeled with a marble appointed bathroom. There was also a free buffet breakfast every morning with fruit, cereal, yogurt, eggs, toast, etc that was very good. All the staff were very friendly from the bell boys to the bar. The hotel is centrally located - coliseum 15 min walk, a metro stop 5 minutes, Spanish steps, Pantheon only 20 minutes. I would absolutely stay here again! Thank you everyone at the Hotel Artemide for making my first trip to Rome a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: MCampbell079
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent 3 nights at the Artemide Hotel and we were quite pleased. First, the hotel was immaculate,( a top priority !), the location was key to all sites, and the breakfast offered was perfect. The front desk staff was quite accommodating, very willing to answer questions ,make suggestions, as well as give great directions (in English). Traveling with a teen and a young adult we all appreciated the gym and the free minibar. Located near a supermarket and a pharmacy, along with the metro and bus stops literally right out the front door make this an excellent place to stay while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excels in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Prebbletonite
Reviews.Content: This hotel excels in every way! Great position , an easy walk from the railway station. The lobby, bar,( roof top in the summer), room with a conservatory and terrace were wonderful, great bathroom, tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar eta. The breakfast service is the best I have ever seen, It is well run by a manager and he makes sure that everything is replenished and that all your needs are catered for.Any plates that are finished with are removed within 2 minutes.And I applaud his work! This hotel is elegant, and oozes class! But without a doubt it's the staff and service that makes this hotel the best! From check in to check out, the service was flawless. and nothing is to much trouble! The reception staff know their stuff , our bags were in our room before we even asked, the bar staff will go out of their way for you, and everyone is greeted with a smile and hello! This is one of my top finds in our european trip of 5 weeks. Do not hesitate , you will not be sorry! In a place like Rome, it was a pleasure to return to every evening.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary, First trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bellagio90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned our first trip to Rome on our 20th anniversary. We had read so many great review on Hotel Artemide and I would say they were very accurate. Our stay was for 4 nights, October 20th-25th. The hotel is comparable to a 4 star US hotel. The first room we were given was on the first floor and was somewhat noisy. We asked to switch rooms the next morning and were relocated to the 6th floor. Both rooms were upgrades to a superior room. The beds were king size beds, comfortable and each room had a couch and business desk. The free wireless internet access functioned well. The bathroom was large for a hotel in Europe. The breakfast was a nice start to the day and had a nice selection of scrambled eggs, bacon, juices, pastries, pancakes, toast, yogurt ect... The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a nice bottle of wine in our room the first day wishing us a happy anniversary. The location is a couple blocks from the Repubblica Metro and less than 10 min walk from the Termini Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique property”
Reviews.Author: mpfund
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! We stayed for 3 nights, Oct 30-1Nov and were very pleased. The location on Via Nazionale is great. The bar, breakfast and rooms were excellent -- especially the large bathroom. But where this hotel really excelled was the amazing service. Nothing was too much trouble from helping a computer challenged senior citizen with printing boarding passes, to recommending local restaurants that exactly matched our desires. We would return to Artemide hotel again and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Veloist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a short break. Upgraded to a superior room which was clean and comfortable and a good size. Front desk staff friendly and helpful and the location made it possible to walk to everything we wanted to see. Would stay again, the only downside was the bar service, very difficult to get any. We walked out on one night after waiting 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CamAmy
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Artemide. The staff we're exceptional, so helpful..nothing was too much trouble. They really made an effort to make sure we could find our way around Rome and offered their advice on tours, restaurants etc. Very helpful. The hotel itself was excellent, truly the best I stayed in throughout Europe. The furnishings were top quality, bed was so comfortable, free minibar, cleanliness was top notch. I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. Husband and I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for all things Roman”
Reviews.Author: Readalot936
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel lived up to its billing, with friendly, helpful English-speaking staff, large spacious room with contemporary furnishings, and the most wonderful breakfast we had on our 20 day trip to Italy. The advertised WiFi was free and fast and the minibar was well stocked and replenished everyday free of charge also. The breakfasts included every kind of fruit, breads, pastries, hot American entries like eggs and bacon, hot sides that appeal to the European traveler, salad makings, etc. Tea, coffee, expresso, and capachino were all included in the buffet. We'll be back here again as the closeness to tourist sights was very important to us. The metro was just blocks away and walking to places like the Coloseum or Trevi Fountain were about 20 minutes. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidandAnneGrimsby
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a citybreak. The hotel is very convenient to walk into the centre but also located near to the metro and main station. This makes it easy to access from Fiumicino airport on the easy to find and use (if somewhat overpriced) Leonardo Express. The hotel is very well presented throughout. It is meticulously clean and the decoration is tasteful and well executed. Despite being on a very busy street, the hotel has a peaceful atmosphere where we immediately felt relaxed. Our room was a very good size with a lovely bathroom. The free minibar was a nice touch and the ample consumables (minibar, tea/coffee/biscuits etc, bathroom) were good quality and fully re-stocked each day. The sheets and towels were fresh each day. Although the view wasn't up to much (not that it pretended to be - it is a city centre after all) the windows opened easily but kept out the light and noise of a big city with ease. There were shutters, insect screen, double glazing, blind and heavy curtains to each window! Enough to provide even the lightest sleeper with total peace. The breakfast was excellent with a very good choice of all cold items and a more limited choice of hot. All the food was really well displayed and looked very appetising - everything we had was of the very best quality and kept at the correct temperature. It was easy to eat healthily from the excellent choice of fruit, yoghurt, salad, cold meats and cheeses etc but even easier to eat very badly on the wonderful choice of cake and pastry (I counted 10 different items!). The service was of the highest standard at all times. The staff were impeccably dressed and extremely polite at all times. They were friendly yet didn't intrude in any way. Everything was attended to immediately and discretely. The service left us feeling very well cared for and reflected admirably the high quality experience provided throughout. We ate in the hotel one evening and the meal was good but not as outstanding as the remainder of the hotel's provision. Rome is a wonderful city and the Artemide provides accommodation to match.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Loudot79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Artimede Hotel from 28.10.10 to 02.11.10 and although I had read all the reviews, I found it very hard to believe that this hotel would be so good. I was wrong to doubt it. Everything about the hotel was great, especially the staff! The breakfast was good and you could eat as much as you wanted. There were lots of nice touchs in the room, like asking if you had forgotten anything e.g. razors, toothbrushes etc. All you ahd to do was phone reception and they delivered the goods in minutes free of charge. Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Ira_Sh
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel at May 2010 with a baby. The hotel is situated in a great location, so you can walk to most of the tourist attractions by foot. The front desk team is amazing and very helpful. The rooms are ok ,the breakfast is ok, but the service and the location are that make this place a great choise for your stay in Rome. The free mini bar is a plus too. We've made the hotel know that we had a wedding anniversary, so the hotel sent us wine to celebrate in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful short break”
Reviews.Author: Horsfields
Reviews.Content: First visit to Rome and I must say it was fabulous, helped by the great hotel. The Artimide is very well placed being only 5-10 minutes walk from the Termini station (where the Terravision airport coach drops off) and also easy walking diatance from most of Rome's main attractions. It was our 15th anniversary, and not only did we get a free upgrade but also a card and bottle of wine on arrival. The room was clean and very quiet considering the amount of traffic noice on the street. Free WIFI and Mini bar were a good treat, nice to relax after a days walking with a bath, free cold beer and chance to check facebook!,and water to take with you each day is a must. Staff were friendly and helpful, and breakfasts delicious with a good selection. Over all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: alvinlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first visit to Rome, and could not have been better served. The staff were courteous and helpful, the room was lovely, and the breakfasts superb. I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “love it love it love it”
Reviews.Author: travnutz
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! We feel that this will be our hotel of choice to stay at in Rome in the future. The rooms were comfortable, great amenities, exceptionally clean, and the breakfast was yummy. I must mention the outstanding service from the front desk. Alessandro took very, very good care of us. Always around when you needed anything, great local gelato recommendations and remembered our anniversary and sent up wine to our room. He went above and beyond to make our stay very memorable. The hotel location was walking distance to many place of interest. We will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andawem
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day break with our teenage daughter. We had a triple superior room which even with the extra single bed in, was still spacious. Our room was at the front of the hotel, and as other people have said, the road can keep you awake. The hotel is in a great location with most of the sights within walking distance. The only trip we made on the Metro was to the Vatican City. The staff were very helpful recommending restaurants and sorting out a car to take us to the airport. The breakfasts were very good, everything from eggs and bacon to fresh fruit and yogurt and the restaurant staff very efficient. We really can't say a bad word and look forward to visiting again! Visiting Tips (hope they are useful!) Roman Forum/Palantine Hills/Colosseum:- When you are visiting these buy a ticket that covers all three (we bought ours at the Roman Forum entrace) you can then walk straight in the Colosseum without standing in line for hours. Also if you have under 18's with you, take their passport with you as they get in free! The toliets at the Roman Forum are shocking, there is not even anywhere to wash your hands afterwards, so make sure you go before visiting. Metro:- We took the metro to the Vatican and was amazed at how easy it was. The trains are clean and spacious, much nicer than the London Underground! You can buy a 1 Euro ticket that is valid for 75 mins and allows you to hop on the Metro as many time as you like in that time. For 4 Euros you can buy a 24 hour ticket. There are also weekly and monthly passes available. Car to Airport:- We took the train into Rome from the airport. Whilst it was no real hassle we regreted not getting the hotel to send a car. They kindly arranged this for our return to the airport at a cost of 45 Euros. This was great value when you consider that we paid 42 Euros for the train and then had to walk from the Termini to the hotel. Airport:- We flew Heathrow to FCO. We had no problems coming in, but cannot say the same about flying out. We reommend you leave plenty of time for going through security. The organisation was terrible and it took us over an hour and a half to get through. I can only liken the experience to being like a rugby scrum. People were pushing, Italians were screaming at each other and tempers definately got out of hand. My husband, daughter and I got split up due to all the pushing and shoving and people from the back kept trying to queue jump. In the end my husband, who managed to get through way before my daughter and I, called a police officer to come and help us as our daughter was so distressed she started crying. By the time all three of us were through, we were soaked in sweat, physically shaking and pretty distressed by the whole ordeal. The airport needs to seriously review its security arrangements as I would say it is only a matter of time before someone is seriously hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: DianeBNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Artemide and found the service to be very good. The room was very clean although a big dated. The bed was rock hard, some people may like that, we did not. It is located on a very busy street so it lacks charm but you can walk to all the major attractions. We would recommend to someone who wants a good, clean hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: amtc63
Reviews.Content: A very impressive hotel all round. Excellent staff in all areas - the front desk deserves special attention. They were extremely helpful and any issues/queries were sorted out immediately. The free mini bar ( 2 beers each day, still & sparkling water and several other soft drinks) is a nice touch. Bar prices are very reasonable for a hotel of this standard - eg a decent bottle of wine for 15 - 20 Euros. Rooms are very clean and comfortable and housekeeping efficient. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 4travel59
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a few days in Rome after a week in Tuscany with extended family. The hotel location is perfect for exploring all that is Rome. The rooms while not large are quite comfortable and the WC is spacious. The front desk staff were helpful and accomodating. They went out of their way to help me with wireless issues with my Nook reader. The rooftop bar is wonderful with incredible views and perfect for relaxing after a full day exploring. The breakfast offered was bountiful! with excellent service. This was a repeat trip to Rome for us, and while our previous hotel Via San Pio was lovely, I would stay at the Artemide without hesitation. It will be our go to hotel for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: captexpress
Reviews.Content: This is a very well managed hotel with outstanding service. Our stay was very pleasant from check in to check out. Everyone in the hotel staff did a great job making us feel welcome throughout our stay. In particular, there is a very kind gentleman who oversees the breakfast who will make you feel right at home with his swift, elegant and efficient service. The front desk staff were always eager to help us with any advice, recommendations and reservations. Housekeeping staff were very professional and seamless in terms of room cleaning and turn down. The rooms are spacious by European standards and very clean and quiet. The free mini bar is also a very nice touch. If you are looking for an excellent hotel in a perfect location for sightseeing, the Artemide is the way to go. I go to Rome each year and this was my first stay at the Artemide, it will not be my last. PS.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MickeySydney
Reviews.Content: Artemide is a really good 4 star hotel in a good location in Rome. The front desk staff were very helpful and professional - it was the best tip during our stay in Rome to get the Vatican tickets in advance, when we arrived in Vatican the next day and could skip the very very long queue, we were very grateful! The room was spacious and elegant, no shabby chic here! The breakfast also was very good. The only reason we took off one point is our lunch experience. The guy on the roof in charge of the restaurant wasn’t very interested in his job at all! He kept disappearing and we had to wait for very long indeed to get the food ordered. I ordered beef which was meant to come with potatoes. I was brought beef with few salad leaves, when I queried the whereabouts of the potatoes, the waiter said he thinks the kitchen ran out of them!!! We finally got the potatoes when we were long finished with our food! It was a comedy on the roof. Stay in the hotel but find somewhere else to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay for great Value Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dgmiterek24
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel cute and charming! Our room were very spacious and clean, the shower was a bit small but the rest of the room was great! The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful! The location of the hotel is in the center walking distance to most major sites, the metro is 2 min walk from the hotel so you can take metro everywhere as well. The metro ride to the vatican is about fifteen minuets! I would definitley stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveller_0070
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel is a great hotel for the price. The location is fabulous - with a pair of good walking shoes, the sites of Rome are at your disposal. I would recommend taking a cab or public transportation only to the Vatican. Although I personally did not have many questions about tourist sites and access thereto, I overheard many others asking the staff questions. The responses they received seemed to be very informative and helpful. In addition, the service at the Hotel was really great. We arranged for an airport transfer, which worked out great. My husband's "extra pillow" demands were met quickly. And, when I forgot some items of clothing in the closet, the Hotel staff rounded them up and sent them to my home. Honestly, I was shocked at this level of service. I would recommend this hotel whole-heartedly to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neri52
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and rarely does a hotel exceed my expectations. The Artemide is the one exception. We were in Rome traveling with teenage daughters, coincidentally on my birthday, when the bellman rang our door, sang happy birthday, and delivered a bottle of Italian wine for my enjoyment. Apparently when we checked in, the hotel staff noticed by birthday from my passort. Everything about this hotel was confortable, clean, great food and location within walking distance to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Artemide”
Reviews.Author: fabulous_lottie
Reviews.Content: Lovely 4 star hotel in a great location, particularly if you like walking and easy access to Rome's underground metro links. Rooms were nicely presented with a generous size bathroom. Really enjoyed the free mini bar too :) Had breakfast the once - lots of variety including cooked (such as eggs and bacon) and many cereals and fruit were also available. The hotel also has a rooftop bar, but it wasn't open during our stay. There is one about 50 metres away from the hotel (turn right as you come out of the hotel entrance), which we went into and enjoyed a free drink and buffet food! This was our first visit to Rome, but we only explored the main locations. Vatican City is a must (where you can also send a postcard to someone back home), the food is amazing (especially at the restaurants within the Cavour area) and the Colosseum will definately take your breath away! (Oh and not forgetting the Trevi Fountains, Piazza Navona and the Spanish Steps of course). We were also fortunate enough to go watch AS Roma win at their home football ground! Overall, Rome is a beautiful city with so much to offer...you will not see everything on your first visit! I definately recommend the Artemide hotel and would stay here again should I be fortunate to return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: smallface1
Reviews.Content: This hotel does it all right. Rooms are very nice, breakfast is great, the staff is very helpful and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: floridanativedawn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Artemide was nothing short of excellent. The front desk was always personable and helpful. The location is excellent. They have a great breakfast every morning. Housekeeping was better than anything I've ever experienced. This hotel is a great value. The rooms are a tad small, but we were comfortable. The bathrooms were very nice. I highly recommend Hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything good that you read on trip adviser”
Reviews.Author: Zubsmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 17 day trip to Rome to celebrate our 25th. The Hotel Artimede was our last stop. It was a very lovely hotel, with wonderful staff, beautiful rooms, and a great breakfast. We were suspicious of all the good reviews, but it is truly a wonderful find. The staff were helpful with good suggestion for walking trips, and the Vatican tour that they recommended was amazing. We were not thrilled with the hop on and off bus, and if you wish to do this, just take the 2 hour tour. The subways were very good, and taxi's anywhere from the hotel are 10-12 euro's. Rome is a busy city, and this is a wonderful oasis, quite well located. We would return here, and would highly recommend this to our friends and family. The room was large, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was the largest we had in Italy, and beautifully appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTorontoTom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from train station - Termini, and you won't get lost. The standard room I got is super quiet, bathroom is big and bright. In addition, minbar is no charge including beers and mineral waters. Most importantly, breakfeast over there has ample choice with fresh fruit juice and nice cappicino. If you don't mind, 15 - 20 minutes walk to old city to start you sightseeings, few subway stops to Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “was really something out of the box”
Reviews.Author: CraigH3
Reviews.Content: We originally booked 3 nights at this lovely hotel but need to reduce to 2 due to events beyond our control around 3 weeks before arriving. This was done via email and was a simple and easy task. We had no preconceived ideas and whilst was on the pricey side we understood this was the case in Rome. When we arrived at our room (401) it was a very pleasant surprise with a big spacious bedroom (basically a studio size) and a large well appointed bathroom. The bed was one of the most comfotable we experienced during our European vacation. Whilst facing the very busy Via Nationale we had no issue with noise at all even though we did not find the roller blinds until the second day. The room had all the little things that you may not see everywhere (eg, do not disturb switch next to the bed). Service was efficent and hasslefree (although hotel policy of not being able to supply an iron was a little unusual) and when TV was not working there was someone up in a matter of seconds to rejig the connections and cables. The inclusion of free mini bar and breakfast lessened the price aspect and ultimately this was not an issue. Location was a little "out of the way" in terms of mainstream attractions but certainly not too far and meant an extra 5-10 min walk was required. However we were looking for something near the Termini since we were arriving and departing via train and the hotel was within say 800 metres (care the Airport train terminates at a different part than most of all the other trains that use the Termini. I would seriously consider staying here again although would check out other options also.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelingbrenda
Reviews.Content: For my 35th birthday, my husband and I decided to go on a trip to Rome and stay at the Hotel Artemide. It was our first time in Rome and wanted to stay somewhere nice, close to all major attractions and decently priced. The Hotel Artemide was the perfect choice! The room we stayed in was pretty big compared to other European hotels and there were free snacks/drinks and a breakfast buffet which was delicious. Nothing fancy but everything was well prepared. Also, the staff is so nice and helpful. I can't say enough good things about this hotel! We'll definitely stay here again the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12390
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The rooms were very clean and the location is great - in the heart of Rome and within walking distance of most of the key attractions. The rooms are a good size. The hotel has a good selection for breakfast. The staff are very helpful - recommended restaurants and booked transfer to/from the airport. It is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for sought seeing and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Jes_England
Reviews.Content: Great location for sight seeing and shopping. Lovely quite room, breakfast was good. Restaurant and terrace bar pleasant but not fantastic. Would happily recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SightseerKent
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (as planned) but desk service very friendly and welcoming even late at night. Checked in very efficiently and gave us a map of Rome and a few quick tips. Free welcome drink voucher too which we used a couple of nights later. Staff throughout the stay were polite, friendly and helpful. The room was large and clean - the bed was a little firm for my liking and there we no drawers to put stuff in but there were plenty of shelves and a largish wardrobe. The mini bar fridge was good (one of the few we have found that actually chills things!) and everything in it was complimentary and replaced every day - very handy since they gave you four bottles of water, a couple of juice cartons and soft drinks, a couple of beers and some snacky bits every day. There is a Spar just opposite the hotel if you wanted to buy more drinks than than this in the room. Nice spacious bathroom with nice bath and great shower - slippers, bathrobes and toiletries all available to use if you want them. No balcony which might have been nice but since balcoies would have been over the main road it might be just as well! Roof top bar didn't have a great view but was a nice atmosphere and wine by the bottle was a good price up here. Breakfast had plenty of variety. Not many English channels on the TV (just news) but the hotel is a short walk to all the major attractions of Rome so this doesn't really matter! To get to the attractions you are going downhill - getting back to the hotel is a steepish climb uphill which we didn't mind but might be difficult for some. We like to walk everywhere sine you find lots of different things - the neighburhood round here was great - something round every corner and there were several different ways to get back to the hotel from the historic centre so you could take a new route every time! Do take an iron if you need one though (or pack carefully) - teh hotel doesn't have them in its rooms or a ironing room - it is a professional ironing service only which is, of course, pricey. Only a short walk to Terminii station too so no need for a taxi or bus just walk it. All in all we thought it as a very good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Zandy61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in a small suite overlooking the main road with a small balconey. Great views and bustle with the balconey doors open but quiet with them closed, no problem sleeping. Roof top retaurant/bar was still operating and we had a nightcap there after eating out on three evenings. The room was well appointed, with a free mini bar that was a delight on returning from long sight seeing trips on foot. Breakfast buffet was varied with both continental and hot egg/bacon/sausage options. Staff were helpfull, we would happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good quality for money”
Reviews.Author: jessica1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and got an upgrade because it was our honeymoon. Although the interior is quite "standard" (like from big chains), it is a good hotel and offers good value for money (i believe we paid less then 200 euros a night). It's clean, location is good, parking is a bit expensive (i think we paid 65 euros for 1.5 day) in relation to other italian hotels in big cities, breakfast is very good. My husband thought is was quite noisy, but I didn't notice it (so it depends on how light you sleep), the hotel is on a busy street so that can be a negative point.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in the middle of everything, with great amenties.”
Reviews.Author: fyllla
Reviews.Content: We, hubby, teen daughter and I, were in Rome and Florence for hubby's 40th. Met some friends there who stayed at a different hotel. They wished they had stayed at ours! Room was easily big enough for the 3 of us, one queen sized bed, one single bed and large closet, desk and small sitting area. Bathroom was a very good size, seen much smaller in the US. Location was ideal, step outside and on a bustling street just blocks away from many sites. Breakfast was amazing and served with such a big smile. I cannot remember the man who was in charge of the breakfast room, but he was efficient and friendly, such an attribute to the hotel. On hubby's birthday they sent sparkling wine and an amazing cake. Only dissappointment was we asked the front concierge to book a restaurant for us on the night of hubby's 40th. They agreed and never said it was a problem. When we arrived, our reservation was not made, and the restaurant was completely booked! I was VERY dissappointed to say the least, the concierge should have let us know, since this was a big night. We didnt have a plan b, so we just had to walk around looking for something else, which was a pain (literally) after being dropped off by a cab in very high heels on cobblestone streets. The hotel was lovely, but the concierge could have done a better job with following through for us. I would definitely stay here again, but do not count on the front desk, as friendlty as they are, to necessarily do their job, and check and recheck.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable hotel with an excellent arrangement”
Reviews.Author: ZurabNikolava
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly hospitable hotel located in the center of Rome, in 10 minutes of walking from station Termini. Comfortable and careful. If I can visit once again Rome - the problem of a choice of hotel at me won't be - only to Artemide Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Artemide Hotel - Positive and Negative Experience”
Reviews.Author: Josie4
Reviews.Content: What we liked: The central location, the 15 minutes of Internet access each day, the excellent breakfast buffet, the quality of the lobby and other public areas. The rooftop bar was also very nice, and we were given a coupon for a complimentary glass of sparkling wine at check in. What we didn't like: At check in, we were told that there was a problem with our reservation, and we were told to have a sit in the lobby while the issue was resolved. We did as instructed. In about 10 minutes, we were called back to the counter. The hotel front desk employee told us that we were not entitled to the breakfast with our reservation, but that we could pay a supplemental fee if we wanted the breakfast buffet. I pulled out my reservation form (booked through European Destinations) and showed him that we had booked the breakfast. He pulled out his own form from European Destinations, which showed room only -- no breakfast. I asked him if he could call European Destinations to resolve. He agreed to do so, and although I could not understand what he was saying, it was obvious he was angry. He finally slammed down the phone and told us (in a voice that made us feel like we were getting something we did not pay for) we could have the breakfast on the next morning while they tried to resolve. I never heard anything additional, so I assumed the issue was resolved and we were not changed an additional fee at checkout. Next, the porter took us up to the room. He opened the door, and it was immediately obvious that another guest still occupied the room! Eventually, we were taken to another floor. We were surprised to see the size of the shower in the room -- literally 2' x 2' -- the smallest shower we had ever seen! The friends with whom we were traveling had a full size bathtub with shower in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with a nice roof top bar for relaxing after a busy day”
Reviews.Author: TNbeacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really very nice. The room was lovely and upon arrival we were told that we were upgraded. So I don't know what the other rooms were like but our was spacious and had a much needed jacuzzi tub to ease your legs and feet after a long day of sight seeing. I will say that our room was facing the street and we did hear street noises at night which did impact our sleep. However, the room was so nice we decided not to change. I am sure the rooms not facing the street would be very quiet as we never heard our neighbors. The breakfast buffet in the morning was wonderful and had a good variety of items to select. The hotel staff was very accomodating in providing information on where to go and dine. They gave have us some wonderful options that really helped in trying to avoid some of the touristy restaurants that do not offer the best cuisine. The rooftop bar was an added treat to relax and enjoy one last apertiff. I highly recommend this hotel and their staff! The location was not as close to some of the main attractions, but that may be why the price was reasonable. We walked everywhere just the same (hence the need for jacuzzi and drinks!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central hotel, in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Foxy-of-Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located to all the sites and most can be reached comfortably by foot. We paid extra for a Superior room and was well worth the extra money. Our room was spacious and we were on the 4th floor and was one of the few with a small balcony overlooking the main road but there was no traffic noise at night. We had a jacuzzi bath and decent shower, robes, slippers and toiletries. Our bed was made with clean sheets every day. The mini bar was free but you only get 2 cans of lager, 4 fizzy soft drinks and 4 waters. There is tea and coffee making facilities in the room and biscuits. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms. There is an Italian law where they cannot hire out irons so bring your own otherwise you will have to pay 6E for a shirt to be ironed!! The breakfast is sumptuous and will fill you for the day apart from maybe a huge icecream by the Trevi fountain. Cooked breakfast, cakes, cheeses and fruit, a full fresh range of food everyday and any type of coffee you desire. You have a welcome drink upon arrival which you can use at your leisure. The staff were very polite and helpful. We didn't eat the hotel so can't comment on that. But we found a superb restaurant overlooking the Colloseum and would recommend it if you can sit upstairs. All restaurants seem to be of a similar price. My one main recommendation is either to purchase the tickets in advance for the Vatican or plan to pay extra for a tour guide. We had a queue of 3 hours long and finally succumbed to one of the touts on the road and paid 40E each (negotiated down to that). Normal costs without guide are 20E. The guide was well worth the extra money and was very informative. In summary if we were to go back to Rome this would be the hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: Great location, (near Metro), perfect service, superb breakfast, lovely room, free mini-bar and internet. I had trouble with the safe and someone came to the room to help me within minutes. The internet access code was also delivered to my room immediately. The service was really impeccable and I can't wait to return. This will be my hotel of choice while staying in Rome from here forward.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: maz186220
