Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is a wonderful friendly hotel to stay in when in Rome for touring. Its location is very convenient for the historic centre of the city whether walking or using public transport. Termini Station is close by as is the. National Museum of Rome which is well worth a visit / There are numerous cafés and restaurants close by. The hotel staff are very friendly and extremely helpful with all sorts of queries. We had a nice sized, modern room, that was very quiet - and enjoyed both a peaceful and trouble-free stay stay. The complementary mini-bar is such a nice and unexpected touch which sums up the attitude and welcoming nature of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay there - it's very good!”
Reviews.Author: Smaske1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide on a visit for Rome for the weekend. We flew into Fiumicino and took the express train to Central Rome - Termini. The station is right in the airport and it was 14 euros single and took 35 mins, the bus is 8 euros but we were told it took longer. From Termini the hotel is a 10 minute walk if you have wheelie bags, everyone seems to wheel suitcases around in Rome! The entrance to the hotel is set into the main street on Nationale and is very unassuming but when you go in you are met with a very warm welcome, smart decor and helpful staff. The room was just as clean, not so big (they have different sizes) but high ceilangs making it feel more spacious and perfectly adequate, comfortable and well appointed. Not tatty anywhere in the hotel. This was one of the few hotels we have been to where you are told at reception that the minibsr is complementary and stocked daily - don't get too excited, a couple of beers, water, juice and soft drinks but this is so refreshing after the normal rip off prices and we chilled with a beer on the balcony - room 404 overlooked the main street but it was still nice being able to open the windows. There is tea and coffee in the room also and a mini safe. The bathroom was bigger that expected, clean and well stocked with freebies - the hot water was a little erratic in the mornings, hot one moment, cold the next but with a little fiddling we got it right, we probably just showered at the same time as 100 other people. The bedding was clean and the room comes with a flatscreen TV (not much in english) and internet cable or email on the TV - yuo could get 24 hour access plus all of the films for 9.5 euros 24 hours. Breakfast was 'american style' and included in the price. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, perfectly good buffet with cold food, pastries, juices, fruit, meats, cheese etc and you can ask for an omellette as an option. The staff were really nice there as well. We didn't eat in the hotel but did have our complementary drink on the rooftop bar (nice to be outside but it does just overlook rooftops!), again a nice touch. Overall we loved this hotel, can't really fault it and the location is close to the Metro at Barberini and the buses stop outside but we walked all around rome - 30 minutes in each direction and you can see most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: aniko1
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, everything is in mint condition, immaculate, excellent service. Whenever we asked for something, it was done in 2-3 minutes. Pazulo at the front desk was always very helpful, we can't say enough good things about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: kitslovesitaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights. It's in a good location to go see all the sites, and far enough away from the dodgy area around the train station. It's on a busy street but we couldn't hear any traffic noise at all. The staff were lovely, the room was great and the free mini-bar was a great touch. We were also provided with a voucher for a free glass of prosecco on the rooftop terrace which has nice views of Rome. Would highly recommend staying here as it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sussex82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel is situated in an excellent location, being within walking distance of all the major sights of Rome and only 5 mins from the train station. The room was lovely and modern and we especially enjoyd the free minibar which was restocked everyday. It was a lovely place to relax after some very busy days in the city. The only slightly disappointing aspect of the room was the noise that came from the very busy road at the front of the hotel - this kept me almost completley awake on the first night. Considering the rooms are supposed to be sound proof we were slightly diappointed. Other than this, I don't have any other complaints with the hotel - the staff were all very friendly and helpful particulary when they helped us out with a problem we had relating to our private transfer to the airport. They called the company for us and sorted everything out. I thought this was excellent service. Also, the breakfast was lovely with a huge choice and the vouchers for a free drink in the rooftop bar was a very nice touch. Overall I would recommend this as a brilliant hotel for sightseeing in Rome and we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: mswoojie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is three blocks from the Piazza della Republica (where there is a metro) and a 10 minute cab ride from the train station. We got ripped off by the cabdriver but the hotel bellboy said it should only be about 10 Euros from the train station with 2 bags. Alternatively, you could take the metro and walk the three blocks if you do not have too much luggage. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the beds are just heavenly. The snacks that all the other reviewers talk about are just awesome. The minibar is free and stacked with waters (fizzy and natural), juices, beer, and cookies. At the end of the day, it is so refreshing to come back to something cold and not worry about the cost. The location is fine -- it is on Via Nazionale where hotels are on every block. It is an easy 15 minute walk to the Colloseum and the Roman Forum. The metro is convenient to get to Vatican City, and we walked mostly everyplace else (although there are buses that go to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon). I thought the hotel was a little pricey but given the quality, I can't complain. The hotel acknowledged our wedding anniversary by placing a free bottle of wine, peanuts, and note in our room before we arrived. They provided us with a voucher for a welcome drink (prosecco or coffee) on their terrace. They arranged a car service for us to the airport for a flat fee (which eliminated our concern about being ripped off by cab drivers). Finally, the wi-fi connection in the room was free and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to a Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kanda_829
Reviews.Content: The first stop of our Italian tour was one of the best. As honeymooners they upgraded us to a junior suite and provided a bottle of congratulatory wine. The room was clean, modern but warm, front desk service was top notch, breakfast was the best of our 12-day trip. The immediate neighborhood is a major shopping street, not especially noteworthy but easy walking distance to a lot of things that are: Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. And the rooftop bar adds a nice place to start up or wrap up an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our honeymoon through Italy”
Reviews.Author: pmulliki
Reviews.Content: (Almost a similar great experience to the other guest from California) We loved this hotel. We were upgraded without asking, perfect location, excellent staff, great rooms, internet was solid, great breakfast, etc... !! I would advise this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: tinatot76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Rome a few times before and we were only going to be in town for 2 nights this trip. We chose this hotel because it was near the Republic metro station and on Via Nazionale which has a ton of buses and stores (supermarket across the street). This is good because there are only two train lines in Rome and this one will get you to all the major sites. The hotel itself was nice and very large. The room was actually nicer than I thought it would be (see attached picture). The bathroom was very large (see attached picture), had great water pressure, but downside, very very dark and no tissues, which is a pet peve of mine. We had no view, but that was okay, because you are never in the room. The staff was nice and helpful. We did run up to the roof top bar, it was just okay. We paid about $330 USD for the two nights. Will stay at this hotel again, and reccommend to others looking for a nice clean, safe hotel not to far from the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee33
Reviews.Content: We selected the Artemide from Expedia based on price and location. We had traveled a good distance on foot after touring Rome and were graciously greeted by Hotel staff with smiling faces. We were immediately upgraded to a larger room at no additional cost. During the check-in we were assisted with setting up transportation to the airport for the following day and the staff member immediately recognized that due to our early departure, we would miss the buffet breakfast. He notified the kitchen to prepare and deliver "to-go" bags for a breakfast on the run. The room was outstanding! Very clean and well appointed. This is the first hotel we have been to which stocked a free mini bar. Snacks, soda, beer and water! The bed was oh so comfortable and all staff members were eager to please. We were provided maps with verbal direction for all sights we wished to see. The following morning our town car was waiting as promised and took us to the airport like clockwork. This was without a doubt one of the best hotels stays we have experienced. More establishments need to take notice of the cleanliness and customer service. We loved Rome and will definitely stay at the Artemide again. This hotel is centrally located and close to popular tourist attractions. They also provide complimentary internet service for Airline check in.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: JEAMM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate my daughters A level results before she went off to university. It was perfect. A good location for seeing the sights. Really helpful and friendly staff. A really good breakfast to start the day too. The weather was lovely so a drink on the roof terrace was very much in order. Mario on reception greated us when we arrived and from that point on they has us sold.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: budd311
Reviews.Content: The location, service, and cleanliness of the hotel was flawless! The concierges were beyond helpful whether it be picking our a restaurant or finding us AA batteries! For the price this hotel has one of the best values you can ask for! The only drawback was the Wifi was not working in our room, so I had to use the business center, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudette_10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of the trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Impeccably clean rooms and guest areas. Excellent buffet breakfast.....something delicious for everyone. Front desk guys were extremely helpful, professional and knowledgable. Free minibar (soft drinks, mineral water and beer) in room, re-stocked daily and comfortable beds. We ate a light lunch on the roof terrace on three occasions attended to by Eugenio who was charming, efficient and made our visit very special. For a decent meal outside the hotel try Ristorante Esperia in Via Firenze two streets up as you exit the hotel to your right. We both had a dish of grilled prawns and calamari which was fabulous. All tours booked were through Viator online with no hitches. The hotel booked a limousine service for pick up and drop off at airport...105 euro in total if you want to treat yourselves. Just e-mail the front desk and it will all be arranged for you. All in all a great experience so if you are visiting Rome, stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OVER RATED!!”
Reviews.Author: 23Feb45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Artemide Hotel for two nights in July. There wasn't anything "wrong" with the hotel, but there wasn't nothing great about it either other than the location. The "chilly" service didn't bother me, it simply wasn't what I expected from a hotel rated 7 out of 1,289. My junior suite was very basic. Nothing special here. None of my rooms in Venice, Florence, or Sienna had carpeted floors, so I was surprised to find carpet in this hotel. If you're looking for a "nice" hotel or some place special, the Artemide Hotel is not the place (look for something rated higher than 7). However, if you just need a place to sleep in a good location, you'll be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, really made the trip”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingHobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Artemide hotel with my girlfriend to celebrate our first anniversary, I had checked the hotel here in advance and can definitely agree with the excellent reviews it receives. I had emailed the hotel the week before leaving to ask if they could pick up a bouquet of flowers to put in the room to surprise my girlfriend. The staff were very helpful and a beautiful bouquet was put beside the bed but that wasn't all, they went far beyond my expectations by giving us a free upgrade to a honeymoon suite with a huge private terrace and also had a very nice bottle of red wine waiting in the suite. We also made use of the roof top bar, which is very nice, as we were given a couple of free drink vouchers on arrival, the breakfast is also a fantastic spread with plenty of variety. We will definitely be staying in the Artemide if we return to Rome, I strongly recommend it. Thanks guys for making our anniversary so special.

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LivinglavidaRoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Rome every year to unwind and to visit family. WE ALWAYS STAY AT ARTEMIDE! After a day of site seeing, visiting family, or at the beach, getting back to the hotel at the end of the day is the perfect way to recuperate. The rooms are extremely clean, cool, and comfortable. The entire staff can't do enough for you. Paolo, Pino, Mario and the rest of the guys at the front desk were a great help in helping us plan out our daily activities. The hot and cold breakfast buffet is delicious and beautifully presented. Pasquale and his staff in the restaurant are gracious,attentive, and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel for it's level of comfort, great value, the great staff, and it's location.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: eagle56Greece
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Artemide hotel in Rome. We enjoyed our stay very much and we shall carry very good memories about it. Everybody was helpful and friendly starting from the porter to the reception staff. They helped us with a lot of queries about places to visit and restaurants and also how to work out the local buses. The breakfast was really good and plentiful. The double room was a good size and we enjoyed the complimentary drinks from the mini bar. We had a free voucher for drinks on the magnificent roof and we could see St Peter church from there. We recommend this hotel to everyone who wishes to have a lovely stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: TCPort
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service!!! In the bussling eternal city, this property stands among the finest, especially considering the value. Clean, large well appointed rooms with free minibar, GREAT service, friendly, proactive, stylish are all elements of this hotel. We reviewed trip advisor previous to our booking and it did not us down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money - Nice, Clean and in Great Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Ben951
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviewers that this is an excellent hotel that offers great value for the money. It's a clean, neat, and quiet hotel despite situated on a main street with buses at door and close to the train station. Staff is extremely helpful. We booked 2 small double rooms and were upgraded to 2 standard double rooms upon check in without even asking. And there are coupons for welcome drinks in a garden cafe/restaurant on the top of the building, which is really nice and romatic. There are all kinds of shops and restuarants nearby so everything is accessible within a few minutes walk, including the Metro All in all, it's a great hotel that offers great value accommodation at a reasonable price. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and relatives, and stay there again if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room uneven service”
Reviews.Author: summer-projects
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at this hotel and the room we got was tiny. My husband and I are not big people but the rooms seemed even small to our standards especially when you add the luggage etc. One person had to sit on the bed so the other could get by and we continually bumped in to one another. We found the service at this hotel to be very good overall. When we arrived from New York at 9am we were allowed to check in and catch up on some much need rest. For all the years I have traveled to Europe I have Never been allowed to check in quite so early and it really made our day. We were able to sleep a few hours and then go explore rather than drag ourselves around until a 3pm check in and fight to stay awake. When we accidentally slept through breakfast the following morning we were given an additional voucher for coffee (since we had already used ours for Prosecco on the scenic roof terrace the night before) and unprompted the waiter brought us complimentary croissants. That said, we did get a call sharply worded call from the front desk as we were 15 minutes tardy exiting the room which perhaps we deserved since we were allowed to check in so early, but my husband felt the tone was a bit hostile and the frosty attitude followed as we checked out. I think this is a good hotel if you are only staying overnight and want to be near Termini station but I think it would difficult for 2 people to stay in such a small room for more than a night, for this reason I would call this a three star rather than four. I am surprised that it is rated the #7 hotel in Rome as upon our return we stayed at another hotel which was a formerly a Palazzo near Via Veneto which was 20 Euros less and had a much nicer atmosphere, much larger rooms and more consistent service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and quality - this hotel is worth looking at!”
Reviews.Author: Altaskibum
Reviews.Content: I booked the Artemide based upon all the reviews I read. Being a Marriott Platinum Elite I was tempted to book at the Marriott Roma, however, the $350 euro price forced me to consider alternatives and the Artemide did not disappoint. I booked several months in advance and was able to get a Superior room for around 165 euro, which included breakfast and free minibar. Honestly...it was a steal. Our room would compare to any Marriott in size and quality. The room had a digital safe, which was very handy. The minibar was stocked with water and a few sodas. The water bottles came in very handy during our tours around Rome. Breakfast consists of cold cuts, bread, cereal, cheese and a hot egg dish along with sausage links and bacon. The waiters delivered any kind of coffee you desired and we never had to wait for a table. The hotel also has a terrace at the top of the hotel where they staff a bar at night. The views are ok, however, it is a nice area to relax in after a day in Rome. Location wise you are about half a mile from the central Rome train station and several hundred yards from a Metro stop. There are plenty of buses going up and down the street. The area is predominately a shopping district, however, we were able to find some nice restaurants on the side streets. The hotel is not terribly close to the major tourist attractions, however, central Rome is not that large and most attractions are a couple of bus or metro stops away. Overall this is nice hotel offering very good value for your euro. The rooms were very clean and the staff was quite helpful. It's not a 5 star...but it is a great 4 star! Forgot one thing...it has free wireless Internet in the room that is actually quite fast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not what expected”
Reviews.Author: TravelFun1800
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by no means bad, although I would say it was our least favorite on our trip. We stayed for 4 nights during on honeymoon around Italy. The hotel was in a fine location, about 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum and if you like to walk then you could walk to just about anything else (we walked to the Vatican and it took us about a half hour). The room was clean but nothing special. The bathroom was the nicest out of all the ones we stayed at, although the shower head was stuck kind of pointing at the wall and wouldnt turn. I was a little disappointed in the rooftop balcony. It really didnt look out over anything of interest and I think looked alot nicer in the pictures. The one really great thing was the free minibar. They refilled it everyday and it had water, pop, juice, and beer which was really nice and saved us from having to buy it as much. I also thought it was way too overpriced for what we got. The staff was very very friendly though and they recommended a great restaurant that had amazing gnocchi and our whole bill was only 17 euro. I would recommend it but I think I would try a new place the next time I was in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Rome”
Reviews.Author: kkpathan
Reviews.Content: I was in italy for two weeks from the middle to the end of Aug. We stayed in three hotels, two in Rome and one in Venice. They were all good, each had its unique advantages and that is so interesting. I intentially avoided any chain hotels because I wanted a Roman experience and not US chain experience. I must have been lucky to hit all of them right. This Hotel is pretty much in center of Rome with a short walk to Forum and the Collesium. The shops aound were reasoably priced, no designers. The hotel quality was definetly five star with all the amenities you would expect in such hotel but in a smaller space. Rooms were excellent, they were clean and adequate in size but not big. we had two rooms because I was travelling with wife and two kids. This was the only hotel with a card key, personally I liked the old fashioned keys that the other hotels had. The room came with a small fridge with a good selection of drinks that were include in price. The room also had a small water heater and good selection of coffe and tea, it was replenished every day. These two amenities alone saved a bundle. We had reserved through the priceline and hence, without breakfast. we did try the rooftop restaurent but the selection of menu items was small but had 6-9 pages of wine and drink selection. We chose to leave and had dinner aound the corner in a restaurent. Hotel staff was very gracious and accomadating. They arranged my reservation for Viila Borghese, had a cab arranged and gave me access to business lounge to check in my departing flight. Unfortunatly that did not work because US fights are tightly controlled and I had to check in at airport again with our passports. I would recommend this hotel without resevation even with a limited menu selection for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Made our holiday very special.”
Reviews.Author: PhilyDrage
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Aremide with my boyfriend as a 21st birthday treat, we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in August and had a great time. The Hotel itself is in a brilliant location near lots of nice restaurants and shops, and a good distance from all the attractions Rome has to offer. They offer a free coffee or glass of sparkling wine in their roof top restaurant, which offers good food for a surprisingly reasonable price. The hotel also provides a free minibar with a few cans of beer, coke and fanta as well as water. We used this everyday to take out on our travels, and it was refilled for our next day. My personal experience of the hotel builds on these possitive points, when we arrived we were told we had been up graded to a kingsized suite. We also received a complimentary bottle of wine and birthday wishes from the staff, which was very much appresiated. The room itself was really well furnished and included lots of complimentary toiletaries including slippers. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom kept really clean, the inroom safe was very useful and we also watched a film one evening which was only 5 Euros. The reception staff spoke very good english and were polite and eager to help. We asked them many times for advice about the city and how to get about. Overall a very well kept hotel, luxurious and the staff were very polite. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent at what it does”
Reviews.Author: WTBManila
Reviews.Content: Very quiet indeed if on the inside of the hotel - don't know about on outside - if facing Via Nazionale, I imagine might be noise from vehicles. Real focus on providing value and doing the things it does very well: very helpful, cheerful staff; very good breakfast; excellent idea to give free minibar; well located. Certainly met and in fact exceeded our expectations although worth mentioning that we weren't happy in our first room and were given another on request which was much nicer (aim for higher floors).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fi_star
Reviews.Content: Expecting the worst, my boyfriend and I booked a no frills double room for our 3 night trip. We were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the room, the friendliness of the staff & the wealth of free stuff we got given! The hotel is in a great location near to all the main sights and bus stops. The roof top terrace bar and restaurant is also an incredible way to spend an evening watching the sunset. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel for my first trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theteachers
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, within walking distance to all major tourist sights. Rooms were excellent value for money - especially the small rooms- and very clean. Staff were friendly and very knowledgeable about the city and major attractions. Would recommend to anyone wanting a nice hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: chooknhally
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train so it took us 10mins to walk to the hotel with our cases. Very friendly staff who were always available to answer any questions we had..and also gave out their own tips on what to look out for. Right in the heart of the shopping/eating areas and so close to many sightseeing activities. Room was excellent as was breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “5night birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: hedgehogLancs
Reviews.Content: We arrived to celebrate my husbands 40th... and what a treat we found. The hotel looks stunning on entry and the staff very friendly and keen to answer any questions you have about the area or customs. We were upgraded on arrival to a superior room which had everything you would need for a great stay and if it didnt all you needed to do was ask and it would be provided. There was a well stocked free mini bar and replenished free daily, free toiletries replenished free daily, slippers, and tea/coffee/snacks replenished free daily, if you forgot any shaving items, sanitary, other bits they would provide free on request. The bed was soooo comfortable and slept soundly every night. Rooms had aircon, safe and soundproofed. There is a lovely roof terrace but a little pricey so just had a couple of evening cocktails up there. Breakfast was included and lots to choose from and as much as you like. Location to everywhere was great, we walked everywhere, even though we constantly got lost with all the little back streets and that was with a map!! But there was a metro or buses which were frequent and cheap. Colosseum,Vatican,Trevi fountain,Pantheon are a must!! Eating out can be very expensive but was aware of this before booking the trip. A evening meal 2 starters 2 mains 2 desserts a bottle of wine nothing fancy was around 90 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Generosity and professionalism”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I recently went with my parents for their golden wedding anniversary and stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of a friend. I didn't expect them to upgrade my parents room to the honeymoon suite nor provide a beautiful bowl of fruit and champagne as a gift from the hotel to my parents. We stayed in the superior double rooms and they were excellent. Location is superb for the underground and transfers to and from both airports.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Daisymaybe
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone looking for a hotel in Rome to head for the Artemide. One major advantage is that it is only a 10 minute walk from the Termini station on arrival, though we opted for a hotel to airport taxi on the way home, only 44 euros including booking fee. The staff were without exception so helpful, never without a smile and a friendly greeting. The rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms just right (it;s always nice to find a bathtub, power shower and a smaller shower for hair-rinsing, and the toiletries were good quality, expecially the oddly grey, but very fragrant body lotion). The hotel is well-appointed and spotless, and the extras make it very good value. These include an excellent breakfast (hot and cold choices, plenty of juice, fruit, pastries, yogurts, etc as well as the continental meats and cheeses, and the English bacon, eggs, mushrooms, beans), the free mini-bar (2 beers, a Fanta, a coke, 2 fruit juices and 4 bottles of water every day), the free tea and coffee making facilities, and the free snacks (nuts, crackers, two sorts of biscuits, replenished daily), and a voucher on arrival for a free glass of prosecco. Norhing disappointed - the rooftop bar was too quiet for our taste, but has a lovely view and I'm sure will suit others. The hotel is well-situated for good small restaurants - we found one at the top of Via di Serpenti just up the road that had a 3 course seafood menu for 16 euros, and a similar pizza menu for 10. We tried Target on Via Torino just two streets away - the food was fine but not outstanding, but the good house red wine at 9 euros a bottle was amazing value. The hotel is in a pleasant shopping/business area which does lack atmosphere in the evening - but there are plenty of places within 10-15 minutes walking distance that don't, including the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. We particularly enjoyed our visits to the Pantheon, and to the Capucin Crypt at the church of Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini on the Via Veneto. Both free, but the crypt deserves a generous donation - it's decorated with the bones of 4,000 monks (bizarre, but fascinating - it only takes 10 minutes to look round, but is well worth the short walk to it). We had a fantastic time, and would definitely return to the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service; Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: LynnyLu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide in late July and had a very nice stay. The staff was so friendly and helpful. There was always a smiling face to greet you in the lobby. In particular, Alessandro was very helpful and nice. We found the people in Italy to be aloof and not very friendly for the most part- but not here. Alessandro recommended some nice restaurants that had excellent and affordable food. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. We had a wonderful balcony off our room and it was fun to overlook life on the street. The location was great- central to all the attractions we wanted to see. The breakfast was a very nice "American style" breakfast. They even gave us a coupon for a couple of drinks up on the roof bar. Lastly, we enjoyed the free snacks and drinks in the mini bar. We would highly recommend the Artemide for your visit to Rome! So if you want a stuffy, elite, overpriced hotel with a rude doorman, look at "those other ones." If you want a friendly, welcoming, warm and comfortable place in which to enjoy Rome, the Artemide is you place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: bconwayOU
Reviews.Content: While I realize there are some negative reviews of the Artemide we booked it for 3 nights in August based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews here on Trip Advisor. In my case it was a great stay and I have no complaints, only compliments. We stayed in room #501 which had a king bed, a great bathroom, a small "study" room, and a terrance overlooking Via Nazionale. With the terrance door shut it was very peaceful and quiet. The rooftop bar was open during our stay and it was a great place to hang out and drink wine after a busy day roaming around. The location is perfect as it is about a 15 minute walk from the train station and 5 minutes to the nearest hop-on hop-off (Ciao Roma) office/stop. It is also a short walk to the Repubblica metro stop from which you can get to many other locations around Rome. There are many great places to eat and drink around the hotel on Via Nazionale. The front desk staff were very knowledable and helpful and went out of their way to help with any questions I had. Breakfast was great- not sure why there are all the complaints of the "unsafe spiral staircase" as it was really no big deal. Wireless worked well in the rooms. Overall we had a really great time in Rome and the Artemide was a big reason for that. I am not sure what the other rooms are like, but #501 was fantastic and worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: “... coming back from a cruise...”
Reviews.Author: brunello097
Reviews.Content: The Hotel, was excellent and clean. The personnel helpful and cordial. Their terrace is worth having a drink on sunset. I got very good advise from their staff for sightseeing places.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: DailyRun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artemide for three nights in two rooms. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the location was good. Breakfast was included in the price. Coffee was great and there was a good selection of breakfast items. The hotel made sure that the two rooms were next to each other. The staff was very couteous and extremely helpful in arranging taxi rides, recommending restaurants and making dinner reservations for us. In fact, the restaurant that they recommended near the Vatican we rated as our #1 restaurant on our two week trip.

Reviews.Title: “The one and only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PortugueseDiscoverer
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this hotel on our way to Sicily and I must say that from the moment we walked in till the moment we walked out we felt we were treated like royalty. We chose this hotel based on the reviews and because of its location and loved it. What makes the difference between this and other hotels is not only the attention to detail as well the super attentive manager and friendly staff. Though it is near the train station we ended up taking a taxi from the airport as it is not easy to walk with a six year old and a big suitcase. Be aware that there are two different kinds of taxis charging fixed, but different, rates: Rome taxis charge 40 eur and Fiumicino taxis charge 60. We had a triple room, with all the amenities we needed.And like several people mentioned before, the mini bar was very handy after walking in the Roman heat. The day we arrived was my husband's birthday and the manager sent us a bottle of Chianti to our room, which was a very thoughtful gesture and prooves how this hotel goes out of its way to please you. The hotel is located in easy walking distance to Rome Coliseum and Forum as well as dinner options. We had dinner at Berzitello, in Via delle Quattro Fontane, 2 minutes walk from the hotel but it was disappointing. We tried pizza, the tuna steak and lamb and were very disappointed. The pizza didn't have mozzarella but some cheap cheese, the tuna was swimming in olive oil and the lamb burnt. The service was erratic. Therefore, if you're looking for dinner options, you'd better walk a little bit further. We felt sorry that we were only able to spend one night at this hotel but if we went back to Rome, we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: feribeh
Reviews.Content: we stayed at artemide hotel for 6 nights, the room was perfect, the place, nazionale street is good for shopping, it's just 4-5 minutes waiking to metro station, bus stop and Republica square. breakfast, staff, gym , wifi service and room facilities were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Fred_the_needle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Italy. Couldn't fault the hotel itself in any way, shape or form and found the staff more than helpful with our queries (including taking us to the nearest pharmacy when my wife needed some tablets, standing with us to ensure that everything was ok). I travel a lot for work and stay in a lot of hotels around the world. This one really was good. As an aside, during our trip we stayed in 3 hotels recommended by Trip Adviser in different parts of Italy. All were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: iloveitalia10
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, with 2 children, 12 and 10. We stayed in the family room. I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and bathroom, especially for European hotels. The staff at Hotel Artemide were amazing. The hotel was centrally located, 10 minute walk to colosseum, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The breakfast was wonderful with many options for everyone. The free mini bar was great to take bottled water with us during the day. We loved having drinks on the rooftop before going out to dinner. I can't wait to go back to Rome and I will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff, caters to Americans”
Reviews.Author: RJD22
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for touring the heart of Rome. On a nice business street with great shopping, nearby restaurants, etc. Two blocks to the metro means you can be at the Forum or Vatican in minutes, about a 10-15 minute walk to Spanish steps, Pantheon, etc. Rooms are very well soundproofed and you will not hear outside noise. Staff was super nice and helpful (blew a fuse and they were there in about 2 minutes)and had very good english skills. Nice breakfast buffet, not extravagant but good selection and quality. Plenty of Americans and westerners frequent this place, kind of fun running into people who lived within half hour back home. Try La Gallina Bianca pizza place a few blocks toward Termini Station - one of the best pizzas we've ever had. Our room would have been roomy for 2, a little snug with 3 of us but very nicely furnished, and a reasonable prices for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a great shopping location”
Reviews.Author: joseph2009Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and is on a main shopping strip. There are restaraunts closeby, while the ancient rome sites are about a 20-minute walk away. Buffet breakfast is included and has a good selection food. This was our second time in Rome and this is actually a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: mambrini
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the "small double room", the simplest room at Artemide. On my business trips I have already stayed at intercontinental, ramada, marriot, prince, crowne plaza and some other 5-star hotels, and I can assure that Artemide will give you a similar experience. I was welcome by Mr. Pino, great guy, and me and my wife were granted with a free proseco at the terrace of the hotel, as well as precious Rome tips for our daily walks. And I had to confirm about 5 times that, incredibly, the mini-bar consumption was free of charge!! (unbelievable) The room has a vault, boiler for cofee, hair dryer, internet, Tv and mini-bar. The bathroom was wide and very well decorated, and the 33º C of Rome weren't a trouble, for the air conditioning made the room a small paradise (I had many bad experiences regarding temperature control in big hotels). The location is perfect. If you see it in google maps, it may appear that the fontana de trevi, for an instance, is far away. But it isn't. You have the forum romano and the mercato traiano 500m down in the same avenue (via Nazionale). There is the Piazza Republica two small blocks away, as well as the Termini station. Many good Pizzerias, Mc Donalds, supermarket, bus point to vaticano (take the metro instead), and tourist information within 1 block distance. We’ve actually used public transportation only to the Vatican. My stay was completely pre-paid in booking.com, there was no additional fee. I most definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel. Good location and helpful staff. Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: anne_lusher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights following a week's Med cruise. We booked a superior room which was a good size and nicely appointed with a fully fitted bathroom. On the first morning we booked a very early morning trip to the Vatican so the hotel arranged for a boxed breakfast to be delivered to the room at 6.30am which was a nice touch. Nothing was too much trouble for the front desk staff and helped us with a couple of recommendations for restaurants. The hotel has a cozy roof terrace which is nice for a coffee on arrival or early evening drink. The roof top restaurant lacks atmosphere and style but with so much on offer elsewhere in the City you probably would want to venture further for dinner anyway. The hotel is well placed for the Republica metro station and being on a main street, there is plenty to of shopping opportunities (!) and no problem for walking late at night. In fact we walked practically everywhere so that we didn't miss any of the sights! Can recommend Ristorante il Vineto at via Vittorio Veneto. Had a fabulous lunch there on the day we left and would have gone back for dinner if we could. This was our first trip to Rome and would definitely consider staying again at the Artemide on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, ideal location and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: thereptonsagain
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel to celebrate our pearl wedding anniversary. On arrival, the manager told us that we had been upgraded free of charge to the best room in the house! The room was excellent. We had a lovely bedroom, a lounge, bathroom with jacuzzi bath and shower and our own lovely roof terrace! There is a mini bar which is free and restocked each day, tea and coffee makiing facilities with biscuits. We could not have asked for more. I do not think I have ever stayed in a hotel before where all the staff were so very friendly and helpful, Breakfast in the morning was a treat too! The location is just right with the colosseum just a 10 minute walk away and the trevi fountain and spanish steps about 15 minutes. We had a fabulous time in Rome and would recommend this hotel strongly,

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ebio
Reviews.Content: nice, cosy, clean apartment,r comfortable small rooms but fully equipped and laid-out well. ideal for sightseeing room and getting a good nights sleep, buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a gracious, attentive staff .”
Reviews.Author: Jules7777777
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide was a beautiful little hotel with a convenient location to just about any site in Rome. It was very modern and attractive. Housekeeping kept the rooms meticulously clean and well supplied. The entire staff was helpful, attentive and very friendly. Every morning, the breakfast buffet was displayed beautifully. It was plentiful and delicious. This hotel exceeded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WestSide21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in July. W absolutely loved it!!!!! Its location was great, the rooms were huge and extra clean and the staff was super helpful, polite and professional. And let's not forget the amazing breakfast!! Amazing value for a great price. Would recommend for everyone and come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ideally placed near the metro”
Reviews.Author: pjtips
Reviews.Content: excellent value 4 star hotel. fantastic breakfast, free minibar, lovely smallish roof terrace which we enjoyed sitting on after a hard days walking round rome. Only gripe the superior triple room was smaller than we expected but we didnt spend much time in it anyway. complimentary bathrobe, slippers and full stock of toiletries was nice. Not much storage in the room for 3 peoples clothes. great shopping on the via nazionale on which the hotel is. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: DuffyEh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in June and enjoyed everything about it. It is not a huge flashy hotel, but for the price, it is a great find! The hotel was situated nicely in Rome (not too busy, but close enough to walk to all the sites) - the rooms were clean, large and the free mini bar was a welcome bonus. All that said, the absolute best part of our stay here was the friendliness of the staff. They went out of their way for us in every way possible, as if they wanted nothing more than to improve our already terrific stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Rask46
Reviews.Content: 4 days in Rome combining business and pleasure. Prima location, walking distance to the attractions, apart from the Vatican. Nice large room, wich was quiet at night. Very friendly and helpfull staff, wich you don´t often expect in big cities in Europe, but they were really helpfull in organizing restaurants, taxi´s etc. Cold water in the minibar, wich was filled every day. Breakfast was excellent . I would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - friendly staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewWatford
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for our short break to Rome for my 40th Birthday with the kids as a surprise. We had never been to Rome and took a chance on finding a good hotel and boy did we land on our feet. From the moment the hotel car picked the six of us up to when they dropped us off three days later I could not have been happier with this hotel. The rooms were very clean, the staff were very efficient and the location was just great. It was within walking distance of all the major attractions as we had my 72 years old mother with us who managed to walk everywhere. The breakfast was filling and we eat twice in the roof garden restaurant who served a brilliant fillet steak . We are planning to go back and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Beautiful room. Breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: JOrenstein
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beautiful room. Breakfast, service people, front desk, etc all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, fabulous location, comfortable, large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: 4Virginia_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms during July, 2010. The beds were comfortable, not hard like most European rooms and larger rooms. There were so many good things about this hotel, it's hard to say what was the best. The location is fantastic. We walked to all the major attractions, except Vatican City, but it's centrally located near a Metro station, so it was a quick on/off with the Metro. The service is superb! Front desk staff bent over backwards to help with any request. Breakfast staff was professional and friendly (great breakfasts too, with a huge assortment (both American and European style food), porters were more than helpful. All in all a fabulous hotel and experience! Would highly recommend to anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Extra effort to please”
Reviews.Author: dockramer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the staff couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant. We were greated with Maps, public transit information, free internet access codes, free mini bar, drinks on the roof terrace, delightful breakfast etc. Via Nazionale near the Piazza Della Republica is not the greatest location but it is central. the hotel is very comforatble and goes to great lengths to overcome the minor negative of the location. We were very comfortable here. This is an excellent value. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You don't need frills to enjoy the Artemide”
Reviews.Author: jkwoycke
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay the Artemide Hotel in Rome. We reserved the "No Frills" room, which made us nervous about what we would receive, but we had no reason to be! The room was small, but the bed was comfortable (and really, when you're in ROME why do you need a large room?) The hotel staff were friendly, and very helpful, and the roof terrace was a nice place to relax after a long night and enjoy the beautiful city views. The location was walking distance to everything we wanted to see! The decor was clean, modern and relaxing. Even in our small room, we had plenty of space for our bags. The best surprise features: A free internet point in the lobby (you get 15 minutes free) so we could check our email daily if we needed to. And best of all, the minibar in the room was free! It was great to come back after a long hot day and have free cold water, juice and beer waiting for us. I would recommend the Hotel Artemide without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: chaucer5050
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a central location combined with spacious, well-equipped rooms, and an extremely high level of service. The free minibar and breakfast are both pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at Via Nazionale”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller73
Reviews.Content: Spent few days at Hotel Artemide while on business in Rome. Hotel is located on the busy Via Nazionale quite close to Termini railway station too. Hotel is nice and has everything that you can hope for from a medium sized hotel in Rome: Good breakfast, nice room with big bathroom, "computer-room", small gym (sauna wasn't functioning), bar and free minaibar fullfillment.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: Dotti05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Artemide for 4 nights during the first week of June. It took quite a bit of research, but based on Tripadvisor reviews as well as the Frommjer's guide, we reserved a triple room (we traveled with our daugher). Pro's: The breakfast room was pleasant and the buffet breakfast was very beautifully presented. The servers were attentive and efficient. Our room was of ample size as was the bathroom--it looks just like the photos online.We found the beds to be comfortable, though narrow. We had no problems with water as was mentioned in a previous review. The air conditioning worked well, but we also had beautiful weather at the beginning of June. We too were delighted with the free mini bar with its supply of water, soda, juice and beer. The members of the staff at the front desk were very polite and formal as well as very, very helplful in answering all our questions. . .An exceptional staff. In addition to our well-researched list of restaurants, members of the staff also suggested two very nice restaurants. Truly a pleasant stay. We would definintely return to the Hotel Artemide. Cons: I would suggest that the hotel replace the mirrors on the sliding doors as well as the full-length mirror as they had black spots. Either they need to be resilvered or replaced.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff, home from home”
Reviews.Author: numnum64
Reviews.Content: We highly rate this hotel. The staff were very friendly and approachable and helped us with any enquires we had and the service was one of the best. The food at the hotel was very nice maybe a little expensive but good if you are not up to going out. In the evening the restaurant is on the roof terrace which was lovely. The breakfast buffet is brilliant and free and has a good selection of food and you can eat as much as you like. We had just a standard room, as we were in Rome for 4 nights. The room was clean and the sort of room you get at the Hilton Gatwick but with better furniture. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels. There was also a safe box in your room which you can lock with a combination so was reassured that passports and money was safe and secure. You also get a free “mini bar” which has soft drinks and water which we found to be enough and really quite useful on a hot day and these were replaced everyday. There are also free tea and coffee making facilities in your room. For this type of room I would advise on bringing your own DVD’s and player or some form of entertainment as the television is all Italian except BBC world news so you may find being in your room a bit boring or you may want to consider booking a more comfortable room if you are staying longer than a few days. The only bad thing about our stay for us, was the use of the shower, we were on the 6th floor and the shower was very temperamental, if you turned the valve just a small amount it would be really hot or really cold and the pressure of the shower was high one minute and low the next. But this is the only critism that we had about it the hotel and to be fair to the hotel we did not inform them of the problem as we were only staying a few days. But we would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like but wear your shoes”
Reviews.Author: rellah
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with husband and 2 kids (9&12) in a family room. Pros: Excellent location as base for all sights in Rome, 10-15 minute walk from train station with suitcases. Welcome Prosecco, mini-fridge refilled daily, English newspaper daily, breakfast buffet included. Family room had ample walking space and great views of Via Nazionale with balconies. Kids had a fold-out bed separated from our room by a pocket door. Good soundproofing between rooms, but street noise from fronting busy street in the evening (acceptable for the benefit of having balcony). Cons: Carpet in room was so filthy our feet turned black (literally) after walking on (now we know why they provide disposable slippers). Notifed desk staff who confirmed room number but offered no apology. Also, heat in Rome was oppressive during our stay and you cannot control room temperature. Consulted front desk who explained that it was the same temp for entire hotel. A/C level felt inadequate (maybe even reduced) in the evenings. Other hotels we stayed at in Italy with "family rooms" had a second bath, which would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Moonboots11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights for my wifes 50th birthday and we were hoping for something memorable, we were not disappointed. We arranged for a pickup from the airport, the driver was there as arranged, the return transfer was far cheaper than any found on the internet. The hotel was very clean, room was spacious and aircon was fantastic, a sanctuary from the searing heat., breakfast was great and the free minibar a bonus. The location is fantastic, we prebooked trips and found found that all pickup points were either 10 minutes walking distance or only a short trip on the metro. If a go to Rome again I would definately use this hotel again the staff were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: citybreakerEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences of my life and we loved every second of our stay at the hotel. The staff were lovely and so helpful, the breakfast delicious, the room was stunning and the location perfect. It made my trip to Rome very memorable. As it was my 30th birthday celebration with my husband, the hotel even sent up complimentary strawberries and sparkling wine. We will definetely be back and recommend to familes and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, spotlessly clean and comfortable and very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: B4rb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located being within easy walking distance of Termini Centrale and most of the 'must see' tourist spots and great for shopping. It is very comfortable with spacious rooms and spotlessly clean. It is the only hotel of the many in which we have stayed in Italy with tea/coffee-making facilities and complimentary minibar and the breakfast was excellent. We found all the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I hoped it would be.”
Reviews.Author: SteveJTodd
Reviews.Content: I found the Artemide hotel through Trip Advisor and made my reservation based on the reviews. My wife and two teenagers (18 & 16) were not disappointed. The service at the front desk, the kitchen crew, the hotel valets, and the maids were exceedingly responsive and friendly. Our sleep was undisturbed and quiet. The free wireless service was great, and the cheap use of the computer room made a huge difference for our internet-loving teens. The front desk booked several excursions for us that left quite early, and without asking they dropped off four bagged breakfasts/drinks that we brought on tour. The free bottled water, Coke, coffee, and snacks in the room saved us huge $$$ as we walked around the sweltering downtown area (most attractions are within 15-20 minute walk). The restaurant on the roof served great food and had a wonderful ambiance (and friendly waiters). The breakfast buffet was delicious and varied. What didn't we like? My room key went on the fritz a few times, and the shower had one of those glass partitions which really doesn't keep water off the floor. Also, I used the gym (very small) and it was much too hot. All in all, it's an elegant hotel with a beautiful interior and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but wifi signal weak in rooms”
Reviews.Author: ajl123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is centrally located and is in walking distance to almost all of Rome. The rooms were clean and very quiet. The only downside to this hotel is that the wifi signal in the rooms is very weak to non-existent. However, the signal in the lobby is strong. Overall, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent week in Rome at Hotel Artimide!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBetsy
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for 4 nights in June and was really pleasantly suprised by everything the Hotel Artimide had to offer. Great location, 10 minutes walk from Termini and central enough to walk to lots of major sites kept travel costs down and depsite being on a really busy street, our room was so quiet we weren't disturbed at all. The free minibar was a great touch and we we even upgraded to have our own terrace! The room was lovely, modern, clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet had everything you could want. Staff so courteous and helpful also. Really enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend - if we ever return to Rome (coins were thrown in the fountain!) we'll be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imadilly
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Artemide Hotel and have nothing but praise for it. The room we had was lovely and spacious, it was great to be served a full breakfast daily, with excellent coffee, the desk staff were very helpful and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: billfa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Good location. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Nice touches include free internet and free water, beer, and soft drinks in minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in all areas!”
Reviews.Author: toronto97
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazingly central - within 10 minutes walk from Main train station - 15 minutes walk to Spanish Steps; 15 walk to Coleseum; the rooms were spotless and very, very quiet - thus a wonderfully sound night's sleep...The breakfast had many fresh choices - you also cannot beat the value....The staff was very attentive from the front desk to the chambermaids. We will definitely stay here again!...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Ktwofish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before a Mediterranean cruise--my husband and I, and our children age 23 & 24. We arrived early as most flights from the US arrive in the morning. The hotel secured our luggage and provided us with a safe before we went out to see a few sights and have lunch. 3 hours later, we were in 2 double rooms, side by side, on the main street. We did not notice much noise as we were out of the rooms most of the time...and very tired in the evening. The rooms were updated and clean...maybe a little small, but the bathrooms were spacious. WiFi access was good, and the free mini-bar was appreciated after sightseeing. DH appreciated a cold beer at the end of the day! Breakfast was excellent, and served both American and European fare. The staff was friendly and accommodating--from the front desk to the breakfast room. Loved their cheesy map. It had pictures of the main monuments, so we knew if we were in the vicinity of something to see. My map just had street names, and we got lost trying to return from the Trevi Fountain one evening. We flagged down a taxi for the short ride back to the hotel. Taxis were not very expensive considering there were 4 of us travelling together. Check out the roof. Not a spectacular view, but a nice sight in the evening. I would suggest researching restaurants in the area before you go. We ate at 2 nearby that were just OK. All in all, we were very happy with our stay at the Hotel Artemide!

Reviews.Title: “Well redeemed”
Reviews.Author: GSGRiverForest_IL
Reviews.Content: We had arranged that the hotel would have a limo waiting for us at FCO, but after an hour and it didn't show, we took a taxi to the hotel. On learning of the problem (the driver had been in an accident), the desk staff were most apologetic and immediately upgraded us to the honeymoon suite. We had arranged for a junior suite, but the rooftop suite was lovely -- including a beautiful patio garden, a view of all of Rome, and a very well appointed room. The location is great and when we're back in Rome, this hotel will be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: gmccabe1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Artemide Hotel was a pleasant surprise. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The air conditioning works, something not too commonplace in old restored hotels in Italy. The staff are extremely obliging, which is also something not usually seen in Italian hotels. Having spent the previous week staying at supposedly 5 Star Hotels in Venice, Florence and Milano Maritima, the staff at this charming little hotel restored my faith in the Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Living up to reviewers comments”
Reviews.Author: mdomeney
Reviews.Content: Every now and again you find a really excellent hotel back by great reviews, great service, and reasonable pricing - the Artemide is in that category and class. From the first few seconds in the hotel you get the feeling that the staff are there only to assit and serve. Our hotel room exceeded expectations in quality, comfort, and size. The free mini-bar is an excellent touch - not seen that before! The breakfast (ours was included) was very good with a choice of American and European. If I had to give a single negative it must be the fact that the bar on the roof does not open until July - this should be moved to early June as the weather supports it. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will feel like every possible effort is being made for you to enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: GMorris84
Reviews.Content: I was cautious about choosing a hotel since this was a surprise trip for my girlfriend (now fiancée) in order to propose - and it had to be perfect. Since there were some bad (even awful) reviews I was worried Artemide Hotel would be a bad choice. Man, am I glad I chose this hotel!! The staff is a gracious as can be asked of anyone-polite, helped us make several reservation to restaurants, check our flight times and advise us on travel in the city. The breakfast choice is broad and covers the basics plus some more and as you walk in you are offered Coffee, Capuchino or what ever you want - and they will make it for you as you are taken to your table. Location is excellent - 30 second walk from a Metro station and 30 second walk from a bus stop with lines in many directions... The free mini bar is great (water, juice, beer & snacks - all replenished everyday) and if you ask the staff for extra (we asked for extra water bottles for the day's sight seeing) they will provide it without even a thought. The thing that proved to me that this hotel takes care of it's guests is that even after checking out - we were teated to water bottles for our last days sightseeing and trip to the airport. Best hotel ever, and I've been to many high class 5 star hotels around the world (London Hilton, Vagus Ceaser's palace etc.) - and I've never been treated with such curtsy!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary great service”
Reviews.Author: EmpressSophie
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed at Artemide Hotel for three nights and seriously can only think of positive aspects. Great location (most sights are within walking distance), super friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are furnished very tastefully and spotlessly clean. We even had a balcony. Also worthwhile mentioning is the open roof-top bar where you can enjoy a cool drink after a full day of sightseeing. Breakfast is lovely, there's something for every taste. Another highlight: as it was my birthday, my husband asked the staff whether they could provide a birthday cake to surprise me and they went out of their way to ensure I would get one. We absolutely love this place and will definitely come back here next time we're in Rome. A big thank you to the entire Artemide staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Hemi36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Artemide for 3 nights. We organised a transfer from the port through the hotel. The driver was waiting for us. I cannot praise the hotel enough. We were upgraded to a superior room. The room was very comfortable with a large bathroom. A complimentary coffee or sparkling wine voucher was supplied on arrival. A minibar with snacks and drinks was also complimentary. The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke good English. The location of the hotel was perfect. We walked to the Colisseum as well as the Spanish Steps. The metro stop was a short walk from the hotel. Rome is best seen by walking. All the modes of transport were close by such as the open top bus stop as well as the regular bus stop. I would most certainly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! In a great location”
Reviews.Author: kc_travelnotes
Reviews.Content: Artemide Hotel was great - good value and good location! My husband and I stayed 2 nights. The free mini bar was a nice touch as well as the late checkout. The hotel is a $8-10 taxi ride from the major train station (be careful of taxi drivers trying to rip you off ie we were told it would be $20 euro's - but I insisted on the metre). The hotel room size was good, bathroom was good, all very clean and new looking. The hotel gave us welcome drink vouchers for that evening which was nice, normally I don't bother with that stuff but we had a drink in the bar. Also the WiFi in our room was handy. Other attractions near hotel - 2 mins from metro ie handy to get to Vatican City, 20mins walk to Colosseum, 10-15mins to Trevi. One thing that suprised me about Rome was that all the attractions were quite close together, so you can't go wrong here. Only thing was we didn't find any nice places to eat near the hotel but that was ok. So if your heading to Rome the Artemide is a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great, customer-care hotel”
Reviews.Author: GS_VA12
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our two nights at the Artemide in Rome. We were travelling with 3 tweens and the triple room they provided was perfect. In addition, complimentary snacks and drinks were provided in the rooms (packets of nuts, biscotti, water bottles, soda) that were much appreciated after long days touring the city. Our stay included a free breakfast that was much better than many hotel breakfasts -- scrambled eggs, variety of pastries, large selection of juices. It was a delight to be greeted by the host the second morning with "Two cappuncinos and three chocolates?" as he had remembered our coffee order from the previous day. The hotel also provided us with drink coupons for the hotel bar. We enjoyed glasses of Prosecco on the rooftop terrace. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - just far enough away”
Reviews.Author: BobAtSea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Artemide Roma after a 12 day Mediterranean cruise. We were greeted warmly by the reception staff and provided a great deal of information at check-in. We were a little concerned about the location or our room - right next to the front lift - but heard no noise. Our superior room was both beautiful and spacious. The large desk made me almost wish I was there on business. If you want to be in the middle of things this might not be the hotel for you, but it was an easy walk to the Victor Emmanuel monument (north end of the forum), the Trevi Fountain and a nice walk back from the Spanish Steps. About a block and a half away was the hidden treasure of the Four Fountains. The hotel is close, but not too close, to the Termini station - if the train is part of your plans. We like to retreat from the crowds and Hotel Artemide met our needs for this without being remote. We concluded our stay with dinner and a bottle of wine on the roof terrace. We enjoyed watching the sun set with St. Peter's dome in the distance. The bells of St. Paul Within the Walls are nearby but not too loud. The rest of the view is not too spectacular but nonetheless it was a great finale to a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, that I'll remember always....”
Reviews.Author: Mollywoo
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in Rome, and spent a week in this hotel - a great location, they kept our bags safe when we arrived early, upgraded us upon check-in to a larger room (that really was more room than we needed, but still nice...) The wireless internet service didn't work with my Mac laptop, but after repeated attempts, we were able to use the computer center on the ground floor st no charge. Breakfast every morning was a full breakfast - a lot of options, and very filling - perfect for a full day on the go, visiting all the sites, and museums. We left very early on our last day, and the staff packed a "picnic" breakfast for us....way more food than we needed, but we were able to enjoy it on the train to the airport. The beds were very comfortable (we still talk about the beds) and the best part? I woke up to church bells ringing on our 2nd day there....that night, my boyfriend proposed to me. It was a sign! The trip in itself was unforgettable, and this hotel was wonderful. I can't say enough to compliment the staff. Very attentive to our every need, and we fully intend to return. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a soul”
Reviews.Author: MurrayHants
Reviews.Content: For our 25th anniversary we stayed at Hotel Artemide for three nights. The location was excellent, the food great but above all else the service was exceptional. I'm not sure we could have been more welcomed if the hotel had been run by our family and friends and I think that really sums up the warmth and hospitality with which we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Huntgas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy trip where we stayed at the Hotel Artemide during our Rome stay. Everything was handled easily and with a smile. Only disappointment was rooftop terrace advertised was reserved all week for a private event?? Free mini bar, great breakfast (they packed a sack breakfast one morning as we were leaving very early), and everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff at a hotel that is close to all you want in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PPCKKV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Artemide Hotel for our wedding anniversary and my wife's birthday; It was a great decision. This hotel is a short walk from the train station and also from most of the main sites of interest in Rome. Artemide is also far enough outside the main tourist centre of Rome to be in an area of great restaurants for evening dinner that, moreover, are frequented by Romans - a sure sign of their quality and popularity. From the moment we arrived the hotel staff made us feel like returning friends and were constantly doting on our needs and requests for adivce and suggests for everything from a restaurant to local attractions, walks and transport. Having thrown our coins into the Trevi Fountain we will be returning to Rome, however, it will be very difficult to stay anywhere other than Artemide Hotel. This is a solid choice at an affordable price (for Rome, that is!) that beats many of it's peers in other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: darrendu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a 2 week trip to Europe, also visiting, Paris and Barcelona. This hotel was great, and I thought a very good value. First off the location, I thought it was a great location that can get you whereever you want to go. It's realistically probably a 10 - 15 min walk to Central Termini if you're hauling around luggage. It's definitly doable however the taxi rate from the airport is a fixed fee of 40 Euro. You can look it up on the internet and you'll find info about it. We took the train in and it was a pain hauling the bags around and then getting out of the station and trying to find the hotel. The train was around 12 euro per person if I remember correctly. We ended up taking a cab back to the airport, well worth it. Anyway, once you're settled in, from the hotels location it's very easy to get around, the subway entrance is just a few min walk up the street and it's very inexpensive. One way trips are 1 euro per person and they have stops pretty much at most major sites. The front desk can tell you where to get on and off, it's really easy. We took the regular bus 1 time, it also has stops right on the street by the hotel. The Open Bus tours are just up the street, I recommend it if you're a first time visitor, it gives you a good oversight of the city and sites. The hotel is also pretty close to some major sites if you want to walk to them, it's nice to do because you'll walk by a bunch of shops and stuff along the way. I read someone else's posts about restaurants in the area where they said they couldn't find any that were that good. Not true, what you want to do is walk down "Nationale" (which is the street the hotel is on) towards the Coleseum, and then on the side streets on the left, you will find a bunch of great restaurants. Also here's a tip for gauging prices on food, look at the price of a margharita pizza, if it's over 7 euro, that restaurant is probably on the high side. You should realistically pay 4-6 euro for a margharita, it's one of the easiest things for an Italian restaurant to make. The hotel itself I thought was fantastic. Free minibar, there's not a great amount of stuff in there but it's still nice for some water, pop, and a couple beers. The breakfast for an was great in my opinion. They have eggs, bacon, pancakes, fruits, cold cuts... now don't get me wrong, it's not like an American breakfast spread but it's still good and it's included in your rate. Our room was a triple, decent size and comfortable beds and the bathroom was fair size also. They have slippers and bathrobes in the room. They have free wifi, if you have an Ipod touch or Iphone, and you can also get on the computer downstairs free for 15 min if you want to check email at home or whatever. I would definitley stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not carzy about the location”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite lovely - beautiful lobby with a bar ,sitting area and business center. Check was painless. 60 euros by taxi from airport. I would not have wanted to drag my suitcases from the train terminal. From the terminal that connects to airport - it would be a 15-20 minute struggle thru some high traffic areas. To switch from main terminal to metro would be difficult with 2 bags but do-able. The walk then would be a straight line and about 10 minutes. Elevator is smallish. Room was great -spacious for 2 adults and a teen. Immaculate maid service. Fridge stocked daily but items were tepid at best. We really only drank the water as the juice was always "pear". Breakfast was adequite - mostly continental fare, lots of fruit (though mostly canned) and a small roaster of scrambled eggs and bacon (which never seemed fully cooked) and lost of coffee to pick from. Bar staff were very professional but not engaging -very hard to chat to staff at this hotel. They all greeted everyone but not much on the conversation side. I enjoy talking to locals when I travel so this was disappointing. The location is along a shopping street and there was not many restaurants to pick from in the evening. Unless you wanted to hoof to the Trevi or Barberini area, it was limited. We did eat at the Irish Pub that is about 20 meters away. Not bad, but not great. We only had fresh pasta once while in Rome -very strange-we expected it all to be fresh and not boxed. Biggest tip -they do NOT accept Euro Travellers Cheques - not at this hotel or seemingly, anywhere. I had to cash them in upon return to Canada. Hotel itself, fine but I would stay in another area of Rome. For me- near the Vatican- safer area, loads of shopping and a "view".

Reviews.Title: “Life was re-valued by Hotel Artimede and the city of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: BoomerangHantsUK
Reviews.Content: We thought our trip to Rome was simply a heartfelt wish from our three children for both of us to have a much needed holiday. That was our frame of mind until we arrived at hotel Artemide.
