As soon as we entered the hotel there was a natural aura of warmth an unquestionable acceptance into the "Artemide Family" - nothing was too much trouble and the staff just simply wanted to do as much for us as possible - what an ethos! Rome can only be seen and understood on foot, the Hotel Artemide is in a prime position toward one end of the via Nazionale, and ideally situated to walk in any direction to discover the numerous treasures of Rome. Time flies by when taking in the splendour of Rome and Roman, life so it is with much relief to return to the hotel and totally relax in the bar, lounge or the quiet ambience of our room. If, like us, there is a very special occasion then somehow the hotel Artimede seems to have a natural ability to provide some of the most memorable and unexpected experiences to make that occasion so special. All the amenities we encountered were of extremely high standard - just another aspect of the overall quality hotel Artemide can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for your perfect stay in Rome than Hotel Artemide!”
Reviews.Author: dorydavis
Reviews.Content: I am writing this on behalf of my parents whom I sent on a surprise trip to Rome for their anniversary. I booked them into Hotel Artemide based on the fantastic reviews already on Trip Advisor and I have to say I was not at all disappointed with my choice. The hotel upgraded my parents for free on arrival and they loved their spacious room with free minibar! I emailed the staff to ask if they could do something special for my parents on their anniversary as a surprise. I could not believe just how friendly and helpful the staff were! They went out of their way to make their day special with flowers, wine, fruit and a card delivered to their room and a special meal in the evening in their lovely restaurant. They emailed me daily to update me with how their 'secret' plans were going and seemed genuinely as excitied as I was about the surprise. I have never had such a positive response and was very impressed with their enthusiasm to make my surprise possible. My parents were overwhelmed with the hotel's generosity and how much effort they went to to make it a truely memorable experience. I really could not thank the staff enough. I would highly highly recommend this wonderful hotel which is not only friendly and welcoming but has excellent facilities and is centrally placed for all of Rome's top attractions. I honestly cannot fault it. Both my parents and I hope to visit Rome again in the future and would not contemplate staying anywhere else!! Thank you Artemide!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTeacups
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel. Rooms not large but very well appointed. Comfortable beds, great bathroom with counter space, great lighting and a fabulous shower. Good breakfast, a nice cozy bar and a relaxing den type room. Staff very helpful with good suggestions. We walked to many major sites. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jamesthefirst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Artimide hotel in mid June with my wife. Whilst the facilities at the hotel were OK they were not what I was lead to expect. For the benefit of the reader of this review I know through my experiences of travelling the levels of quality of surroundings & service to expect with the whole range of hotels from B&B's to 5 star. The hotel itself for a 4* was not unpleasant but was just average if that. It did not wow me by any stretch of the imagination. It was clean and tidy and the location was OK on a main road through the town. It was about a 30 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps and the same to the Colosseum. Maybe a list of likes and dislike might help. 1. Breakfast served on small plates with bread cut into 4 slices as one slice would have been larger than the plate. It was all done on a miniture scale and was just OK. Scrabbled egg & quite fatty bacon. fruit selection, cereals and pasteries. Tea, coffee etc just the normal kind of thing. 2. Put a suit, shirt & 2 dresses in to be pressed after getting creased in the suitcase. The 24 hrs service turned out to be an almost 30hr service and I had to go to recepotion twice to remind them I had my dinner table booked for that night. 3. Shower was not powerful enough and getting the right temperature was a bit of a struggle at times. 4. The hotel gave us a complimentary drink in the bar which was nice - Thank you! 5. The roof top terrace was not formally open although you could go and sit up there under the stars. It does not open for drinks until late June. 6. The bed was hard where as my bed at home is more cosy. This might be great for some but not me or my wife. 7. The view from the window? Sorry no view except into the office building opposite. Maybe my fault and I should have upgraded as not all rooms can have a good view. 8. The hotel did have a bag holding area after we checked out and they did provide a special safe deposit box for my wifes Jewery - Thank you! Be careful of the taxi's in Rome that they put there meter on as we go ripped off by one who did not. It was only a 15 euro fare but it should have cost 5 euros. If you are looking for a very special meal we had dinner at the Eden Hotel. The views were spectacular on a hill top across Rome. Its quite pricey at 165 euros each with wine for a set meal or you can go alcarte. we ahd a drink after we settled the bill and My Gin & tonic & my wife Voka and orange was 38 euros. The service however was fantastic and the food was very good. I would go there again but would have to start saving now. Another good place which was recommended to us (by an Italian Friend) was Alredo Scrofa on Via Scrofa which is down by the Pizza Navarone. The menu out side looked good but we opted to dine in the sun that night and did not want to be inside. There is probably lots of other things which I am not putting down on this review as I am running out of time. One last thing is that there are loads and loads of hotels in Rome. Almost every street has hotels so have a good shop around. And remember no matter how nice the reception looks you will not be sleeping there so make your decissions wisely. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nap-pc
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from 10 day Italy trip. The staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast was very nice. The hotel was extremely clean. The hotel location was easy access to historic Rome but was a little out of the way. The room, family room was a little small for the four people but was a great value. We would consider staying here again.I consider myself to be a tuff critic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ecloftus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July for 4 nights during our honeymoon. We splurged for the honeymoon suite so I can't rate the average room for you. We had heard bad things about the service at other, more expensive hotels. We chose this one due to the fact that the reviews praised the service. The staff was helpful and friendly. If something wasn't perfect, they went out of their way to fix it. Breakfast was just enough to get you moving. The rooftop bar was a nice way to end an evening. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Recommend the Roma Pass - then use the card for free use on subway's.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SouthwellSophie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been hugely overpraised on trip advisor. Reception area and public rooms are limited and drab. The roof garden was not open in May. Amusty smell hung about the corridors. The restaurant was in a basement down a spiral staircase with an unsafe handrail. Our superior room was clean but depressing, and the beds were unbearably hard. We could not leave soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality/price choice”
Reviews.Author: mkhalil
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location in the centre of the city close to all the tourist sights and areas. Also close to bus stattions, subway (Metro) and 3 minutes from Rome central station. The staff are great, very friendly, polite, helpful and welcoming. They worked hard to meet all our needs and requests. The hotel provide a free room mini-bar and free internet access. The breakfast buffet is awesome. The hotel offer an excellent quality-price service. It is definitely a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better in pictures”
Reviews.Author: mcnjfamily5
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this hotel look much nicer than it actually is. When we arrived at the hotel we were quite disappointed with the entrance and lobby area. It was small and looked shabby. Our room was spacious and clean, however, our safe wasn't working, the pillows were terrible, the toilet seat was not on securely and the water went from very hot to very cold with little pressure. My impression was that the room was a little worn out and dated. We did enjoy the breakfast, there were many fresh choices and the service was good. When we asked the front desk for info, they provided it but never elaborated. We couldn't help but feeling that the staff wasn't happy to be there. The location was fine on Via Nazionale, but I feel I could have gotten better accommodations for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Pedantix
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our choice of the Artemide Hotel for our five day stay in Rome. Located on via Nazionnale, Artemide Hotel is within 20 mins walking distance of the colosseum, the Spanish steps, the Trevi fountains, and is handy to the metro (Republicca station). The staff were wonderful, and especially friendly and warm towards our 18 month old daughter. Our room was small but cost and the cot we had requested was waiting for us the moment we checked in. Breakfast was a special delight. The buffet included a large selection of seasonal fruit (some of which we stashed for later in the day), pastries, breads and cheeses, delicious coffee, and warm milk was supplied by the obliging staff for baby's morning cuppa. (There was also scrambled egg and possibly some bacon and sausages but being vegetarian we didn't pay much attention. Sorry.) Another plus was the free wifi in the room which meant that we could hop online with our iPhones just before heading out and research locations of restaurants or whatever. We chose to book our Vatican museum tickets online and the staff at the reception desk were very helpful in printing out the voucher for us free of charge. Another freebie is the Internet room which offers 15 mins casual surfing. There are several computers so never a need to wait. Our room was maintained every day by a sweet charlady. The mini bar fridge and snacks were replenished at that time too. These too were free of charge and included great take away snacks like peanuts and biscuits/cookies which we carried with us on our daily excursions. All in all a top class hotel, conveniently located, and with friendly and helpful staff. They certainly outdid our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesleymac_323
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights last week, and the Artimede lives up to its reviews. Spotlessly clean, and high quality fittings, free safe, mini bar containing water, beer, juice and soda. Coffee and tea making facilities, which is not always the case in Rome. Our room was not facing onto Via Nazionale, but this was a bonus as it meant that we were not bothered by noise and could sleep well. The breakfast was very good, fruit, yoghurts, cereals, cold meats and cheese incluiding ricotta, 5 fruit juices, bacon, scrambled or boiled eggs, pancakes and maple syrup, croissants, pastries, cake, jams and breads. The staff were excellent and couldn't have been more helpful. We would certainly return to the Artemide again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLeonia
Reviews.Content: Shortly after ariving we realized that our room was full of mosquitoes. We notified the front desk and some type of bug killer was put into the wall socket, that did eliminate the problem. Otherwise the hotel was fair - decent room size, clean bathrooms and very good location...walking distances to most sites. The reception area could use a bit more personality. While any questions were answered no additional information was offered. I might suggest this hotel but most likely not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful end to a wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: NTexasT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Italy for a 25th Anniversary trip in May. We stayed at a B&B in Venice, an apartment in Florence, then finally at the Hotel Artimede in Rome before coming home. My husband wanted us to be pampered in style on this last leg of our trip, so we chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were very happy with our choice! We had one of the four junior suites in the hotel. Our room overlooked the Via Nazionale and had a terrace where we could pull chairs outside and watch the people and nightlife below. The traffic was a little noisy, and the police sirens were distracting at all hours of the day or night, but overall the sound was minimal. The location far made up for this. The staff were wonderful in every way. They provided umbrellas our first day when ours were still locked up in our luggage. We bought a bottle of wine to take back to our room and the bartender in the lounge let us borrow a bottle opener to use. Any request was met with courtesy and a smile. We felt very pampered with the tons of free bath amenities - lotions, tissues, bubble bath, etc. - even bath slippers! We had a wonderful whirlpool bath that felt great after a long day of walking. The safe in the room worked like a charm. I used the tea kettle to make a warm cup of chamomile before bed each night, while my hubby enjoyed a beer from the complimentary items in the fridge. The breakfast was the best we had anywhere. There were hot scrambled eggs and sausages, with tons of fruit, pastries, yogurt, cereal and juices. Hot tea and cappucinos were provided endlessly with attentive service. On our last morning there we had to leave very early - before breakfast service - and we were met at check-out with two large bags of food to eat on the way to the airport (yogurt, apple, juice, cheese, crackers, water bottle). The only complaint I could give is that our bed was very hard compared with what we are used to at home, but that was the case EVERYWHERE we stayed in Italy, so it's no fault of the hotel. It's just a cultural thing I guess. We would highly recommend the Hotel Artimede to anyone. It was very easy to walk anywhere we wanted to go and close to the Metro to go to the Vatican and Borghese Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: JimMassachusetts_USA
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a long and exhausting trip. The staff was warm, welcoming and helpful. Rooms were clean and modern with great ammenities. We did not spend as much time in this hotel as planned, because of the volcano eruption in Iceland,but we will certainly stay here the next time we come to Rome. Location is great, you can literally walk to everything. Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Rome - out of our 7 hotels throughout Italy and Spain this was the best!”
Reviews.Author: CRAustin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location right on Nazionale, close to Colliseum and other artifacts. Service was top notch, free champagne and appetizer. Checked us in early, no problem holding bags, great with everything - highly recommend. When I return to Rome this will definately be where I stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Wolfpack_Lamb
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Rome, and couldn't have been more pleased with our first hotel. When we arrived we were informed that we would be upgraded to the honeymoon suite for free! Our suite had a bedroom, spacious bathroom, sitting room/sun room, and a spacious beautiful private rooftop terrace. The staff at the front desk were exceptional and provided us assistance in making reservations for tours, providing recommendations for dinner, and assisting in getting taxis directions or other necessary things for people who are new to Rome. We had dinner delivered by room service and ate on our terrace one night. The food was excellent and the service was delivered at the exact time we requested. Our only disappointment was that we didn't stay at this hotel longer and it set the bar quite high for the rest of the trip. The location is convenient to the train station and sights in that area with a short cab ride to Vatican City or sights on the other side of the Tiber.

Reviews.Title: “This service at this hotel is excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: annaj11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 4 days recently. The service from all of the hotel staff was the best that I have ever encountered anywhere I have stayed around the world. They were very friendly and appeared to genuinely want to help with anything we needed. The front desk was very friendly in general but particularly helped us by answering our questions about restaurants, cash exchanges, directions etc. The porter Paolo was very nice and helpful. On a sunny morning when he was helping us get a taxi, he ran inside and came back out with umbrellas because he feared that it might rain that afternoon or evening and he didn't want us to get wet. Indeed it did rain hours later and we were protected by the umbrellas he gave to us. Thank you Paolo!! We ate at the breakfast buffet everyday. The buffet was excellent! It had cheese, meat, fruit, yogurt, pastries, breads, muffins, cakes, eggs, bacon, cookies, 5 or 6 varieties of juice and many other things. I loved it!!! The restaurant staff was very attentive also. The room was spotless and the AC worked excellently. The room came with a free minibar that was restocked daily. It contained water, beer, wine, soda, juice, chips, candy and other things. It saved the day everyday for snacks, drinks etc. The bathroom was upscale and spotless. I will absolutely go back to this hotel when I return to Rome and will recommend it to anyone else going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything good, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: philipo_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a city break over the May Day bank holiday. The staff were very friendly. Our room was smallish but very clean and well appointed. Nice modern bathroom. Firm but very comfortable bed and pillows. Tea/coffee supplies in the room were stingy, but more came if you asked. The mini bar (beer/water/juice) was free. Worse thing was that the room looked out onto only a dingy internal light well. Breakfast was relaxed but a bit limited, not a huge spread. Free (15 minutes) use of the internet. Location was good for the station (we waked with wheelie cases) but a bit peripheral for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: travelling2ross
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent. Staff were helpful and friendly and extremely polite, the room, whilst not overly big, was nicely furnished and despite being on a main road was very quiet. A lovely touch was the voucher, on checking in, for either coffee or a glass of Prosecco. Also the free mini bar was a great idea, giving you water, beer, fizzy drinks and snacks. It was within 10-15 mins walk of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Colosseum. There were a few small restaurants within a 5 min walk, although we did eat in the hotel restaurant one evening and the food and service were superb. We had a little trouble with the safe in the room but the staff were excellent and had it sorted in no time. The breakfasts were very good, plenty to eat although not a great choice of hot food. The lounge and bar area were very pleasant but I could have done without the big flat scrren television and the sport!! Overall a very nice hotel, we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: baywatch77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Hotel Artemede a few months before we travelled based largely on reviews on TripAdvisor and the location of the hotel. We were determined for it to be special as the trip was for our 10th wedding anniversary. We weren't disappointed! From the moment we walked into the lobby to check in to the moment we left all the staff could not do enough for us. We were made to feel so welcome and were given some fantastic advice about how to get about and where to eat. The hotel is well situated with the majority of the main attractions within 20 mins, either on foot or by bus (virtually outside the hotel) or by metro (about 5 mins walk to Termini). As it is in central Rome there is no escape from the fact that sometimes you are aware of traffic noise outside, but we did not find this intrusive enough to cause us any concern. We would argue that any hotel in central Rome is going to experience some noise. The free mini bar was very welcome when returnig from a hard days sight seeing! Breakfast was included in our rate and had enough choice to make it more than acceptable. Once you add up what you would get charged for breakfast and mini bar drinks at other hotels, the room rates are very competitive, especially given that it is a 4 star hotel right in the heart of Rome. We cannot rate this hotel high enough, and we would not hesitate in going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel, friendly staff very central .”
Reviews.Author: HolidayhappyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my husband to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary. Hotel was lovely staff were very friendly and helpful. The room (a superior) no 301 was a good size the bathroom was great it had a jacuzzi bath and very powerful shower. However if you are a light sleeper ask for a room at the back the hotel is on a very noisy main road and traffic and sirens can be heard even on the 3rd floor. Other than that the hotel was great and the breakfast was lovely plenty of fresh fruit, juices, meats and cheeses, pastries and bacon sausages and eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Truly outstanding service in a well-located hotel in the center of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: katesiegel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome only one night on our way home from three weeks of travel. This hotel was well staffed by attentive and professional people. It is located on Via Nazional not far from the train station. We arrived early and the room was not ready yet, but our bags were looked after carefully and one that held some ceramic we bought in Florence was marked 'fragile' when we arrived back for check-in. They offered a free cup of coffee or flute of Spumonte in a lovely well appointed lounge. Free internet was available in the lobby. The room was comfortable, and a buffet breakfast was included for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank421132
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I just returned from a great week in Italy. The last 3 days we spent in Rome and stayed in the beautiful Artemide. This hotel was more than we expected. I would definitely stay there again and will recommend it to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: kmtYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We chose the Artemide on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews, and there isn't really much to add. We liked the location and the area. The free mini bar was appreciated, also the welcome drink and tea and coffee tray. The prices are not cheap, but this is central Rome and they do include so many of these thoughtful extras. We would certainly return. Although the hotel is on the busy Via Nazionale, there are plenty of quieter areas just off it, with nice cafes and restaurants, and the bus service is easy and cheap although potentially crowded. (see atac. web site for unusually detailed instructions of bus routes and stops - even pictures of bus stops so that you know what to expect!) For eating in the area we liked Gran Cafe Piacente in the side street next to the hotel, Dodo in Via Serpenti nearby and Taverna dei Monti in Via del Boschetto.

Reviews.Title: “"Hidden Gem"”
Reviews.Author: Meredith_8255103
Reviews.Content: You could be forgiven for missing the entrance to this wonderful hotel-it is elegantly understated just like the hotel itself! The position is on Via Nazionale not far from the Repubblica Metro (and only about 8 euro cab ride from Termini Metro). The staff are wonderful and the restaurant downstairs is a gastronomic haven after a day's sightseeing. The prices there are on par and even cheaper than the surrounding restaurants and the service is second to none. The breakfast (included) is wonderful and a special mention to Eugenio - best service ever!! The rooms are clean and modern and beds are very comfortable. Altogether a great stay-will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “This truly is a very good hotel with top staff and tasty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChristchurchFusspot
Reviews.Content: Well located and within a 15 minute walk from the railway station. Check in was quick and professionally handled and we had our bags taken up and shown to our room. Good spacious room with an excellant free mini bar/tea making and nibbles...peanuts/biscuits. Bathroom was very well equiped with good supply of hot water and shower flow. Rooms were spotlessly clean. In the evening the room was prepared for the night and sweets put beside the pillows, a nice touch. Breakfast food and the staff were fantastic and plenty of tables as was very busy. Bed being very hard was our only complaint but this is what we had to put up with through Italy. Apart from the hard bed this really is a top hotel and we did enjoy our stay here

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: charlies66
Reviews.Content: Location is about perfect for visiting the main sights. An oasis after a day's tramping around the Forum or the Vatican Museums or all the other wonderful sights of Rome. Our only bleat is that the rooms are far from soundproof - beware! Would certainly consider staying there again and would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limbardet
Reviews.Content: Artemide is an excellent 4 star hotel: cosy, comfortable, very clean and quiet. Their staff are competent and polite. They also have a good quality food restaurant which is not ever priced unlike most restaurants in Rome. Artemide is situated in the centre of Rome and within walking distance of the Quirinale, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese and Medici. An ideal base to visit to historic centre of Rome on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: krimar
Reviews.Content: The number one reason I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to everyone is their service. Even before we booked our stay at the Hotel Artemide, the folks there were answering our email inquiries. All emails before our visit were answered promptly and efficiently. The hotel arranged transportation for our party of four from the airport to the hotel at the cost of $60.00Euro. Even though my husband speaks Italian, everyone behind the desk speaks English quite well. On the day of our arrival, our bellhop took extensive time with us to tell us about the rooms, service, and area. The rooms are nicely sized and well maintained for Europe, and the hotel is located in a very safe and nice part of Rome. I am a light sleeper, so I requested rooms in a quieter part of the hotel, and the request was accommodated. We could hear no street noise from our rooms as the shutters and windows are quite thick. The beds were firm, but quite comfortable. European beds in general are much firmer than American beds. Breakfast was delicious, the service was fantastic, the hotel is so conveniently located to EVERYTHING (we even walked to the Vatican from there)--you simply cannot go wrong by chosing this wonderful hotel. It's a great value for the price. The Internet worked well and all of the time, unlike other hotels we stayed at in Rome. One point of caution: the hotel is located in a restricted driving zone which should not be a problem unless you are driving there. Check with them about how to proceed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Primary9000
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Artemide and would consider staying again, if i went back to Rome. It’s location is very central on the main street in Rome. A few minutes walk to a metro station and circa 10 minutes to the train station. A circa 20 minute walk to Colossum which was good, as we first arrived at the hotel in the morning and visited the Colossum that afternoon. The room was comfortable, clean and well kept. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The free wi-fi was good for finding restaurants/sites etc and there was also free to use computer with internet in the main reception area. We got a free mini bar for the length of our stay which was very useful. The buffet breakfast was great with lots of choice and well serviced. No real negatives from me, only small things; - Gym is only a small room with a few machines. - The hotel’s own restaurant menu was quite limited so we never tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: PFBBedford_NH
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel for a family with teenagers. The front desk spoke fluent english and was helpful in everyway. The Beds were comfortable (we took 2 rooms for 4 people). Room sizes were typical but more then adequate. The room was meticulously clean with and the bathroom was more typical of a four star US hotel. The minibar included in the price was stocked daily and great for the kids. The morning breakfast was good with great service. The location, while not the most idyllic, was very convenient to most of the main attractions which were within easy walking distance. Overall would recoommend this Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: gmitchellc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a perfect location-close to trains and attractions. Our room was spacious and very quiet, located in the back of the hotel. The breakfeast features a great selection of food for every taste and is located in a pleasant room. Staff is very friendly and helpful with arranging tours and transportation. Rome is a great city and would recommend the Trastaverse section for dining-some very reasonable restaurants with great food. Note avoid the restaurants in the squares (piazzas) generally overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: pbills50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights at the Hotel Artemide Roma after a cruise. The hotel met all of our expectations! The location was wonderful; you could walk to all the major sights. The breakfast each morning included many choices, and the coffee was excellent. We loved being in the front of the hotel with a small balcony, and the complimentary drinks and snacks were a nice touch. I had my laptop so the free wifi was much appreciated. I would recommend Hotel Aratemide to anyone traveling to Rome, and we will definitely return. I threw a coin in the Fountain of Trevi just to make sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redd18
Reviews.Content: On checking in at 1 PM our room was ready. We were upgraded at no cost to a superior double room. It was large and had a fruit bowl of pineapple, kiwi, strawberries, grapes, oranges and apples. The mini bar had fruit juice, water, soda (fanta and coke), and beer, which was free and restocked daily. The staff was very helpful in every way (directions, suggestions and even buying stamps and mailing post cards for us). The breakfasts were amazing. (sweet breads, pastries, pancakes, eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, potatoes, cereal, fresh fruit, fresh squeezed orange and other juices). The bathroom was very clean and spacious. The king size bed was firm and very comfortable. We found nothing lacking in this hotel or its service. The best hotel we have ever stayed in. It was close to most of the sites we were interested in. We will stay there again when we visit Rome. We staying four wonderful nights in early May.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very friendly staff, wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: NPAKLER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Artemide for three nights in early May 2010. The hotel is a short walk from the Termini train station and located very close to the Republicca metro stop (very easy to get everywhere from where the hotel is). The staff was extremely friendly and we really liked our room. The bathroom was large with very nice fixtures, etc. Stocked minibar that was complimentary. The breakfast was really fantastic - a very large buffet with eggs, pancakes, croissants, fruits, etc. We would definitely stay there again - it was just nice having a comfortable, nice room to come home to after long days of exploring Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A truely unforgetable and magical experience.”
Reviews.Author: TreeSurgeon65
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide is situated right in the heart of the city and within easy walking disatance of most historical sites and also close the metro line for exploring further from the city. The hotel is elegant and includes modern comforts such as air conditioning, flat sreen TV , tea and coffee making facilities and complimentary mini bar which is topped up daily. It has an excellent restaurant offering a broad menu and outstanding service. All the hotel staff were attentive and friendly and very helpfull at all times, and made us feel really welcome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EKIR123
Reviews.Content: just back from a 5 days break to Rome, hotel is excellent, great location very central. Rooms a lovely and clean. Breakfast is a great start to the day, reception & restaurant staff are very friendly and helpful, would definately recommend it to anyone travelling on either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May at the Artemide. The hotel was easy to find from Termini station - only a ten minute walk but far enough away not to be disturbed. The hotel is near to (less than 5 minutes) to Republicca tube which you can take to the Vatican. The public areas are airy, spacious and clean. The reception staff are friendly and efficient and they have a man who takes your luggage up to your room. You receive a voucher for a free glass of prosecco or coffee which can be used any time during your stay in the bar. There is a free mini bar in the room with beer, soft drinks and water. There are also tea and coffee making facilities. The room is spacious with a very large bed. The bathroom is again large with both shower and bath. There are plenty of complimentary toileries and slippers. It is very clean. The hotel is well situated and you are within a 20 minute walk to all main sights, save for the vatican which is around 5-10 mins on the tube and a 10 minute walk at the other end. If you do intend to go, i'd recommend booking your tickets for the museums in advance unless you hours to spend queuing. There are a selection of pizzerias and restaurants on the side streets off the main street., Nazionale, however it is not too far to walk to areas around the Trevi or Piazza Navona is you want somewhere more central/touristy. Breakfast is simple but adequate to fill a hole until lunch. There is a sauna/fitness centre which may be relaxing after a full days sight seeing (the sauna more than the gym!) There is free 15 minute access to internet in reception for quickly checking things such as whether you can fly due to volcanic ash! Or you can pay 12 euros for unlimited access to the internet during your stay. Overall this is an excellent hotel and if i were going to Rome again, would certainly stay here and would recommend to anyone going.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kirstey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room with my husband and 1 year old daughter. The bed was very comfortable, the room spotlessly clean and the service wonderful. My only minor negative comment is that the food from room service was not that great for the price charged. Best to eat out but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: May5018
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Artemide for 4 nights and selected this hotel due to the excellent reviews on trip advisor We were not disappointed the staff very professional and nothing was too much for them rooms very clean beds comfortable location excellent 10 out 10 We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Will definitly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedTrvler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was also part of our honeymoon, they upgraded us to a Superior room and had a bottle of Chianti waiting for us. The room was huge by Italian standards. It was in an excellent location, breakfast was great and the staff was super helpful. We booked a car service to Fiumcino through the hotel, prompt and helpful. My ONLY complaint is that the dinner recommendation was bad. It was for a seafood place around the corner. Next time I will do my own restaurant research.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: jpateAL
Reviews.Content: Great location to tour Rome by foot or to meet a bus for a hop on/off tour. Great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Cool Pub right next door open for late night drinks and snacks. Staff very accommodating and rooms good size for Europe. All the amenities you would need. The FREE minibar that is stocked daily was a great touch. Free wi-fi as well. Would stay again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: PRS8124
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Artemide very well placed for all the major attractions, the breakfasts splendid and the rooms comfortable, what really makes the difference is the attitude and willingness to help of all the staff; we were caught up in the volcanic ash cloud flight ban and the staff couldn't have been more sympathetic or helpful. When returning to Rome, I won't even bother to look elsewhere for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, location and staff - made our honeymoon unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_B_Eastbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally in Rome close to all sites of interest. The rooms were very comfortable - with very large beds and extremely clean spacious bathrooms. The toiletries provided were great and were replaced daily. The complimentary minibar in the room is great and we made great use of it. We stayed at this hotel during the first three days of our honeymoon, the staff were very friendly and only to happy to help us with any questions or enquires. Upon arrival we were given vouchers for a free drink of coffee or local sparkling wine in the lounge and given small cakes as a complimentary snack, this was very welcome and enjoyable. We were also given a further two vouchers to use throughout our stay. The breakfast was fantastic catering to all tastes with american pancakes, sausages, bacon and scrambelled eggs available as well as numerous cearls, continental meats and cheeses, cakes, fresh fruit and juices. My husband loved the green apple juice - wheras i loved the fresh cheese and tomatoes - carpreses salad style breakfast. The only negative thing i would say is that the hotel location is slightly different to what i expected as the hotel website shows a beautiful fountain and this is at the top of the street and not directly outside the hotel as i und4erstood it to be, however, this did not detract from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: rjtxx
Reviews.Content: The best service from desk and bell service I've seen in many years. Great location highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Total Joy!”
Reviews.Author: weechocolategirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend, and my only gripe was IT WASN"T LONG ENOUGH! The hotel was lovely, staff extremely pleasant, great brekkie and close to loads of gorgeous buildings...would go back in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine086
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is an excellent hotel in the centre of Rome, within easy walking distance of the major attractions, and close to Rome Terminii. The rooms are very comfortable, well furnished and the free minibar is a real plus. Our stay there was meant to be for 5 nights, but we were caught up in the volcanic ash chaos, so stayed for 2 more nights, before moving on. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and helped us enormously with our travel plans. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, and if/when we return to Rome, it will definately be to the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kurk
Reviews.Content: our flight was canceled due to the snowstorm in JFK, we could not make it the first night. I contacted the hotel and they waived that night's charge. Of the four nights there, very friendly staff, helpful and informative, nice room, bed is firm - ensure a good night sleep. restaurant is good too. Location is very good, safe and quiet. Would stay there if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mkjava
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Artemide Hotel in Rome. We actually stayed twice, once as planned and once as we returned to Rome in an attempt to get home from Europe after the volcano! The hotel is in a great location, close to everything. Breakfast was excellent and you can't beat the free mini-bar. Our room was very nice and good value for the nightly rate. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to offer some additional English language TV channels, but all in all it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “First class with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Eastlighter
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly professional, well-run hotel with efficient, friendly and helpful staff. The interior design is art deco with, for a city hotel, a spacious lobby and public rooms. On arrival provides a free drink (coffee or sparkling wine) - which can in fact be taken any time during your stay. A free mini bar (no spirits, but beer, bottled water, Fanta, fruit juices plus nuts, crackers and wafer biscuits) is replenished each day, plus facilities for making tea and coffee. Rooms appear to be soundproofed. Close to Termini station (Rome's main train and bus station) and therefore convenient for the airport via the 'Leonardo Express' which shuttles between them, - a little further to walk to the more central attractions (Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona) and best to take the Metro to the Vatican & St. Peter's. The hotel was very helpful during the volcanic-ash crisis when flying was banned; actually reduced the room rate and provided a free room and free coffee to passengers assembling from this hotel and other hotels for a privately-organised coach journey back to London. Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssshelley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as tripadvisor had ranked it well. Spot on. Location is great. Simple to find. Staff wonderful. Free wi-fi. ..good breakfast. free minibar(bonus). and the price was k to. Highly reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and convenient for all the major sites”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamKevin
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hotel with polite helpful staff. We had a lovely room with a complimentary bottle of chianti, and a free minibar full of beer, juices, prosecco, snacks and spirits, which was replenished daily. The hotel breakfast was excellent, again with cheerful staff who went out of their way to help. One night we ate in the restaurant and it was one of the best meals we ate in Rome! Easy to walk to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterNick
Reviews.Content: Could not have wished for more helpful and friendly staff. Nothing was to much trouble. You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: Stawberry-Girl123
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the manager and staff of the Hotel Artemide enough. We were staying at the hotel when the flight ban started. The 'first' part of our holiday was great, the hotel is is in a very good location, close to everything you could want to see, is spotlessly clean, very comfortable, free minibar, great breakfasts and the staff are so helpful, happy to give recommendations for restaurants, advise on sightseeing and book tickets for galleries etc, you really couldn't ask for more in a city centre hotel and I would have recommended it to anyone thinking of staying in Rome. However the hotel really came into its own when the flight ban was imposed. The staff were amazing. They allowed all of us free internet access 24-7 and rearranged our room bookings on a day-to day basis, often without any notice, when flights got cancelled. On Monday 19th April, they played unexpected host not only to us 40+ guests who had organised a coach to travel back to UK, but also to a further 40 extra UK residents who arrived without notice seeking coach travel. (The British Embassy were absolutely useless during the flight ban and just sent these extra people to us wihout any support, contact or help generally ). The hotel laid on extra space, extra seating, provided refreshments and allowed guests and non-guests alike the use of the facilities. By the time that the coaches were over 8 hours late, everyone was very stressed but the manager and staff continued to be so helpful and professional. They are quite simply the best hotel staff I have ever encountered anywhere in the world and the hotel manager is wonderful. I cannot thank them enough. If you are ever in Rome, stay at the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Location”
Reviews.Author: AP_JLondon
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Rome due to the Volcano Ash and having just flown in from Ethiopia we did not know where to stay. A quick look at trip advisor and chose Artemide Hotel as it appeared as a favourite. We were not disappointed. The rooms were very comfortable, free mini-bar and snacks topped up everyday. Breakfast was plentiful and the location was great. What is very apparent is how friendly and helpful all the staff were. There were lots of stranded guest staying but life was made a lot easier by their charm and helpfulness. We originally booked 4 rooms but our stay was cut short by the opportunity of getting to the UK earlier than expected and they very kindly said it was not a problem and waived the penalty. We will definitely stay there next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was the icing on the cake for our trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: jmiller_1732
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 6 nights at the Artemide Hotel. From the first day to the last day our experience was excellent. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was very good with a good selection of fruits, juices, cold cut meats, pastries, eggs, and bacon. We were able to eat enough there to hold us over until the evening especially with the free snacks in the room. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. Since we were in the back of the motel we didn't have much of a view from our window but it was made up for by the fact that it was very quite. Also as I mentioned above there were free snacks and drinks in the room that were refilled every day. This helped us a lot since we didn't have to go looking for a place to get water we had 2 free bottles given to us every day. The hotel is centrally located in the city and is about 20 or 30 minute walk from most major sites except the Vatican (though you can still walk to it in about 45 or 50 minutes if you don't take all the little back streets like we did :)). It also has a metro stop about 5 minutes away and the Termini Station is 10 minutes away so your option for getting around the city are about as good as you can get. Finally to get back to airport we took advantage of their shuttle service. It was ready and waiting for us at 6:30am even though it was only supposed to be there at 6:45am. The driver was very friendly and spoke good English. Even though it cost a bit more then a taxi I found it to be worth it for us. Overall I would recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Rome and my wife and I look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service @ the Artemide Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mandmstam
Reviews.Content: My parents, sister and I really enjoyed the Artemide hotel and the great service. We were assisted with transportation, restaurant recommendations and reservations, booking a tour guide, and even on line reservations for a visit to the Vatican. They even provided us with picnic breakfasts twice when they knew we would be leaving out early! There were no communication problems even though none of our party spoke any Italian. I am really picky about cleanliness when I stay somewhere and the hotel and rooms were immaculate. This is a great place to stay with excellent service and also a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel for a great Roman holiday.”
Reviews.Author: mmcgRome
Reviews.Content: Excellant service and everyone spoke perfect english especially when none of us speak italian.Car service ordered thru the hotel was dependable. Great location for metro,Termini and walking to all major sites. We walked to all except the Vatican. Family room was large and comfortable and the minibar was great.Breakfast was wonderful too.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Juice_London
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Artemide Hotel on our first trip to Rome. Whilst located on a busy street, since our room was at the rear of the hotel, this was really no issue at all and there was no street noise. The location was great, being within walking distance of the Termini, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum. In addition, have to say the service was great, particularly from the guys at breakfast - which consisted of a good selection, frequently replenished which not the case at some hotels I have stayed at. Only slight downside was the restaurant which we ate in one evening (due to mum being exhausted after hours of walking!) - it was practically empty and expensive. But all in all a great place and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent friendly, centrally located and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJAndover
Reviews.Content: Excellent service - breakfast particularly, friendly and helpful staff. Our room was comfortable, with everything we could need. Even the mini bar stocked with soft drinks and munchies came at no extra charge. The hotel is well situated right in the middle of Rome making it easy to explore most on foot. I think the only downside was that we only had a courtyard view from our hotel window which was a bit drab but otherwise excellent all round. We found all the staff to be polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rachie1234
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Dad went to Rome in March 2010 and picked this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We arrived about 2 hours before official check in time but our room was ready so we were allowed check in. We had a twin room and it's not gigantic but was good for us. We brought a laptop and the free wifi was great. Bathroom was quite big and had a nice room fragrance and freebies like shoeshine, shower cap, etc. Every part of the room was very clean too. The free minibar was great and you also got a few biscuits every day too. The turndown service was nice, yummy chocolates too! The TV didn't have a huge amount of English channels, BBC News 24 was one of the only ones I think. Breakfast was delicious. I recommend the blood orange juice. The waiters are lovely, so friendly. We had dinner there one night which was lovely and the waiter was extremely attentive. The hotel was in a great location, we walked everywhere. It was really handy for the train station and the Roman ruins. We found some nice restaurants near the hotel too. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed and positioned hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Baguan
Reviews.Content: This place is extremely well positioned, (100m from the Metro), well maintained and consistently well appointed. I would also say very good value for money. You get the impression it is a well managed place, back and front of house. The hotel staff is genuinely friendly and helpful. Both my partner and I were escorted to our room and shown the facilities upon arrival. They do not lurk around for a tip but are thankful if you do. The rooms are on the smallish side, (based on Aussie standards), but are reasonable by European standards. Like most old building establishments, the lifts are slow and small but at least there are two of them. The stairs are fairly wide and accessible so not a bad option if you want to burn some of that Roman food. The bed is comfortable and you have all the mod cons well placed and in ample supply. The bathroom is relatively large and the shower works really well (fast hot water). Good soap and shampoo and ample soft new towels. There are large windows that can be open with a shutter. Did struggle with the aircon and to this day do not know if I switched it on or not? High points are the LCD TV, good quality free wireless internet (even on the 5th floor) and free mini bar drinks which are replenished daily. The breakfast is real treat in terms of quality, variety, ambiance and again staff friendliness. The staff are very child friendly and able to communicate in a number of languages. I would highly recommend Artemide as a good quality well rounded destination that gets most things right. (Be aware if travelling by car that the hotel has no where for you to stop to offload your luggage other than straight in front which is a one lane taxi and bus way. This takes parking half on the curb and enduring a few beeps while you move with pit stop briskness. Also be aware if travelling by car that the hotel is within the Rome Limited Traffic Zone.)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent room a welcoming staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rafi50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for 5 nights at the end of march beginning of April. The room was comfortable and pleasent, hotel staff made us feel welcome responding willingly to every request we made and the location is in a walking distance from most sites, we used transportation just once to get to the Vatican which is a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: 99PRIXGT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel for our honeymoon. I booked this hotel based on the reviews I've read and my wife and I were not disappointed. It's a beautiful hotel located within walking distance to most of the major sites. The excellent staff were always knowledgeable and attentive to our needs. They even sent a bottle of champagne to our room upon learning we were on our honeymoon.....nice touch. We had one of reasonably sized superior rooms which was quiet, very comfortable and exceptionally clean. The large bathroom and free minibar were huge pluses. My wife and I also enjoyed breakfast every morning which was included. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel within walking distance of Coliseum, Spanish Steps etc”
Reviews.Author: Rumbar
Reviews.Content: Big 4 star hotel that seems to have been recently refurbed. Spotless and excellent service, the staff were incredibly helpful in every way. The room was very quiet, not huge but perfectly adequate and the bed was queen and really comfortable. Free minibar and toiletries is nice touch and much appreciated. Aircon in our room didn't work and our room was too warm, but it was quiet as were at the back, so we were able to sleep with the window open and there were black out curtains so it was fine! We managed to miss breakfast on more than one occasion, despite it being served till 1030 so sleeping was not a problem! Great location on one of the main drags, so lots going on nearby. About 15 mins walk to Coliseum, bit further to Spanish Steps. We even walked back from The Vatican (about 5 stops away on Metro) fairly easily, and there's always somewhere beautiful to stop for a drink on the way. Hotel arranged transport for us to Ciampino airport (which is to Rome what Stansted is to London) for 40 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel caterf for coeliacs”
Reviews.Author: PemEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect - we were in an upgraded room and at the back which was quiet. I had emailed ahead that my wife was a coeliac and the reply was that the hotel was aware of this condition but we were not really expecting to be so well catered for - we were brought toasted gluten free bread, gluten free crackers and gluten free biscuits each morning in addition to the generally available cheese, meat, fruit,yoghurts etc that were gluten free. The free mini bar and snacks were very useful and filled the gap between the big breakfast and evening meal. Have nothing but positive feedback for the hotal and the staff. We walked everywhere from the hotel and I would recommend this as the best way of seeing the sights. We joined a guided tour of the colleseum/ forum which I would recommend - we jumped the long queues by doing this and it made the experience much more memorable. We also met up with one of these guides for a guided walk of some of the other famous city sites and some secret ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre weekend break hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnandCaroline
Reviews.Content: We have just come back (28.3.10) from a three night stay in this excellent city centre hotel. From here you can walk everywhere after a very filling and varied breakfast. All the staff are very friendly. We stayed in a standard double room which was very clean and well appointed and so quiet for a city centre hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very good service and some nice extra touches”
Reviews.Author: Abs16
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Artemide very tired after arriving on the delayed over-night train from Paris. The hotel was very conveniently situated only 5 minutes walk from the station, and even though we arrived 3 hours prior to check in time (expecting only to be able to leave our bags) the reception staff quickly checked whether our room was ready, and checked us in. For a central hotel in a city not renowned for its value for money, the room was spacious and excellent value for what we paid. The bathroom was also roomy and very nicely equipped. It was lovely to have the free "mini-bar" which was stocked daily with beer and soft drinks, and there was also a good range of snacks and hot drinks in the room. We were also given a voucher each for a welcome drink of either coffee or sparkling wine, which we saved for day two which was my husband's birthday. We exchanged these for a very respectable glass of prosecco each. Breakfast was good, with an excellent range of fruit juices and various pastries, breads, cheeses and meats as well as yoghurts, cereals and fruit. There was a business centre and a fitness suite which we didn't use as we were fully focussed on relaxing! The only thing to be aware of is that there was a charge to get the internet/wireless connection which wasn't clear from the information we had seen in advance. However, this was a flat rate for the stay which was quite reasonable if you needed a lot of usage, and we found an "Irish Pub" down the road where you could use the internet for 15 mins free of charge, which was fine for us. All the staff we came into contact with during our stay were friendly and helpful, and I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for a central point in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Fantastic Location! Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ellebaby2010
Reviews.Content: Myself and five friends have just returned from a city break in Rome staying at the Artemide Hotel. The rooms/bathrooms were very spacious and clean and bed linen and towels were changed daily! The staff were extremely friendly and they all spoke very good English. There was plenty of choice for breakfast and the free mini bar in the room (replenished daily) was an added bonus. Also, the Hotel was very well situated for both sightseeing and shopping. I would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to anyone and I would definitely stay there again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY/NEED TRANSPORT FROM THE AIRPORT?”
Reviews.Author: mrpellow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel and every comment on the previous reviews are true. The hotel is in a fantastic location, the staff are extremley helpful and friendly and as well as the free mini bar you also get a free drink on your first visit to the hotel bar. The breakfast is wonderful, the rooms are large and very clean with bed linen and towel change every single day. We really can not speak highly enough about the hotel. If you require transport for up to 8 people from the airport or a limousine service at a very reasonable rate e-mail [--], they are much cheaper than the regular airport taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gbsand81
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 5 nights (2 rooms) in March and enjoyed it immensely. They don't nickel and dime you -- the minibar was free as was the wifi (although the wifi did not work with my ipod touch, for some reason. We paid 12 euros for unlimited internet service in the business center for the length of our stay -- very reasonable. I don't understand why more hotels don't adopt this policy. Breakfast was excellent -- a lot of variety (though the scrambled eggs were runny...). While the location was convenient to pretty much all that Rome has to offer, the via Nationale is a bit like staying on Lexington Avenue in New York (and that's not a compliment). Not too many great restaurants in the area, and it wasn't conducive to strolling (though it was perfectly safe). But our rooms were in the back and were very quiet Great people working there. All in all, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide is Excellent! Wonderful location, service, rooms, and prices!”
Reviews.Author: HDGolden
Reviews.Content: We booked the "No Frills" room because the price was so low, but upon arrival were upgraded to a normal double room. The room was wonderful, large with lots of storage space, free minibar and coffee/tea and snacks, desk, flat screen TV, and a large bed. The bathroom was very nice with a full sized tub, very clean and in excellent condition. The staff at the front desk helped us almost daily with different questions. We booked a car to take us to the airport at 4:30 in the morning, and it arrived on time and it made the trip so easy - much easier and more trustworthy than a taxi. The room was incredibly quiet and once you shut the black out curtains, very dark also so it was easy to sleep. We walked to everything - even the Vatican and Trastevere! I very highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: laurahc84
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide was in a great location, had beautiful amenities and a very helpful and knowledgeable staff. After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to make a reservation to stay here. We will recommend this hotel to family and friends who visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rodenbach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at Artemide Hotel. We checked in at midnight and were quickly received and welcomed. The room was larger than we expected, clean and very well appointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly return. The hotel is very close to Termini Station, and within easy walking distance of many of Rome's famous attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckygirlnewjersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artemide Hotel and it was a fabulous experience. Tremendous service, great location (walking distance to Trevi, Pantheon) and exceptionally clean, comfortable rooms. Buffet breakfast was best we had in Italy and free minibar items was an unexpected treat. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable as at home”
Reviews.Author: MrbMoscow
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, quiet, close to main important places, good service, good choice for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - do not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: LilLarky
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome on a few occasions, but my most recent visit was with my boyfriend to celebrate our 5th anniversary and my birthday. We chose the Artemide Hotel and they made every moment so special I will always return to this hotel whatever the occasion. The staff were helpful, welcoming and incredibly professional. Once they knew why we had chosen to visit Rome, we were lucky enough to be upgraded to the honeymoon suite and welcomed with a bottle of sparkling wine and a birthday cake! The room (as you could image) was beautiful. Very well appointed with everything you could want of a hotel.. huge comfortable bed, well stocked bathroom, and the bonus of the free minibar as mentioned in other reviews. This suite also had a separate room with a dining table, sofa, music system and tv as well as a beautiful private roof terrace overlooking the streets of Rome, where you could sit and watch the city go by. Amazing. The hotel is near the end of Via Nazionale - towards Pz Republica. We were able to get the metro to St Peter's from here and the whole journey from door to door was about 20mins. Everywhere else is within easy walking distance. The Spanish Steps are about 10-15 minutes north on a straight road at the next cross section from the hotel. Trevi fountain 5 minutes east from there. The Colosseum is 10 minutes south east and all very easy to navigate. The road itself is safe and lively and if you are looking for a few places to eat outside of the more 'touristy' squares, there are some nice restaurants in the residential areas a little further north of the hotel beyond Pz Republica. I always read these reviews waiting to be 'convinced' about a particular hotel to choose. Not only did the staff at this hotel go above and beyond to make our trip amazing, even if they had not done so, the hotel would have been beautiful and perfectly located for everything Rome has to offer. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel time after time... maybe even for our actual honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly tranquil hotel in the heart of the city... big thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: braddeluca
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Europe with low expectations for our hotels - small and cramped were what we expected, and with Rome as the first stop along the way I was expecting nothing fancy... we were pleasently surprised! Artimede is a wonderful hotel on a very busy road, but the rooms are dry, warm, quiet and very very clean. Apart from the lift being pretty small, and the breakfast slightly on the expensive side I would have to say that this hotel is an ideal location to explore the wonderful city of Rome from!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishDaisy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artemide hotel for three nights after a lot of research and on the advice of tripadvisor members, we were not disappointed. As soon as we arrived the concierge could not do enough for us & were very helpful and informative. we were also presented with a voucher for a free welcome drink of presecco or beer at the hotel bar for that evening. We stayed in a classic double room which was on the fourth floor & had French doors with a balcony. The room was small but spotless with all the usual amenities, slippers toiletries etc and even had a free mini bar that was stocked up daily which was a nice touch. We even forgot to pack our toothbrush but nothing was too much trouble and we were given mini tooth brushes and toothpaste until we managed to get some. The breakfast buffet included fruit & fruit salads, selection of cold meats, pastries, bread and bacon and eggs. These were stocked up at all times also the waiter was very friendly & made sure coffee and tea was always available. The location of the hotel is good and is only a 10 minute walk from the train station. Overall our stay at Artemide was fantastic & we will defiantly be staying here again if we return to Rome. WORD OF WARNING A taxi from the station to Artemide hotel should cost around 8 – 10 euro’s depending on traffic. Be very careful when getting into a taxi at the station as we were charged 20 euro’s by a bogus taxi driver who took us the long way round. Apparently we were lucky as some people have been charged 40 euro’s in the past. Also if you get a train in Rome remember to get your train ticket stamped at one of the machines on or just before the platform. There are not many signs informing you to do this but if you don’t you’ll have to pay a 50 euro fine on the spot. They don’t make any allowances for tourists and we witnessed four in our carriage get fined.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, gracious and helpful. Hotel is in an excellent location for getting around. Walk to some attractions, short walk to metro for others. Great breakfasts. Free minibar and treats. Clean rooms. Upscale atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steph0611
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend are just back from staying at this hotel for 3 nights, cannot fault this hotel at all, the rooms are lovely and have everything you need in them, we had a king size bed which was fab, you get a free mini bar, which has can of coke, fanta, 2 cans of beer, 2 bottles of still water, 2 bottles of sparkling water and 2 cartons of juice, they replace everything each day also, which is brilliant, there is a kettle, which you have different kinds of tea bags (green tea also), and coffee, you also get a bottle of water beside this every day, and you get crackers, mini biscuits, chocolate wafers, peanuts, beside this, which are also replaced. The bathroom is a good size, and has all your minature toiletries and slippers. The breakfast is good with a great start to the day, its a buffet breakfast. Staff are very nice and friendly. We had a room to the back which was nice and quiet, no noise at all. Overall highly recommended. Would return to this hotel if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide in Rome is the best!”
Reviews.Author: jodiandandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Artemide Hotel on our first visit to Rome and can't say enough about the hotel. The staff is helpful and welcoming, the room was great and the breakfast is fantastic. One morning we were going out early and my husband went to breakfast alone so I could get ready and Pasquale insisted I get at least a cappacino and rolls before we left, made me a tray and had someone bring them to me in our room. We got great advice from the front desk staff and the room was large and very comfortable. The Artemide is walking distance to all the major attractions except the Vatican and perhaps the Piazza Navona/Pantheon so we bought a 48 hour pass on the tour bus Caio Roma and used that in lieu of cab rides and got around great. The free internet access and minibar saved us a ton! Wonderful city, perfect hotel. Go there and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: jstanton8869
Reviews.Content: We found Artemide Hotel on TripAdvisor and researched elsewhere as well. Having visited Rome before we knew the location was great - ideal for the railway station and the transfer buses to the airport and ideal for exploring this fantastic city. The room was a good size for Rome hotels - spotless, modern and a free mini bar that they don't mind you using as your own fridge and free wifi all through the building. The hotel staff are excellent, nothing is too much trouble. A welcome free prosecco on arrival in the friendly bar and excellent breakfast as well as great restaurant recommendations when needed. Worth looking at booking direct as we got a special weekender deal that was not offered on the other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CottonCandy1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice rooms, breakfast was good, staff was really nice & accommodating. The down side was the small elevator, the air conditioner shutting off for 1 hour every night, the street noise. But, overall it was really good. I would come back again, but will ask for a quieter room on the other side of the bldg.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching - this is Your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: -MP069-
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really worth of all the good reviews one can read from this site. Best possible location, reasonable price, spotless clean, free minibar, very friendly staff (if I have to mention one person he has to be Pasquale, head waiter) and so on... I can't see any reason why to choose some other hotel - well, if there's no rooms available maybe then. When we visit Rome again we will book this hotel again, no doubt about that. Thanks for everybody and for everything, this was some memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but a little small”
Reviews.Author: Rivonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night with two young children in a triple room. The staff were excellent and the rooms were beautifully done but very small on the other hand the bathroom was huge. The whole hotel was exceptionally clean. The breakfast was good with highchairs for the kids. The rest of our time in Rome was spent in another hotel which had a room double the size of this one and was cheaper. This hotel might be better suited to couples or singles, just going by the size of the room. Otherwise a great stay. Hats off to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendy Staff”
Reviews.Author: holiday456
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Artemide and it was a wonderful experience. The staff were so friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a family room with our 2 young children and there was more than enough space to accommodate all of us. Breakfast was great - the waiters were fantastic with the children - very friendly. The welcome drinks on arrival were a nice touch as was the free minibar. Bathrooms were a good size, Beds were comfortable, Free Wi-Fi on request was great, Tea and coffee making facilities were there. Although on a fairly busy street the soundproofing was good. It was a great location from which to see all the sights. Not too far to walk to the Colesseum, Forum etc or to the Spanish steps and beyond with a 5 and 7 year old in tow. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice!”
Reviews.Author: oahioforever
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel coming from our first accommodation, my wife and I had the pleasure of staying there. we found ourselves well, we booked the hotel on Expedia and all transfers on takemeitaly.com from airport to hotel and tour night at discount prices

Reviews.Title: “An unforgetable experience....”
Reviews.Author: l_matthews1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice of hotel. The servcie we received was impeccable at all times and 'nothing' was too much trouble for any member of staff. The room was furnished to the highest standard and the cleanliness could be seen throughout. The hotel is situated in a very good location and although it faces onto the main route of Via Nazinale,there is no noise to be heard from the passing traffic. There are an abundance of restaurants, shops, bars and general food stores directly surrounding the hotel. The transport system is to a high standard and constantly on time. Being in a central position, it is not far to walk to most sight seeing areas from the hotel. The walking made it all the more better as it allowed us to take in the beautiful city of Rome. This hotel is definitely 4 * rated an lives up to the expected standrad one would expect. Do not hesitate to stay at the Artemide, it was for us an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, helpful staff, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: SueandJonNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of this hotel. It was walking distance to almost all the sights we wanted to see (just needed a cab to get to the Vatican), the breakfast was great and the staff incredibly helpful (except for restaurant recommendations - after trying their suggestion our first eveing I did the research on my own). The room was clean and comfortable and even had a balconey. We would definitely stay here again - good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: Thomas012
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every aspect of staying at the hotel, the excellent service and attention to detail, the suite and mini bar service, the gym facilities and long and very convenient hours of its operation, the proximity to everything without the overcrowding, the very helpfull reception staff and the list goes on. We have since been recommending your hotel to all our friends and family, and we will stay again at the Hotel Artemide at our next visit to breathtaking Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first time in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: r.walgreen
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, friendly personell , good breakfast ... we loved it !!

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Refuge from the Roman Heat and Crowds”
Reviews.Author: left_at_eaglecap
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Rome and our first staying at the Artemide. We booked the room based upon its proximtiy to the subway and Forum.Coliseum. We were very pleasantly surprised at the upscale, clean, trendy and relatively affordable Artemide. The hotel staff looked after us very well. Our fondest memories are sitting up at the rooftop lounge enjoying the sunsets over Rome as well as the staff preparing us a breakfast to go when we had to leave at 5AM to catch a return flight to the States. The hotel is different than those on Capo de Africa, but different in a very cosmopolitan sort of way and the Artemide is much closer to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect first time in Rome, thanks to Artemide”
Reviews.Author: EvadBrussels
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect. Very friendly personal that really cares for you. The hotel is very classy and clean, without losing a human touch. Ideal location, close to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than the Hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: nutshellKent
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Hotel Artemide through Tripadvisor and how right the reviews were. The hotel is in easy access from the train station, in a good location, with good access to city bus tours and good restaurants. The staff are very friendly, helpful and polished.
