The accomodation is clean, well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and the bar well stocked! Well done Hotel Artemide, we can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of la dolce vita"”
Reviews.Author: GregF73
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the Trip Advisor members that reviewed this fabulous hotel. We booked on your recommendations and were not disappointed. Stayed six nights in a standard room. Cozy by U.S. standards but large for Europe. Bathroom was full size and featured a shower with superb water pressure and lots of hot water. Room was very well kept. The free breakfast every morning was huge - we were able to save lots of $$$ by eating at the hotel and then having just a small lunch. Location is ideal - short walk to the Roman sites and near the Metro for the Vatican. We even day-tripped to Florence without issue. Also, wireless internet worked flawlessly while we were there. A first rate stay - I cannot recommend the hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service, everything was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: XTim
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of the hotel was great. We traveled for two weeks through France, Switz, and Italy. Rome was our final destination for the trip. One very underrated aspect of traveling through Europe is the ease of getting to your hotel from the train station. At the same time, you don't want to stay in a crummy part of town. This hotel was perfect in that regard. Artemide Hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from the train station. Definitely no need to take the metro or a cab. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating, courteous, and just all around pleasant. They always seemed to go out of their way for us.The room was spacious, very clean, and pristine. The bathroom was also very clean, and spacious for European standards. Another nice plus we found at this hotel was the mini-fridge in the room... It was stocked daily for free to include soda, beer, and snacks. The breakfast was free and good. We walked just about everywhere in Rome. Some locations like the Vatican would be quite the hike. The metro is only a block from the hotel though. Everything considered, it was a great hotel, and would definitely recommend this hotel to any of our friends. If we ever make it back to Rome, we'll stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Will definitly return & recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Herbie025
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Artemide as a surprise birthday gift for my partner and it was everything i was hoping for and more! After looking at so many hotels and reading many reviews i was happy i chose this one. Before our arrival the hotel arranged for a lovely bottle of Chianti to be in the room for my partner as a birthday treat. The hotel was in a very good location, within walking distance from everything. We walked to all of the major sites, there is a bus stop outside where a direct bus goes to the Vatican in approx 15-20mins but we even was able to take a scenic walk back to the hotel after! The hotel breakfast was lovely, and the staff were so friendly and cheerful which was nice each morning! The mini bar was great stocked up each day which after a long day site seeing was much appreciated and an excellent final touch to make this hotel stand out from the rest. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, family and friends and would definitely stay here again. The hotel reception staff and everyone was so helpful and freindly. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbellnat1
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a fantastic break in this beautiful city and we were lucky enough to stay at the Hotel Artemide. I just wanted to say this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in and this was due to the fabulous staff. In particular I would like to single out Alessandro on the front desk and Pasquale in the breakfast room who made our stay that more perfect with their passion for excellent customer service. It was my boyfriends 30th birthday two weeks earlier and so this was a surprise trip for him. When we went to our room we had a bottle of wine waiting for us which was just a lovely gesture. It's added extras such as this that make a difference. Finally the location seemed very central with everything in walking distance. A stroll back from the Vatican was around 40 mins and this was with lots of stops and sight seeing along the way. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and many more attractions are less than 10 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Artemide and Rome”
Reviews.Author: RonCole
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Artemide hotel and it was excellent. We were upgraded automatically to a superior room which was huge. Free minibar which had water, beer and some soft drinks. For those who like their tea and coffee, all the facilities were there also. Buffet breakfast was also especially if you like cake. Finally bed and pillows were great (Mrs wants one of the pillows) staff also very friendly, highly recommended hotel. On arrival get a Roma pass, and use the Metro, Rome is very walkable but you can explore and not have to worry about the trip back. Take advantage of the free guided tour from the Spanish steps at 5:30pm, which was excellent. Vatican city and its museums, were a bit of a dissapointment, they are closed Sunday, except last Sunday of every month when its free, all other museums are closed Monday so plan accordingly. Finally drinks are very expensive, you pay less at the bar than sitting down.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cuticuti2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and I would definately recomend this hotel to my friends. The location is superb. Room and the service was good. Overall it made out rome trip something memorable and a note to return again.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right. A superb hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoinerJnr
Reviews.Content: The first time I've ever been moved to write a review. Fantastic central location within walking distance to all the main sights. Hotel was beyond our expectations - Rooms were very comfortable, clean, modern, well decorated. The free minibar restocked daily was an impressive touch. Service was superb. Had a problem with the TV and they gave us complimentary free films and wi-fi as well as promptly fixing the problem. Rome was a great experience. I struggled to choose a hotel when I was faced with a list of so many. It will be easy the next time as we're definately going back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanPen
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth staying at this Hotel. Staff are wonderful, clean, pretty good location, 15 min walk to Collaseum and Central Rome and the Mini Bar is FREE, Wow!!! Highly recommend and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smithyep
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend with my sister and mother to celebrate her 70th birthday . Hotel made us all feel welcome with some great extra touches - fruit and wine in the room. Breakfast was to die for. We could have stayed there all day !! Plan to use the hotel again on future visits to Rome !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean, quiet, nice.”
Reviews.Author: Steveh3Texas
Reviews.Content: We actually walked to the hotel from the train station although many folks would take a short cab ride. It is definitely walking distance to the Metro. The hotel was very clean, rooms larger than most European hotels and we could not hear any street noise. Breakfast was included in our internet price and was good, not great. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel with all the amentities and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jsmosley7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in mid January during a trip to other Eurpoean cities and found this hotel to be in a class above the others. We really enjoyed the stay and found the hotel exceeded all our expectations. The room was well appointed and included use of the mini bar and wireless internet for free; definate plus to have drinks and snacks in the room after a long day of sightseeing. The staff were very helpful and we had no issues with a language barrier. Anytime we asked for directions they pulled out a map and really showed us were to go and gave a few extra helpful tips. Recommendations for places to eat nearby were also spot on as we had the most delicatable meals in Rome. Location was good; it is a short walk to the metro and Termini and on the route of major buses that go to all the sights. We actually ended up walking to all the sight but the Vatican and found it not to be that far, everything looks much further on the map than reality. Again, anytime you needed help the front desk was very useful and friendly. Perhaps the only warning would be for the pricey breakfast (we did not opt to include this in the reservation and tired it one morning) which was the typically overpriced, mediocre hotel-ish meal. I'd recommend not including in the reservation and grabbing a bite at the many nearby cafes as we did most mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: I was really well treated by the stuff. Specially the daily manager is very polite and attencious. They do care about you. The room is very good, has a medium, but good size (for Europe standars specially), the breakfast is very good and the mini bar is free (what is a very good complimentary gift). I´d, for sure, be there again. Only the waiter at the bar could be a little bit more friendly, but except for that, they really deserved all the rewards they received.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - If I'm lucky enough to go to Rome again, I would definitely stay at the Artemide!”
Reviews.Author: mung0jerry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on a combination of tripadvisor ranking and price (using Expedia for a package deal) and had a very positive experience for the 4 nights we were there. Firstly, location: The hotel itself is a short 5-10 minutes walk from Termini Station (dependent on amount of luggage you have with you!) in a safe, if relatively un-eventful area - Via Nazionale is a busy shopping street with a metro station 60 seconds walk away in Piazza della Republica. Pretty much everything worth seeing on the east side of the Tiber is within walking distance from the hotel - the only time we used the metro was to get to the Vatican, although this probably would still only have been a 45 minute walk away. The staff at Hotel Artemide are great - really friendly and knowledgable - from the front desk to the bell boys - especially the guys in the breakfast room - great sense of humour and service (it's great when someone remembers how you take your coffee on the first morning and has it ready for you every day for the rest of the trip!) On the subject of breakfast, this was also great... big selection of pastries, cereal, juices, yoghurts, bread, cheese, salami/ham, eggs and bacon and homemade cakes - so good and plentiful that we sometimes didn't even need to stop for lunch! The hotel also wrote a personal greeting to my girlfriend who was celebrating her birthday and had a nice bottle of chianti waiting for us in the room when we arrived - a lovely touch. The room itself was great with just a few points that i felt warranted the less than perfect score... on the plus side, it was very spacious with nice high ceilings, good sound proofing from the street noise, a free mini-bar re-stocked daily and a big modern bathroom with robes/slippers etc. We did however feel that there wasn't enough hanging/storage space in the room. The TV was terrible - only 2 english channels, very bad signal and it kept switching itself off intermittently - although we, and I don't imagine many people travel to Rome to sit in the room and watch TV - so only a minor negative. I'm not sure the air-conditionning was working that well... but still only a minor inconvenience. Overall Hotel Artemide was everything we were looking for in a hotel and more, and I believe could be considered 5 star if the very small details were attended to. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tinkin3
Reviews.Content: After staying 5 nights at the Artemide Hotel, I can only say that the reviews are 100% accurate. This place is fantastic. From the very accommodating front desk to the fantastic room to the great breakfast, it was very enjoyable.There was a group of eight of us staying at the hotel, and we were all pleased. Upon checking in, we were told that we had been upgraded, which was a pleasant surprise. The room was fantastic - large by European standards, and the bathroom was excellent. It was clean and the bed was huge! It was my boyfriend's birthday, and the front desk sent a bottle of wine up to our room as a gift, which was a really nice surprise. There is also free wi-fi if you decide to take your laptop, and if you don't, the front desk will give you a password to use the lobby computer for 15 minutes at a time. An added bonus is the free mini-bar, which is great after a long day of site-seeing. The location is perfect and in a safe neighborhood. It's less than two blocks to the subway, and easy walking distance to many of the site. The front desk recommended several restaurants, which were all really good. They also arranged transportation to and from the airport, which was so much easier than cabbing or taking the train. All in all, I highly recommend Artemide Hotel to anyone visiting Rome. You definitely can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DennyR
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier choosing this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, the location is perfect for sightseeing in this beautiful city of Roma...all within walking distance, also fine restuarants nearby and most of all a great staff...very friendly, courtious and helpful. I am looking forward to staying at the Artemide on my next visit, all due to a satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rome experience to remember!”
Reviews.Author: annod_725
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide Hotel on Via Nazionale and it was a fantastic choice of hotel. We were upgraded without asking, staff were attentive and helpful. The rooms were beautiful and exceptional value especially compared to same standard in Paris for example. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to all the major must sees, safe area and quiet as well. The free mini bar was very much appreciated, the bed being turned down and cutains closed during the evening when you were out was just a nice extra touch as were the chocolates which were left. Also have to comment on the breakfast which was really good, excellent choice of fruits, cereals, cold meats, bread etc. that set you up for the day. We are already planning to return to Roma and will most definetly stay at the Artemide again, I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel. Should also say it is only 15min walk from the Termini where the bus from the airport drops you off and picks you up. I loved Roma and really enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Breakfast, and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: the_boiler_fan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Artemide Hotel in January 2010 and it was one of the best hotels I stayed in for business or pleasure. The staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were always friendly and fluent in English. We arrived well before the stated check-in time and because the room was not ready upon our arrival they upgraded us to a Superior room free of charge. The location of the hotel is only two blocks from the Metro stop at Piazza della Repubblica which made getting to the major sites much easier and faster. The breakfast buffet was included with the room and the food was very good everyday we were there. There was a cold bar with meats, cheeses, fruit, and yogurt. There was also a variety of coffee cakes, breads, cereals, eggs (they were a bit runny for me but still tasted good), and bacon. When we arrived for breakfast we were greeted with the choice of coffee, tea, or cappuccino which were all excellent. The superior room we were given was very large and very nice - clean and quiet. The mini-bar in the room was restocked everyday and was included in the cost of the room. The water bottles were great to take while sightseeing. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel was the Wi-Fi did not work with the MacBook that we had with us. The staff did everything they could to solve the connection problems - I am not sure if it was the hotels fault or ours but they were accommodating and let us us the computers in the business center free of charge all week. I will stay at the Artemide Hotel every time I am in Rome. Thanks to them for making our vacation special and worry free!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy on the house”
Reviews.Author: kukel
Reviews.Content: Hotel site successful, near to all sights. The personnel very affable, pleasant. Cleaning of rooms good, every day. Rooms small, but cosy and it is good furnitured. A wish - porridges for a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: TomMontgomery
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with some friends, stayed for three nights at the Hotel Artemide around Christmas. We had an excellent stay, and would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. Rome is a big city, so no hotel is going to be near all the sights, but the location on Via Natzionale was fine for us. It was in a busy part of town with plenty of places to eat and drink. The Irish Pub next door was a great way to unwind after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel is near all the stops for the hop-on, hop-off bus tours, so we jumped on ours every morning right near the hotel and got around the city very easily. There are also a few sights, but no big ones, that are within easy walking distance of the hotel. If you want to stay within walking distance of any of the major sights, or in a more touisty area, this probably isnt the best place. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and polite. Everything we asked for was delivered. The hotel accomodations were also very nice. There is a nice hotel bar and lounge area with big-screen TV. This was nice for early morning or after a long day of touring. There is also a computer room with internet. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant for any meals, though, so I'm not sure about that. The rooms were better than average. We got a discount on a very small room, but our friends were given an upgrade to a very large room with a terrace. It was extremely nice. All in all, the Artemide is a very nice hotel and a good base from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Martin017
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome over Christmas and just loved it. The staff was very friendly, the free mini-bar an absolute winner after a long day out shopping and sightseeing. The room was very spacious and clean and the breakfast was good. Great location, bus and metro service less than 5 min, Rome Termini railway station less than 10 min. Most of the majot tourist attractions are within walking distance, Colosseum, Piazza Venicia, Trevi Fountain, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: KarenC5
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for 3 days over Thanksgiving to see our oldest son who was living in Testevere on a Semester Abroad. We found the Artemide through Trip Advisor and it was fantastic! The room was spacious and beautiful. We had a lovely view of Via Nazionale which while the view was amazing it did prove to be a bit noisy when trying to sleep. We managed just fine however. The free mini bar that was stocked daily was a major plus as was the included full breakfast buffet. The staff were pleasant and took care of arranging our transportation to and from the airport. The hotel is right by a bus stop and this was handy! Everything was easy tot get to from this location by walking, however we did utilize the bus to get to some areas more quickly and save our feet! There was a small safe in the room and ample storage for belongings. We were in a Superior Triple and the bathroom was huge! We even had a pants press in the entryway of the room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights over Christmas with our 18 year old son. We were upgraded to a suite with a terrace, large comfortable rooms with many amenities (bathrobes, slippers, free minibar with drinks and snacks). We were within walking distance of many of Rome's greatest attractions. We received excellent restaurant and travel advice from the friendly hotel staff, and enjoyed the breakfast and the bar. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price”
Reviews.Author: AMARCAR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located (near piaza republica where you can find Metro and Bus and not farway of railway principal station of Termini (as to go to Fiumicino Airport). The street it is locatde is a principal one, with good restaurants and top shops as MaxMara,etc. About 300 m to Piaza Venezia (a central point on Roma, as frome there you have Av. Del Corso, V.Emanuele etc with shops aonda so on).

Reviews.Title: “What a big deal !!!”
Reviews.Author: MVamAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide Hotel for 3 nights last week and I definitively can say that it was a great deal for us !!! Even if we had booked the cheapest room, we found it clean, beautifully arranged and above all, quiet. The reception guy gave us all the information we needed and was always really kind. We was very delighted to discover that the minibar was complimentary, that we had tea and coffee facilities in the room including cookies too, and the free internet access was a plus !!! I enjoyed my stay and can only strongly recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: FlyPhylly
Reviews.Content: I actually joined Trip Advisor so I could review The Hotel Artemide! The hotel staff were very friendly, spoke perfect English and managed to accommodate every single request we threw at them! We were immediately upgraded to a superior room, which was clean, had a king-sized bed, a nice, big bathroom* and a FREE MINI-BAR, which is totally unheard of elsewhere (even having fresh cold bottles of water replenished daily was a huge bonus)! The breakfast was wonderful, de-lish cappuccinos, and in addition to the typical Continental fare, they also had hot American-style food as well. The location was great, we were able to take the bus or metro everywhere we wanted to go. One tip is to get the Roma Pass; in addition to discounts on sights, you get 3 days of unlimited public transportation! We had a really fabulous time and highly recommend this hotel! *Our only complaint is on the last day our drain clogged and took several hours before all the water escaped the tub. The maintenance staff were extremely helpful, but were unable to fix it. Since we only had to take 1 more shower we didn't make a big deal out of it, but I figured I'd mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service”
Reviews.Author: euro_licenced_driver
Reviews.Content: The attention to customer service is second to none. i must agree with the other reviews and rate this hotel as outstanding. we arrived at 11.00 and they managed to find rooms for us at very short notice, and the offer of prosecco was most welcoming. The staff are so genuinely friendly and willing to help - whether it was finding restaurants, ordering taxis or dealing with any issues that arose. The rooms are top class, spacious, and modern. The free refreshments in the room were a great idea to help us relax after a day sightseeing. The location couldn't be better for the subway or the hop-on-off buses, and several top class restaurants within a few yards of the hotel. Any problems that we had were immediatly resolved with the help of Alesando at the front desk supported by Loredana the hotel manager. Their focus on customer satisfaction is second to none and it shows in all their dealings with customers. and the breakfasts... wow. We were spoiled for choice with hot food, pastries, breads, fresh fruit, juices and again the friendly staff were ever present to assist. Breakfast was a pleasure in itself. I was delighted to have chosen it for myself and my fellow company directors. I highly commend this hotel as one of the top hotels in Rome and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Twan090
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much. Everybody was very friendly and helpfull. The service of all employees was great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations and made you feel at home in a foreign city”
Reviews.Author: Pranamama
Reviews.Content: We found the Artemide here on Tripadvisor.com and selected it based on the reviews. We have traveled extensively and without reserve I can tell you this hotel is exceptional. The staff is friendly and quick to meet your every need. Prior to our trip,transportation to and from the airport was arranged through the hotel without a glitch. We arrived early in the morning on our check in day and were offered to enjoy the complimentary breakfast even though we were not checked in yet. The breakfast is amazing! The room was spacious, clean, and stocked with coffee/tea service with cookies etc. and the complimentary mini bar-fantastic. Prior to our trip I made several email inquiries and everyone was answered promptly. The location is wonderful and central to all the "must see" sights. We traveled with our 18 yr. old son and our 20 yr. old daughter, who is studying in Florence for the academic year, and joined us in Rome. They loved the hotel as well. Great computer/internet lounge. We will return to Rome and would not consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectitions!”
Reviews.Author: calliencleo
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable rooms, fabulous amenities...we enjoyed our complimentary glasses of Prosecco and I cannot say enough about the complementary mini bar access that our package included - it was a lifesaver for traveling with the kids! Fabulous location for walking to almost any of the sights...when we return, we will be staying here without question.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with superb service”
Reviews.Author: CityhopperMJ
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about how well cared for we were during our 4 night stay in October. The hotel was lovely and the service amazing. From reception to porter to the breakfast room, we were made to feel very special. We can not wait to return again! Forget throwing coins in the Trevi fountain, if you stay at Hotel Artemide, you will definately go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: skylinedave
Reviews.Content: just got back from stay ,and have to say the hotel was beautiful ,the service was 1st class and friendly ,well worth its 4 star rating ,would recomend to all .metro is also just a short walk away ie 2 mins to explore the rest of rome.on the same street as several bars including a couple of irish pubs !! perfect

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: H1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, just 15 minutes walk to the coliseum and very close to all other attractions but I would not recommend a stay there. It is certainly not worth the price, the rooms and bathrooms are tiny, they didn’t have irons in the room nor lend them out which was very inconvenient and they had no out of hours service, so after arriving late we couldn’t even get a bite to eat. There are no facilities in the room i.e. tea/coffee/fridge for water and the view was an internal view looking over derelict buildings. I realise that Rome is a very expensive city but this hotel is definitely not worth the money, I would go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for simply being there....”
Reviews.Author: TheGreenTravellerUk
Reviews.Content: Just a note to say we reviewed options before booking on Tripadvisor and agreed that the Artemide was the place to go re comments, locations, options for rooms, rates etc. When we arrived after a short walk from the railway station, our expectations were met. Great room for the family, as was the service and welcome, the food at breakfast was just enough, and generally felt at home. One thing our family room on top, at the back and very quite, so as hotel is on Via Nazionale, cannot speak for other aspect rooms etc. Location was good for us and we walked everywhere from the hotel as weather good also, plus easy to get to the major sites of interest. Again, would recommend the hotel as a good base for any type of break.

Reviews.Title: “it needs an effort to become excellent”
Reviews.Author: dorkyr
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our trip to Rome.We stayed for 4 nights in Artemide.The room was ideal for our family.Big ,clean,comfortable.The staff was very kind and always tried for the best.The location is in the heart of Rome and we felt pretty safe walking with two young children.The week points of the hotel are the breakfast(very average in variety,and especially its cakes,which reminds you super market products) and the temperature of the room.I don't know if only our room had this problem,but we mentioned it twice and we had no result.The room was extremely hot and we couldn't turn off the heat!!! Good surprise the 32" tv.BAD surprise that at my 40's ,i learned that cappuccino is not a coffee,so we had to pay our ''welcome'' coffee.Would i return at this hotel?Off course because they gave us the impression they try to become better day by day and because the result was that my family left satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMLincoln
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide for 5 nights in November. Unfortunately there was heavy rain for most of our stay, but we still enjoyed the trip. On arrival we were told that we had been upgraded to a superior room, The room was spacious, with no view as expected, but very quiet at all times which is good for a city hotel. The mini-bar was wecome after a long day sight seeing. Breakfast was fine, but became repetitive by the end of our stay. We found Rome to be expensive in the main toursit areas, but found some good small restaurants. If you turn left out of the hotel and head to Via Del Serpente a few blocks down on the left, there are some small restuarants there that we found to have excellent food at reasonable prices. Rome is a great city with lots to do and see. We booked a two day city tour bus through reception, but found that 1 day would probably have been long enough. Other than this, we walked to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming modern hotel convient to everything.”
Reviews.Author: IFliesAA
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is very welcoming and accomodating from the front desk staff to the housekeeping and breakfast room. Our room was large (superior category) with a large bathroom. The room has been recently redocrated and immaculately clean. The bathrooms has very nice amenities, including bathrobes and slippers. The bed was very comfortable, especially after long days of wandering around Rome. The included breakfast was fresh everyday with a wonderfual assortment of fruit, cold cuts, pasteries as well as hot scrambled eggs and crispy bacon. The coffe, capacino or espresso is very good. From this hotel you can easily walk to most of Rome or catch the metro or frequent buses across town within a block or two of the hotel. Also, it is a short flat walk from the Termini train station to the hotel if you have a roll a board or backpack and three minute cab ride. I have stayed in Rome before and this hotel is best in terms of location and value. There are numerous and varied dining options within a few blocks of the hotel and the front desk staff is happy to assist with recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mandyLancashire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. great price for the service we received. The rooms are warm and cosy. I would definatel return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, used to be great value for money - a shame if they have put up their prices”
Reviews.Author: RuthEleanor
Reviews.Content: We did an extensive review using trip advisor and chose this Hotel and we were not disappointed. We received a lovely room which was an upgrade as we were celebrating a birthday. There was a problem with the internet connection on the first day so we received it free of charge for the duration. Great breakfast which was unexpected. Staff friendly and efficient, we had no problem with the location albeit we did not manage to find anywhere really nice to eat very close by. However, Rome is a city for walking and there are tons of places to eat elsewhere. Room confortable with a big bathroom. Would love to go back so hope the price has not increased too much

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: coastalgardener
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Artemide and found the hotel to be in a good location. We walked everywhere (except to Vatican City) within 20 minutes or so. The staff was helpful and the breakfast had a great variety of foods to suit just about anyone. I had read reviews that the hotel was not in the best section of the city but my husband and I never felt unsafe and there were a lot of places to eat and shop in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: melbur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus another couple stayed here for 3 nights early October. We had the "Honeymoon" suite as it's called, what a fabulous room. large private terrace where we all had our nightcaps each evening. Our friends had a balcony room just above the entrance doors, beautiful room as well. The terrace of the hotel was closed by then, so we couldn't dine there.My only complaint - as the weather was still so beautiful there I wish they had kept the terrace open into October! Service was great, got great recommendations for some local restaurants we could walk to. In fact, we walked everywhere to all the major sights, it's in such a great location. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CavanNoeleen
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights. great location, you can walk to all the major attractions in rome from the hotel. staff were all very helpful and friendly, esecially the lovely waiter who brought us up breakfast to the bar even though we had come down too late for breakfast! "american breakfast" as they call it was ok, not much cooked food, just scambled eggs and breakfast, but lovley freshly squeezed oranje juice, really good cappachinos and croissants. rooms are quite small but i beleive this is quite common for city centre room. no view from room either but again location was key deciding factor in picking this hotel. would highly recommend this hotel for its great central location. its right beside the main bus/train station and you can walk into "centro storrico" thanks for great stay in rome, cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: jscott646
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 15 and 16 2009. Good location, nice room, would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service makes this hotel one of the best”
Reviews.Author: MrPKI
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were simply some of the best we have seen in the industry. The room was clean, comfortable, well stocked and cozy. Any time we needed even the smallest of request, the staff went out of their way to meet our needs. When we wanted to order flowers after hours, the staff would call a local business on their mobile phone and ensure that our request was serviced. I could not recommend a better hotel for someone looking to have an extraordinary time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: eleanora63
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent two nights at the Hotel Artemide and were very pleased with the hotel and the location. It has recently been renovated and was very clean; we had a good size room with a large patio situated at the back of the hotel for quiet and privacy. There was tea, coffee, cookies and complimentary mini bar of water, juice, soda and beer! We were also given a complimentary glass of proseco (a type of Italian champagne) upon arrival. The hotel is within walking distance to the main tourist attractions and there are cafes and trattorias close to it for lunch or dinner. An extensive and very tasty buffet breakfast was included with our room. The staff was knowledgeable and courteous. I highly recommend the hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: JW20
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Italy and spent 2 nights at the Hotel Artemide. We were very hapy with the hotel. The staff was very accomodating. Our room was on the back of hotel so very quiet. It was well appointed and very clean. There also were no surprises. The room included a bountiful breakfast, free minibar and a well supplied room. It was close enough to walk to several attractions and great shopping just outside the front door. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “elegant, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtrd
Reviews.Content: good sized room with a nice, full bathroom. Free minibar, coffee station, access to excerise room, newspaper and limited internet daily. Only complaint was there was only one chair in the room. Excellent breakfast buffet. Unfortunately, as we were about town most of the day, we didn't get to spend a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gailfromwa
Reviews.Content: We are a family group of 10 Australians including 2 children 8 and 3. I had researched this hotel on trip advisor prior to booking to stay for 4 nights before we boarded our cruise ship. The reviews I read were true to form. We found the hotel to be very accommodating with comfortable roomy rooms, obliging staff who could not do enough for us, and the little extras's like free internet and mini bar beverages (soft drinks and water) were just some of the things that made it an enjoyable 4 night stay. The breakfast whilst not being your typical American/Austalian buffett, was still great with plenty of variety. The location was also excellent for visiting the tourist sights (many within walking distance), plenty of restaurant options and quite good shopping area. Our boys enjoyed visiting an Irish Pub which was a couple of doors down on the corner. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Artemide Hotel and we would certainly use this hotel again if visiting Rome. We stayed at two hotels whilst visiting Rome, the other hotel was The Diana. We stayed at the hotel Diana after disembarking from our ship for 2 days.The Diana was Ok but the Artemides won our vote!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: Mollymooker
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I booked this hotel for our romantic few days away. We paid 165 EUROS per night including breakfast (sun-wed). For the price we payed we have stayed in much nicer hotels in London. The great thing about the hotel is the location & the breakfast! The 'Daily replenished mini bar' consisted of 2 bottles of water, 2 x cans of small beer 2 x cartons of apple juice. The room was clean but very small. As my partner proposed on the second day of our trip I was on cloud 9 anyway so didn''t care where I was staying! All in all a nice enough hotel but I wouldn't return especially not for 165 euros per night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in a great city”
Reviews.Author: AndarFL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Artemide for 5 nights and we can only recommend this beautiful hotel. The location worked great for us, being only about a 3 minute walk away from the subway (Piazza della Repubblica) and a mere 15 minutes' walk to the historic center. We loved the free minibar and the complimentary breakfast buffet. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times and most of them spoke very good English. Over all, we very much enjoyed our stay in Rome thanks to the Artemide Hotel and we would certainly recommend it to anybody looking for a comfortable and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, convenient and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joatsea
Reviews.Content: The only thing we are disappointed with is that we have not stayed in very much! The room we are in is very quiet and clean. The bed, linens and pillows are very comfortable. The bathroom is very nice and the robe and slippers are a nice touch. The free mini bar is great - it has water and beers, juice and space for you to put your own things in too. The staff are very nice, very helpful. Breakfast is fantastic, lots of choice. The location is perfect and a short walk to most things. We bought a pass for the hop on and off bus at the front desk and used it a lot. We only have 2 more nights - boo hoo!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and ambience. Staff are superb”
Reviews.Author: Larry20832
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon in Europe with Rome being the first stop. We stayed one night at the Hotel Artemide; we received a free upgrade to the honeymoon suite and a complimentary bottle of wine and snacks. The entire staff was gracious, they were even able to get us breakfast altho the adjacent restaurant had closed.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet61
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Artemide for 1 week in August. Cannot say enough about how amazing the staff was. They went out of their way to make our stay memorable. It was my mother's 68th birthday and they surprised her witha beautiful fruit basket on her birthday and prepared a lovely dish for breakfast. The room was large, by European standards and it was very clean. We mentioned at the front desk that we would love to see a soccer game and again, they went out of their way to find us tickets at the last minute. Whatever restaurant they recommended was just perfect. I will definitely return with my family and will recommend this hotel to everyone I know. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gida1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Artemide hotel and were very pleased with this hotel. We arrived in the morning after a long flight and were very happy to learn that our room was ready for us. They also upgraded us to a larger room which was wonderful. The staff was always helpful and the complimentary breakfast was great and served a large variety of hot and cold foods. I must say the complimentary mini bar was our favourite touch as each day it is replenished and you don't have to worry about purchasing any beverages during your stay at the hotel. The location was perfect, walking distance to all the main attractions and right around the corner from the train station. A great experience at this hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, well appointed and a good value”
Reviews.Author: saabco
Reviews.Content: Large room overlooking Via Nazionale. Near metro and train station, with easy access to all major sights. Very good value for Rome. Highly recommend Artemide Hotel for touring or business

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, large rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: glai79
Reviews.Content: The interior of this room was a bit dated and could be a little cleaner. Large bathroom and couch area make up for this. Amenities were great, free napkins and shoe polish for the day trips as well as bottles of water replenished every day. Internet downstairs was good (12 Eur) for the entire stay and the hotel staff were great at recommendations. Within 15 mins walk of Vittorio Emmanuel monument, 40 minutes walk of Campo de Fiori, 20 min walk from the Coloseum. Lots of shops in the neighbourhood, but not a lot of good food choices. Overall, for the price, the value was good but.... we had mosquitos in our room. Over 10 mosquitos that completely ruined our second night of sleep - did not complain to the front desk as we just wanted to get to bed and check out the next day but it could be a freak occurance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Alan037
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days in this hotel on my first visit to Rome. I used many hotels over the years in many locations but the Artemide was by far the best. Location in the city was excellent for all the sights as well as access to good public transport. As soon as I arrived at the hotel I was welcomed by friendly staff who clearly seemed to enjoy working there and helping guests. Registration was quick and painless and I was shown to my room and shown where everything was. The room was quite spacious,comfortable, spotlessly clean and well maintained. It was also very quiet, during my whole stay there I was never aware of any noise. The breakfasts were incredible with an amazing choice of food to satisfy every taste, together again with very helpful and friendly staff. I also used the restaurant for an evening meal and was pleased with the service and quality of the food. On approaching the staff of the hotel for questions or advice on travel and sights, nothing was ever too much trouble for them. They were invariably helpful and friendly and never had any difficulty with someone who had no Italian. I had a great time visiting the city but my stay in Rome was made all the more enjoyable by the welcome I received at Hotel Artemide, the standard of the accomodation and the quality of the staff there who really understood what customer service was all about. I will certainly be returning to Rome again as 3 days did not give me enough time to visit everything I wanted to see but for me there is only one hotel for me to stay and that is the Artemide. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie54
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is a wonderful 4 star hotel located in an accessible area of Rome. Walking distance to everything but far enough away that you're not overwhelmed by the crowds. Great local restaurants in near by side streets and a knowledgeable and friendly staff. If street noise is bothersome, ask for an inside room -- There isn't a view, but the quiet was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Best Hotel we have stayed in, loved it so much”
Reviews.Author: Barbaralouisa
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in the boiling heat, was greeted with very friendly reception staff, they were so helpful. Lovely room welcoming air-con, had welcome drink, lovely mini bar, room was amazing for hubby's special birthday. Everything was great in the room plus bathroom, very comfortable. Lovely breakfast too. Would definitely go there again, shame they don't have other Artimedes Hotels around the world, and in the UK. Well Done on being the best hotel we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: summatyme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for only one night before our cruise the following day. We loved it. Our room was very clean, the staff was great. They spoke a little English, which was to be expected - of course, we are in their country! Their rooftop bar was just the right size, nice and cozy. A good atmosphere. We enjoyed the location also. It was near a lot of food places and a good number of bars. I would for sure stay here again and reccomend this hotel to all of my friends. Thank you Hotel Artemide for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service, location and value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: richardpryor
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay while visiting Rome. First of all, the hotel is clean, the rooms relatively spacious and the value excellent, especially considering the free wireless internet, in-room mini-bar and daily breakfast. Second, the staff and service were outstanding. Everyone was friendly, helpful and spoke very good English. Finally, the location is wonderful, with ready access to numerous sights, transportation and restaurants. I would readily and enthusiastically recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but standard rooms small and roof terrace not open”
Reviews.Author: DenBetty60 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to the railway station. It was convenient for this and for the hop on hop off bus stop. Within walking distance of the Colosseum and other ancient sites. The standard rooms were small and we were very disappointed that the roof terrace was closed as this was one of the attractions that made us choose this hotel. The staff were Ok - the porters were the friendliest people and recommended places to go and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience At The Hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: jmwh7
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Artemide before our Mediterranean cruise. The stay exceeded our expectations in every way. The location was perfect for exploring Rome. We were able to walk to most of the major sites, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colleseum, etc. It is a 2 minute walk to the Republica Metro Station to reach the Vatican. There are trattorias filled with local residents located on the side streets of Via Nazionale where the food and wine were great and the prices were very reasonable. The hotel was very clean and the service was friendly and efficient. Our room was spacious by Roman standards tastefully decorated with a beautiful marble bathroom. The breakfast that was included in our roomrate was very good. The Capuccino that was served each morning was excellent. The rate also included a complimentary mini bar that was stocked each day with bottled water, beer, sodas and snacks. It was great to return to the room after siteseeing and enjoy a cold drink We are planning to return to Rome next year and will certainly stay at Hotel Artemide again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Rome and Hotel Aremide”
Reviews.Author: JameE59
Reviews.Content: We had a splendid time visiting Rome, in fact we spent very little time int he hotel however when we came 'home' the accomodations & personnel were outstanding. Looking forward to next visit.

Reviews.Title: “loaction location location with hospitalty”
Reviews.Author: casper1010
Reviews.Content: I reviewed Trip advisor before my stay and was certainly very pleased by my choice Hotel location first class, Service and Hospitality first class, Room more than adequate clean tidy, fresh clean sheets everyday on 4 night stay, complimentary mini bar re-stocked every day. Breakfast a real pleasure. I am difficult to please as I work in the hotel industry. A value stay in Rome is a Must for everyone awesome....I reccomend the Atremide you will not be dissapointed. Nb get Leanardo express from Airport but definetly pay for the Taxi-Limo from hotel on return. Guarenteed Prices. Bertizellos was about the best we could find for quality food just around the corner, the other restaurants visited were dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: cflemeta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 days in Rome at Hotel Artemide and had a great experience. The staff were friendly. The complimentary breakfast had lots of choices, the staff were very attentive and kept everything well stocked. A great way to get the day started. The room was very clean and space was not a problem as that can be a problem with European hotels. The bathroom was a great size, clean with all of the amenities. Having a complimentary mini-bar was also a great treat. One of the best things about the hotel is the location. You are within walking distance to most of the sites and near a metro station which we used quite a bit to get around when we didn't feel like walking. The staff arranged for a shuttle to take us to the airport so we didn't have to worry about that since we had an early departure. If there was one negative is that the bed was really firm to the point of it being uncomfortable. I normally don't mind a firm mattress but this was a bit much. This is the only thing that keeps me from rating this hotel "Excellent". Still, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will book here again on my next visit to Rome. BTW, if you are planning to visit the Vatican Museum in the morning hours do yourself a huge favor and buy the tickets online. The line to get in was huge when we got there but luckily we bypassed it and walked right in with our pre-paid vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Unexpected Treats”
Reviews.Author: EMBadger
Reviews.Content: A great, comfortable, well kept hotel only a few blocks from the train station. We walked there with our bags and it only took a few minutes. No need for an expensive shuttle or taxi service. The hotel is spotless and well kept. There were a lot of unexpected treats - snacks, free drinks, in-room wetbar (free and refilled daily), candies on the bed every day, water bottles to keep us hydrated walking the city, and a bottle of chianti! Breakfast is gratis, filling, and is more than just the usual 'continental'. After filling up on eggs, fruit, yogurt, and pastries we were satisfied for most of the day. The hotel itself was a 15 minute walk to just about everything except the vatican. Our only complaint was in the internet service. There's supposedly free wifi in the rooms, but we couldn't connect with either of our computers and the front desk was unwilling to let us have access to the business center without paying for it. All in all it was a great stay and we'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: ireneDerby
Reviews.Content: We stayed late September. Yes the hotel is very nice but nothing out of the ordinary. The reception staff are very courteous and helpful. The "free" mini-bar in the room was disappointing with 2 of still an fizzy water, fruit juices, small beers, 1 coke and 1 fanta orange. We chose this hotel as they stated that they had a roof garden, (we thought drinks up there, watching the world go by), only to be told it is only open June and July. The breakfast is very extensive, catering for all tastes, with bacon and eggs being particulary good. We paid 498 Euros for the two nights which we thought was very expensive. We have stayed in swankier hotels in New York, Paris and London for far less money.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WeeMinx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Artemide during a recent trip to Rome for my mother's 65th birthday. I chose the hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and can honestly say that I was not disappointed. This hotel really is as great as the reviews here would indicate. The service was absolutely outstanding. Even when we first arrived, the desk staff knew who we were, were expecting us, had already given us a room upgrade and really made us feel like important customers and not just another nameless booking. Nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff, who were extremely keen to help with any request. The room was very nice and comfortable. The linen was clean and of very nice quality. Our request for an additional pillow was answered within minutes. The minibar was free and was replenished daily and there were good tea and coffee making facilities. We were looking out into a courtyard, but the room was very quiet - amazing given the hotel's location. The bathroom was large and very clean and had a bath tub - very welcome to be able to soak after a day trudging around Rome. The breakfast was included and was very nice indeed. Again the staff were extremely helpful and made you feel like a valued customer. There was a good choice of cereals, cold cuts, cheeses, fruit juices, fruit, pastries and a hot selection. We did not eat in the restaurant, but did order once from room service. The food was absolutely the best we had in Rome (the stuffed loin of pork was amazing). The menu changes daily depending on the best available produce - definitely worth a try. There was a free internet terminal and also a lovely business centre, where you could surf and print for an all-in charge of 12 Euros for your stay. The location of the hotel was fabulous. A very easy walk to many of the sights and convenient for bus, metro and train to anywhere further afield. There was a taxi rank at the top of the road and the hotel were happy to call up a taxi on request. I would recommend this hotel absolutely and definitely plan to stay there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Holsrule
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during August when the temperature was hot hot hot! Thankfully the air conditioning in our (upgraded) room was a welcome relief after wandering rounds the sights and shops during the day. The hotel is ideally positioned - Colosseum 15 mins walk, Trevi fountain 10 mins, Spanish steps 10 mins and has some fantastic eateries very closeby (we loved GranCaffe Strega which is just around the corner and actually went there 3 times during our 9 day stay!). As the temperature was so high, we went to the beach for the day at Ostia (metro from Termini to Pyramide then train from there straight to Ostia in about 45 mins) along with lunch recommendations from Pasquale (our superb breakfast host!). The beach was very busy but clean and easy to find a spot - definitely take your swimming cozzies!! Lunch was terrific as were all recommendations given to us by the hotel staff. All in all, a fantastic trip - and a special thank you to Pasquale who made our stay even more memorable!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RSElliott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide during our recent trip to Rome. We stayed in a "no-frills" room, which translated to "very very small". While the room was small, we found the hotel to be very nice in almost every other aspect. The location was convenient (walking distance) to the train station and most of the major sites. The staff was courteous and helpful, and had some great restaurant recommendations. We enjoyed the lobby bar where we stopped for a nightcap on two of our nights in Rome. Overall, a very nice experience, but next time we would probably book a little larger room.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: goumetcruiser
Reviews.Content: This is a "gem" of a hotel is very well maintained and a short 10 to 15 minute walk to most major sites. The staff was incredibly helpful particularly Matteo and Giovanni. When we experienced trouble with the internet in the room they allowed us to use the Business Center free of charge. Even the bellboy was extremely attentive when we had some questions regarding the computers usage. Breakfast was delightful. They had a nice variety of breads, croissants, pastries and cakes. They also had cold cuts , cheeses, yogurts,juices, fresh fruit, cereals, milk, eggs , bacon and bottled water. If you feel exhausted as we did after a long day of touring there was a nice selection of complimentary beverages and snacks to welcome you back to your room. Our room rate even came with a complimentary glass of Prosecco which we enjoyed at the roof top bar before dinner one night. Request a room toward the back of the hotel if you wish to avoid any noise from the street traffic. We definitely would stay here if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Artemide”
Reviews.Author: StevefromBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as the first leg of our honeymoon. Emailed ahead to say we would be on our honeymoon and they upgraded our room and give is a free bottle of proseco along with a card welcoming us and congratulating us which was a nice touch. Hotel itself, location is without fault, breakfast was excellent, hot eggs, sausages bacon as well as the usual cold stuff. Rooms were nicely decorated, we were on the 4th floor so traffic noise was no problem, but the street outside is quite a busy one so dont know about noise in the lower down rooms. Staff were all very pleasant. We ordfered room service a few times too and the dinner food was really tasty too. Overall I had a positive experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting rome. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: frogcurry
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel with much to commend it, and very few downsides. Location is convenient for access to most of the main Roman and historical sites, and also reasonably near to the metro. The hotel staff were helpful and co-operative, with friendly greetings and offers of assistance whenever needed. The rooms are reasonably sized and have good facilities inside, including minibar and safe. A good degree of supplies is made available in the bathroom as well. A good range of hotel services are supplied, including free wi-fi and a pleasant bar on the roof. The only negatives are: - Some noise from other rooms is possible but it was not considerable. However if you are bothered by late night noise then I'd suggest to try to avoid being next to the lift-shaft as some noise also comes through from it. - Too many lights in the room at night from electronics etc, about 7-8 little LEDs glowing away...

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pati822
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the Hotel. The room was large, clean and attractive. There was a nice set up for coffee and cold drinks. Breakfast was included, which was delicious. The front desk staff were very helpful in suggesting restaurants, giving directions, and answering questions. They did seem to have a bit of trouble with the Internet, however they worked on the problem until it was resolved. The location is excellent. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chitown962
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was what I expected. The interior seemed nicely maintained and the room was in nice shape. I was disappointed because of no view at all from the window because of stairs to a neighbors patio were right in front of the window and the shutters seemed to be locked partly open. The location could have been better mainly because of the distance to a lot of restaurants. There are a few in the area but a location in the middle of the city would have been better, but it is close to the train station. The wireless internet was hit or miss on signal strength. The business was out of service a couple of days, but they didn’t charge us for it because of the issues I guess. The staff was always helpful and pleasant. The fee “mini bar” was nice to have and we did use it for water. The free breakfast that was included with our room was ok. The eggs were always under cooked as well as the bacon. But the service for coffee and such seemed to be very good. I would recommend this hotel if you are traveling a lot on the train since it is about a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Coming Back !”
Reviews.Author: THEOINARKANSAS
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing negative to say. The staff was incredible, and the hotel very beautiful. We loved the location, as it was walking distance to many sites, and was very close to the train. Again, the staff at the front desk was very professional, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DkMk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Artemide, it was clean, close to all the major attractions. Not far from the train station, walking distance to everything. Staff were friendly, the free minibar was a very nice gesture. An excellent airconditioner that cooled us down in the middle of summer was a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Excellent location, friendly staff, lovely rooms - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLucy
Reviews.Content: Some background: My husband and I came to the hotel for our honeymoon in Rome. We were married in Australia (in March) before moving back to Ireland so we didn't have a chance to have a honeymoon straight away. What better place than Rome! Due to our finances we'd booked into the hotel for 2 nights in a Double Room and 3 nights in the Honeymoon Suite. Imagine our delight when we arrived and Mario advised we'd been upgraded to the Honeymoon Suite for the full 5 nights as a gift from the Hotel. We were welcomed with Moet Chandon and strawberries. Our room had an attached conservatory and a large terrace to sit/eat outside. I know this is not a standard room but to anyone on their honeymoon - I'd really recommend this suite as it was lovely to relax on the couch in the conservatory after a hard day walking. The nitty-gritty: I found the room to be very clean, the staff very accommodating and the breakfast OK. The cappucino each morning was actually very good. We ate at the hotel twice and I found it quite nice (especially when you consider the price and it being so easy to get to:-)). The location is superb - 2 mins walk from Rupubblica station (so only 5 stops from the Vatican on the Metro) and walking distance from everywhere else. Also, the cleaning staff are very quiet and the air-conditioning good. Overall: I would definitely stay here again, even in just a normal room as the staff are so professional, the service good, the price reasonable and the location excellent. I can't think of anything negative to say - perhaps the bath could be a bit wider.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value in an Expensive Venue!”
Reviews.Author: Vagabondo525
Reviews.Content: We would normally have stayed in a 5-star on the Via Veneto without further investigation, but chose the Artemide based on its location and the reviews on this site. We weren't disappointed. The service and staff are wonderful -- very accommodating. The rooms are clean, spacious, utilitarian and serviced promptly. It may be hard to think of a $400+ room as a bargain, but those are the facts of visiting Rome. We took the breakfast buffet, a complete continental European-style layout with cold meats, cheeses, fruit, juices and pastries, with mediocre scrambled eggs and bacon as a concession to American and British guests. Their "American" coffee is EXCEPTIONAL! The hotel has its own rooftop restaurant, a very nice place for an early-evening drinkbut with unexceptional food -- if you're tired from your day, it's OK, but the neighborhood offers much better choices for less. Via Nazionale is a very central location and has lots of restaurants and major attractions within easy walking distance (1/2 mi. for restaurants, 1 to 1-1/2 mi. for attractions). The area isn't a high-end district and opportunities abound for you to see how middle-class Romans handle life in a sometimes-chaotic city. We had a junior suite facing the street -- be aware that the windows are not soundproofed as most American hotels are, and that the street is very busy at all hours of the day and night. There WILL be sirens. The wireless internet provided by the hotel was very, very slow. They are working on it and it should be improved soon, but if you have problems, you should consider the Vodafone Alice universal service or something else. The staff was very accommodating but seemed to be limited by their incoming high-speed "pipe." All in all, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not as expected!”
Reviews.Author: dizzymiss67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the middle of July for 3 nights. It was our first time to Rome so we wanted somewhere central. Central it is. Check in was quick and the staff very helpful and pleasant. The room was very small in comparison to other places we have stayed. When people say they couldn't swing a cat, the were describing the rooms here. Thankfully that's where the complaints stop, Aside from the small room, everthing else was as expected, the breakfast room was well stocked with a great selection, the hotel's roof top bar/restaurant was simply lovely, very romantic and the bar man makes great cocktails, Hotel was centrally located, within distance of all the sites with the exception of the vatican (get a taxi). Overall a good stay and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: discokitchen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and chose it based on the reviews here and because it had a free mini bar. Probably also, as we travelled with our two children we were able to book a room that comfortably slept 4 people. The room we had faced Via Nazionale and even with the window / door open to the balcony was very quiet. Everything about this hotel was great - service was excellent, rooms were a good size for Rome, location was good for most of the major sights - we walked to Fontana Di Trevi with our kids and back from the Colleseo also. The only things that could be improved is possibly the breakfast - I found it a bit uninspiring and the choice a bit lacking. Irish pub on the corner provides a good value option if you eat before 3pm for lunch. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent throughout”
Reviews.Author: ChasEssex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance from the station, so don't brother with a taxi. Most of the main attractions were easily reached on foot, only used the metro to go to the Vacation. Our room was clean and really appreciated the free mini bar after a long day sight seeing, also the air conditioning! The roof terrace was charming and provided a cool and pleasant end to the day.Staff were friendly and helpful.We would stay again on any future visit to Rome.Breakfast was very good, staff attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rufus1117
Reviews.Content: Artemide Hotel was an easy walk from the Metro station and was very clean. The room and bathroom were small, but nothing different from most Italian hotels. The people at the front desk were always kind and answered any questions we had. I would certainly stay there again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service!”
Reviews.Author: ellep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Artemide Hotel for four nights and would like to give our thanks to the hotel and especially Matteo from the hotel's front desk for saving our stay in Rome. Upon our arrival to FCO airport we found out that Alitalia had lost our luggage. As non-Italian speakers we relied heavily on the hotel front desk to coordinate with the airline to recover our luggage. They were very helpful, calling the airline multiple times for us before we finally got our luggage back. Our room was very spacious and clean. All the amenities were replenished daily. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and we received excellent service from the breakfast staff as well. The location of the hotel is OK. While it is within walking distance to many points of interest, we would opt for a taxi back to the hotel after a full day of walking around the city. We chose this hotel because of the past reviews on service and cleanliness and it exceeded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice But, a little overrated when it comes to service.”
Reviews.Author: SRBe
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy therefore, researched a lot of hotels, read all the tripadvisor reviews and chose to stay at Artemide. Although, the hotel is very nice and centrally located, the service left much to be desired. The room is nice and clean and the minibar is a great plus and so is the breakfast but, don't look for any concierge service. Why I was disappointed with the service, you ask... -Tried to get some restaurant recommendations from the front desk, the person was able to recommend 'one' restaurant in all of Rome close by which was closed. Asked for some club/lounge recommendations, was told to goto Campo di Fiori which was great but, didn't have any clubs or lounges. - Decided to get a bottle of shampagne from a local store, figured I'll be able to get a bucked of ice by calling the front desk. Unfortunately, they pointed me to the ice machine at the gym and asked me to get the bucket from the bar at the terrace. Just felt a little strange carrying the bucket of ice from the bar to my hotel room! Overall a good stay, will still recommend the hotel but, I guess when you go with high expectations, the tendency to get dissapointed is somewhat high as well. Also, it all depends on your individual experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sion3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artemide in February for five days. It was a fantastic hotel and definetly four star. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good points: -Amazing continetal and cooked breakfast with yummy pastries. -As we travelled through the night we wanted to sleep in the day and it was very quiet to do this and the curtains blacked out any light. -Location was good and not far from all attractions and tube station although we walked everywhere. -Stocked mini bar every day which was free. Bad points: -We didnt have a good view from our room but this didnt bother us. -The maid did forget to leave us toilet roll one day but we rang reception who brought some right away. -Price of drinks in the hotel was expensive but expected. 10 euros for a vodka and orange juice. Would definetly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice of hotel. Easy walking distance to most of the main sights”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghWillow
Reviews.Content: I planned the trip to Rome as a surprise for my husband's 50th birthday and the hotel lived up to my expectations having read the reviews. We arrived early thinking we would not be able to check in but our room had already been prepared and we were quickly taken to it . The room itself was spotlessly clean and comfortable. It wasn't huge but big enough with ample clothes space. Our room was at the back of the hotel so was very quiet. The hotel's location was perfect for us. Well within walking distance of the major sites and with the metro just up the road we were able to get to where we wanted very quickly. The hotel reception staff were very helpful - no hestiation in making a reservation at Galleria Borghese for us when we enquired about it. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. We loved the roof terrace - great to relax and have a refreshing drink after a long day of sightseeing and watch the sunset over St Peters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - except for air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: tmoore48
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at this hotel was positively wonderful, from the convenient location near the Metro to the well-appointed bathroom. My ONLY gripe is that it was August, it was hot, and although we cranked the a/c down to 19 C, it never made it below 24 C, and actually started rising when we returned to the room. If we go again in January, I'd definitely stay here again, otherwise I'm scouting for somewhere with a better air conditioner!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel saved my holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly1981
Reviews.Content: My first review!! And wow.. what a start. I took my mum to Rome as I wanted to show her how much I loved her. We had a very rocky start.... My mum hasn't been abroad much and when we arrived at the airport and travelled to the Termini - we were shocked to see so much graffitti!! ... It was so busy and hot. We got the hotel late - we got lost and oh my.. The hotel couldn't do enough for us. We were tired and stressed.. We got the free mini bar... complimentary free drink on the terrace bar. The staff were so so friendly. We asked for help with the kettle to THE CLEANER (first person we saw one morning) Within minutes she solved our problem and it wasn't really her job to do so!!! The breakfast area is the cleanest I have ever known... All staff made effort to speak as much English. They helped us with travelling about (as we continued to keep gettting lost!) And if there is one thing I would truely recommend is the taxi to the airport. It's pricier at 45 euros, but it arrived 30 minutes earlier and was air conditioned merc!!!! I swear it was most comfortable ride. The hotel made our bed on first evening - leaving sweets and saying goodnight. It was the little touches that made the holiday. My mum is the kind of lady that KNOWS good service and she was blown away with the hotel. If I come back to Rome, I wouldn't consider another hotel. They make you feel welcome - even e mailing us to say they hoped we had a safe journey home. This hotel is by no means the cheapest.. But is very much worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: e2637
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great end to my nearly month long trip to Europe. Staff was very helpful and friendly, the room was large and clean, and the hotel was located in a great section of Rome that provided easy access to tourist sites. Can’t go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Noisy Maid in A.M.”
Reviews.Author: travelchicusa
Reviews.Content: Overall I loved the hotel and its location; although I was not thrilled about being awakened by the maid daily around 6:30 am. I finally had to open the door and say something to her because she was so unbelievably loud and inconsiderate. Aside from that, we enjoyed our stay. Be sure to request a room far from housekeeping's storage area!!! Housekeeping excluded, all staff was very helpful, especially with recommendations for tours, restaurants, etc. A lot to see in Rome so give yourself at least 5 days, 4 minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, helpful staff, great service and food”
Reviews.Author: n2brains
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my expectations. The only problem was poor air conditioning in Aug., so it was hot. But the breakfast was great, the free mini-bar was always restocked, the rooms were clean and modern with a lovely bathroom and the location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, location, and service.”
Reviews.Author: ellie64
Reviews.Content: Just recovered from a week in Rome and spent the whole time at Artemide. We had room 404, balcony room overlooking the main road Via Nazionale. When we pulled up I knew itwasn't going to look as advertised on the hotel website, because of feedback in another review, but inside it was lovely. Ever member of staff was pleasant and Reception staf Alessandro and Paulo could not have been more helpful, between booking taxis, recommending restaurants, giving directions etc. We had a late flight on our return journey, but hotel was able to keep our belongings so we could spend the last day touring. Although the room wasn't overly big, it was big enough for the two of us, and depite being on the main road, we couldnt hear a thing the soundproofing was so good. Food was good, but make sure if you want breakfast to get down before ten.
