Although serving times go to half ten, most bacon and eggs is gone by this stage and you haven't a hope of getting anymore, so we were disappointed in this, especially as we had paid for b and b basis. only way round this was to order room service, but we were charged for this. that said, breakfast was good and the room was cleaned out every single day. the holiday was for our silver anniversary, and the hotel had kindly left a card and bottle of chianti in the room for us as a gift, which was a nice touch. unfortunately, one of the maids threw the card out during cleaning, but when i pointed this out to the hotel on my evaluation sheet, by the time we came back to pick up our cases on the last day, they had made out a replacement card - i was really appreciative of this and the trouble they took to do it twice. overall, i would have no hesitations in recommending the hotel. only three doors away from an irish pub that stayed open till half one, we were able to wind up most evenings with a relaxing drink without worry of cathcing taxi, bus or metro. very central to all major attractions, it may be a little pricey, but if you are looking for an honest opinion, artemide would be very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pizzinini
Reviews.Content: We staid at this hotel for four nights and were fully satisfied. Our room was fabulous and the minibar in this hotel is for free (!!!) and refilled every day. The location is great... in walking distance to most of the sights but not too close so you are not surounded by lots of tourists once you walk out. There is a great small restaurand just around the corner. Room service was fabulous and our room was really clean every day. When coming back to rome, we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from room 114!”
Reviews.Author: cindylane123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hotel Artimide. There were 11 of us staying at this hotel. Everyone had really nice rooms except for my husband and I. In fact, the room we were put in may have been an overflow room...Our friends had jacuzzi tubs, robes, rather large rooms and bathrooms, all new and clean. Our room looked like it should have been for munchkins! It was so bad, that our friends doubled over laughing when they saw it! The shower was so tiny and old...it didn't drain and the lip was only 2 inches high, so we had to hurry with our shower before it started to overflow into the bathroom. Two lights were burned out in the bathroom, so we took showers basically in the dark...couldn't see which was shampoo and which was conditioner! We had twin beds, though our friends all had king beds. Our room wasn't really dirty, although the floor in the bathroom must not have been swept, as there was lots of hair in the corners. All of our friends were put in a different part of the hotel, they even had a nice marble elevator...we had a different elevator...and our hallway was old and narrow, theirs was much more upscale. Two of our friends had french doors in their rooms, that opend out to balconies they could walk out on...we had a small window that had shutters closed on the outside, and could not be opened. We tried to be good sports about it...the room you get can be a crap shoot sometimes...but we paid the same rate as our friends, and it was as if we were staing in a different hotel. Actually, their rooms were great, and I would recommend the hotel, as long as you don't get room 114! Breakfast was great...and our room did provide a great laugh for all of our friends...I just want people to know if they stay here DO NOT accept room 114! :)

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel - with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: thisisthedesk
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The hotel itself was beautiful. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The breakfast was delicious. The bathroom was HUGE. Wi-Fi in your room was free. Mini-bar is free. Minuses: The room is pretty small (enough space only for the bed and a small desk). The air conditioning didn't work well. It was fairly uncomfortable for us most nights. The bed is very firm (which is great if you like that, but I don't). It was a fairly long walk to most places that we went. Free Wi-Fi was highly undependable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a hotel to enjoy your holiday.”
Reviews.Author: CorkCove
Reviews.Content: All staff at the Artemide Hotel were pleasent and easy to deal with. The food was excellent and we enjoyed a lovely meal in the roof top restaurant. Our room was cleaned daily and the free mini bar was most welcome after a long day touring the beautiful city. The buffet breakfeast provides choises for everyone and sets you up nicely for the long day ahead. We spent 5 great nights at this hotel and also had our 14 year old daughter with us who also enjoyed her stay. Reception staff catered for all our requests and organised our airport and hotel pick up. I Believe that if your accomadation is not right your holiday is ruined from day one. This hotel is ideal for touring all the major attractions in the city and is right beside the metro which is a huge asset. There are some lovely restaurants in the area and the hotel menu is hard to beat. If i was forced to find a issue with our stay I would point to the air conditioning which was a little noisy but this is grasping at straws.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: AugustKildare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good city centre location with only a ten minute walk to the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and the Colosseum. Cannot fault this hotel. The room was spotless. Excellent buffet breakfast included. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel provides a taxi service from the hotel to the airport (35 minutes approx.) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishchap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon. The hotel is located a few minutes walk from the main station. The staff at reception we extremely welcoming, when we told them our names checking in they congratulated us on our marriage. Then they told us they had upgraded us to a suite. When we arrived in we had a beautiful bottle of red wine left out for us with tasty snacks etc! The room was spacious, looking over the main street outside, the noise of the street didn't really bother us because you expect some level of noise staying in the centre of the city. The mini bar is also complimentary which is great considering how much money sometimes you have to pay for a bottle of water in Rome. We also got two free drinks from the hotel on their roof top bar which is great with some nice views. Breakfast is a buffet, plenty of choice and very friendly staff. When we were checking out we had an evening flight the reception staff were very helpful in organising our trasport for us.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to spend a romantic night, great service.”
Reviews.Author: bobzaguri
Reviews.Content: Will recommend this hotel to all my friends travelling to Rome. The only suggestion I have is to please improve the outside of the hotel, from the footpath it does not look like the great hotel that it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with very friendly service at walking distance of all attractions”
Reviews.Author: BROCOAntwerp
Reviews.Content: We certainly enjoyed the hotel. For being in Rome family room was spacious and clean. Free mini bar is sympathetic and contains some soft drinks and beer (just to quench your instant thirst). Very nice staff at all levels. Good breakfast provided. Location at a main road, but in our room not too much problems with that. At walking distance of many attractions and at night it only takes 10 minutes (by foot) to get to the good restaurants and nice outdoor dining/drinking. Rooms are not the cheapest, but counting on a family of 4, you do not get same quality with 2 individual rooms at same total price.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Nice Rooms, and a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mlalli01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the last leg of our honeymoon and were really taken care of. Check-in was a breeze with English-speaking reception. Our room was rather large (very large when compared to most European hotels). The rooms have free wifi, just call the front desk for your access code. The rooms are air conditioned, with their own thermostats. We were greeted with Champagne and strawberries, a very personal touch. The hotel is moderately priced and a great value considering its nice location in Rome. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and about a 15 minute walk to the Colessium/Roman Forum Area. Our first night in Rome we walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo d'Fiori, ate dinner, then walked to the Colessium and back to the hotel. It was not a struggle at all, even in the middle of summer. Though not situated in the "heart of historic Rome," its location provides easy access to the different parts of the city and is on a nice, clean, safe street. The Hotel sits on Via Nazionale, which is a large street with its fair share of shopping. A taxi ride from Termini station will cost only about $8 euro. A mere 5 minute walk North on Nazionale from the Hotel brings you to Piazza del'Repubblica and its Metro station, which is on the same line as the Spanish Steps and Vatican City. The Hotel has a bar and a roof terrace, but we did not visit them so I cannot comment on them. We were always greeted with a smile and the staff was more than helpful. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Artemide again and absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel with friendly staff whose service exceeds your expectations”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonhame
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot in Rome to reach all the sites of interest. It has many good restaurants and bars within walking distance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Organising taxis to and from the airports. The rooms are very comfortable withall the usual facilities with the added bonus of a complementary drinks from the terrace bar and the fridgein the bedroom. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to any friends or family who might be travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, clean, concerned and cosmopolitan!”
Reviews.Author: inawe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week in Italy that included several nights' stay at the Hotel Artemide. First impressions, extremely clean, all glittering marble and glass. Next, no matter that hour (and there were some late ones and very early ones!) the concierge on duty was always extremely helpful, gracious and (at times) creative. Our rooms were climate controlled by us so even though Rome was enduring a heat wave, we were cool and comfortable. Outstanding bathrooms facilities that you would appreciate if you also had traveled to Florence and Assisi that same vacation. Just a wonderful, spacious feeling that proved a peaceful, rejuvenating haven after constant touring during the day. Finally, don't miss that opportunity to visit the roof top bar. At night, Rome cools off and a beautiful breeze comes in. A prosecco or ice-cold Peroni enjoyed high above the frantic Roman pace is a fitting end to each day spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chaz044
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week at the Artemide Hotel with my wife and son. Warm welcome and as we got there before 2pm our room was not quite ready, but coffees on the house during a short wait was a nice touch. Breakfasts good, we ate out in the evenings. Clean rooms, ours was at the back of the hotel so was very quite. The air conditioning was a little bit noisy but acceptable. Friendly staff who showed an interest when asked questions and they were very helpful. You can get to most places by foot although we took the metro to the Vatican. Even a week is a bit too short to do everything. We also went to Ostia Antica, metro to Pyramide, then train to Ostia. Really nice day there. Visit the Nazionale Romano Museum near the hotel, Museo Altemps near the Piazza Navona and the Capitoline Museums near the Forum to get a real feel for the greatness of ancient rome. These museums and the Vatican Museums go well with the visits to the ancient sites themselves. It was very hot in Rome during our stay so getting back for a rest in the late afternoon was great. What I like about this hotel is that you are left to yourself as much as you like but staff are attentive when you need it. We would definitely stay here again when again in the Eternal City. Due to it being near the Termini (but not uncomfortably close) you can easily take the Leonardo Express dedicated train to the Airport, 11 euro each and takes 25 mins.Tickest from newsagent in station as well as other places. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Eccellente”
Reviews.Author: RGCalder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 5 nights in July 2009, there were 7 of us in total, two twin rooms and a triple. The triple room was spacious (which is good), comfy beds, air conditioning (essential as it was so hot in July the pavements were melting), good shower, extras such as slippers, toiletries and a chilled peroni in the complimentary minibar each day were a nice touch. The staff were all lovely, the breakfast was delicious and I am still missing starting my day with a cappucino! Everything was spotless. The roof top bar was a lovely spot to end a day with a nice bellini. Rome, obviously, was fabulous and this hotel was in a perfect spot for exploring all sites on foot. Overall I'd thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The staff were amazing”
Reviews.Author: KimLangley_BC_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed post cruise and we couldn't have been happier. I had read alot of reviews before booking this hotel and I'm so glad we did. It was central to everything and we walked to all of the attractions including the Vatican. The hotel room was very clean and the size was not bad considering we were in Europe. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who want to stay central to everything. The stock min-bar (daily) was a really nice feature. Last but not least, the staff were most helpful and made our vacation a memorable one. Alessandro and Mario in particular went that extra mile for us and I would like to thank them for that. Even when we had a tour booked and we had to leave before the breakfast was served, they had boxed breakfasts done up for us, among dinner recommendations etc. Thanks again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel I have stayed at on the continent!”
Reviews.Author: Crofton_Couple
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide proved to be all that I could have hoped for on a recent vacation to Rome with my wife and daughter. We occupied two adjacent rooms on the sixth floor, one of which had quite a nice patio. The rooms faced the courtyard, so there wasn't any view; however, the patio proved to be a wonderful place to relax after a long day walking all over the city. Additionally, facing the courtyard, rather than the street, it was extremely quiet. By and large, hotel rooms in Europe tend to be considerably smaller than most travelers from the states are accustomed to. This was not the case at the Hotel Artemide. The room size was comfortable, especially when one considers that most of the room usage is for sleeping. It may have been nice to have a bit more storage space for unpacking; but, this was not a problem, unlike some much smaller hotels we have stayed at - especially in London. The rooms were kept sparkling clean throughout our stay. The bath was a shade less than sumptous; still, the equivalent of most high end hotels. Great terry robes, slippers and high quality bath products. Plus, unlike another review I saw here, we had wonderful water pressure and absolutely no lack of hot water at any time during the day or night. The stocked refrigerator (included in the room rate) was a real plus! A couple of beers, waters, juices, crackers and other nibblies. Also, a fine selection of coffees and teas to start your morning. We had breakfast included in our room rate and although on most of our vacations we opt for a quick bite on the run at a local street shop or vendor, we actually ate at the hotel most mornings. The breakfast was nothing short of magnificant! Fantastic coffee and a wide variety of pastries, meats, cheeses, juices, fruit and on and on. What a wonderful way to start the day! The Hotel Artemide is absolutely perfectly located for those looking to tour by foot all the magnificant sights of central Rome. Even better is the proximity to many trattorias for lunch and dinner. We did take the subway to the Vatican one day - the entrance to the subway was only a couple of blocks up the street - very convenient! Another day, we took the train to Pompeii and easily walked to the train station in about ten minutes. Last and certainly not least - the hotel staff... Each and every staff person we came in contact with was smiling, gracious and appeared to really want to assist us in making our vacation as escellent as it could be. The front desk staff arranged for us to be picked up at the airport upon arrival and taken to the airport the day we left. Both times, we were met by the same very nice driver in an immaculate Mercedes sedan who delivered us to our destination rapidly, yet without giving us a concern about safety. Unfortunately, tripadvisor only allows up to five stars; otherwise, I'd give the Hotal Artemide many more in all categories. Thanks to all at Hotel Artemide who did so much to help make our Rome vacation memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clare101
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Rome where I stayed at the Hotel Artemide with my partner. We both had a wonderful time at the hotel and I would like to thank the extremely efficient, friendly and helpful staff who made our stay very enjoyable. The rooms were beautiful and the food was delicious. Also the hotel is in a superb location as it is near the main train and bus station and the city centre tourist attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah492
Reviews.Content: This was truly the perfect location -- walking distance from Termini and to most all of the sites in Rome. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The hotel was immaculate - from our rooms, to the lobby. The rooftop bar was a wonderful place to relax after dinner -- quiet and great views. The hotel breakfast was very nice -- delicious fruits and pastries, plus eggs and other heavier fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Petermountain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artimide after a cruise for three nights in late June, 2009. The hotel is in a great location about two blocks West of Plaza Repubblica on a main street. We requested a quiet room on a high floor and got a room facing the inner courtyard on the 6th floor. Since there is basically a view of the building across the street from the front of the hotel and there is street noise, you are better off with a courtyard view quiet room in the back of the hotel. Our room was very quiet however it was a bit on the small side. There was a little room on each side of a King bed. But the room was newly renovated, modern, plenty of storage and has a safe, and a free mini-bar. I was surprised to see that it had beer, soda, still and mineral water, and juice and snacks which was restocked each evening, all at no extra charge. The bath was full sized, with marble counters but the water pressure was non-existent. Overall, very clean and well kept. We paid an average of about 140 Euros without breakfast which was a good deal for the quality of the hotel and the great location. We booked it directly from the hotel website. There's a cafe next door where we got Capachino and pastries for breakfast for about 5 Euros each. So save the 20 Euros for the hotel breakfast and go there with the locals. It took us 15 minutes to walk to the Coliseum and about the same to Trevi Fountain. There's a bus stop a block away and about 10 buses go down Via Nazionale towards Termini station. So we got the 3 day Roma Pass for 21 Euros and we took buses everywhere. The Metro station is two blocks away at Repubblica as well. We took that to the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. The hotel also has a great deal on wireless Internet. It was 12 Euros for the entire stay (regardless of how many days). There's also a business center with about 6 desktops for the same rate. So we were able to research places to eat and dine on the go. There's a nice rooftop restaurant and bar. You get a good view of St. Peter's and the menu looked nice but we only had drinks. The biggest negative was the elevator. It was about the size of a coffin. It held 4 people. We ended up walking down the stairs and only using the elevator on the way up. There were no problems, it's just very tiny and claustrophobic. So the perfect room would be on the 2nd floor in the back facing the courtyard. It would be quiet and you could avoid the elevator. The front desk was very helpful and made several reservations for us and got us a taxi for the ride to the airport. Overall an excellent experience and a great value for the money and a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Artemide!!”
Reviews.Author: NicNac0206
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome on a girls trip for 2 weeks. The Artemide is a great hotel. Friendly staff, great location and excellent service. Our room was smaller then I figured it would be but other then that nothing to complain about. There was a free breakfast every morning and the staff is extremely helpful. There is also a business center and for 12 Euros you can have unlimited internet access for the entire length of your stay. Make sure you visit the roof top terrace during your stay! Our room was always neat and clean. I would stay there again if I am in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Chipcounter
Reviews.Content: Room was nicest found for the price in Italy. Even included a basic minibar, free! Summer season had the rooftop bar open and was given a free prosecco as an enticement. The staff was extremely helpful. I lost my wallet in a taxi and I called the hotel. They found the driver and everything was returned intact with no fuss. Extremely lucky. All employees seemed to like working there and helping guests. Definitely would stay here again. Location was terrific. Easy walk to train station, colosseum, forum. Vatican is walkable or the subway is 2 blocks away for €1. Restaurant and shopping options on or just off of Nazionale. Elevators a bit slow. Loved staying here and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Artimide”
Reviews.Author: David_ChEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wife and I to escape to Rome to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The flowers and wine that I had requested were there courtesy of Alessandro on the front desk and the room we had looking onto Via Nazionale was big, very comfortable and air-conditioned. The buffet breakfast is ideal to get a day's sight-seeing off to a good start and the free mini-bar in the room was ideal apon returning to the hotel in the late afternoon. We used the roof top terrace bar a few times before heading out for dinner in the evening and again for a night cap before retiring for the night. We found all the staff very helpful and courteous and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any-one visiting Rome on either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shady25
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel from the reviews on tripadvisor & I have to say it was a great recommendation!! It was the perfect hotel, great value, great location (a lot of the best rated restaurants on here are very close!! which is handy), very easy to get around. The room was a good size - especially after being in a shoebox visiting Paris!! It was very comfortable hotel & we were made to feel very welcome. Upon check in we were given vouchers for 2 welcome drinks & this was basically the start of a great holiday! The mini bar was very handy especially after walking around in the sun all day!! and the air conditioning worked very well. Generally no complaints & this is definitely a hotel I'd go back to or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “deceitful hotel website and various service outages sums this one up”
Reviews.Author: GaamsPooNam
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at this hotel, but expectations were not to be met. As the taxi stopped outside the hotel front doors, we thought he had the wrong place. As it turns out, 'Hotel Artemide' fraudulently depicts their hotel (online) using pictures of another hotel in the area, the Boscolo five star luxury hotel. Room was nice and clean although small and with very poor pillows (it was as if sleeping without a pillow altogether). The Internet worked only during some days and when it worked, bandwidth was severely limited and most non local web pages would not load at all. Movies (paid) on the TV set would also not work at times, although the hotel still allowed you to subscribe to movie packages during the outage, forcing us to request a credit at the front desk. Lastly, upon checking out, the hotel had our bill wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers099
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was excellent and the breakfast each morning was fantastic. Our room was on the fouth floor with two big french doors leading onto a balcony that overlooked Via Nazionale. We had an awesome experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: marcellaable
Reviews.Content: You know when you book a hotel online...you are taking a gamble to what you will end up with. I read the review & they were right on. We arrived at the hotel early, so they gave us upgraded rooms & let us check in early. The rooms were beautiful. Ours faced the street & my sister's faced the courtyard. We only stayed for one night, but I would stay here again, The breakfast buffet was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough! We had a wonderful one-night stay. The room was exceptionally clean and well appointed. The staff from the front desk to the bell men to the breakfast attendants were courteous, well mannered and extremely helpful. We had a family room on the fourth floor facing the street and a huge balcony. It was fun to open all the doors and walk out and just look around. Excellent bath products. The mini bar was nice. There was a beer, Coke, Fanta, and a bottle of water, along with two juice box drinks. Will definitely stay there again whenever we are in Rome. It was close to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the icing on the cake for our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stokie37
Reviews.Content: The Artemide Hotel really was excellent! Location was good, with all main attractions within walking distance. If you wanted to travel further there was a taxi rank just at the bottom of the street. Breakfast was good, staff were most helpful and courteous at all times and cleanliness was clearly of high importance.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolSmigger
Reviews.Content: We got a free upgrade to a superior room. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was lovely with lots of choice. You can walk to most of the sights in Rome from this hotel. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stopout
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after selecting from the hundreds on offer with the help of Tripadvisor and other sources as a compromise balancing cost, location and quality. We were happy with the level of service provided considering the high price of accommodation in Rome compared to some other areas of Europe. The room was just big enough, very clean (although I don't really like the artificially aged mirror glass which is popular here), staff were friendly and helpful and there was a reasonable choice at breakfast, even if I can't really come round to the Italian fondness for cake at such an early hour. The free regularly replenished minibar was a nice touch. The hotel is well located on the Via Nazionale a short distance from the railway station. We had feared that we might be too far from the nightlife and tourist areas but found the public transport easy to use with buses running regularly all night past the front door. I would recommend a tourist transport ticket for several days which is also valid on the (rather limited) tube train. There are reasonable restaurants in the vicinity and if you enjoy light opera regular concerts are performed in period costumes at St Paul's Within the Walls church next door.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodation with the most refined service”
Reviews.Author: MackaOslo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated in a walking distance to the centre of Rome. But what is more important was the friendliness of the staff at the reception desk and at the breakfast, excelent room service (the room was done 2-3 times per day, thank you Patrizia) and the newspaper service (free delivery every morning), too mention some of the services on the top of the list. I will definetely return to Artemide hotel in Roma again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Fauchonlover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap but I guess Rome is very much in demand. The location is good near Termini, the room was nice though older than the pictures would suggest. Free minibar had 1 coke, 1 Fanta, 2 normal waters, 2 gas waters, some little snacks--not bad at all. Breakfast was quite a spread, the pastries fresh and tasty. Free 15 mins internet--there is a place around the corner. It's quite a walk to St. Peter but we are always so energetic in Rome we did not notice. All in all compared to last years nightmare hotel, quite good I would have to say. They kept taking the long metal stoppers out of all the drains, bidet, sink and bathtub--irritating and a little gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tmynatt
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in the historic district close to Campo dei Fiori or Piazza Navona, but since we only had 1 night we chose to stay nearer the train station since that was our arrival and departure point. Booked this hotel via EasyClickTravel for a good rate including breakfast and had no trouble whatsoever upon checkin. Of course our low rate meant that our interiorir room view was the airconditioning ducts and windows of other rooms. But you don't typically spend a whole lot of time in your room when in Rome. The room was quite large, mostly clean and nicely cool. I say mostly clean because there was a big patch of mildew in the shower. The hotel's bellmen were ALWAYS waiting to grab our luggage or hold the door...they were very friendly and helpful. The location was also good and easily walkable to all of the sites. The included breakfast was large and satisfying although the roof terrace was not open which was a little disappointing. The free minibar was OK, but other than a couple of soft drinks and water bottles and a beer - nothing to write home about. There was no real snack food like chocolate bars or anything...only some saltine crackers and 1 bag of peanuts. It's a nice gesture, but all of these items are dirt cheap at the local supermarket so don't let it influence your decision greatly. Internet was not free although wifi is available. They do offer a shuttle service to the airport which was about the same price as the Leonardo Express, but being picked up in front of the hotel was much more convenient than the Leonardo Exp. I would recommend this hotel for newcomers to Rome, but if you know your way around then stay closer to the Campo dei Fiori or Piazza Navonna.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Georgianic
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, after a questionable ride from Fiumicino Airport (we had previously booked airport-to-hotel transfer; I highly recommend taxi from the airport, or the train for those gifted with exceptional navigation skills), we were delighted when we arrived at the Artemide; the staff were exceptional, giving us a warm greeting and offering immediate assistance. We took the elevator (neatly tucked away down the corridor from the lobby) to the fifth floor, were shown to our room, and received amusement by the quietness (remember, this hotel is in the center of Rome). The mini-bar was completely free, and they replenished it daily. And the location; this hotel is centered around all the sites in Rome and within walking distance to most. I highly recommend the Artemide, and I will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawcoley
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a beautiful location. Our two nights at the Artemide were everything and more than we expected. We were picked up from the airport by a driver ( for an additional cost of € 60) which was well worth the cost. The welcome was wonderful: when we arrived we were given a complimentary drink and the receptionist gave us all the information on local attractions - he was as good as a guide. The room was spacious and luxurious and bathroom was also freshly renovated in marble floor and so clean. The breakfast was very generous, you may find equally good but I doubt you'll find better. Absolutely wonderful hotel, everything was perfect - we highly recommend this for anyone's stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveUK46
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Artemide. The hotel had an excellent location, very close to the Metro station and at walking distance from Colosseum and Spanish Steps. The room was good and the bathroom was lovely, the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was great. The service was absolutely amazing! We have never met such helpful and delightful staff. You really felt like you were part of a family! The perfect place to stay in Rome. We really cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great City”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsTh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city. Hotel location was great for the sites. The room was large, clean and with fabulous facilities (free minibar!). It was also very quiet, which was suprising given the location. Staff were very helpful and friendly, especially when we needed a taxi back to the airport. Couldn't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to sights in centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Faye24
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary. Having previously stayed in other hotels in Rome (mainly on the Via Veneto) I was a little apprehensive as to what this hotel would be like. I did not need to worry. Although small and a 10 minute walk from the main attractions in Rome, the hotel was incredibly nice with very helpful, friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had in Rome and the free minibar (water/soft drink/beer and nibbles) made a refreshing change. The free mini bar is good for water when on average a bottle of water in Rome costs 2Euro50. The staff were excellent in recommending restaurants for us and making advance bookings, and every request we made of them was dealt with quickly and efficiently. Our room ( a superior) was lovely. Other people have commented on the bed being hard, and although it as this is quite standard in all hotels we have been to in Italy. Overall this is a very good quality hotel that is a lot cheaper than some of its rivals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillCos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time. The hotel is a 40 min train ride from the airport and in the center of Rome . The staff was outstanding. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Artemide is a superior hotel with exceptional service at a reasonable price in a great Rome location”
Reviews.Author: the_woods01
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the roof top was not open during our stay. We would have liked to have the roof top open to enjoy your great breakfast outside. Also, it would have been great if the roof top was open as a bar to enjoy drinks in the late afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and in a good spot for public transport”
Reviews.Author: bloomsbury3
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call it a cheap stay but looking at hotel rates in Rome, it is probably standard. We had three nights here and would certainly recommed it to others. For a centrally located hotel, it was really spacious. It had a large bathroom, as well as plenty of space in the room itself. The deal included a free mini bar ( don't get too excited!) which meant plenty of soft drinks and even a couple of beers. Breakfast was excellent. There was a real choice and the service was good. In fact, the level of service in the hotel was execellent in every way. I reported a blown light bulb and it was replaced straight away. The hotel is in an excellent location for both buses and the Metro and it's an easy walk from Termini. It was lovely to return to the hotel after a day sight-seeing and enjoy the air conditioning and lots of hot water! If the hotel wanted to imrove, I'd suggest a more effective shower screen. Try as I might, the water managed to evade the shower curtain and end up on the floor. I'd also recommnend taking your own hairdryer, as the one in the bathroom was hopeless! These ar small quibbles, however. Rome was fantastic and we enjoyed our stay at the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skazi-girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in “Artemide” for 3 days in December, 2008 in 405 (triplex superior). It’s a very comfortable room, with everything we needed for our family comfortable staying – big comfortable beds, mini-bar for free, Internet (for charge – 4 EU/day), big bathroom, high walls. Room service was good, every day our room was cleaned, linen and towels were changed. Breakfast can satisfy everybody – as children though old people. The products are of high quality and fresh. The location of the hotel – via Nazionale – is very convenient for tourists. Piazza Venezia, p. Republica, p. Spagna, Trevi, Colosseum – all this sights are close to the hotel. If u want to go to Vatican, you can use subway, bus 64 or taxi. There are also many shops near the hotel. The staff is very professional and friendly. Good knowledge of Rome, fast reaction to all our requests, good knowledge of English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dan945
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of the month. Never been to Rome before. We walked everywhere from here. Had heard bad reports about the street noise in Rome but even though this hotel is on a main road our room was as quiet as a church mouse. Nice buffet breakfast. Staff could not have been more helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vladrom
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Great location in the heart of Rome. All major sights are nearby in a walk distance. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: novg78
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 3 hotels in Rome, that was the best and the price was cheapest. Room 402 is OK, with balkony overlookng Via Nazionale. Free minibar. Free champagne or coffee coupon on arrival. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjwinter
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in May 2009. The hotel was very well located for all our Rome day-trips. Easy access by walking to most attractions and the subway was a few minutes away. The staff was great and our room was large and clean. The business centre offered high speed internet access and the charge was 12 euros for our whole stay. Breakfast was included in our room price and was good. The lounge and sitting area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff, great management.”
Reviews.Author: jbtqy
Reviews.Content: Location was superb. Few hundred yards away was open top tour bus stop, and red metro stn, few more hundred yds further the train and bus terminal and blue line metro. With the Via Cavour and the Via Nazionale bus stops, going out and return to hotel by buses was easy, to wherever wanted. Hotel itself was superb, staff everything you could ask for. Breakfast for city hotel was just right. Clean,bright and friendly. Later in season, roof terrace opens up. Several good restuarants close, Opera House just up the road. Go back any time to stay. .

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brownyCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Italy this year, first Florence, the Umbria (Città della pieve) and finally the CITY.. Rome! What a fabulous town, there is more history here than anywhere else in the world. The hotel is great, very efficient service and good location, but we where out most of the time, so we didn't appreciated fully the beauty of this hotel. Good breakfast too. Reccomended

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel in rome with freiends”
Reviews.Author: tracyleeLiverpool
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the artemide hotel for three nights with eight friends all of thought it was a lovely hotel .it is not a big hotel but it is very clean ,the rooms are very nice some have a sofa in them there is a mini bar which has water beer and some juice inside.,also akettle to make tea or coffee the only thing is there is no ironing facilities.the breakfast was great scrammbled egg bacon various meats and cakes . staff were very nice i would stay there again u get a voucher when u arrive for a coffee or wine to use between five and midnight. location was spot on ten minuites to colloseum ,ten to spanish steps thirty five to vatican .take good walking shoes !

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, stylish hotel with all the right touches”
Reviews.Author: cdcdml94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 5 day trip to Rome. We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Artemide. The staff were extremly accomodating and spoke pretty good English. We got a free room upgrade in celebration of our wedding anniversay which was a very nice surprise. The hotel was spotless. The free minibar was a huge perk and a lovely breakfast was served in the dining room downstairs every morning. The staff helped us with dinner reservations prior to our arrival via e-mails and held our bags for us until our room was ready so we could go out and start sightseeing. I read that some people found their room to be noisy. Our room was located in the back of the hotel so we did not experience this problem. The hotel is centrally located for the most part but a decent walk to Piazza Novana, Campo di' Fiori and Vatican City. There is plenty of public transportation but we didn't mind the walk. Overall we had quite a memorable stay at Hotel Artemide. If you are looking for a very nice hotel with friendly service and comforatble rooms then consider Hotel Artemide. We doubt you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: MakTX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic. Everything was great from the warm and courteous staff to the clean room. Breakfast is plentiful and filled us up for majority of the day. The room was perfect in size, amenities, etc. They were even kind enough to upgrade us. If we return to Rome, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Vacanza Romana, affordable luxury in a perfect place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner39
Reviews.Content: After 3 years, I returned to the Artemide hotel but this time with my teenage children. They wanted to see Rome and I knew that the Artemide has an excellent location to visit the main sights in Rome on foot. However, this time the hotel was a much better experience as everything seemed much smoother and better organized. The staff was very pleasant and the breakfast was fantastic, great selections & plenty. The room was quite, well kept, decent size and with a very nice bathroom and the boys enjoyed the delicious contents of the free mini-bar. The reasonably priced, high-speed, efficient Internet service was a good touch. We were very impressed with interior decoration of the public areas especially the lounge bar. The hotel has a fitness lounge that is included and found it satisfactory. The business centre - although I am not a businessman - looked very impressive and comfortable. There was the one thing that I have not seen before and I am well traveled, that is the electronic screen showing world newspapers with easy to use touch screen situated strategically near the breakfast room, so you can feel at home!!. All in all, we enjoyed our stay in the Artimide and we would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Par excellance allround”
Reviews.Author: Robmatt
Reviews.Content: Searched for ages to find a suitable hotel for ourselves, daughter & 10yr old granddaughter. Booked the Artemide, 4 nights. Minibus from/to airport to hotel makes for ease. Arrived. Welcomed politely. Had asked for adjoining rooms pleased to find that this had been arranged. Mini bar full. Breakfasts an absolute wow. Great selections & plenty. Had good meals in hotel restaurant plus cafe/bar attached is convenient. Free fitness centre used (amazing energy from 10yr olds after sightseeing all day !)Good location for walking everywhere for main sites. Good for shopping. Found some great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “No frills. Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Murasakiyoko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Artemide for 4 nights during the Easter week. We're both pretty well travelled in North America, Asia and Europe and usually stay in 4 to 5 star hotels. This time, we just wanted a no frills, reasonably priced, clean hotel and that's exactly what you get at Artemide. The Easter week in Rome is pricey but Artemide's rate was reasonable. Location is excellent. Staff were nice. Breakfast was okay. Free mini bar is a nice touch. As I said, if you're looking for "No frills", we recommend this hotely very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Our experience”
Reviews.Author: mmaraujo
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent hotel in a good place. The breakfast is excellent, the staff is very kind, the superieur room is really nice. Our room was really quiet. The only problem we had was with the air conditioning. It workes for a while and suddenly stops. We complained, the receptionist said they would figure it out, but nothing happened. We slept with opened window and mosquitos came. This was the single problem we had there. About location, it is in a good place (looks like safe/ large avenue), but you have to walk about 6 or 8 blocks to be in the nicest places. The free internet is: 15 minutes p/ day in their computer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: cwnek264
Reviews.Content: The Artemide is a great hotel with a wonderful staff. The room was very small, however. It barely fit a bed and the bathroom was worse. Very clean and was ok for people who spent very little time inthere but was very cramped with luggage. Also, neighborhood was sketchy when walking a few blocks to the east.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at Hotel Artemide, 5 nights wasn't long enough.”
Reviews.Author: DoloresNIreland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide is a great location to view the historic sites of Rome. The noise of the traffic initially caused concern and myself and my husband thought we would have difficulties sleeping but fortunately this was not the case. The hotel room was extremely comfortable and maintained to a high standard. With the exception of a visit to the Vatican, we visited the main historic sites on foot . The Vatican was easily accessed via the metro which is a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish boutique hotel with amenities and great english speaking service.”
Reviews.Author: dannyo53
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemide was our home for 9 days in Rome. It is located close to the Metro Termini and allows the serious walker access to all the major attractions (colleseum, pantheon,vatican,etc). As european rooms go spacious accomodations, with free mini-bar(nice)and in-room safe.. Great service, Gianpietro, one of the "blueshirted" staff responded to every request with gusto. I dubbed him Superman. The Via Nazionale affords easy access to ground transport and city tours. The business center allows unlimited internet access @12euro for the length of your stay with their PCs. We would return directly to Artemide for future Rome visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and a good location at an acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: Keromar
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are relatively small, they are of a good standard and well-maintained. The personnel is very firndly and helpful but do not trust their restaurant tips ;-) Well, we might just have been unlucky that evening. Do not expect a magnificent view of Rome from your window but get out of your room and you are close to everything! Good for couples young and old. Breakfast is good but the same every day. We liked the idea of the welcome drink.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: aviatortom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artemide staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Great location near the Termini Station and a metro station a short distance away. Room was large, clean, with complimentary minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cla3boys
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Hotel Artemide. I had received a good rate on the hotel's website and asked for a "quiet" room on the reservation form. When we arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Pino gave us a map and directions to the sights. They gave us a room on the fifth floor which faced a quiet courtyard. There was no view but it was worth it not to be facing the very busy road, Via Nazionale. Also, we took the elevator to the fourth floor and then there were stairs to the fifth. only one other room, we never heard any noise from other guests. The location of the hotel was fantastic. We had come from Florence by train and it was a very short walk to the train station. We walked everywhere. The colloseum and Forum are a short walk. We were able to get a bus on the corner of the hotel to go to Vatican City. We took a taxi from the other side of Rome back one night and it was only 6 Euro! The room was large by European standards and had a king size bed. The bathroom was large and had a tub/shower. It was very clean. We did sleep with the windows open at night as the room temperature was too warm for us. The minibar was complimentary and fully stocked each day. We really enjoyed the free drinks and snacks after a long day of walking the city. The breakfast was very nice and plentiful. There were fruits, yogurts, cereals, eggs, bacon, and many different rolls to choose from. We had cappuccino every morning. The morning we left, the staff gave us a "to go" bag loaded with breakfast items. We would definitely recommend the Hotel Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lived up to previous reviews!”
Reviews.Author: mommajotothe480
Reviews.Content: After researching for months trying to narrow down a hotel to stay at for our 20th Anniversary we chose this one. We are so glad we did! The staff including Paulo, Allesandro and Marco were very professional, friendly and helpful throughout our pre-visit emails, providing dinner recommendations, transportation assistance to and from the airport and a providing a welcome smile and greeting every day. We stayed on the 6th floor in the back portion of the hotel. No view however very quiet and we slept every night with the windows open to fresh air. The room was clean and comfortable and had plenty of shelving storage however not much hanging storage for clothing. The minibar was stocked with 2 beers, 2 sparkling waters, 2 non-sparkingling waters and 2 juices daily. There were snacks although we didn't partake - cookies and crackers I beleive. The best attribute to this hotel is its location. For our entire stay we walked everywhere! No need for train or bus or taxi! The city is incredibly compact and easy to get around - just wear good walking shoes and you'll be fine! The longest trek was to the vatican and that was only about a 40 minute walk. We started out our first two mornings with the complimentary breakfast and if you enjoy meat, cheese, rolls, yogurt and some pastries you'll have no problem. We ventured out though and discovered wonderful coffee shops with beautiful pastries and incredible coffee that we much preferred - one is just steps from the hotel. We enjoyed closing down the hotel bar most evenings after a long day of exploring the city and enjoyed conversations with other hotel guests. Although the weather was beautiful the hotel does not open the terrace we were told until sometime in June. That was a shame as it would have been great to have a cocktail in the evening enjoying the fresh air and view of the city. We would definitely stay here again and truly appreciate all those who posted previous reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnloB
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome a number of times, The Artemide is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. On arrival these lived up to & throughout our 3 night stay, exceeded our expectations. The staff were very attentive and could not have done any more for you. We asked at reception if we could move to a bigger room and were told that there was nothing available for that night but they would move us to a superior room the next day for the duration of our stay at no extra charge - what more could anyone want ! Great position, good buffet breakfast. An excellent choice for any visitors wanting a central location in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for young couple sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: eoghain
Reviews.Content: location of hotel is perfect, close to metro and in the middle of a main street. staff couldnt be more helpful, would stay again next week.

Reviews.Title: “A proper 4* hotel - by anyone's standards”
Reviews.Author: chrisNchris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid March 2009 for 5 nights. Have stayed in a few European Hotels and this was, without doubt, the best. Visit their web-site: what you see IS what you get. The free mini bar was great and most welcome, the hotel staff were both friendly and helpful (and did not laugh too much at my poor Italian). A room at the front of the hotel will almost certainly be a bit noisy as the hotel is on a busy main road. When booking ask for a room at the rear of the hotel. These rooms are very quite but have no view at all so keep the shutters closed. The bar is expensive - but you are in the middle of 2500 years worth of history. Its not a "Buy one get one free" drinking culture so expect it to be a little pricey. If you want a cheap alcohol fuelled holiday go to Ibiza. This is for people who want to see works by Michaelangelo, Raphael, Caravaggio and so on, Its great if you want to explore the Palatine Hill and its archeology, its right next to the Colosseum. All of these things are within easy reach if you stay at this hotel and will cost just 1 Euro per person for a single trip on the Metro. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and would have no hesitation in staying there again. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location for site seeing very good. Friendly staff. Very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: redcarman
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly & helpfull to arrange trips. English spoken by all staff. We walked nearly every were in the centre of the city except the Vactican City to which we had a bus pickup & general guided tour. Our stay in the hotel was for 7 nights & would certainly return to this hotel on our next visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay in this hotel again and recommend it”
Reviews.Author: AnnYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Very good breakfast. Easy access from Termini and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Decent with a few challenges”
Reviews.Author: DiveInHeels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. While on a very commercialized street, it is close to many sites and walking distance to some good restaurants. The hotel is decently appointed for the price range and the breakfast is great. The rooms themselves are adequate, not large but not terribly cramped. While the beds are hard, the pillows are plush. The day service is truly friendly and attempts to be helpful. Upon our arrival, we were offered to join breakfast as we arrived the morning of our arrival day. Upon our 6:00 a.m. departure, we were provided with a nice bag breakfast. The evening bartender is very good, always ready with our Prosecco. Some challenges we faced: I would not recommend room #115. Upon booking the reservation, we asked for two quiet rooms. Around 11:00 in the evening, one quickly discovers that room #115 is anything but quiet. Located on the other side of the wall, is an Irish pub. We could hear people talking, music, items and doors being slammed. In addition to this, you could hear water in the walls (pipes) every time someone in the hotel flushed a toilet. The night desk person informed us of the pub next door and was unable to move us that night, but the next day we were relocated without fuss to the 4th floor. Ironically, an hour after being relocated, my husband identified 10 sounds we could hear through our window in our new room: cat meowing, crow, seagull, water rushing through pipes, horn blowing, ambulance siren, church bells, baby crying, people talking, dog barking. However, this was no big deal and our nights were peaceful. The fitness center was another challenge. There is a sauna located within the small room that accompanies the 'gym.' When I began my treadmill run, the temperature read 28.6 celcius (83.5 F). I had to call 3 times to get someone to adjust the temperature. When the bellboy finally arrived, he informed me that there was no AC, only heat at that time of year, and he shut the system off. This did nothing to cool the room down from the dangerously high temperature for working out. I could not complete the run. Just a note if having a gym is important to your travels as it is to mine. Tours: My mother and her friend booked a half day tour through the hotel. They were very disappointed because the audio equipment was full of static and they could not understand most of the tour. The other group members verbalized the same disappointment . My mother felt it a waste of money and time. The map the hotel hands out free is the best map we came across. Don't waste money on purchasing another one. For the best pizza in rome (truly) go to Il Forno at Campo di' Fiori. Also a great wine bar MaterMatuta run by a great guy with great food (5 min walk). Amazing seafood at F.I.S.H. (10 min walk). I would stay here again, but not with the enthusiasm I feel when I look forward to staying at a hotel I really adore.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: pwarne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide (ar-TEH-mide - prnouncing it right helps taxi drivers) for a few days in March. Clean, friendly, well-located, good value, I would definitely go back - a low season winner.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat it with a big stick”
Reviews.Author: CANT1ONA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent.Fantastic service from start to finish.The breakfast was superb in quality and variety.Location is excellent for either turning lleft and walking to the Collesseum area or turning right to use the Republica metro to get to other parts of the city.I would automatically choose this hotel when I am next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: tilehurst38
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Rome for a long weekend for my birthday , as I have always wanted to go. We were lucky with the weather and thanks to Tripadvisor we were lucky with this hotel. Although mainly business people stay here, we were made very welcome. Lovely buffet breakfast and great coffee. The waiting staff were very attentative and pleasant. The menu in the restauant of an evening however did not much have of a choice but there are so many nice places to eat in Rome. The hotel was very clean and the mini-bar was stocked everyday as it was included in our room rate. The hotel is very central to most of the historic parts of Rome. Trevi, colosseum, spanish steps and pantheon are all within walking distance about 10/15 minites and they all lead to one another. We actually walked to the Vatican from the hotel as it was straight forward and took about 30/40 minutes and saw some great sights on the way. Would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to others. The only down side was the bed it was very hard and not very good for my bad back.

Reviews.Title: “molte grazie”
Reviews.Author: emma-in-dublin
Reviews.Content: We have returned from our 8 day trip to Roma. Fabulous hotel in an amazing city. Our hotel was central with easy access to the metro line and buses. A day ticket for bus tram and metro 4 euros... We really used ours... The staff were friendly and helpful and great on advising us where to go for the day and how to get to places. The breakfast was OK and the staff as always were helpful and got to know what we liked. If the dinning room was full we were always found a table promptly. The room was clean and comfortable and big. I emailed in advance and asked for a room with a view. That we got 2nd floor and over looked the via national. We had a balcony which if you were game could tip toe out onto... We also got a jacuzzi which we used a lot... A mini bar which was stocked fresh everyday which is a lovely bonus. My husbands fave was the complimentary newspaper. Not that we were there to watch TV the only stations were BBC world and CNN... When we return to Rome we will definitely use this hotel again . 8 days in Rome is not enough to see and do everything.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, convenient, and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: NJAeris
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a PERFECT stay at the Artemide. The staff was very gracious, friendly, and helpful, but always professional. The room was immaculate, comfortable, and exceptionally quiet- never heard any noise from others or street. All facilities worked exactly as expected, and the stocked minibar (included at no extra charge) was wonderful after a long day of sight seeing. Breakfast was by far the best we've ever had included in a hotel... excellent, efficient service, and delicious, generous food. The location was extremely convenient for all the sights... easy access by walking, metro, or bus to anyplace in Rome that you want to go. The staff was also very helpful in arranging for dinner reservations, transport to the airport, and even sent along breakfast for the road upon our early morning checkout!!! We could not ask for a better place to stay for a wonderful sightseeing tour of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It totally rocked!”
Reviews.Author: tetee21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. the staff was friendly, extremely helpful and just a complete delight to deal with. They made us feel welcomed and confortable. The breakfast was included and had a large array of items to choose from much to our surprise. We stopped in for drinks at the lounge after a day of touring and the seating was comfortable, the bartender was attentive and we were able to just relax with a drink by the TV. Thank you very much for making our holiday away from the kids a memorable event.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Neach-siubhail
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with large, very comfortable rooms, free internet in the rooms, free minibar (!) and great breakfast buffet with a wide range of fruit and fresh bakery products. Staff are helpful and friendly. As a frequent business traveller staying in mid-range business hotels, this is a cut above the average - would definitely stay here again. Surrounding area seems to be a bit of a restaurant desert, however, but I recommend 'Il Chianti' not far away, near the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel a good 4Star”
Reviews.Author: RCHLN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Artemide as an ‘escape’ from a very poor hotel. So we walked down ‘Via Nazionale’ and this hotel looked the nicest, it was a 4 star so yes you expect more. But I’m happy to say that it didn’t disappoint. The stay was great & the rooms very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A+!”
Reviews.Author: findinglimo
Reviews.Content: been around europe for past 2 weeks. best hotel overall for the whole trip. very close to roma termini train station, and we walked to all the local attractions. bed was the most comfortable (would buy one for personal home use if i could), awesome service, great breakfast...free mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: MDuser12
Reviews.Content: I just finished a five night trip to Italy with my girlfriend. We started in Venice for two nights followed by three nights in Rome. I started looking for places to stay 2 months before our trip and after a long decision process decided on the Hotel Artemide based on plenty of favorable reviews, a pretty good rate, and photos that made the hotel look really nice. However, after a fantastic stay in Venice at the Hotel Bucintoro (see my review), coupled with high expectations I was a bit disappointed. I booked directly through the website for their rate which didn't include breakfast but was essentially the same otherwise as a standard room rate. Breakfast cost 14 euros per person per day, so over a 3 day stay we saved nearly 80 Euros. Our rate was 108 Euro per night. For starters, the location of the hotel is one of its best attributes. It is literally a 1-2 minute walk to the Republica Metro station and only about an 8 minute walk to Termini. This made it easy to quickly get to many of the city's sights. We could have walked to many places easily, but with temperatures being in the upper 40s felt we might as well use our 3 day unlimited use metro pass (which came with the Roma pass and I definitely recommend buying it). Being on Via Nazionale was good for reasons mentioned above, but also there were quite a few restaurants nearby if you knew where to look. Gallina Bianca and Quadrifoglio were two that we went to based on Eyewitness Rome recommendations and we weren't disappointed. Both were within a 5-10 minute walk. However, as discussed next the street presented some problems. Upon arrival we were given room 104. I had read in several reviews about the noise levels from the street being high, but decided I would see for myself how bad it was. Upon entering our room I noticed that street noise was very loud and I could easily hear traffic and pedestrian noise. Figuring it wouldn't be too bad at night I decided not to ask to switch rooms quite yet. This was a mistake as the first night resulted in constant tossing and turning and little quality sleep. There was just enough noise from the occasional cars to keep me awake. Also it seemed as if the windows were super thin and did not close properly. The next morning I asked if we could move to a room in the back of the hotel and was told by a helpful Alessandro at the front desk that this wasn't a problem. We packed our things and they moved us to room 107 on the back of the hotel. Upon returning in the afternoon to the new room the lack of noise was immediately clear! The room was extremely quiet which made the next two nights sleep better. Unfortuntely the room felt quite hot (the thermostat said 24-25 degrees). I had to frequently open the window to let cool air in but couldn't do so for too long due to seeing a mosquito or two enter at night. So for no noise I got a room that was much too warm. Aside from that the room was nice although not as large as pictures led me to believe. But it was sufficient. The bathroom had good soaps and shampoo. The shower in our first room leaked tons of water onto the floor but this didn't really occur in the second room. My girlfriend like some previous reviewers noticed that the hair dryer was merely blowing cool air. The complimentary minibar was a nice benefit to grab a snack or drink from after a day of sightseeing. As far as hotel ammenities go it was nice to get a free glass of sparkling wine at checkin from the bar. I glanced at the menu and was shocked to see such high drink prices though. Also while it was nice to receive 15 minutes free per day of internet access, after having essentially unlimited access at the hotel in Venice, it was annoying to feel rushed to check news and take care of travel logistics. You could pay 12 euro for unlimited use for your stay which is however a pretty good value. Also as others mentioned the only English channel was CNN, and while you're not there to watch TV after 5 days of nonstop sightseeing we wanted to relax one afternoon. There was a good deal for 24 hour access to movies and webtv though which we used. As mentioned already the staff were very professional, helpful, and fluent in English. They also booked a private car to take us to the airport early in the morning on our final day which cost 40 euro and sure beat the hassle by metro/bus to Ciampino airport. All in all, my opinion on Hotel Artemide is really mixed. Perhaps my opinions were skewed by the exceptional Venice hotel, but the issues such as street noise, a warm room, and the flooding shower marred my stay. However, the hotels superb location, the professional staff, and the overall niceness of the room made up for these problems. I'd like to think that we just had an unlucky experience and other rooms don't have such a problem with noise/heat as evident by the overwhelming positive reviews. If returning to Rome I'd probably be willing to give the hotel another try as it was quite hard to find a nice hotel at a reasonable price. Hope you found my review helpful and enjoy your trip in Rome as its truly a one of a kind city!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Trip”
Reviews.Author: CCherserlf
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull staff, well located, near of termini station and Reppublicca Station ! Very cosy room and fantastic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The Artemide is a very clean and stylish hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eclecticas
Reviews.Content: Clean, efficient, sylish hotel. Though the public rooms were smaller than I thought they would be from photographs, they are very tastefully decorated and furnished. Comfort and some style. The staff on reception, were always attentive and helpful. Someone there always able to speak in English, Bedrooms again were excellent. Clean, spacious and tastefully decorated. The huge double bed was incredibly comfortable and spacious!! We were on the first floor and also had a small verandah, with table and chairs, though the view, as one might expect in the centre of the city, was building 'locked'. Breakfast was fine, in a pleasant basement dining area. Range of choice a bit limited, mainly breads and cakes, with only bacon and scrambled egg offered as a hot dish. The restaurant was the hotels only let-down. It lacked character and ambience, indeed it seemed more like a basic street cafe. The menu though middle priced, was by no means extensive, and for a vegetarian offered nothing at all. The hotel is situated in a very convenient position. It took us about twenty minutes to complete a very pleasant walk down to the Colisseum, for instance. We would definitly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great locaation”
Reviews.Author: CRobo
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome, having spent 3 nights at the Artemide Hotel. First impressions, great location, 5 mins walk from Rebubblica metro and 10 mins from Termini main line station, so not difficult to get to at all. We arrived before the normal check in time of 1400, but were able to check in immediately which is a bonus after an early morning start. Room was of an average size, clean with all the usual things you would expect, such as TV, slippers, toiletries etc. Another reason why we chose this hotel was because it offered breakfast (American/continental), which was amazing. One thing you should be aware of is the hotel does not permit the use of irons in rooms, so ensure you arrive with crease free clothing. Rooms do not have tea/coffee making facilities, but does have a free mini bar,offering soft drinks and beer. You are also issued with a complimentary voucher on check in, which you can exchange for coffee or sparkling wine. Hotel within walkng distance of most sights and as we had fantastic weather (20 degrees and sunny) during our stay, it was a pleasure to walk instead of taking the metro. Great restaurants all around Rome, so you will be spoilt for choice. All in all, a great hotel, with helpful, friendy, English speaking staff . Definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Was an amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: leazo
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at this hotel at the end of september for my birthday. We have never been to Rome before and loved it. This hotel was fantastic and i would definately recommend it and will be visiting again. It is in the ideal location within walking distance to everything. The staff are lovely and took good care of us. The rooms are immaculate and the hotel is well looked after. We visited all the sights and picked the best time to go as most are free on the last weekend of the month. The weather was lovely and the food is brilliant. I well and truely enjoyed my weekend and will be returning to Rome but taking alot more money for all the shoes and handbags. When i retunr i will be staying at this hotel as i think it was one of the best there.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: SteveNorwich
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most enjoyable experiences we have ever had in a hotel. We found the Artemide to be great value for money. Anybody who wishes to visit Rome could not find a better hotel/location than the Artemide. Very close to subway system; the room was spacious, clean and elegantly appointed; the free breakfast was amazing-huge, in a lovely room, great for Rome. Every member of staff that we came into contact with was polite, knowledgeable and helpful. The free internet was very nice and totally unexpected. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others !

Reviews.Title: “Loved Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mosaafer
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel more than 100%, because that's how everything was! Unbelievably friendly staff, GREAT room, fantastic breakfast, perfect location... Upon our arrival we were upgraded to a Deluxe room for free and given complimentary tickets for sparkling wine and espresso at the hotel's bar... Room was very spacious -for any standards, American or European, and we had 6 pieces of luggage!- clean, comfortable, and per our request when we booked it, in a very quiet section of the hotel. Free use of the minibar, which was restocked daily. Very good fitness room, and for someone who's training for Marathon, and can't miss training, it sure was a very pleasant experience! Any time we called the reception area, they were nice, friendly, helpful, and respectful. Breakfast room was always managed very efficiently, and with all the great breakfast choices, it could satisfy any diet, and any appetite. Hotel is close to all the major sites. We walked everywhere, and the only place we needed transportation for, was the Vatican, which was a very inexpensive cab ride. Great shopping area around the hotel, and lots of cafes, restaurants, even convenient stores, in the same block. We needed to take an early flight out of Rome, so we asked for transportation the night before, along with an early wake up call... Our cab arrived even earlier than we had requested, so they could load 6 pieces of luggage (!), at no extra charge. We had a wake up call for 6 am, so right after we were called, a staff person came to our door with two bags of "boxed" breakfast...How sweet is that?! I am going back to Rome in May, and will most definitely stay at Artemide again. Thank you all for an unbelievable experience and your hospitality. My two week vacation in Italy has been one of my best so far. Ciao, ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: DiMontebello
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at the start of our trip around Italy and we could not have been more pleased. Everyone was fantastic and we couldn't have been happier. The location is PERFECT to walk everywhere (except maybe the Vatican of course) and the hotel and our room were beautiful. The entire staff went out of their way to help us...from Mario and the guys at the front desk, to Enrico and the guys at the bar and restaurant, everyone was great. And lets not forget the manager of the breakfast room(great service, excellent food), Fabricio the driver and the bellhops!! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. There was some road work going on at the time, but it didn't get in our way at all and we never heard a thing (ask for a room away from the street). Thanks guys, maybe we'll be back someday! R.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel Artemide”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2014
Reviews.Content: The hotel Artemide is an exceptional hotel and we can highly recommend the hotel to anyone that travels to Rome. The hotel is one of the cleanest we have ever stayed in and is located at a very convenient location. It has a very tasteful decor throughout the hotel and the rooms are tastefully decorated and very, very clean. The staff is extremely helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet is great and the food, if you eat at the restaurant in the evening, is delicious. The hotel offers a complimentary minibar which is another great thing! We have nothing but great comments to make about this hotel. I believe if you choose the hotel Artemide for your stay you will have an unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: dewbourne
Reviews.Content: Had delightful stay at the Artemede from Oct 18 to 22. Hotel looks quite nice having been updated recently. Staff was most helpful. Arrived from Sorrento in a Hertz rental Saturday evening and was desparate to drop off car at the railway depot before 6pm. Georgio had carried our bags across the construction outside the hotel - there was no where to stop except on the sidewalk. Sympathetic to my concerns about driving alone in Rome to find the Hertz dropoff, Georgio jumped into the passenger side, and together, after several false tries, we managed to find the 7 storey car park for the drop off. Overall, hotel was great. Free minibar was restocked every day. Georgio would arrange for taxis, and watch outside for the correct one. Fine breakfast, herald tribune every morning, welcoming drinks, large business centre for internet. Walk to Trevi or Spanish steps in 15 minutes.
