Via Nationale good street for shopping on the way to Forum.

Reviews.Title: “loved the central location”
Reviews.Author: dunandsun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic place to stay, we were in Rome for 5 days and the hotel was as central as you could get. The staff couldnt have been more helpful, any request was granted and a smile was never far away. The breakfast times were great, from 7am - 10.30am so if you wanted to lie in, you could. The hotel and our room was clean and neat. When we return to Rome ( we didnt manage to see all the wondeful sites) we will be booking into this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “++++ accomodation,service, location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel02
Reviews.Content: Pros - arrived early, 11:30 am, and was checked in immediately, also upgraded from standard to deluxe room. Mini fridge with free beer, water, juice, small snacks, restocked daily. Excellent breakfast with the best coffee I had in Italy. Room was clean, bigger than expected, with excellent bathroom, windows that opened into back alley (nothing to look at), working air conditioner, and very quiet. Bed was firm but if you like that then not a problem. Good location close to metro, which was easy to use even for newbies. Good shopping on Via Nazionale. Housekeeping noticed we used a blanket as a an extra pillow, and replaced it with a real pillow the next day without being asked - very nice. Porter carried luggage across the construction site in front of Hotel and escorted me across the street (little bit of traffic snarl) - very considerate. Overall attentive service without being overbearing. Also everyone spoke good English Cons - roadwork directly in front of hotel makes drop off / pick up a little harder, but really not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a central location”
Reviews.Author: Karen11273
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during the first week of october and we liked it very much. The rooms are clean, and the beds are made up twice a day. The staff members are very friendly and there is a large variety for breakfast. The complimentary minibar is nice when you come to your room after a long day out. Form the hotel you can walk to the main atractions of Rome and the metro stations is very near by. The hotel lies on the Via Nazionale wich has a lot of contruction going on. So ask for a room at the quiet site of the hotel. Though the view is not nice, you can sleep quietly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel central but small issues”
Reviews.Author: meathwoman
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with hotel. Rooms are ok in size but not too big - hotel clean and fresh. minibar was free but not much inside it apart from few waters, soda and 2 beers. They turned off the air con during our stay as "summer was over". we had to open the windows and got eaten during the night with misquitos. We (along with others) complained at reception and they switched it back on the following evening. make sure the air con is on when booking hotel and keep windows closed! Breakfast was grand mostly cold buffet but you could request eggs. They have business area to use internet it was 12euro for length of our stay. small bar area. TV channels only 1-2 in English which are usually news channels. Distance to attractions ok we got taxis to most places. Staff were helpful at reception. would stay there again as long as air con is switched on.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: csantry
Reviews.Content: great hotel ,very central to the main attractions. we had a superior room and it was a large airy room with a balcony overlooking the main street. free mini bar was great and re stocked daily. Breakfast had a good selection and even had twinnings tea . definetly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel@”
Reviews.Author: KLDUNAGAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide before going on a cruise. We arrived late in evening and street was very busy with lights, restaurants still open. Hotel small, comfortable with great breakfast included. Room not large but adequate. Hotel close to coleseum and other sites-walking distance to most places and close to bus line. Shops and stores available on main street. Hotel is great selection for those that can walk and enjoy sites, restaurants, shopping. Could not have made a better selection. Car available for transport to cruise line for approx $168 euro (>1 hour away from Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shilosmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our teenager stayed at the Artemide for one night before our 12 day Med. cruise and again for two more nights upon return from the cruise. I picked this hotel for the closeness of major attractions and the shopping on Via Nazionale. We were not disappointed on both counts. The hotel is very close to the Victor Emmanuel monument ( within 10 min.) which is where we met our tour guides from Icon tours for two walking tours. The breakfast offered was quite good, with enough selection to provide my picky breakfast eater with sufficient choices. The rooms were very quiet and comfortable on both occasions. Others have made mention in the reviews regarding the friendliness of the front desk personnel and I agree, however, they were quite professional and that was good enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend a stay here”
Reviews.Author: 38anchor
Reviews.Content: We had decided to go to Rome mid September and had flights leaving Leeds Bradford (Jet2) on Friday morning, returning the following Monday afternoon. After reading quite a few reviews on here, a friend recommended Hotel Artemide, and so we made a booking direct with the hotel. It was a little more than we wanted to spend but thought what the hell, and booked a Superior room for 3 nights for €777. Once my booking had gone through, I emailed the hotel direct with a few questions, room requests etc and I have to say they were always very prompt in getting back to me. So much so that about a month before we were to leave, I checked their website and found that the room rate had dropped to €678. I emailed them immediately asking if I needed to rebook to get the lower rate and I got an email straight back saying the new rate had already been applied to my booking. Excellent service. We arrived at the airport and had originally decided to get a taxi, but in the end got the train to Termini instead. The map on the hotels website stated that they were not too far from here so we thought this would be quite easy - and it was. The train took about 30 mins and then it was a 10-15 minute walk to the Hotel. We were given room 409 and I was please to see it was a high floor and very quiet, which was what I had originally asked for. Initially I was a bit disappointed not to have a view out onto Via Nazionale, but as there was quite a lot of roadworks going on directly outside the hotel this was in fact a blessing. The room itself was exceptionally clean and larger than I was expecting. The bathroom was great with a really large mirror and fully tiled in marble. I was however glad I had brought my own hairdryer as the one provided in the bathroom gave nothing more than a slight breeze and I would have spent all weekend drying my hair if I had used that. There were toiletries. bathrobes and slippers also provided. The bedroom itself was a little on the dark side, and even by opening all the shutters at the windows didn't do much to alleviate this. TBH though, I do find hotels rooms all over the world a little dark. We had plenty of closet space, and even though we had an initial problem with the safe (and the door sticking) someone came straight up to sort it out for us. The fridge was stocked with a couple of can of Peroni beer, a couple of bottles of water and a bottle of coke and sprite. We also had a TV and I was a little disappointed to find a distinct lack of English speaking channels - there was only CNN. Now I know you don't come to Rome to sit in your hotel room watching TV but we did come back for a couple of hours late afternoon most days, before showering and venturing out for the evening, and it would have been nice to have more of a choice. Minor niggle I know. Breakfast was included and there was a great choice., everything from boiled/scrambled eggs and bacon/ham (not made to order though) to croissants, pastries, cheese, meats, cereals, fruit etc. This was served downstairs and I was a little disappointed to hear the roof terrace was not open. This was one feature I was looking forward to, and when we enquired about it was just told it was closed. Not sure if this is for good as it is no longer mentioned on the website (although it was when we booked) but there is still a picture of it on there. Location of the hotel was very good, and apart from the Vatican city (which we used a taxi) we walked everywhere. The public rooms were very nicely decorated and I would have liked to have used the bar a little more but I am afraid the prices were just a little steep for us. We did get a voucher when we checked in for a free glass of Prosecco, or coffee, which was very nice, but a quick look at the bar menu showed us that a simple G&T was €10 - a bit steep I think. All in all, even though I may have pointed out a few things that were a little disagreeable, I would say that I would stay here again, and recommend the place. The positives far outweighed the negatives. I think Rome itself was quite an expensive city and the hotel merely reflected this. One last thing - the reception staff could have been a bit more friendly. They were perfectly pleasant but we were never asked how we were, how our stay was going, or in fact had any communication apart from when we checked in and out, and this was very business like.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we thought it would be...”
Reviews.Author: cindymouse
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel based a bit on reviews we read here and the fact that the hotel could schedule a driver from the port of Civitavecchia and set up a guide for our day in Rome after a 12 day cruise. We thought the room was okay for the price we paid. It was pretty pricey and the staff really did nothing to make our stay anything special. It would have been nice to have the mini bar restocked when the room was turned down in the evening. Only one can of soda and a couple of bottles were in the fridge which we drank after a tour of the city. The room itself was clean and pretty large. It took a bit to figure out how things worked (lights and tub drain) My daughter thought the lighting system was awesome and a great way to save energy. Bed was hard. It was not a bad room or place to stay, just over-priced, we felt it was not worth the price. The driver the hotel provided us was awesome - the best part of the stay. He was waiting for us at the port when got off the ship. Got us to the hotel in record time and provided details of interesting places we drove past. The guide that hotel provided was awful. He did not speak very good english and seemed more interested in taking us to places he wanted us to go than the places we requested seeing. We were VERY disappointed in him. We were specific in where we wanted to go and had many, many emails to the hotel in what we wanted to do. This was very expensive and not worth it. We wish we would have just gotten a driver for the day. We did not see half the things we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nina1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel Artemide is a beautiful hotel, located in the centre of rome in the well known via Nazionale. Around the hotel you find some shops amd also restaurants. All famous sights can easily reached by feet. The hotel is avery nice 4 star hotel with beautiful entrance hall. Our room was very quiet, it looked over the inner court. The room was very spacious and beautiful furnished, in the bathroom we had two marble basins, bath tube,etc. The breakfast buffet was served in a nice breakfast room and was very rich for Italy. In my opinion a very nice hotel in central location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the free mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: kirstyc2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Artemide after researching reviews on trip advisor! Glad we made this choice! Excellent location by metro republica, which made travelling to Vatican and Colloseum easier. Buy a metro ticket 4 euros unlimited travel till midnight. Not many great restaurants around via nationale, but if you jump the metro or walk to area around Trevi fountain or Pantheon, more resonable priced restaurants around. Mini bar is complimentary and is refilled everyday, so take plenty of water and soft drinks with you during the day. The roof terrace is a lovely retreat at the end of the day, but drinks are pricey! A lot of places rip you off in Rome. Charged 7 euros for 2 cans of soda in a restaurant in piazza navone! Use a tour guide when visiting Colloseum and Vatican. Well worth the extra money to queue jump and save time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “"Mr 21 Nights"”
Reviews.Author: Mr21Nights
Reviews.Content: I checked in during 2003 for an extended business trip, was warmly welcomed and after checking in crashed out without bother. I'd just arrived from the other side of the planet and soon received the nickname Mr 21 Nights, as I was booked to stay for that duration. I always found the the staff to be helpful and pleasant. The quality of the service and facilities was excellent and I would not hesitate to stay there again. The room was secure, clean, easily accessible outside normal hours, contained a modern safe and I thought the nightly chocolates were a nice touch after a long day at the office.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: karislynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Artemide for 2 nights during July and we absolutely loved it! I booked this hotel based on all of the outstanding reviews I had read on tripadvisor and hotels.com...and we found each of them to be true. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the complimentary minibar is a huge plus! The included breakfast is delicious and they offer a wide variety of food, juices, coffee, pastries etc. (My husband was especially fond of the scrambled eggs and bacon!) The staff and this hotel were friendly and so helpful! This hotel would be a perfect choice for anyone who is traveling to Rome and looking for a great place to stay! I would recommend it again and again!

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow81
Reviews.Content: Selected the Hotel Artemide based on the Trip Advisor reviews and it is as good as everyone says. We booked a triple and were upgraded to a mini-suite, which was really spacious. Plenty of room for the three of us and the mountain of luggage we had since this was the last stop after three weeks in Europe. The bathroom was huge. The beds are typically European (i.e. hard), but the linens are soft, the room is immaculately clean and the bathroom is huge. The minibar is truly free and is restocked every day. It was 100 degrees F during our whole stay and we pretty much emptied it of water, soda and beer daily. We were given free Asti Spumante in the bar as well. The breakfast buffet is generous and much more varied than most European breakfasts and is also included. Also included is fifteen minutes a day of internet on the computer in the lobby. The air-conditioning struggled a little to overcome the heat, but did succeed. The only disappointment was that the roof terrace was not yet open (in July?) The location is very convenient, one block from the Metro which zips you right to the Spanish Steps or the Vatican. The Trevi Fountain is an easy walk, the Forum is a longer one, but scenic. You can also easily take the Metro to the Colosseum. The restaurants in the area were rather disappointing, but maybe we just picked the wrong ones. One great find was the National Roman Museum, which is just a few blocks away right off Piazza Republica, near Termini station. It contains amazing exhibits of Roman mosaics, frescos, sculpture, jewelry and coins. It is not a usual tourist spot and very uncrowded. We just wandered in one day around five and stayed until closing. It is amazing. Be sure to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: FionnualaM
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome in June with my 15 year old son and booked this hotel having read the trip advisor reviews. I am glad Idid, and would definitely recommend it and stay there again. It is in a good location, walking distance from main train station, ideal as a base for Romes's attractions, the room was bigger than I expected for Rome city cente and breakfast was very good too. The complimentary mini bar stocked each evening with cool drinks was very welcome after a long hot day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Exceeded all our expactations.”
Reviews.Author: Worldvoyager1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. It exceeded our expectations. Wonderful location. Large, beautifully appointed, modern rooms. Buffet breakfast - which was included - had great variety of foods and beverages. All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for Teatro dell'Opera!”
Reviews.Author: JanBristolUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Artemide. Excellent location, excellent hotel. The Teatro dell'Opera (where we saw Andrea Bocelli in 'Carmen') is just a short walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was varied and set you up for the day. Free mini bar was a great bonus - always had a drink at hand. We had a fantastic suite on the top floor overlooking Via Nazionale, loved watching/listening to the buzz of the city (some may find this noisy but never a problem for us, loved it) Would love to visit Rome again, (threw coin in Trevi Fountain so here's hoping!) and when we do, we'll definately rebook the Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Hotel Artemide - Location is perfect, near bus stops and a brief walk to Roman Forum and all the major tourist points. The room was extremely clean and spacious - The bed was so comfortable we could have slept all day - Fabulous buffet breakfast with an excellent staff to help us with our stay. We really liked the availability of the free internet access for the guests and the very friendly staff. Would recommend strongly to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Aply1947
Reviews.Content: The Artemide hotel is excellent - The staff were charming, polite, very helpful and friendly without being over-familiar. The breakfast food quality was good. We really loved the building and our room. It was much nicer than expected. Perfect location! Tube station within 100 metres. After spending just one night here we would definitely come here again and would thoroughly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, great location”
Reviews.Author: tracya199
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May and had a great time. The hotel is located on a popular street in Rome- so lots of restaurants within walking distance. It's only about a 5 minute cab ride to the train station, 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. We actually walked everywhere except to the Vatican from the hotel- very central. Our room was great- request a room on the "quiet size" of the hotel because it is on a busy street. We really didn't have a view but who cares you are in Rome so you shouldn't be in your room. We had a king sized bed and then a small sofa that might have been a sleeper sofa but I didn't look. Nice sized bathroom. I was expecting a smaller room so I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel staff was very nice and helped us book tours and lent us plus adapters. The breakfast provided was a nice buffet of cereal, fruits, breads and juices. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Essential Rome”
Reviews.Author: RomanticsUk
Reviews.Content: Third time my wife and I have stayed in Hotel Artemide , always welcoming staff with excellent attitudes designed to be ever helpful . We can recommend this delightful Hotel , its personnel and cleanliness together with the breakfast buffet to any discerning visitors. Its situation is also extremely convenient to visit the wonderful Roman highlights and experience the shopping facilities in the surrounding main areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bcurdy
Reviews.Content: An absolutely fantastic hotel, superb staff, very welcoming & helpful. Perfect location right in the heart of Rome. The room was clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Hotel american breakfast was substantial and very tasty. The price was very reasonable. Very close to everything that I wanted to do. Would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Golden middle”
Reviews.Author: maksis
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel purely based on very good reviews by other travelers. My personal view - hotel is substantially overrated. Don't get me wrong - nothing bad with the hotel itself. It just lacks a bit of everything to excel to high marks and stars. Rooms are typical European size, but with extremely small place where to store your belongings. Bath room is decent size and very clean, but with very basic toiletries (soap and shower gel). Breakfast consist of fresh fruits, scrambled eggs, literally few cold cuts, good pastries and very good coffee. As I was staying 6 nights at the hotel, it was quite boring of having the same thing every morning without real choice. Staff is amazing. Somebody greets you from the distance and smile. Somebody pretends that you are invisible. At the breakfast they serve you with real care, at the bar it seems that you are just trouble because football has higher priorities to bartender. Location is just perfect! Either for walking to the sights or catching a bus (stop nearby) or metro (stop 3 min walking). I do not regret staying at this hotel. But next time I'll try to book another one which tries a bit harder to please me.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Raybain
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Artemide Hotel was enchanting and romantic. A very well run establishment, with a strong touch of elegance. All members of staff very helpful. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. Great location for sights and shopping. Our trip to Italy was only 5 days, and the best night we had was the night at Artemide. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Rude front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Beargonefishin
Reviews.Content: Positives- Nice quaint rooms, very clean, good location, quiet interior rooms, OK breakfast (staff was great), easy access to trains. Negatives- Front desk staff indifferent at best, never acknowledged when we came in, when we needed a service (cab, restaurant directions, assistance with internet...) the staff could not have been less helpful or polite. We eventually stopped asking for assistance and figured it out on our own. We felt as if we were a bother. The hotel itself is great, no complaints. Shame about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with even nicer staff”
Reviews.Author: Eva4Eva
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff were very accomodating and provided us with good tips on where to visit how to get there etc. Not many restaurants in the area although the one attached to the hotel was pretty good and provided a cheap, hearty lunch. Breakfast is ok - pastries a YES but would avoid the eggs and bacon (it's not an Italian thing to provide a cooked breakfast and it is obvious here!). Have stayed in Rome previously and would defo recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Melina12
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on reviews on trip advisor. We were VERY disappointed. Stayed for 3 nights, 2 rooms (our children 16 and 12 in a separate room.) OVER RATED, UNDER PERFORMED, extremely poor value, terrible service, horrible food at the 'free' breakfast buffet. Had to ask for a bar of soap (3 nights stay, offered one bar for bath and shower for a total of 3 days!- our second room was given two new bars every day!) House keeping supervisor came to the room to find out what the problem was (she found gooey soap left on the shower floor- we couldn't scrape it up anymore!) Gave us ONE new bar and left without a word. Free minibar: yes, 2 free bottles of water, juice and 2 beer bottles. Don't Romans believe in "dusting" their walls? Dust bunnies do climb! Gross! Fuzzies all over the top of the walls in this hotel! Internet: was never available, however, just trying to connect we were charged.=We called the front desk, and explained we could not get a connection, we were told, "no charge" ,except at check out time: very unhappy gentleman who infomed us we had "extra room charges for internet." When he checked with his superior, he was told we had no charge, he 'waved' his hand at us to leave. My husband asked if we were settled with our charges, he looked at us and again with the wave of the hand said, "Go!" Nice! ( Loved Italy, North and South, NOT this hotel.) If they do not like Americansat Hotel Artemide, please do not accept our reservations...and our money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missiewestmidlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family, good location, walked everywhere apart from the Vatican, good breakfast, rooms were clean and staff helpful, free mini bar restocked daily, would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great people and location!”
Reviews.Author: trvlr13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artemide for five nights and loved it. The people could not have been more helpful or friendly. We had a problem when we first walked into the room that they fixed it right away and gave us a coffee to enjoy while they took care of it. The breakfast is incredible - so much choice. The free mini bar was wonderful. I've walked around MANY cities with water to take back to the room. I didn't have to do that this time. The location couldn't be better - we walked everywhere except the Vatican. This is a GREAT place to stay. The only problem I have is I am now addicted to Pear juice, available at breakfast and in the mini bar, and can't find it at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: katemod
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, helpful attentive staff, the rooms are large with clean bathrooms and the minibar is restocked daily. Would definitely recommend this hotel - try and stay in the room above the lead in as the price isn't that much more.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leet000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, right in the heart of the city. Easy to get to all the major sites. 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and Forum. On arrival the staff were really friendly and the room was clean and reasonably sized. We had a room at the front of the hotel which was a little noisy due to the busy road but we were so tired from all the site seeing that it didn't really bother us too much and the windows were double glazed!! Breakfast was really nice and a good start to the day. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jrbristow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Rome.Read all the reviews on Tripadvisor and all the positive ones are accurate.From the moment we arrived to awarm welcome from Allessandro,the helpful bellboys and the efficient and friendly breakfast room staff,everything was superb.Having booked a superior room we were surprised when Allessandro advised us that we had been upgraded to a junior suite!The room was very spacious,bathroom huge and luxurious.Nice touches like bathrobes,slippers and toiletries.The mini bar was great,and refilled every day with juices,soft drinks,water and a couple of beers.Breakfast was fine with a good choice of food.Hotel well located for walking and public transport.Pre booked Hop On -Hop Off bus tour,great value and helped us plan our tour of this beautiful city.All in all a great trip made special by a great hotel .Would certainly return to Rome and to Hotel Artemide.Jim and Cath Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Very, very pleasant ...”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumman
Reviews.Content: We booked our 6 night stay at this hotel in October, and I monitored reviews of it up to our departure mid January 2008. Everything that others have said that is favorable is true. We were not disappointed. We arrived in the morning, after a direct flight from the East Coast of the USA. We were allowed to check into the room early and given not two, but four "chits" for drinks at the bar. The mini-bar in the room was daily re-stocked & everything was "free." The room was, per request, in the back: no view but very quiet. Though the room, per se, was not large, it was very adequate with nice built-ins, free internet access, with good lighting and truly luxurious linens that were 100 % cotton and ironed, so nice to fall asleep-in! The bath was all marble, with a "rain" shower, deep tub, bidet & toilet. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. In addition to yummy yogurt, excellent fruit, "deli" meats, cereals, and wonderful pastries, there were scrambled eggs & bacon. The eggs were on the "soft" to very soft side, but there were also hard-boiled eggs. We arrived by taxi but opted for just a little more to take the hotel-arranged Mercedes van to the airport on departure. "Mario" at the front desk was particularly pleasant and always had a smile for us. We heartily recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel welcomed”
Reviews.Author: LittleForge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 12 year old grandson on his first visit to Rome. (He has traveled with us to many places.) The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast was more than sufficient, the room was spacious and well-appointed - the drinks in the mini-frig and the snacks were great. The hotel is an easy walk from the Termini - and many buses pass the hotel. Mario, Allesandro and Giorgio at the front desk, the bell hops, and the breakfast staff should be commended for their hospitality. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and unexpected find”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: Once again, my fellow tripadvisor user had done it....I trusted what I read and was right - this hotel was exactly what I had expected. The location is good - 5-7 minute walk from Termini which is basically priceless since you can save a ton of euros by taking a train from Fiumicino instead of costly taxi. For those that don't know, via Nazionale is a bustling street full of stores (with amazing January sales) and it leads directly to many Roman attractions. As for the room itself it was suprisingly new and updated. Everything was clean, beds were surprisingly decent and minibar for free (much like breakfast). What was also nice, is the complimentaly cocktail upon arrival and fairly cheap bottles of wine at the bar. Overall, I am very pleased with this hotel and will recommend it to any traveler Enjoy the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyLambrini
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Rome staying at the Hotel Artemide. The hotel is in a fanstic location being within walking distance of nearly all the major sites - and an easy walk. Hotel staff were very friendly & helpful. The welcome glass of Prosecco was much appreciated. If I had to find a fault with the hotel it is that the rooms were very warm & we couldn't figure out the aircon but even the warmth was welcome after having been drenched with January Roman rain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Artimede”
Reviews.Author: terithecook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artimede in July, 2007 and we absolutely loved it. It was my first trip to Italy and I went with my 22 year old daughter and mother. The hotel rooms were a good size and very clean, the service was excellent, and the hotel staff was more than accomodating with any questions we may have had. It is close to most attractions (by bus or a short taxi ride) and was walking distance to the Spanish steps and other attractions too. I can't wait to go back with my husband and enjoy it again.

Reviews.Title: “In One Word, Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: hyloyang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemide Hotel sadly just for one night November 18, 2007. We had just return from a Mediterranean cruise. The location is incredible in "Via Nazionale" just walking distance from everything the Foro Traiano and then Fori Imperiali, walk along Via dei Fori Imperiali to go straight to the Colosseum, like 10 minutes walk to Fontana di Trevi, Spanish Steps, nice restaurants, tiny beautiful cafes and bars. We have been in Rome before, but this is by far the BEST hotel we have stayed on. Our room was SUPERIOR, with a living room and a breakfast table, also we have a BIG balcony with breathtaking views of Rome, the bathroom was immaculate, we have robes, sleepers, etc. The minibar is included in the rate (awesome!!!!), front desk staff very friendly and helpful, speaking a good English and Spanish, we used the shuttle service they provide to get to the airport at 4:45am next day, and a brand new Mercedes show at the Hotel door in the morning. They have a gym and sauna, very rare to find this in a Rome Hotel. All the hotel seems to be newly constructed, cause they have everything really shiny. They even gave us a coupon for an espresso or sparkling wine as a welcome drink. We reserved through their web, they responded incredible fast, and I sent them an email asking for the shuttle service to the airport, and the possibility to have a room with a nice view, never imagine they will give me this beautiful room. Well, we really enjoy our stay, we really LOVED the hotel and definitely we RECOMMEND this hotel, is worth the 4 stars (check out our pictures) Ana Y. Miami, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: Kerryrx
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Rome with a 15 month old. This hotel was a great choice. It is not the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in but it had everything we needed. The location is wonderful. We only had to use a taxi to the Vatican. We got good recommendations on where to eat with my son. The Hard Rock Cafe was a popular choice. We only had breakfast once and it was nice for European breakfast. Don't expect pancakes and bacon. My husband liked that you could pay one price and get unlimited movies for 24 hrs. This was great for when my son was having nap time. Advice for people with small children.... get a junior suite. There is a separate room that can be shut by a sliding door. It was good for my son who needs his own space. The free snacks and drinks in the room every day were also nice. I have two negative comments about this hotel. The first is that if you are a light sleeper I would suggest asking for a room away from the street. I didn't have a problem but my husband did. The hotel is located on a very busy street of Rome. You will hear traffic! The last problem was that the restaurant that the hotel is somewhat connected to does NOT cater to English speaking tourists. I was very surprised to see that there was not an English menu and there wasn't a server that knew English. I understand that I am in a different country and not everyone needs to know English. Being connected to a hotel, I would think that it would be a necessity. From that point on, I made sure that I saw English on a menu before entering and did not assume. Otherwise, I had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: BeechHillers
Reviews.Content: After hours, hours, and hours of scouring web pages and Trip Advisor reviews I finally found the Artemide, on Rome's Via Nazionale. The location was perfect for our too-short 3 night stay, easy to get by foot or bus to all the major sights. Service, breakfast, and the room were great. The lobby was on the ground floor, so dealing with luggage and check in was a breeze. I would stay there again, enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “ell worth its 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: twizzle67
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly lived up to its 4 star rating, with extremely clean and comfortable rooms, complimentary toiletries and mini bar and a very knowledgable and friendly staff. We will definitely be booking a return visit to the Artemide Hotel. And ask at reception for their recommendations regarding restaurants, menus, prices and locations etc. We were glad that we did as all of our dining out experiences were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...definitely worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: sgkhoo
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel, on the way to Sorrento. What a lovely hotel ! Wonderful staff, eager bellhops, a large room with a very large bed, and free mini bar. The view from the room was a bit disappointing (it was a well shaft!) but the location more than made up for it. It literally is bang centre of Rome, and easily within walking distance to the main sites of interest. Parking was not too convenient though and we had to base our car at a public car park across the road, but the concierge literally jumped into the car with me to show me where it was. That is service above and beyond what is expected, in my opinion. I tried to book another room for our return trip from Sorrento but alas, they were fully booked for that night, but the front desk staff gave me their number to ring in the of chance of a cancellation. I would strongly recommend this hotel, and it's one I will book again for future trips to Rome. Well done Artemide.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireSmudge
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I had tried to book direct with the hotel but was informed they were full. However, I managed to find available rooms on 3 other websites (all at differing costs for the same room) and went for the cheapest (a twin room). I paid for this at the outset and received a voucher to present to the hoteI. I then contacted the hotel direct and asked for a quiet, non-smoking room on one of the upper floors and we ended up in room 511 with a lovely view over the courtyard with potted plants. We had the hotel arrange a private taxi transfer from Ciampino airport (€60 pick up and $40 return ) and we were pleasantly suprised to see a Mercedes 7 seater car turn up with blacked out windows! Fab! Maximo, our driver, then proceeded to point out all the sites as we entered Rome so we had a mini guided tour. On arrival, we were handed a voucher for a free coffee or glass of sparkly in the bar - great start! We had clean towels each day and the mini bar was refilled each day. They also left sweets on our bedsite table as a goodnight treat. The breakfast was superb - crispy bacon, boiled eggs, fantastic pastries (just avoid the scrambled eggs-not sure what they tasted of but I had a mouthful and that was enough)! The location is good- the hotel is at the top end of Via Nazionale but it is really only a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum and Forum and about 15-20 mins to the Trevi fountain and Pantheon. Tip 1 - We booked an open top bus tour through Viator.com. It cost about €13 but was valid for 24 hours from the time you embarked so we had it from 1.00 on Thursday until 1.00 Friday. Tip 2 - as other people advise, book your Colosseum tickets in advance on their website. The guided tour was excellent and can be booked at the same time as your ticket for another €3.50 each and was well worth it. Just take your email confirmation to the "reserved" desk and you will receive a ticket and sticker for the tour. Tip 3 - We booked a tour of the Vatican with MyVaticantours.com. You pay a little bit more than other guided tours but we only had 15 people in our group and it was a fantastic tour! Highly recommended. You avoid the horrendous lines of people queueing to get in and learn so many interesting facts. The Sistene Chapel is NOT to be missed!!! Fantastic!! We didn't bother paying the €4 to climb to the top of the Basilica-the lines were too long and the views are just as impressive from Castel St Angelo. Overall, we thought the hotel was ideal and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide Rome - Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: john3489
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Artemide in September 2007, and found the room to be small, dark, very plain and somewhat depressing, not a picture on the fabric covered walls, rather spartan in fact. The bed was really two twin slabs pushed together and not very comfortable. We had a view of an air shaft and the windows of our fellow visitors. Looking from our window down to the area below we found it littered with many cigarette butts apparently thrown out windows, some bottles, too. Not real scenic. In contrast to the room, the marble floored bathroom was of a good size and had nice amenities. This is a very busy area, so perhaps it was quieter on the shaft, but I would recommend a street side view if the traffic noise doesn't concern you. Getting ice means a trip to the bar and a tip. The front desk personnel were a bit cold at first but warmed up eventually and gave us good recommendations for dining, although we did have our camera stolen by professional thieves as we dined in the outdoor cafe at nearby Target Ristorante. Beware in Rome, there are many incidents like this where one person distracts you while the other takes your goods, wallet, etc. Not a fun way to celebrate my birthday, fortunately we had downloaded the photos to our laptop so we didn't lose memories of Venice, our first stop, and Rome. We visited the nearby police station and found 8 other victims while we filed our report. At any rate, this is a convenient hotel near Repubblica Metro and walkable to Termini Station, just underwhelming. The bright spot is the breakfast which is a feast for the eyes as well as the taste buds, just don't go on the late side as they tend not to refill the hot buffet items. You snooze, you lose. Oh, the rooms have a stocked minibar with free items such as beer, water, juices -- that was a nice feature not typically found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MaveriQ
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome numerous times and this is the hotel that we will be coming back to ! The premises were elegant, the rooms quiet (request one facing the back) and incredibly clean, the staff was very helpful and courteous. The hotel offered a good American breakfast which was essential for us ! The location couldn't have been better - walking distance to all the touristic sites, the metro, shopping, very central. We had no complaints and in fact, will be recommending this hotel to our friends when they visit Rome. Loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: la2travelers
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Artemide was wonderful for the following reasons: 1. Attentive and helpful staff 2. Free drinks in the mini-bar 3. Great central location near subway, shops, and restaurants 4. Clean, quiet, spacious, air conditioned king room 5. Excellent free full breakfast 6. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prissyshay
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel!! I stayed in room 105 and it was roomy , clean, comfortable. The marble bathroom was nice, had robes and slippers for both of us. The was a mini bar with juice, soft drinks, beer, water and sparkling water. Also Peanuts and cookies. I took the train from Fimuincino 11 Euros to Termini and a cab from there 9 Euros. The Hotel is on a shopping street, tons of designer shops (next door to my all time favorite MAX MARA )and small cafes surrounding it, its kinda dead at night though. There is an irish Pub 2 doors down and a café across the street that were a little lively but otherwise not a great spot for nightlife. It was only a 10 minute walk from termini though so easy to reach. Took a bus across the street was in Vatican in about 15-20 minutes for 1 Euro. The hotel has a rooftop bar and restaurant. The front desk staff was a bit rude but didn’t let it bother me. The Doorman was very very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Paolo Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer60661
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! This is a gorgeous hotel close to Termini Train Station. Our room was huge and the air coniditioning worked well. The best part of our stay was Paolo - he is the night front desk man. He not only recommended fabulous restaurants for dinner, but he also assisted us arrange a tour of the Vatican, and on our last morning he not only arranged our ride to the airport but also had a packed breakfast delivered to our door for the journey. He really went above and beyond his duties to make our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal sanctuary in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Amazing_typing_cat!
Reviews.Content: The best city hotel I have stayed in for being able to relax and leave the busy city outside. We stayed 5 nights in the Artemide, followed by 8 in Sorrento and 1 night back in the Artemide on the way back. The room walls are padded and really do keep the sound down to a minimum. We slept really well and had siestas in a room two floors up from a busy street, next to the service stairs and lift. They gave us a huge room for the 5 nights with a jacuzzi bath. Breakfast was a good selection, especially for the sweet toothed like me. The free mini bar is a lovely touch and you can use the small fridge for your own stuff without it being thrown out. Daily, we got two beers, two cans of fizzy (coke & fanta), two fizzy water, two still and two juice cartons! Plus two packs of crackers, nuts and wafer biscuits. In the heat of the day, I would have put the hotel 5 minutes walk closer to the centre. But the location is good, on a main street with shops and the metro is very close. There are also some nice, slightly less touristy restaurants nearby that give you a chance to give the hectic centre a miss if you want to. I loved Rome but wouldn't recommend going in July. It was too hot to enjoy walking and queues were manic for the Vatican. We tried the guide book's early morning recommendation and the queue was worse! However, I totally recommend the guide book trick of buying your Colesseum ticket inside the Forum. Go to the Titus arch in the centre and walk round a bit more, its in an archway under the Palatine. There was 10 people in this ticket queue and we bypassed a queue that went halfway around the Colesseum.

Reviews.Title: “Really a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethrandy
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel. We stayed for one week in August. two adults and a 12 year old. The front desk staff was terrific; booked day trips for us; recommended restaurants; arranged taxi's to and from airport and coordinated with our hotel in florence to book for us a day trip to Pisa out of florence. Our triple room felt more like a suite - two king size beds! Air conditioning was great. Breakfast was included and was more than adequate. Mini bar is free and is a pleasure and there's a computer in the lobby that's free to use. Hotel is on Via Nazionale which has probably twenty hotels all together. a major street if you want to walk around at night. Hotel is walking distance - about twenty minutes to thirty minutes to all major sites (except the Vatican which is in a different section of town)only a few blocks from the train station for day trips to florence. Very Very pleasantly surprised. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in Rome. Dont miss it!!”
Reviews.Author: artimus2075
Reviews.Content: This was a great find..I read the reviews on tripadvisor before I booked the hotel and I wasnt disappointed...room was great, the staff very helpful ( especially Alessandro...and the other person in the reception whose name I forget)...and breakfast was very good..it was close to everything and we had a great time..thanks to this lovely hotel and wonderful people..thanks so much...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Artemide Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louiseUS
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15-year-old daughter and Istayed at the Artemide Hotel July 4-6, 2007 (prior to a Med cruise), July 18 (after the cruise) and July 23 (before leaving for home). Our experience was wonderful. The hotel is clean, upscale, and the front desk staff is terrific and so very helpful and kind. They offer free internet in the lobby and the room comes with a free minibar (primarily soft drinks, beer and some light snacks). The atmosphere of the hotel was upscale and there is a rooftop terrace (serves drinks and light meals) which opens at 7pm. The air conditioning also worked well. There is an inroom safe and cable TV. The hotel uses a key card system so you do not need to leave your key at the front desk each time (which is common in many European hotels). The Artemide Hotel is also conveniently located in walking distance to many attractions. There is also a metro stop a few blocks down the street. The hotel was also helpful in holding our luggage while we travelled for a few days and consolidated what we needed into only one bag to take with us. We loved this hotel and would stay here again in a minute. The only considerations I would point out is that the beds are VERY firm (which we didn't mind.) Also, the hair dryer in the bathroom are new units but don't have a lot of strong power if this would make a difference to anyone. (They remind me of dryers on cruiseships.) We were also fortunate to have requested a quiet room away from the street. (I wouldn't suggest getting a room on via Nationalze since I think it could be noisy) The hotel was great in honoring this request each time and seemed to be eager to please us. We genuinely liked everyone there and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Artemide great value”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeFamily4
Reviews.Content: Lovely welcome by attentive staff. We arrived v.early (on overnight train from Paris) expecting to lodge our bags in the baggage room but our rooms were ready by noon. Rooms on 6th floor were excellent, no views but they were quiet, roomy and well equipped with essential air-con and a a nice touch with a free mini-bar - after a day walking Rome you appreciate the cold beers and water. Breakfast consisted of usual continental elements meat/cheese/yoghurt/fruit etc. the Coffee not the best we have had but the Hot Choc was recommend by the kids. We had a drink on the new 7th floor open-air bar area but it was really too hot to linger. Location is perfect, 10-15min walk from Terminii station and with good bus routes into the centre though we did resort to using air-conditioned Taxis a lot (5-7Euros) when the temp reached 38c. I cant wait to get back to Rome - and I will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: faig
Reviews.Content: This hotel (given its reasonable rates) is a really good choice for seeing Rome and all its sights. My wife and I walked everywhere both day and night. Forum (15 mins), Colosseum (20 mins) and Vatican (45 mins) - with plenty of sights along the way. It is also no more than 10 minute walk from the train station yet in a safe location. Rooms are large and modern and the free minibar is an unusual and welcome extra. Roof terrace with views to Vatican is great for an evening drink. Reception staff - particularly Allesandro - efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City break hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FredandMaisie
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 nights last week. It's a good hotel - ideal for a City Break. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day, the free minibar was a godsend in July and the staff were very helpful. We couldn't hear a single car sound from our room which overlooked the enclosed - and rather ugly central courtyard area. Also the internet access - though limited to one PC, was very useful for online check-in with airlines. The staff were helpful, it was a good location for shops, transport and restaurants. My only niggle was the distinctly average breakfast. The eggs were underdone and the pastries were not at all tasty. Also the back elevator could fit two people and their cases - and not much else! But as I said, for a City Break Hotel this one was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: PhillySacajawea
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Artemide and enjoyed it immensley. Rooms were clean and well maintained. The complimentary mini bar was a welcome surprise! I was travelling with my family ( 4 adults and 2 kids) and we booked 2 triple rooms. The rooms faced the patio in the back so there was no street noise to deal with. The day we arrived they had just opened the roof top terrace. We were given complimentary champagne and appetizers. The view is very nice and the wait staff was eager to serve us. The front desk was a huge help in planning tours and advice on where to eat. They were patient in giving directions and spoke English very well. I would return to Artemide for it central location, great staff, and superior accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: BelfastKeentraveller
Reviews.Content: my husband and i recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and are pleased to say that this is a great hotel. this was our 3rd visit to rome, and some of the hotels can be hit and miss. the artemide is centrally located- an easy walking distance either to the forum or to the trevi fountain. the rooms are clean, tidy and relatively modern.the breakfast offered a good selection and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ,location and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: delucafam
Reviews.Content: Returned to Rome from a 10 day cruise. Had hotel arrange, at a reasonable cost, to have a car pick us up at Port. Car was waiting upon our disembarkation and driver knew way around some of traffic problems. Our party included myself, my wife and our 16 year old grandaughter. We arrived at the Hotel at approximately 10 a.m.and our superior triple room was available. Room was at rear, so no street noise and quite comfortable. Had booked room before leaving US, based on reviews by other Trip Advisor members. Room price included both a complimentary buffet breakfast and complimentary mini bar. Breakfast included eggs, bacon, many different pastries,meats,fruits and juices(we all loved the fresh squezzed orange juice!) Mini bar stocked every day with 4 waters, 2 juices, 2 Cokes and 2 beers. Great to take with you on sightseeing and to have on return to room. At a cost of 2.50 euros for each item on the street, provided quite a savings. All of the staff (front desk,bellman and cleaning) were extemely helpful,courteous and spoke good English. Their recommendations regarding tours and places to eat worked out fine. Walking distance from Hotel (located on Via Nazionale) was about 15 minutes from major sites, except Vatican. Area around Hotel was safe and busy with many nice shops and places to eat. Would certainly recommend to all and would definitely stay again on any return visit.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ratujuin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and so is the bathroom. Bed is big and very comfortable. The mini bar and snacks in the room are free and they refill it everyday. The only thing thet i didnt like was the breakfast selection. The hotel is very central so most tourist attration it is just walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: loul1810
Reviews.Content: find a nice hotel in rome is quite difficult, you usually pay much and get disapointed. the artemide is a nice clean place not luxury but good value. the rooms aren't that fancy but very clean. the location is close to the center, to via del corso to coliseum...you can rich nearly all places of interest in a 10 to 15 min walk or with a taxi (10 to 15 euros) ... the service is good and i recommand this hotel to visit rome

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Happy5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Very good hotel for Rome standards - nice clean room, excellent friendly staff (definately unusual to find in Italy!), good breakfast and superb location. highly recommend this hotel. The location is very central and if you have a courtyard facing room it is extremely quiet even though the hotel is on a busy road. Location is great to walk to most of the tourist sights and also 10 minute walk from termini station - there is no need to get a taxi from termini station. The only complaint I have is that the hot water was luke warm but I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best value in rome-one price includes all”
Reviews.Author: neda2000
Reviews.Content: location is tops. central to almost everything (except vatican but then that is a different country). we walked to every here from here. their price includes a beautigul, clean room with excellent staff. best part FREE MINI BAR. anything in your room that you can eat or drink is included in your tariff, which is how it should be. none of that pay 200 euro for a can of coke in your room rubbish. if they out a can of coke in your room then it is yours. for free. otherwise they should not have left it in there. the satff were great too. they gave us welcome champagne and very helpful in site seeing. they stored our bags while we went site seeing after we had checked out. clean rooms and very nice modern hotel. cant praise them enough. unfortunately we had a booking with another hotel the next night that we could not cancel and we wish we had stayed with this hotel for the whole trip instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: NewMomCanada
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in an almost perfect location (if you like a tiny walk it's perfect). The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were huge, the minibar was lovely. The breakfast with it's hot pastries that were just baked was incredible and the service impeccable. You won't go wrong with this hotel (although it's not 400 m. to the attractions as it says).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyDAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2007. We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is an easy walk to the Colosseum (10 min), the Natl. Museum of Rome, the Trevi fountain and to plenty of restaurants and shopping. There is a bus stop close to the hotel which is convenient for going to the Vatican. We loved that the mini bar was included in the price of our hotel. And the room and bathroom were nice and clean. It was a pretty decent sized room for Europe standards. The hotel also offer complimentary internet access in their "business area." The breakfast was good, but get there early for the good pastries! The hotel staff was not as helpful as our other hotels..in fact they often gave us wrong info! But otherwise, it was a great experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mid-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: italy1234
Reviews.Content: Artimede is the perfect mid-priced hotel whether traveling for business or pleasure. The rooms are small, but have everything you need and are very clean. The bathroom is actually quite large and luxurious. The breakfast is included in the rate and the cappuccino was of the best I had in Italy. The staff is friendly and helpful. They are not necessarily that great at recommendations for restaurants, sites, etc, but will happily help you once you know what you want to do. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from the Termini, on a safe street. Hotel rooms are loud due to the traffic, but it's nothing that should deter you from this nice hotel. There is also free Internet access, but be sure to ask for it as it is not necessarily advertised. Overall, this hotel really was perfect for our needs. We wanted a clean, safe hotel in a good location where we could meet other friendly travelers. We would definitely stay in this hotel again after having such a lovely time there.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend this hotel highly.”
Reviews.Author: CoralExplorer
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip to Rome and Florence. 3/9 - 3/15/07 My stay while in Rome was the Hotel Artemide. I had read several good reviews of it on this website and booked through their website. The price was not bad and the efficiency of "Paulo" at the hotel in returning my e-mails was very nice. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Termini Station - easiy to find on busy Via Nazionale. It is just a few blocks from the "Republica" stop of the Metro. Buses 40 and 64 also pick up and drop off on this street constantly. The interior of the hotel was very nice - quiet and pleasant. The desk staff were very friendly and informative - my favorite - Alessandro. The front desk staff were always willing to help and answer questions - saying "buon giorno" and "ciao" when you came and went. (They all spoke great english too!) My room was clean and had new carpeting in it. The bathroom was very nice also. A free mini bar was greatly appreciated by me also - I took a bottle of water with me whenever I went out to tour around the city. Small juice boxes were nice too as we needed the Vitamin C - we had winter colds we were trying to recover from. Breakfast down in the breakfast room was very nice. Many different types of fruit juices, coffee, tea, fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, toast & jelly, scrambled eggs and ham (italian ham - Yum) Great service. When we left for 3 days in Florence - we condensed our luggage down to one suitcase and stored the rest at the Hotel Artemide until we returned. They had it waiting for us when we arrived back for our last night in Rome before flying home to the States. Alessandro even remembered where we had gone and asked me how my trip to Florence had been. (He even remembered my first name!) That was nice. Checking in and checking out was always efficient and smooth. All in all - I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: crackerbarrel
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading some good reviews on TripAdviser - and we were not disappointed. We spent 5 nights there and the hotel had everything we needed. Nice big rooms (not expected in Rome) and lovely and quiet (we had rooms facing the rear courtyard. Extremely clean and nice little extras - eg bath robe, free mini bar, toiletries etc. Breakfast was great - bacon and eggs as well as lovely range of cold meat and cheese, cereal, fresh fruit, pastries and cakes. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Used the hotel's airport pick-up and return taxi service, Really convenient although we were quoted more for the collection than the prices listed in the hotel itself, But a service well worth using. The hotel location is excellent - less than 5 mins walk from Metro station and on main bus routes. Buses are crowded and offer a rough ride - but they are cheap and take to you all the places you need. You can jump on a bus by the hotel and go all the way to St Peters, for example. As we were in Rome for the 6 Nations Rugby as well as sight seeing, we visited the Irish pub up the road a few times (they show all the matches on big screens and also offer some good meals) - but would recommend taking the bus into places like Campo di Fioris for the best selection of bars and restaurants in the evening as well as a bit of atmosphere. The restaurants near the hotel weren't so appealing and were relatively expensive. Would definitely return to this hotel which is great value for money and ticks every box. We had a smashing time and miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & good location”
Reviews.Author: NK27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Artemide and were really impressed. The location on Via Nationale is excellent - close to the Metro and within walking distance of the Forum (about 15mins). When we booked I was worried about picking a good area to stay in but we weren't disappointed - mainly large stores and businesses and not at all seedy! We booked a double superior room which was really spacious - good sized bathroom, large bedroom and even our own lounge area. The mini bar in our room was free and was replenished each day with soft drinks, water and Italian beer. This was just as well as the hotel bar prices were extortionate. My only gripe would be the lack of tea & coffee making facilities in the room but apart from that the service was excellent. Staff on reception were helpful and professional and arranged a private car back to the airport for us. Breakfast was typical continental style and plentiful - more than enough to keep you going until lunch! I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Elle08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Artemide this past January. It was great. The location is ideal and walking distance to many tourist sights and shopping. The breakfast was terrific and the service was great. Our bathroom was fairly large too which was a nice bonus. We also appreciated the complimentary beverages in our in-room mini bar. Overall, it was a great choice and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic locations!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-reader
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Right on Via Nazionale, around the corner from the main train station and within walking distance to the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc! The hotel is gorgeous, with a little bar, breakfast room and business centre. The rooms are extremely comfortable, and although not huge, not as small as I was expecting after reading about rooms in Rome! Breakfast was great with scrambled eggs and bacon for some hot options and loads of cereals, breads etc. The staff were wonderful, especially Mario and Paolo and after staying here twice (at the beginning and end of our Italy trip), I would definitely stay here again if coming to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: carndonagh2
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my wife for 4 days in jan 07 booked a superior room and it made a difference, the other couple with us booked a double room and it was much smaller than ours and at the side of the hotel looking onto the side alley,our room looked onto the main road.the free mini bar is a nice touch and it is nice to have a cold beer when you return from a long days walking and not be ripped off! the hotel bar is very expensive but there is an irish bar next door for a few swift ones while the ladies shop ! eating in the area is easy with a choice of different cuisines but i recomend going out of the hotel and turning left and walking straight down the road as far as you go untill you come to some steps there on the steps you will find a lovely tatteria with no name but an exellent menu and very reasonably priced . 4 of us ate there 4 courses with 2 liters of wine beers water and liquers after for 120 euro ! hotel is close to everything with a metro stop an the top of the street a must for the vatican(saves the feet).from campagino airport to the hotel only cost us 2 euro each by bus/metro!the hotel organised our return to the airport for only 40 euro as we had an early flight and it was money well spent ,the taxi was a large 7 seater and very comfortable. all in all a very nice hotel with nice staff in a nice area well worth the money .

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ab_roody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2007. It was extremely good and would highly recommend it to anyone. The rooms are tastefully decorated and very clean, and the staff very pleasing and helpful. We lost our luggage en route and we felt they made an extra effort to make us comfortable. It is convenient for most of the landmarks and has lots of restaurants in the vacinity. They will also collect and turn you to the airport by their own transport if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irishgreen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form our 4 day trip to Rome and the Hotel Artemide was in a prime location. The hotel was spotless clean, very helpful staff and a great breakfast each morning. There is a free mini bar, which was re-stocked daily. We walked to the Coliseum and Spanish Steps from the hotel. The bus stop to the Vatican is right out side the hotel, and the Metro station is also near by. There is a good Irish pub next door for a well deserved pint after all your sightseeing, and the variety of pizzerias and restaurants along Via Nazionale are excellent. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone lucky enough to visit this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Nick99
Reviews.Content: This is a very well located hotel - when we arrived we walked from Termini railway station in 10 minutes, when we left we walked to Avis Rent-a-Car in via Urbana in 10 minutes. During our stay it took only 15 minutes to walk to the Coliseum and only 5 to the metro to get to Saint Peter's. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was very good by Italian standards. We had a lovely room with a terrace and an excellent bathroom - but we had been upgraded (not sure why, although we were on our honeymoon). Without the upgrade I think we might have found it rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, better than most”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, perfect location along the bustling Via Nazionale with easy access to Rome’s, albeit very limited, metro. The rooms are clean, as are the bathrooms, and not a bad size for hotels in Europe. Compared to some American hotels, I can see why they would be seen as small by some, but then again, I have stayed in some New York hotels where you wouldn’t fit a cat in, let alone try to swing it! Hotel staff were pleasant, compared to Romans in general, it was a rare source of pleasantries for our stay. Easy walking distance to the Forum and Coliseum, about 15 minutes at a leisurely stroll, and some good restaurants in the area. The free minibar is a nice touch, although it contained no more then 10 drinks, 2 of which were beers and 4 bottles of water. Better if they gave you free internet access (which cost 10 euro for 24 hours access). Overall, you could do much worse in Rome than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: aputigna
Reviews.Content: We were originally looking for a hotel located near the Spanish Steps and there was no availability. We chose the hotel artemide based on reviews in tripadvisor and were not dissappointed. The room was not as large as say the hotel boscolo but was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very nice and the water pressure was excellent. The included breakfast was very good and the minibar which is complimentary was perfect us in that it had 4 bottles of water (2 gas, 2 non gas) and some assorted sodas. If you are looking for a reasonably priced above decent hotel with good solid service, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, the rest is average”
Reviews.Author: Travelord
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for a week in this hotel. Imho it's an averge hotel, definitely not the best you can get for your money. The good - The best about this hotel is that it's located in the city center, most of the main attractions are just a walk away from Via Nazionale. - Reception desk and bellboys were friendly and helpful. - Complimentary drinks are a plus. - The rooms are pretty small but clean. - Food quality (breakfast) is pretty good. The bad - Restaurant was closed when I was there. It didn't bother me too much since I had no intent to eat there anyway but still...a four star hotel without a restaurant? - Free internet access is great but requires a working computer. The one they have has an ugly CRT that hurts your eyes after five minutes; half of the time the computer was out of order and nobody seemed to care about getting the computer to work again. The ugly - While food quality was great, the breakfast staff flat out refused to do their work. It's the old "we already have the money in our bag so let's not hurry too much" problem. Save one male waiter the staff down there was busy ignoring the guests (they were rather chatting). They seem to lack organisation, everybody was busy refilling the juice carafes but I always had to actively approach them just to get a coffee. I was never asked if I wanted a refill and when I politely asked for one, I got a face as if I had seriously insulted the waiter. Quite frankly, if I were in charge I'd fire the entire staff and get some ppl who know how service is done. So, this hotel is average; if you can get good rates I'd say go for it but don't expect a four star hotel. It isn't and I'm bewildered they actually have a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: corja
Reviews.Content: When we evenutally found the hotel (we decided to walk from the train station, and discovered that the hotel isn't quite where the map on their website says it is - it's far nearer the northern end of Via Nazionale than the map makes out!) we checked in without a problem, despite arriving quite early in the day. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and we were given a voucher for a free drink of sparkling wine in the bar that evening! The hotel is within easy walking distance of pretty much all the main sites - and the metro stop is just at the end of the road which means getting over to the Vatican is easy too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for seven nights while in Rome, it was a perfect location as far as walking any where in rome. Nice rooms and bathrooms-had everything you need-Clean. Staff was very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: tahiti05
Reviews.Content: My husband had a last minute business trip to Italy so we decided to make a weekend trip to Rome afterwards. Since it was on short notice, most hotels were booked full but we were able to get the Artemide for $300/night. I thought that was expensive for the type of hotel it is but Sept is peak tourist season so that was probably in line with what other 4 star hotels were charging. The staff at the front desk were generally friendly but not outstandingly so (except for the kind hearted Paolo). The room was a decent size (by European standards) and the bathroom was modern and clean. We had some problems with the shower head water spilling out onto the bathroom floors at first (quite annoying) but after maneuvering the shower curtain a bit we managed to keep the floor dry for the next few showers. There is a computer terminal in the lounge area where you can access the internet and printer for free. The breakfast spread in the mornings was decent, with lots of different pastries to choose from. The breakfast room though, being in the basement without windows, was a bit dull. The location of the hotel was good in terms of being close to the termini train station (we caught the leonardo express train to the airport when we left) but we actually took cabs to see most of the sights since we didn't have much time. If we had known about this trip earlier, I would have tried to find a hotel closer to the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon. A side note: we had a fabulous dinner at a michelin-starred restaurant called L'atro Mastai one night, the food/service/ingredients were wonderful and we just wanted to mention that to anyone who might be looking to splurge for dinner when they're in Rome. The restaurant is close to Piazza Navona.

HotelInfo.Name: Artemide Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 22, 00184 Rome, Italy
